speaker: Sonia
text: So, in the end, you failed to defeat them, didn't you?

speaker: Sonia
text: I only introduced you to Lord Nergal out of respect for your rank. I was mistaken, though, to think that a former royal soldier would be--

speaker: Vaida
text: Next time will be different, I swear it. I beg of you, give me one more chance!

speaker: Sonia
text: Ha ha ha... "One more chance"? Surely you jest.

speaker: Vaida
text: Without Lord Nergal's good word, I'll never fly again! Not as a royal wyvern knight, at least! Please! Another chance!!

speaker: Sonia
text: Ah, but you're quite skilled at begging, at least. Desist. You have fallen from our graces, and nothing will change that. Just be grateful. You are an outsider, so you are spared the Fang's judgement.

speaker: Sonia
text: You stink of failure. Leave me to breathe in peace.

speaker: Eliwood
text: That wyvern rider.. That was the same woman we fought earlier. This proves that they took this mountain path.

speaker: Hector
text: Now... What have we here... What a complicated place.

speaker: Eliwood
text: It's little more than whispers, but I can hear human voices.

speaker: Lyn
text: Over there! Let's go take a look.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Marcus! Wait here with Ninian and everyone else. Be ready to escape at any time. I'm counting on you!

speaker: Marcus
text: Yes, sir. I will not fail.

speaker: Nino
text: Really? You're giving me a mission? Really and truly!? Mother!

speaker: Sonia
text: I am. And it's a very big job at that. ...It's for the king of Bern.

speaker: Nino
text: The king!? Such an important job... for me?

speaker: Brendan
text: Sonia? I'm against this!! Giving such a dangerous job to this child...

speaker: Nino
text: Father?

speaker: Sonia
text: ...You're right, this really is a job for your sons. However, we've seen nothing of them since their last report.

speaker: Nino
text: Lloyd... Linus......

speaker: Sonia
text: So my daughter will do this. And I will have no complaints from you about it.

speaker: Nino
text: Ah! Father......

speaker: Sonia
text: ...You may do as you please!!

speaker: Nino
text: But...

speaker: Sonia
text: First, business! Jaffar! Come!

speaker: Nino
text: Jaffar!

speaker: Lyn
text: Look! That man! He was at the Dragon's Gate.

speaker: Hector
text: Nergal's henchman. No question about it.

speaker: Nino
text: Jaffar! Should you be up? Don't your wounds hurt?

speaker: Sonia
text: Must you be so discourteous? It really is quite irritating. You heard the king's request, did you not?

speaker: Jaffar
text: Prince Zephiel... He wants him assassinated.

speaker: Nino
text: What? The prince? The king wants to kill the prince? Why? He's his son, isn't he?

speaker: Sonia
text: Nino! Be quiet.

speaker: Nino
text: Ah... I'm sorry.

speaker: Sonia
text: Jaffar, this mission is yours... and you're to take Nino.

speaker: Jaffar
text: ......You're not serious?

speaker: Sonia
text: Yes, I'm serious. This girl is my daughter. She must prove herself as soon as possible.

speaker: Jaffar
text: ...Don't do this. This is too much for her.

speaker: Sonia
text: As long as you're with her, there should be no problem. I'll brook no disagreement. We must have the king in our debt. Those are Lord Nergal's explicit orders.

speaker: Sonia
text: Nino! You understand the consequences if you fail, don't you?

speaker: Nino
text: Um... Yes.

speaker: Sonia
text: Then we're off to investigate the prince's manse. I'll provide more details on the way there.

speaker: Sonia
text: Jerme!

speaker: Jerme
text: Yes?

speaker: Sonia
text: Where is Brendan? He just left the room.

speaker: Jerme
text: He went outside with Jan.

speaker: Sonia
text: ......I wonder what he's about... ...I'll deal with it later. Listen, Jerme. You're in charge of the guard while I'm gone. Do not let anything happen to the item.

speaker: Jerme
text: In charge of the guard... Bah! I was top dog until that cretin Jaffar showed up.

speaker: Sonia
text: Jerme!

speaker: Jerme
text: ...I know, I know!

speaker: Sonia
text: Kenneth!

speaker: Kenneth
text: Yes, Lady Sonia.

speaker: Sonia
text: Where is Brendan? He just left the room.

speaker: Kenneth
text: He went outside with Jan.

speaker: Sonia
text: ......I wonder what he's about... ...I'll deal with it later. Listen, Kenneth. You're in charge of the guard while I'm gone. Do not let anything happen to the item.

speaker: Kenneth
text: Understood. I will guard it with my life.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Do they seriously mean to assassinate the prince?

speaker: Hector
text: Aye. On the orders of the king, it would seem. Unbelievable...

speaker: Lyn
text: The Emblem is essential to the prince's ceremony, right? Having the Emblem becomes useless if the prince is dead!

speaker: Eliwood
text: We must stop the assassination! The girl, Nino... If we speak to her she might understand.

speaker: Lyn
text: Jaffar looks like a dangerous man... But we have no other course of action.

speaker: Jerme
text: Oh, here you are! How delicious! My blade shall feast well tonight, won't it?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Oh!!

speaker: Jerme
text: Now, which...one...first? Wait! Hold it! There are some nasty ones mixed in with the rest. Mustn't get one of them. Might ruin my sword's appetite. You don't mind do you? If I do it this way?

speaker: Eliwood
text: That's...

speaker: Lyn
text: Eliwood! There's no reason to treat with that madman!! We must find the exit...

speaker: Jerme
text: You! Woman! You have beautiful skin. If I sliced you into lovely red ribbons with this, would the pieces be as soft and delicate as silk?

speaker: Lyn
text: You...

speaker: Nils
text: It's no good! Something's blocking our way. We can't get out!!

speaker: Ninian
text: I can feel an evil power emanating from every foe here. If we do not defeat them all, the barrier will hold strong.

speaker: Jerme
text: Hyaa ha ha ha haaa! That's Lord Nergal's doing! He knows how I love to slice through people. He lets me do it as often as I want, which really is all the time. He's after something he calls "quintessence"... I care nothing for it, but... as long as he keeps bringing me people to slash and cut! I am Jerme! The finest assassin the Black Fang have ever known! Now come! My blade hungers!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Gone...

speaker: Ninian
text: ...It's all right. He's still close... In this building...somewhere.

speaker: Nils
text: We've got to defeat him and destroy this barrier! Otherwise, we'll never leave!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mark! We have to find that man and escape this place! What are your orders?!

speaker: Kenneth
text: Hello trespassers. I bid you welcome. Imagine, the stronghold of a guild of assassins, infiltrated. Quite amusing, isn't it? Heh heh heh heh.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Oh!!

speaker: Jerme
text: However, you shall not leave. Sonia has given me authority while she is away.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You... You're a holy man. What are you doing in this place?

speaker: Kenneth
text: Are you referring to my relationship with the "gods"? Are you still held in the thrall of such a concept? You've met Lord Nergal, haven't you? Then there is something you must know. Gods are lies created by the weakness in all mankind. ...If a god truly exists, then it is my lord Nergal. Only him.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Insane...

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! Waste no time with that madman!! Let's get out of--

speaker: Nils
text: We can't! Something's blocking our way. We can't get out!!

speaker: Ninian
text: ...That man. The one in front of you... A surge of evil...

speaker: Kenneth
text: Nothing is more beautiful than the suffering of men. When I'm watching, I'm afloat in an ocean of pure bliss... I will watch you for a long, long time.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Gone...

speaker: Ninian
text: ...It's all right. He's still close... In this building...somewhere.

speaker: Nils
text: We've got to defeat him and destroy this barrier! Otherwise, we'll never leave!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mark! We have to find that man and escape this place! What are your orders?!

speaker: Geitz
text: Come on, Mark! Do you really want me? Oh, bother. I really hate the cold. What? Everyone's counting on me? ... Oh, fine ...

speaker: Wallace
text: Huh huh huh huh. You’ve done well to choose me for this, Mark! Weaklings! Their pathetic attacks mean nothing to me! I’ll cut through this snow like a new-forged blade!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Who are you?

speaker: Karel
text: Karel.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Are you fighting the Black Fang, too?

speaker: Karel
text: I heard the Black Fang was gathering recruits. I'm here to challenge them.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Do you... Do you have a reason to do so?

speaker: Karel
text: My sword is my life. My sword is my reason. You...

speaker: Eliwood
text: What?

speaker: Karel
text: You are quite good, but you will improve. Very good. I will join you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You're going to help me and my friends? But...why?

speaker: Karel
text: Someday, you will be a great swordfighter. It would be a waste for that skill to die here. I must have you... stronger. I will wait for that time with much anticipation.

speaker: Karel
text: Shall we continue? The feast awaits...

speaker: Hector
text: Who are you?

speaker: Karel
text: Karel.

speaker: Hector
text: Karel, what are you doing in this place?

speaker: Karel
text: The Black Fang is gathering recruits. I want to hone my blade on them.

speaker: Hector
text: What? Do you have...a reason?

speaker: Karel
text: My sword is my life. My sword is my reason. You...

speaker: Hector
text: What?

speaker: Karel
text: You are unpolished...but powerful. Very well. I will join you.

speaker: Hector
text: You're going to lend us your blade? That's a nice gesture and all, but... Why?

speaker: Karel
text: You will someday be a famed general. It would be a waste for that power to be lost here. I must have you...stronger. I will wait for that time with much anticipation.

speaker: Karel
text: Shall we continue? The feast awaits...

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh! Who are you?

speaker: Karel
text: Karel.

speaker: Lyn
text: You're a...swordfighter from Sacae. Are you fighting the Black Fang as well?

speaker: Karel
text: The Black Fang is gathering recruits. I want to hone my blade on them.

speaker: Lyn
text: Why would you... Do you have a reason to?

speaker: Karel
text: My sword is my life. My sword is my reason. You are... So beautiful...

speaker: Lyn
text: Pardon?

speaker: Karel
text: Your blade and mine are different, yet...Your swordplay is truly beautiful. Very well. I will join you.

speaker: Lyn
text: You're going to help us? But...why?

speaker: Karel
text: Someday you will be a renowned swordfighter. Losing you here would be a waste. I must see you... stronger. I will wait for that time with much anticipation.

speaker: Karel
text: Shall we continue. The feast awaits...

speaker: Eliwood
text: You... Can it really be? Is it you, Harken?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Wait, please! You're Harken, a knight of Pherae, aren't you?

speaker: Harken
text: Lord Eliwood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I heard that all my father's men had fallen defending him. It's good to see you well. Why didn't you return to Pherae?

speaker: Harken
text: I failed in my duty to protect my sworn lord... I am not worthy of the honor of being a knight of Pherae.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Harken...

speaker: Harken
text: Before Nergal's magic, we were annihilated. When Lord Elbert was taken away, I was...powerless...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nergal...

speaker: Harken
text: I heard he shared some connection to the Black Fang. I searched the continent for signs of them... I intended to strike against them with my final breath.

speaker: Eliwood
text: And that's what brought you here... In that case, Harken, you should come with us.

speaker: Harken
text: Forgive me, Lord Eliwood... I would rather die a knight than live in shame. I will trade my life for many of theirs.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hold! Harken!! Do you think my father would want that?

speaker: Harken
text: Lord Eliwood, please...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Join me, Harken. Neither my father nor I would condone such a senseless death. Help me fulfill my father's one ambition and restore peace.

speaker: Harken
text: ...I understand. My life is yours. May it serve you better than it served your father.

speaker: Isadora
text: You! Can it truly be you, Harken?

speaker: Harken
text: Isadora!?

speaker: Isadora
text: Wait! You are Harken, a knight of Pherae, are you not?

speaker: Harken
text: Isadora...

speaker: Isadora
text: You... You're alive. We'd heard that all of you had perished. Thank goodness... Thank goodness you're well. But how is it that you're here?

speaker: Harken
text: I failed in my duty to protect my sword lord... I am not worthy of the honor of being a knight of Pherae.

speaker: Isadora
text: Harken...

speaker: Harken
text: Before that man's magic... we were powerless. When Lord Elbert was taken away, I... I could do nothing...

speaker: Harken
text: I learned that the man who took Lord Elbert...Nergal, shared some connection to the Black Fang. I searched the continent for signs of them... I intended to strike against them with my final breath.

speaker: Isadora
text: ...... Lord Eliwood... He's here, too. Come, Harken. You must join us.

speaker: Harken
text: ...I cant, Isadora. I would rather die a knight than live in shame. I will trade my life for many of theirs.

speaker: Isadora
text: Wait! Please, Harken! Don't be foolish!

speaker: Harken
text: Isadora...

speaker: Isadora
text: I've just now found you again when I thought you were lost. If you vanish from my life once more... Please, Harken. Do not waste this chance. I beg of you...

speaker: Harken
text: ...... I understand. Isadora, I'll do as you ask. My life for my dead lord and for his son, Eliwood.

speaker: Marcus
text: Harken! You are a knight of Pherae! It is you, isn't it, Harken?

speaker: Harken
text: ...... Lord Marcus...

speaker: Marcus
text: I received reports that said the entire elite guard had fallen... It looks like you survived. Tell me, why did you not report to Pherae?

speaker: Harken
text: I failed in my duty to protect my sword lord... I am not worthy of the honor of being a knight of Pherae.

speaker: Marcus
text: Harken...

speaker: Harken
text: Before Nergal's magic... we were annihilated. When Lord Elbert was taken away, I was...powerless...

speaker: Marcus
text: Nergal...

speaker: Harken
text: I learned he shared some connection to the Black Fang. I searched the continent for signs of them... I intended to strike against them with my final breath.

speaker: Marcus
text: ...... Harken, come with me. You must aid Lord Eliwood in this war.

speaker: Harken
text: But...I...

speaker: Marcus
text: Do not waste the life you swore to Pherae. We are knights, Harken. Be mindful of your oath. You must not die here. For the sake of our fallen master ...live now and, fight.

speaker: Harken
text: I understand. My life for my dead lord and for his son, Eliwood.

speaker: Lowen
text: You... Can it be? Lord Harken?

speaker: Lowen
text: Wait, please. It has to be you... Lord Harken, a knight of Pherae!

speaker: Harken
text: You... You're one of Lord Marcus's young men.

speaker: Lowen
text: Yes! I am Lowen. I'm currently traveling with Lord Eliwood. I'd heard that your entire company fell, Lord Harken... And yet, at least you survived! Lord Eliwood will be pleased. Why... Why are you in this place?

speaker: Harken
text: I failed in my duty to protect my sword lord... I am not worthy of the honor of being a knight of Pherae.

speaker: Lowen
text: Lord Harken...

speaker: Harken
text: Before that monster's magic... we were annihilated. When Lord Elbert was taken away, I was...powerless...

speaker: Harken
text: I learned that the man who took Lord Elbert...Nergal, shared some connection to the Black Fang. I searched the continent for signs of them... I intended to strike against them with my final breath.

speaker: Lowen
text: What a tale... Come, you can join us, Lord Harken.

speaker: Harken
text: I cant, Lowen. I would rather die a knight than live in shame. I will trade my life for many of theirs.

speaker: Lowen
text: Wait, please! Lord Elbert would not have wanted this!

speaker: Harken
text: Lowen...

speaker: Lowen
text: Please, be prudent. Lord Eliwood, Lord Marcus, and Lady Isabella... I know that none of them would want you to do this.

speaker: Harken
text: ...... You're right. You speak the truth, young Lowen. Let us go and see Lord Eliwood. My life for my dead lord and for his son, Eliwood.

speaker: Hector
text: You-- It can't be... Harken?

speaker: Hector
text: Hey, hang on! Wait a moment! Wait! You're one of Pherae's knights! Harken, right?

speaker: Harken
text: ...Lord Hector.

speaker: Hector
text: You were one of Lord Elbert's sworn men, right? I'd heard all his knights died on Valor... Why didn't you return and report to Eliwood.

speaker: Harken
text: I failed in my duty to protect my sword lord... I am not worthy of the honor of being a knight of Pherae.

speaker: Harken
text: Before Nergal's magic, we were annihilated. When Lord Elbert was taken away, I was...powerless...

speaker: Hector
text: That dog Nergal...

speaker: Harken
text: I learned he shared some connection to the Black Fang. I searched the continent for signs of them... I intended to strike against them with my final breath.

speaker: Hector
text: And now you are here. You can fight with us, Harken. Eliwood is here as well.

speaker: Harken
text: Forgive me, Lord Hector. I would rather die a knight than live in shame. I will trade my life for many of theirs.

speaker: Hector
text: Hold, Harken! Do you think that's what Lord Elbert would ask for?

speaker: Hector
text: I'm not from Pherae, so it may not be my place to say, but... Eliwood waited for you... for any of you to return.

speaker: Harken
text: ...Lord Eliwood.

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood is in a war. If you're a true knight of Pherae, you need to be by his side.

speaker: Harken
text: ...I understand. My life is his. May it serve him better than it served his father.

speaker: Isadora
text: Young sir... Are you not Sir Harken?

speaker: Isadora
text: Hold! Are you not Sir Harken, a knight of Pherae?

speaker: Harken
text: ...Sir Oswin.

speaker: Isadora
text: I'd heard that your entire company had fallen. It is good to see that you are alive and well. Is Lord Eliwood aware that you survived?

speaker: Harken
text: I failed in my duty to protect my sword lord... I am not worthy of the honor of being a knight of Pherae.

speaker: Isadora
text: Sir Harken...

speaker: Harken
text: Before Nergal's magic... we were annihilated. When Lord Elbert was taken away, I was...powerless...

speaker: Isadora
text: Nergal...

speaker: Harken
text: I learned that he shared some connection to the Black Fang. I searched the continent for signs of them... I intended to strike against them with my final breath.

speaker: Isadora
text: I see... Be that as it may, Lord Harken, you may now travel with us. Lord Eliwood is also with us.

speaker: Harken
text: Please, Sir Oswin... I need you to understand. I would rather die a knight than live in shame. I will trade my life for many of theirs.

speaker: Isadora
text: Sir Harken, did you not swear a life of service to Pherae?

speaker: Isadora
text: As a knight of Ostia, it may not be my place to speak, but... Lord Eliwood waited for you... for any of you to return.

speaker: Harken
text: ...Lord Eliwood.

speaker: Isadora
text: Lord Eliwood waits for you still. We are knights, bound by duty to the houses we serve. You can still be of service to your lord and master.

speaker: Harken
text: ...You are right, Sir Oswin. Forgive my weakness. My life for my dead lord and for his son, Eliwood.

speaker: Kenneth
text: You’re doing much better than I had anticipated. But it’s about time to put an end to this.

speaker: Kenneth
text: Does this…mean… that I…lose…

speaker: Jerme
text: Hyaaa! I’ll chop you all up into tiny, little pieces!

speaker: Jerme
text: G-Gwaah... It hurts... These...cuts...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Everyone is being driven mad by Nergal...

speaker: Lyn
text: It must be terrifying, to lose yourself entirely... To fall completely under the sway of Nergal's power... ...Hey! What could this be?

speaker: Eliwood
text: It can't be... the Fire Emblem?

speaker: Hector
text: So this madman had it all along? Let's take it and go!

speaker: Lyn
text: We've finally gotten it back... Let's not waste our good fortune.

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! There's no reason for us to stay any longer!

speaker: Eliwood
text: I know! Let's make haste for the manse! We must stop the assassination! We cannot let the prince's life be put in jeopardy!

speaker: Sonia
text: You know your role, yes? The plan must be carried out tonight.

speaker: Nino
text: Mother...just once...if only for a little while...may I...hold your hand?

speaker: Sonia
text: Nino, you know how I abhor such displays.

speaker: Nino
text: I... I know. But...I may not get another chance... And I thought...

speaker: Sonia
text: ...Very well.

speaker: Nino
text: Huh?

speaker: Sonia
text: If you complete this mission, I'll hold your hand as often as you like. I will even hug you and stroke your face.

speaker: Nino
text: Oh, really!? Then I must do my best! I will, I will! I will succeed!! Wait for me, Mother!

speaker: Sonia
text: I will. Be careful!

speaker: Nino
text: ...All right!! I'll be back!!

speaker: Sonia
text: Ah, Jaffar, wait here for a moment.

speaker: Sonia
text: It's about tonight's mission...

speaker: Jaffar
text: What is it?

speaker: Sonia
text: Once you've killed the prince, kill Nino, too.

speaker: Jaffar
text: What!?

speaker: Sonia
text: The assassinations... Both come directly by the king's request. The prince is well loved, and his death will trigger much chaos. If the assassin is not caught and hanged immediately, the chaos will engulf Bern. A scapegoat is needed. Do you understand?

speaker: Jaffar
text: Nino is your daughter!!

speaker: Sonia
text: She is trash. Garbage. Human refuse. I'm just happy at last to have found a use for her. She did say she would do anything to please her loving mother, did she not? Her death will please me more than her living ever did.

speaker: Sonia
text: ...What is it? Do you have something to say?

speaker: Jaffar
text: ......This...has nothing to do with me.

speaker: Sonia
text: When Lord Nergal found you as an orphan, he chose you because of your callous heart and your skill with a blade. Lord Nergal does not give second chances. Do not forget.

speaker: Hector
text: ...Oswin.

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector.

speaker: Hector
text: Have you heard anything from my brother?

speaker: Oswin
text: When you say anything ...

speaker: Hector
text: ...Come, you know... About his condition...

speaker: Oswin
text: No, nothing new.

speaker: Hector
text: I see. That’s good.

speaker: Oswin
text: Why do you ask?

speaker: Hector
text: No reason really. I’m simply concerned for my brother. Earlier... When I saw him in Ostia, he didn’t look well. When father took ill and died... I wonder if he looked at all like that. Forget it, I’m worrying about nothing. If something were wrong, I’m sure we would’ve heard.

speaker: Oswin
text: Yes, indeed. Now that you mention it, I did forget something. Lord Uther sent word to you through a messenger.

speaker: Hector
text: Oh! What did he have to say?

speaker: Oswin
text: Don’t trouble Lord Eliwood by being overly obstinate.

speaker: Hector
text: Just like my brother! Always the same thing! How many times have I told him to stop treating me like a child!?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I’ve received word from Caelin’s neighbors, Laus, Tuscana, Kathelet, Tania, and Santaruz. They will not interfere in Caelin’s affairs. This they have promised.

speaker: Lyn
text: Eliwood, I don’t know how to thank you…

speaker: Eliwood
text: All I’ve done is convince them to remain neutral in this dispute. However, this means I cannot aid you in any way either. Will you be all right?

speaker: Lyn
text: I will win. I have to. It’s the only way that I can help my grandfather.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I understand. Although I cannot help you directly, as a friend, I pray for your success.

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you. I won’t waste the opportunity you’ve given me.

speaker: Lyn
text: All right, everyone! Let’s get going!! This weather is turning foul. It looks like a fog is rolling in.

speaker: Kent
text: This is no good. If the fog thickens, we’ll be blind in battle. It will be difficult to fight what we cannot see.

speaker: Lyn
text: We can’t let it delay us, though. Let us press on. We must get closer to the castle. What’s the best route?

speaker: Kent
text: Let me think… Our best path is to the south… However, that runs through General Eagler’s estate. It looks like we still have one final obstacle to pass.

speaker: Matthew
text: Mark, put me in the lead, please. Surely you know that we…er…thieves, if you must, can see through fog. Follow me, everyone!
So you’ve come…

speaker: Sain
text: Aah!

speaker: Kent
text: You! You’re… Lord Wallace!

speaker: Lyn
text: Kent, who is this?

speaker: Kent
text: He used to be the commander of the knights of Caelin.

speaker: Sain
text: Aren’t you supposed to be retired? I heard you were sowing fields now.

speaker: Wallace
text: I am, and I was. Then I received orders from Lord Lundgren. I was told to capture an imposter and a pair of rogue knights.

speaker: Kent
text: Lord Wallace! Surely, you don’t believe us to be oathbreakers, do you?

speaker: Wallace
text: Bring me the girl that claims to be Lady Madelyn’s child.

speaker: Sain
text: What are your intentions?

speaker: Wallace
text: If I don’t like what I see, I will take her.

speaker: Kent
text: We will prevent you.

speaker: Wallace
text: You? Prevent me? You must be–

speaker: Lyn
text: Enough! I’m right here! I am Lyndis.

speaker: Wallace
text: Ah…

speaker: Lyn
text: I’ll understand if you don’t believe me. But I’ve had enough of you and your foolish posturing!

speaker: Wallace
text: Hmm… Such beautiful eyes…

speaker: Lyn
text: Pardon?

speaker: Wallace
text: I’ve been a knight for 30 years, and here is one thing I learned. A person with eyes as bright and true as yours is no deceiver. Ha ha ha ha ha ha! Ah, yes! I like you, girl! Why, I believe I’ll even join your little band of mercenaries!

speaker: Sain
text: Are you… Are you serious?

speaker: Wallace
text: This old bull’s pledged his loyalty to Caelin. I would never allow an usurper on the throne. Let’s march!

speaker: Kent
text: Lord Wallace! He… He hasn’t changed at all.

speaker: Lyn
text: I like him. He’s…honest.

speaker: Kent
text: That he is. He deserves our respect.

speaker: Wallace
text: I’d planned on living out my days in peace on my farm… Ah, well… It looks as though it’s time to take up arms once more. Mark! You’re the tactician of this group, correct? What are my orders?

speaker: Tutorial
text: Wallace is a level 12 knight. He can rise as high as level 20. Most units can change classes once they reach level 10. By changing classes, units can improve all of their abilities. Movement range, constitution, usable weapons… Everything. There are many benefits. With a single action, you can make your units significantly more powerful. In order to change classes, units need to be of a certain level. However, you also need a special item. For example, Wallace is carrying a knight crest. With this, cavaliers and knights can change classes. Each character class has its own unique item that allows units of that class to switch to a different class. Well then, why don’t we try changing class now? Select Wallace, then choose knight crest from his items and use it.

speaker: Wallace
text: Mark! Let Wallace show you his might! Give me an order!

speaker: Wallace
text: Ha ha haaa! So you’ve noticed my knight crest, have you? You’ve eyes like an eagle, my friend! Once I’ve used the crest, I’ll be even stronger! A terrifying thought, isn’t it? Ha ha ha haaaa! What are you waiting for? Order me to use the knight crest!!!

speaker: Wallace
text: Let them stare in awe at my might! Their knees shall quake! Order me to use the knight crest!

speaker: Wallace
text: Ha ha ha haaaa! Look! A giant walks among you!! My defense is impenetrable! Come! Break your weapons against me!

speaker: Lyn
text: Mark… The fog’s rolling in. We can’t hit an enemy we can’t see. Keep your eyes open, everyone!

speaker: Man
text: Hey, you… Do you have any torches? What? You don’t? There’s a thick fog rolling in, and you have NO torches? Wandering about without a torch is… Well, it’s ridiculous! Here. Take one of mine. Use this when it’s foggy, and you can see a bit better. Hm? No, no need for thanks. I know all about you and your comrades. We all, well… Not one of us believes what Lord Lundgren is saying about you. We all want to help the marquess… and his rightful heir. Good luck!

speaker: Lady
text: The forces of Caelin are led by General Eagler. He’s an honest man who has always treated us well. A good general. He must be aware of Lundgren’s evil plans to seize control of Caelin. I can only believe Lundgren’s holding someone dear to him as hostage. It’s so sad, but there’s nothing anyone can do. Why must so many innocents get hurt in the foolish games of nobles?

speaker: Eagler
text: Imposters to the throne, you shall not pass! No quarter for traitors!

speaker: Eagler
text: Nnng… Go… Go quickly. The marquess… He knows nothing of this… His life is… There’s no illness. Only…poison… Please…for the marquess…for all of Caelin…

speaker: Eagler
text: Bring forth the imposter who calls herself “Lyndis”! She shall not pass beyond this place!

speaker: Lyn
text: I am Lyndis. I’m no pretender. I’d ask you to believe me, but your heart and mind seem set.

speaker: Eagler
text: Enough talk… Draw your sword!

speaker: Sain
text: General Eagler…

speaker: Eagler
text: Sain… I never imagined you could turn traitor…

speaker: Sain
text: Who’s the traitor here? I am following the orders of my sworn liege lord. Not Lundgren, but my true liege, the marquess himself!

speaker: Eagler
text: You speak with conviction. I think it’s time to test the bounds of loyalty!

speaker: Eagler
text: Kent! Is that you?

speaker: Kent
text: General Eagler! We found Lady Lyndis on the orders of the marquess. We’ve worked so very hard to return her safely to Caelin.

speaker: Eagler
text: And yet you have no proof of the girl’s identity. Is that not true?

speaker: Kent
text: Yes, but…

speaker: Eagler
text: Then our talk is finished! Draw your weapon and come!

speaker: Wallace
text: Eagler!

speaker: Eagler
text: General Wallace… So you’ve sided with the girl, too, have you?

speaker: Wallace
text: I fight for Caelin’s honor, not for Lundgren’s lies!

speaker: Eagler
text: Ah… Is that so? You are– Enough! There’s nothing more to be said. I name you traitors all! Come! Do your worst!

speaker: Wallace
text: Fool… At the very least, let mine be the blow that finishes you!

speaker: Lyn
text: What kind of man was General Eagler?

speaker: Kent
text: When Sain and I first became knights, he was our captain. Our teacher…

speaker: Lyn
text: I think he must have known we were telling the truth. Why did he force the fight?

speaker: Sain
text: Something must have… Lord Lundgren was exerting some hold on him… Eagler was trying to protect someone. A friend perhaps, or family.

speaker: Lyn
text: May Lundgren never know the peaceful embrace of Mother Earth! I care not what others do. I WILL stop that man! Mark! The final battle is approaching!

speaker: Lundgren
text: How are you feeling today, my dear brother?

speaker: Lord Hausen (Off Screen)
text: Lundgren… You… You fiend…

speaker: Lundgren
text: Your granddaughter is dead by now. And soon, you will join her.

speaker: Lord Hausen (Off Screen)
text: Lyndis… Why did this happen? I… I only wanted to see her once.

speaker: Lundgren
text: Have you lost all hope? Has your life lost all meaning? Then hurry up and die, you miserable old dotard! You and your precious granddaughter are in my way!!! I curse your name! I despise you! My worthless wretch of a brother!

speaker: Hector
text: Bah! Dark already.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We'll have to stop here for the night. We'll set out for Laus at the first sign of sunlight. Marcus, prepare the camp.

speaker: Marcus
text: Yes, my lord.

speaker: Hector
text: So this is Caelin? You think we ought to present ourselves to Lord Hausen?

speaker: Eliwood
text: We're simply passing through, so I don't see the need. I am curious how Lyndis is getting along, though.

speaker: Hector
text: Lyndis?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Marquess Caelin's granddaughter.

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, her. The missing heir who dealt with Lundgren last year. Didn't you have something to do with that?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mm.

speaker: Hector
text: And? The granddaughter? Is she a beauty?

speaker: Eliwood
text: A beauty? She's... I don't...she's... I think it must be her Sacae heritage. She's...striking...

speaker: Hector
text: Striking? Too bad, isn't it?

speaker: Eliwood
text: What?

speaker: Hector
text: That we don't have time to see her, loverboy.

speaker: Eliwood
text: No! Lyndis and I are... We're not...

speaker: Hector
text: You're not? Then why are you getting so worked up?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector! Don't make me angry!

speaker: Hector
text: Ha ha ha ha! You are so much fun to tease! Huh? What was that? Did you hear something?

speaker: Eliwood
text: It was a scream. Someone's being attacked!

speaker: Hector
text: Do we help?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Of course!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Oh noooooo! Someone! Help!!!

speaker: Bandit
text: Grrr! Stupid old fool! He's kept us running in circles for hours!

speaker: Merlinus
text: My... My valuable merchandise! What are you going to do?

speaker: Puzon
text: Hey, look at this. The old fool's wealthy.

speaker: Bandit
text: Huh huh huh. Our lucky day. Eh, Puzon?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Let go! Let go!! Will you let go!!!

speaker: Bandit
text: What a racket! Puzon, can we get rid of this simpleton?

speaker: Puzon
text: I suppose so. There's no reason to let him live.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Oh my!! Eeeyaaaaahhh!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Release him!

speaker: Puzon
text: Who--

speaker: Eliwood
text: I told you to let the man go!

speaker: Hector
text: If you move quickly, we'll let you live.

speaker: Puzon
text: Ha! A pair of dandies like you? You know what I think? Living off your parents' names, prancing about... I despise you! Come on! Don't hold back! We'll kill you all!

speaker: Hector
text: Hold! Release that man!

speaker: Puzon
text: What?

speaker: Hector
text: We're not after you, dullard. We want the old man and his goods. If you value your life, you'll leave now.

speaker: Puzon
text: What did you say? Who do you think you are? Do you think you can walk away with our spoils?

speaker: Hector
text: You half-wit! Do we look like thieves to you?

speaker: Puzon
text: We'll not let our profit be snatched away so easily! Come! To me now! Hold nothing back! Kill 'em all!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Aaaiiieeee!!! You! They call you Mark, am I right? I am Merlinus, a humble and lowly merchant. I know nothing of combat. Please! You must protect me!

speaker: Bandit
text: Oof… Blast! I won’t forget this!

speaker: Hector
text: Then you’re smarter than you look! Get out of here!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Are you all right?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Hm? Oho!! I… I’ve been saved!

speaker: Eliwood
text: We’ve driven them off. Are you injured?

speaker: Merlinus
text: No, not at all. As you can see, I’m as fine as fine can be.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I’m glad to see that. Good day, sir. Hector.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Wait a moment, please! A token of my thanks…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Do not worry yourself. We did nothing to merit reward.

speaker: Hector
text: That’s right. We’ve no need of a peddler’s junk.

speaker: Merlinus
text: P-P-Peddler?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector!

speaker: Hector
text: Oops!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Ahem! I am Merlinus. You’ll find no other traveling merchant whose goods compare. Don’t let your eyes fool you: I’m quite prosperous.

speaker: Hector
text: Huh? You’re a merchant? Books and knives and all that, eh?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector, your manners are terrible. Merlinus, please… Pay no mind to what this oaf has to say.

speaker: Merlinus
text: No, of course not. I wasn’t concerned at… Ahem! By the way, you two obviously come from highborn houses. Would you grant me the honor of your names?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I am Eliwood, son of the marquess of Pherae.

speaker: Hector
text: I’m Hector. Marquess Ostia’s brother.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Goodness! Ostia! Pherae! The greatest houses in all of Lycia!! Ahh… To be saved by noblemen such as yourselves… It is an honor beyond words!

speaker: Hector
text: It’s nice to be appreciated for a change. Lately, people just seem to want us dead. Tell me, Merlinus, what are your plans?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Pardon? My plans, my lord? I had planned to travel Lycia selling my merchandise, but… It may not be possible in such dangerous times.

speaker: Hector
text: If that’s the case, why don’t you come along with us?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector?

speaker: Hector
text: Our travels will not be ending anytime soon. We’ve gained more people and more items, right? It might be good to have help managing our things.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Oho! Now THAT is a splendid idea! Managing merchandise is my specialty, after all!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Quite sure, my lord. To be honest, I’ve dreamt of working for a noble house. To have my fondest wish granted in such a way… I cannot stem these tears of joy! Lord Hector! Lord Eliwood!!! Take me into your bosoms and keep me safe forever!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Uh… Thank you. Well met, Merlinus.

speaker: Hector
text: We’re counting on you! Now, I’ve got some things I want you to carry…

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes, of course. Whatever you have, Merlinus will keep!

speaker: Hector
text: Blast! Where on earth has that snake Darin gone?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I doubt he’s left Lycia yet, but… Hector…it’s been five days. The death of Marquess Santaruz… Our attack on Laus Castle… Word of these things must have reached Lord Uther by now. And yet he shows no sign of action… Why?

speaker: Hector
text: I’m sure he has his reasons. My brother has other concerns tying his hands right now.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Hector
text: It’s Bern. We’ve received disturbing reports over the past few months. King Desmond is behaving oddly. If he sees even the slightest crack in Lycia’s defenses, we believe he’ll invade with all of Bern’s might behind him. My brother has only recently become marquess, as well as head of the Lycian League. He can’t allow another country to see weakness or discord.

speaker: Eliwood
text: He has to present the face of stability and strength, is that it?

speaker: Hector
text: Yes. It seems every country has a spy working in Ostia right now. They all want to assess the new marquess’s temperament and skill. If they sense anything wrong, word will spread like wildfire.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector, you’re the marquess’s brother… Would not being at his side be seen as something “wrong”?

speaker: Hector
text: The marquess’s brother is a well-known lout. If I WERE at court, they’d sense something wrong.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You’re not too proud of that reputation, are you?

speaker: Hector
text: Not in the least.

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector! Lord Eliwood!

speaker: Hector
text: What is it, Oswin? Have you heard something?

speaker: Oswin
text: Yes, my lord. A messenger from the east! Castle Caelin has fallen to a surprise attack from Marquess Laus!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Castle Caelin!?

speaker: Hector
text: They’ve struck again.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Hausen… Is he unharmed?

speaker: Oswin
text: My apologies, my lord… We’ve no word on Lord Hausen or his granddaughter, the lady Lyndis.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I never imagined they would attack Caelin… Lord Hausen… Lyndis…

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector… What should we do?

speaker: Hector
text: They might still be alive, right? There’s only one thing we can do!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector!

speaker: Hector
text: Come on! We’ve got to hurry!

speaker: Kent
text: Milady, I’ve returned, and I have brought news. Laus soldiers are scattered from the castle to the edge of this forest. There must be at least 50 soldiers!

speaker: Sain
text: Are you sure about this, milady? We barely escaped… Going back to the castle would mean almost certain death.

speaker: Lyn
text: My grandfather is in the castle. I left the castle on his orders, but… I can’t leave him in there alone!

speaker: Wil
text: The numbers we face… Rescuing Lord Hausen will be no easy task.

speaker: Sain
text: I wonder if we can expect any reinforcements.

speaker: Kent
text: I overheard some of the Laus soldiers talking. They claim that Lord Eliwood invaded Laus and drove them out.

speaker: Lyn
text: Eliwood? Why would he attack Laus?

speaker: Kent
text: It gets even more interesting… Not only did Marquess Laus abandon his castle, but he also left his son, Erik, behind when he fled here to Caelin.

speaker: Sain
text: That’s despicable! He abandoned his own son?

speaker: Lyn
text: But at least we know Eliwood is in Laus. We might be able to ask him for help. …Assuming there were a way to contact him.

speaker: Wil
text: If we are to avoid being caught, the best path would be through the forest. Shall I go?

speaker: Lyn
text: I suspect you’re right. Horses cannot move well in woods… It’ll take you a while, but you can travel lightly…

speaker: Florina
text: Lady Lyndis! I’ll go! I can fly above the forest. I can be in Laus faster than anyone else.

speaker: Lyn
text: Florina? You can’t do this on your own! It’s not possible!

speaker: Florina
text: Thanks to my time here, I’m no longer as timid around men as I used to be. And I’ve met Lord Eliwood before. I’m sure I can do this on my own.

speaker: Lyn
text: It will be terribly dangerous… You understand, don’t you?

speaker: Florina
text: Yes. But… I promised myself I would become braver for you. I’m not the weak little Florina I used to be. I’ll be fine. Trust me.

speaker: Lyn
text: You’ve convinced me. The job’s yours, Florina. But you must promise me that you won’t try anything impossible!

speaker: Florina
text: Yes, my lady. Farewell!

speaker: Sain
text: Did you hear our meek Florina? She sounded most forceful! Beautiful!

speaker: Kent
text: She’s become a full-fledged pegasus knight.

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, she has.

speaker: Wil
text: All for you, Lady Lyndis. That’s quite gallant.

speaker: Lyn
text: When we lived on the plains, I was always her protector. I know I shouldn’t feel sad, and yet…

speaker: Soldier
text: Commander Bauker! There’s something in the southern skies.

speaker: Bauker
text: Is that…a pegasus knight? Where do you suppose she’s going? It doesn’t matter. We’ve been told not to let anyone out of Caelin. Archers! Advance! Bring her down!

speaker: Florina
text: To reach Laus, I must go over the forest…and fly north. Then, I’ll have to… Wait! Who are those people? They fly no banner, and yet… Ah! That man in the lead! It’s Lord Eliwood! He’s come to Caelin’s aid! That’s wonderful. I have to tell him where Lady Lyndis is waiting!

speaker: Hector
text: I’ve spotted the enemy… Why are their archers advancing? They’re aiming at something up high.”

speaker: Marcus
text: Lord Eliwood, look! Up there! A pegasus knight!

speaker: Florina
text: Lord Eliwood!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Could it really be… Florina, is that you?

speaker: Florina
text: Yes! I’m Lady Lyndis’s…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Florina! Fly lower!

speaker: Florina
text: Wha–Oh! Aaaaaaah!!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Florina!!!

speaker: Hector
text: Oooh!

speaker: Florina
text: …… Ah…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Can you hear me? Florina?

speaker: Florina
text: Lord Eliwood?… I…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Those archers almost hit you. You avoided the arrows, but you lost your balance and fell.

speaker: Florina
text: And yet… I’m not hurt. I fell from such a height. What–

speaker: Hector
text: You got lucky. I didn’t. You landed right on top of me!

speaker: Florina
text: Oh!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector saved you.

speaker: Hector
text: I saved no one! I simply gave her someplace soft to land! A bale of hay could have done more than I did.

speaker: Florina
text: Eeek! Oh… Oh, I’m so sorry!

speaker: Eliwood
text: You were lucky, Florina. If you had fallen on me, I couldn’t have caught you. Or your pegasus either!

speaker: Hector
text: They fell one after the other! I couldn’t get out of the way!

speaker: Florina
text: M-M-My pegasus, too? I am so… I’m truly… I don’t know what to say! I…um… I……

speaker: Hector
text: No apology needed. You do need to tell us why you’re here, however.

speaker: Florina
text: Yes, of… of course! Lord Eliwood, Lady Lyndis is beyond that forest. She’s waiting for a chance to assault the castle.

speaker: Eliwood
text: She’s what!? Ah… Still, it’s good to hear she’s safe.

speaker: Florina
text: She’s fine. However, Lord Hausen’s been captured. He’s still in the castle.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I see. Let’s go then!

speaker: Bauker
text: Someone get up there and scour the area! I want to know if we brought down that pegasus knight! If she’s still breathing, make her stop!

speaker: Soldier
text: My lord! To the west! We’re under attack! It’s the Pheraen noble, Eliwood!

speaker: Bauker
text: He’s here, eh? Now’s our chance to show Marquess Laus our loyalty. Our opponents are a motley band of fools! They’re no match for us!

speaker: Erk
text: Pherae's new tactician... It was you all along, wasn't it, Mark? Me? I'm still traveling in pursuit of knowledge. I'll never outstrip my tutor, but I'm getting a bit closer... Well, Mark, tell me what you need me to do.

speaker: Florina
text: Uh... Mark... Um... It's me... Florina. Um... I'm... I'm over here.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyn!

speaker: Lyn
text: Eliwood?! You came here?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Florina told us where you were. We're here to help.

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you!

speaker: Lyn
text: Are you an ally, too?

speaker: Hector
text: Yep, that's what it looks like.

speaker: Lyn
text: In that case, I have something to tell you.

speaker: Hector
text: We're a bit busy now. Save it for later.

speaker: Lyn
text: What? Hold on! Wait just a minute!

speaker: Florina
text: Whew…I’m sorry, Makar. You must be all tired out from all the flying we’ve done. You need some water. That’s a good boy.

speaker: Hector
text: Hey, you! You’re in the way! Move!!!

speaker: Florina
text: Kyaaaa!

speaker: Hector
text: This is a battlefield! It’s not a stable! I’m not picking you up if you get shot down again!

speaker: Florina
text: Oh…uhm… Excuse me…it’s… Lord Hector, isn’t it? I…well…it’s…

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, hey! Eliwood! It’s the…

speaker: Florina
text: Ah…

speaker: Lyn
text: Hey you! You're ...

speaker: Matthew
text: Um... No I'm not. You've got the wrong fellow... Bye now!

speaker: Lyn
text: Stop right there Matthew!

speaker: Matthew
text: Saw right through my disguise, didn't you lady Lyndis?

speaker: Lyn
text: What are you talking about? How could I not recognise you? You're... You!

speaker: Matthew
text: Yes, but I had to at least try to fool you. Being memorable is not the best quality for a spy to have.

speaker: Lyn
text: Spy? I thought you were a thief!

speaker: Matthew
text: Oops!

speaker: Lyn
text: What's this about? Come on, tell me!

speaker: Matthew
text: I can't it's a secret.

speaker: Lyn
text: A secret? Would you have your mouth sealed if you spoke it?

speaker: Matthew
text: You're very knowledgeable!

speaker: Lyn
text: Very well, I'll ask no more questions. If you have any trouble, though, you can talk to me. I'm sure I'll be able to help. (Leaves)

speaker: Matthew
text: Ahhh, Lady Lyndis? I believe you are the one currently in trouble. You're either generous to a fault or something altogether.

speaker: Serra
text: Ah! Lyn! I'm so happy to see you safe!

speaker: Lyn
text: Serra! What are you doing in Caelin?

speaker: Serra
text: I'm with Lord Hector. We've come to save you!

speaker: Lyn
text: Hector?

speaker: Serra
text: Oh, come now! Lord Hector! Marquess Ostia's younger brother! He's a good friend of Lord Eliwood's by the way.

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh...I see. Well, thank you for coming, Serra. I'm glad to see you again.

speaker: Serra
text: It's no trouble at all! When a dear friend's in trouble, you have to help. It's a rule!

speaker: Lyn
text: A dear friend?

speaker: Serra
text: Don't worry. Social positions never bother me. I know we'll get along well, Lyn!

speaker: Lyn
text: Florina!

speaker: Florina
text: Lady Lyndis!

speaker: Lyn
text: You're unharmed! I'm so relieved. Really!

speaker: Florina
text: Was my service at all helpful?

speaker: Lyn
text: Of course it was! You saved us! Thank you!

speaker: Florina
text: Tee hee! I'll do even better next time!

speaker: Lyn
text: I'm counting on it!

speaker: Erk
text: Lady Lyndis, please stay back. I'll serve as the advance guard.

speaker: Lyn
text: Hm? You... Is that you, Erk?

speaker: Erk
text: Yes, my lady. A pleasure to see you.

speaker: Lyn
text: Erk, why are you here in Caelin?

speaker: Erk
text: For reasons of my own, I've joined up with Eliwood's company. We're here to rescue Caelin. Please, Lady Lyndis, would you kindly withdraw?

speaker: Lyn
text: My grandfather is in the castle. I'm not going to retreat from this battle!

speaker: Erk
text: You might be a noblewoman, but you haven't changed at all. Very well, at least stay near me. I'll be your escort.

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you Erk.

speaker: Lyn
text: Dorcas! Dorcas, is that you?

speaker: Dorcas
text: Glad you're well, Lyn.

speaker: Lyn
text: What are you doing in Caelin?

speaker: Dorcas
text: I'm working for a Pheraen nobleman. When talk came of Caelin, he grew worried about you. Looks like we got here in time...

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, thank you. However, my grandfather is still in the castle.

speaker: Dorcas
text: I understand. Let's do what we can do.

speaker: Lyn
text: Dorcas? Is Natalie in Lycia with you?

speaker: Dorcas
text: Uh-huh. We moved there when I saw it firsthand with you. She's waiting for me now in Pherae.

speaker: Lyn
text: Really? That's good. I'd enjoy seeing her again sometime.

speaker: Dorcas
text: She feels the same way about you. Someday... When you've free time, will you come for a visit?

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, of course! Once the fighting's done, I'll definitely come see you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Command Bauker… He was a fierce enemy. Lyndis, once we’ve defeated the remaining foe, the castle’s yours.

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you, Eliwood. If not for your help, I don’t know where I’d be right now.

speaker: Eliwood
text: All of this happened because we routed Lord Darin at Laus. It’s only right that we help.

speaker: Lyn
text: You explained your motives to me, Eliwood. This is about your father. I would do the same thing in your position. What happened in Caelin is not your fault.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Thank you. However, until your castle is yours again, I take responsibility.

speaker: Lyn
text: I understand. Thank you.

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! We’re moving into the castle!

speaker: Eliwood
text: All right.

speaker: Lyn
text: Who’s that?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Oh, yes. Let me introduce you. Hector!

speaker: Hector
text: What?

speaker: Eliwood
text: This is Lyndis. She’s Lord Hausen’s granddaughter. Lyndis, this is Hector. He’s Lord Uther’s brother.

speaker: Lyn
text: His brother? Really?

speaker: Hector
text: Yes.

speaker: Lyn
text: I was watching the way he fights… He’s not like you, Eliwood. He’s somewhat like my own knights, but different still. He relies so much on power. It’s like he’s never been…

speaker: Hector
text: I haven’t. I taught myself how to fight.

speaker: Lyn
text: I’ve no issue with that, but the way you swing that axe around… You’re a threat to your allies! You should be more watchful.

speaker: Hector
text: What did you say?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis? What’s come over you?

speaker: Lyn
text: Hm? Oh…I… My apologies. I didn’t intend to seem so critical.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Granted, Hector’s style may be a tad dangerous, but… There’s no one I depend on more. You may think him careless, but he’s always aware of his surroundings.

speaker: Hector
text: The more you praise me, the less worthy I sound.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis, once you fight alongside Hector, I’m sure you’ll understand.

speaker: Lyn
text: I’m sure you’re right. I apologize, Hector. I’m honored to have your help.

speaker: Hector
text: No apology necessary. I’m glad I can lend a hand.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let’s go inside, shall we?

speaker: Lyn
text: Mark! Is it really you, Mark? So good to see you! Have you been well?

speaker: Kent
text: Well met, Mark. Good to see you again.

speaker: Sain
text: Well! This really is a pleasant surprise!

speaker: Wil
text: Hello, Mark! Has it really been a year?

speaker: Lyn
text: What’s wrong, Florina? You needn’t hide back there.

speaker: Florina
text: Um… Nice to see you again. I don’t suppose you… Do you…remember me?

speaker: Lyn
text: Everyone who remained in Caelin speaks of you fondly. We’re always saying “I wonder where Mark is…” Yes…you’re right. This isn’t the best time to catch up. We’re here to rescue my grandfather. Mark, will you help me again?

speaker: Darin
text: Ri…Ridiculous… Even Bauker?

speaker: Hausen
text: Lord Darin, it’s time to give up this madness. Further resistance is meaningless. For what you’ve done, you may never be forgiven, but it’s not too late to try. Tell Eliwood everything. He’ll intervene with Marquess Ostia on your behalf…

speaker: Darin
text: I…I’ve…lost…

speaker: Hausen
text: Hurry! Eliwood will be here in no time. Let me speak for you. Gurr… Guaaaa!!

speaker: Ephidel
text: None of that now. Marquess Laus needs no troublesome advice.

speaker: Darin
text: L-Lord Ephidel?

speaker: Ephidel
text: There is no turning back for you now. You should know that. First, Marquess Santaruz… and now Marquess Caelin. Both deaths are on your head.

speaker: Darin
text: What? It was by your hand that they both died! I-I never asked for this.

speaker: Ephidel
text: Yes, I killed them… for you.

speaker: Darin
text: To…trap me?

speaker: Ephidel
text: Don’t be absurd. I follow my master’s orders. My only wish is to deliver your dreams to you. The crown of a united Lycia…. And once that is done, dominion over the entire continent. Is that not what you desire?

speaker: Darin
text: … … …Yes…Yes, of course. That dream IS still worth a few sacrifices, isn’t it?

speaker: Ephidel
text: You’re exactly right. Our plans may have gone drastically awry, but as long as we have the master’s power behind us, we cannot be defeated. We’d do well to leave now, before those meddlesome worms arrive. You will leave everyone from Laus behind. We will use them to delay our foe.

speaker: Darin
text: Everyone… My soldiers? But…who will protect me?

speaker: Ephidel
text: The Black Fang and I will more than suffice for that task. There is nothing else you need, I assure you.

speaker: Darin
text: Yes…I…I see that now. Where do we go from here?

speaker: Ephidel
text: To the Dragon’s Gate… Our master awaits us there. The master has informed me our hostage may be all we need. If all goes well, we may be able to perform the ceremony with him alone.

speaker: Darin
text: Oh! Is that so? I suppose we’ve nothing to worry about.

speaker: Ephidel
text: That is correct. Now please, begin your retreat. I have two or three orders to give, then I will be right behind you.

speaker: Ephidel
text: Pathetic imbecile… Leila? Where are you?

speaker: Leila
text: I’m here.

speaker: Ephidel
text: While Eliwood is occupied, finish off Marquess Caelin and hide the body. The enemy will waste precious time searching for him.

speaker: Leila
text: As you command…

speaker: Ephidel
text: You know, you’ve only been with the Black Fang a short while. However, you are quite skilled… I look forward to watching you.

speaker: Leila
text: Yes, sir.

speaker: Man
text: Ah, you there! You’re Caelin knights, aren’t you? Marquess Laus’s man, the one called Bauker... He seems like a gentle man, but his skill is near legendary. Do you carry weapons suited to battling knights? Take this if you please.

speaker: Woman
text: Different shops carry different items for sale. If you find something you’ve never seen, you should buy it, just to try. By the way, have you been to the local shop? If not, you should drop in. My daughter runs the place.

speaker: Woman
text: You’re all Caelin knights, are you not? What? Lord Hausen’s still in the castle? Oh... This was to be for our daughter’s wedding, but... Here. Please help Marquess Caelin. Our lord needs rescuing.

speaker: Man
text: Weapons are only as strong as the material they’re made of. Most of the weapons you have now are made of iron, right? Iron is a poor match for steel, and poorer still for silver! Slim weapons are weaker than iron ones, but easier to wield. Good weapons are expensive, but they’re worth the cost.

speaker: Woman
text: Your company seems close-knit. It’s vital to have friends who support and assist you, isn’t it? You have to be close to someone if you really want to get along. Stay close to those with whome you’re compatible to strengthen your bond. A reading by a fortune-teller will tell you who you’re compatible with. But don’t become so concerned about it that you forget to fight!

speaker: Nergal
text: Ah, sweet Ninian. This time, you will open the gate.

speaker: Nergal
text: So you intend to resist me to the end? You only joined me to postpone your own friends' deaths, did you? You never had any intention of offering your aid freely?

speaker: Nergal
text: ...Heh heh heh... Whether you wish it or not, it is all the same to me. I will call forth a dragon and claims its quintessence. I will harness a power never before seen on this world. And I will become this world's master. That is my desire. Ninian, you are but a tool to help me achieve that end.

speaker: Ninian
text: ...I don't want to help you. I... I don't want to do it.

speaker: Nergal
text: Don't want to? You are truly amusing. My dear, I am not looking for your consent. You are weak, and I am strong. You will bend before me.

speaker: Ninian
text: No...

speaker: Nergal
text: It's the same as when I sacrificed Eliwood's father. With enough energy, I do not need your acquiescence. Come, Ninian. Open the gate!

speaker: Ninian
text: No...no... No... Nooooooooo!

speaker: Nergal
text: So, at least... Your true form... is liberated. Hmph. To where do you hope to run, beast? You'll never be human. Why do you cling to them so? What would Eliwood say if he saw your hideous form? Ninian, for one such as you, there will never be a place you can call your home!

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...I never imagined there could be a place like this in Lycia...

speaker: Lyn
text: The air is so hot. It even hurts to breathe.

speaker: Hector
text: Look down there. There's lava everywhere. Hey! Next to the path... Are those columns of flame?!

speaker: Athos
text: Long ago, in the depths of this cavern... When Lycia was a single country, an altar was built.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Here? In this place?

speaker: Athos
text: There's something here that needs protection from those with evil hearts.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Durandal, right?

speaker: Athos
text: That's correct. The weapons we wielded contained great strength. Power fearsome enough to cut down dragons... Today, the might in those remaining weapons is not what it once was. Yet they have been safeguarded to keep them from evil hands. This place... No one's stepped foot in here since Roland's death. Roland's presence still fills the air. All that reside here now are former soldiers who guard the sword. This is your trial, Eliwood. A few of you may enter, but only you can approach the altar. Go and prove that you have the strength to wield Durandal!

speaker: Hector
text: Listen, Mark. You know how Eliwood is. Never wants to burden anyone else... Takes all responsibility on himself... Now, more than ever, we have to support him. Let's go, Mark!

speaker: Georg
text: …I am one of… Sir Roland’s… warriors…Georg……You trespass here… I will…cut…you down…

speaker: Georg
text: …… …I don’t understand… you seem…familiar… …Who…are…you…? …You and …Sir Roland are as one…

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...You have stood your guard for so, so long. I'm sorry...

speaker: Athos
text: Their souls may now rest. ...At long last...

speaker: Athos
text: Time for a reunion of sorts. Eliwood, move back.

speaker: Athos
text: My old friend... The little knight, Sir Roland.

speaker: Athos
text: Roland... Awaken, and answer my call.

speaker: Roland
text: ...My friend... Wise, all-seeing Athos...

speaker: Athos
text: Good to see you, Roland.

speaker: Roland
text: I feel much time has passed. Seeing you again... It brings back memories. Fighting the dragons... Old friends... All this time, lost in memory...

speaker: Athos
text: It's been almost a thousand years...and yet, once again, the world is threatened by one who craves the might of dragons.

speaker: Roland
text: ...The might of dragons?

speaker: Athos
text: Heed my words, Roland. This boy is descended from your blood. Please, lend him your strength.

speaker: Roland
text: I...no longer have flesh and bone in this world. I cannot... No, wait. Take this. Its blade shall serve as a vessel for my soul's strength.

speaker: Athos
text: ...If you do such a thing, you will pass forever from the reach of this world.

speaker: Roland
text: And yet my heart will be glad. If I might help my children, there is nothing else I need do. ...I ask that you see this through, my friend...

speaker: Athos
text: I will...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Athos, who was that man?

speaker: Athos
text: So you were able to see him, too? That was your ancestor, the warrior Roland.

speaker: Eliwood
text: That was Roland?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Look! Above the altar! A sword...

speaker: Athos
text: Take it! It belongs to you now.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...What a wondrous blade.

speaker: Athos
text: Durandal. The sword of sacred fire.

speaker: Hector
text: So this is the legendary blade...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Durandal, the sword of sacred fire.

speaker: Lyn
text: ...It's strange, isn't it? I've never seen it before, and yet it feels so familiar...

speaker: Eliwood
text: I will use this to battle Nergal. Come! To the Dragon's Gate... What!? The sword... It's glowing... Watch out! Something's coming...

speaker: Eliwood
text: It can't be...

speaker: Lyn
text: It's a...dragon!

speaker: Hector
text: No!!! How is it possible!?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Get back, everyone!

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! Are you all right?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I think so... My body moved on its own. It was as if the sword itself was guiding my arm.

speaker: Athos
text: The sword of sacred fire was made to combat dragons. With so much power, who can say what it might be capable of? But this ice dragon... Surely...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Is something the matter, Lord Athos...

speaker: Athos
text: No...
Let me be the one to answer that.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Blackheart! Nergal!

speaker: Nergal
text: Ninian proved useless. I've come for a replacement.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nils!

speaker: Nergal
text: Don't waste your breath. He won't be awake for some time. Nils will do for me what Ninian would not.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Scum! What have you done with Ninian!?

speaker: Nergal
text: It's not what I've done. It's what you've done, Eliwood.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What?

speaker: Nergal
text: Eliwood, did you never once question it? Why the siblings were needed to open the Dragon's Gate? Why did it have to be Ninian and Nils?

speaker: Nergal
text: The answer is simple. The Dragon's Gate cannot be opened by humans. Why would humans be able to open a gate that was designed...for dragons?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...What?

speaker: Nergal
text: It's pitiful, really. Poor Ninian's plight. Coaxed by my honeyed words, she passed through the gate... Though unable to return home, she refused to aid me and wandered lost and alone, until...she was slain by the hand of the one she loved.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What... What are you saying?

speaker: Nergal
text: Can you not guess? Or is it that you are afraid to know? Very well. Let me tell you, Eliwood. The ice dragon there... The beast slaughtered by your hand... That is Ninian. The girl who adored you. She returned to her true form and lost all human memory. Yet you, above all else, remained in her heart, and she came here... Look upon the creature you have slain. That is Ninian.

speaker: Nergal
text: Go on, look. She's using the last of her strength to take human form for one last time. I believe there may be still be time enough to say farewell. You know, of course, that you cannot save her.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nergal!! You foul demon !!

speaker: Nergal
text: It's not me. You, Eliwood. You killed her. You--

speaker: Eliwood
text: I... Aaaaaaahhh!!!

speaker: Hector
text: Calm down! Get hold of yourself, Eliwood.

speaker: Ninian
text: Lo...Lord Eliwood...

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Ninian?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian! Ninian!

speaker: Ninian
text: Eliwood...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian... Please don't die... I... What have I done?

speaker: Ninian
text: I'm glad...

speaker: Eliwood
text: What?

speaker: Ninian
text: That you are unharmed, my lord... I'm so glad...

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Ninian... Ninian? You can't... Answer me... Niniaaaaaaan!!!!

speaker: Nergal
text: That's enough. You will await the end of the world trembling in the shadow of dragons!

speaker: Athos
text: I will not permit it. Instead, I will see you perish in flame!!

speaker: Nergal
text: The purest fire... Flame breath. Very impressive, Archsage Athos. However... However, fire is no longer my foe! Look! Not even a legendary blade can cause me harm! At long last, I am impervious! Ha ha...ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!!!

speaker: Nergal
text: Miserable, aren't you, Athos? Yet out of respect for the great man you used to be, I'll leave. After all, 500 years ago, we followed the same path, did we not, old friend? Ha ha ha ha ha!!

speaker: Hector
text: What do we do now? Not even legendary weapons can stop him!

speaker: Lyn
text: Nils! You're awake! Are you OK?

speaker: Nils
text: ...Ninian! ......Ninian. ...Ninian!? Where is my...

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Nils... ...I'm so sorry.

speaker: Nils
text: ...Uuh... Aaaaaaaaaa!!!!!

speaker: Helman
text: Master Ephidel! What is the meaning of this?

speaker: Ephidel
text: Peace, Lord Helman. Whatever is wrong?

speaker: Helman
text: You said you were just going to frighten Eliwood! Your men almost killed him! My patience is at an end! I've decided I must tell Eliwood everything and apologize.

speaker: Ephidel
text: .......You would betray us?

speaker: Helman
text: I am tired of you and the Black Fang! Now, remove yourself from my castle! Your presence pains me!

speaker: Ephidel
text: Lord Helman... Is there nothing I can do to change your mind?

speaker: Helman
text: Nothing.

speaker: Ephidel
text: In that case...you're no longer of any use.

speaker: Helman
text: Gaa...urrgh...

speaker: Hector
text: There's the castle, Eliwood! Hm? Who's there? Show yourself!

speaker: Boies
text: Pah! Can't believe I was spotted by a snot-nosed stripling...

speaker: Hector
text: Who are you? No, never mind. Keep your name. Why should I care what a corpse is called?

speaker: Boies
text: The cub thinks he's a wolf! Does your bite match your bark? Tell you what. If you make it to the castle alive, we'll find out, eh? Geh heh heh hehhh!

speaker: Mercenary
text: Hey, you! Yeah, the new dog! Get this right, or you're gone!

speaker: Guy
text: I know, I know. I just got this job! I don't want to lose it!

speaker: Guy
text: 'Course, the smart thing to do would have been not to get involved with this ugly bunch. Got to have gold if I want to eat, though. I was too picky before. If I think about the time I passed out in Caelin... Ooooh. Nothing funny about that! That man... What was his name... Matthew? If it hadn't been for him, I would've starved to death...

speaker: Mercenary
text: What are you mumbling about? Get over here now!

speaker: Guy
text: Yes, yes, I'm coming! At least I've got work!

speaker: Lowen
text: Nice to be working with you, Mark! As a journeyman knight of Pherae, I'm here to serve Lord Eliwood and you, Mark! I await your command!

speaker: Matthew
text: Say, Mark. Not sure how to say this... You're a full-blown tactician now, aren't you? Not just an apprentice like before. Ha ha... No need to be so modest. My lord tactician! I humbly await your no-doubt brilliant orders!

speaker: Matthew
text: Hold on! You! I know you! Isn’t your name Guy?

speaker: Guy
text: It’s–Is that you, Matthew?

speaker: Matthew
text: What a pleasant surprise! How’s your swordwork coming?

speaker: Guy
text: You are aware this isn’t the best place to be catching up, aren’t you? You and I…We’re on opposite sides here.

speaker: Matthew
text: What? Are you saying you’re going to fight me?

speaker: Guy
text: I…Well, yeah. I’m much improved. You can’t beat me.

speaker: Matthew
text: You’re quite a terror, Guy. Well then… Hold on! I’d prefer it if you repaid what you owe me.

speaker: Guy
text: Huh?

speaker: Matthew
text: Last time I saw you, I gave you food.  If I remember correctly, you said you owed me your life.

speaker: Guy
text: I only said that ’cause you said you’d feed me if I did! I hadn’t eaten in ten days, and you were cooking meat! You… This… This isn’t fair!

speaker: Matthew
text: The people of Sacae never lie. Isn’t that right, Guy?

speaker: Guy
text: Grrr… Fine! I finally find work, and now I have to throw it away! This is all your fault!

speaker: Boies
text: What’s this? You’ve made it this far? Ah, I paid too much for that worthless pack of sellswords!

speaker: Boies
text: You’ve beaten me…but you’re too late to save him… Too…too bad, eh, laddie? Geha ha…geha!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Helman!!

speaker: Helman
text: … Is that you…Eliwood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hold on, my lord!

speaker: Helman
text: I… I must apologize… Your father… He…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Do you know something, sir?

speaker: Helman
text: I… … If I hadn’t told Elbert…about…Darin’s plans…This would…never…have…Cough cough…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Helman!

speaker: Helman
text: …..Go to Laus…Darin…the marquess of Laus…knows all.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Marquess Laus?

speaker: Helman
text: I’m sorry, Eliwood…I…I can’t…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hold on!

speaker: Helman
text: Beware…the Black…Fang………

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Helman!

speaker: Hector
text: He’s gone…

speaker: Eliwood
text: It can’t be…Lord Helman…Why……Why did this happen?

speaker: Hector
text: Blast! What is going on?!?

speaker: Eliwood
text: …..We go to Laus. We must speak to the marquess of Laus, Lord Darin.

speaker: Hector
text: You’re right. We should leave quickly. I’m not sure how far we can get today, but…I can’t sit still.

speaker: Servant
text: Pardon me…

speaker: Hector
text: Hm?

speaker: Servant
text: If I may?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Who are you?

speaker: Servant
text: I’m the steward of Santaruz. With our lord gone, what are we to do?

speaker: Hector
text: First, you give Lord Helman a proper burial. After that…I’m sure the Lycian Council will have to meet. Stay here and defend the castle until you hear more.

speaker: Servant
text: I understand.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let’s go. We must keep moving.

speaker: Hector
text: Yes…and now we seek answers for Marquess Santaruz, too.

speaker: Eliwood
text: …Lord Helman…May you find peace.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...We’re here. The Dragon’s Gate...

speaker: Eliwood
text: What’s wrong, Ninian? You’re trembling.

speaker: Ninian
text: ...This place... so frightening. Something... powerful...

speaker: Lyn
text: It’s her power, isn’t it?

speaker: Hector
text: Her power? What’s that?

speaker: Lyn
text: Ninian has the ability to sense impending danger. Her memory may be gone, but her power remains.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What is it you sense, Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: I... should not have... come here. Something awful will happen if I’m here. Ah!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian!? Snap out of it!

speaker: Ninian
text: This place... No... I... I...

speaker: Eliwood
text: She’s getting worse! Let’s get her away from here!

speaker: Ephidel
text: You’ll not be going anywhere.

speaker: Ephidel
text: That little bird has escaped this island cage twice. Now that she’s back, she’ll not be allowed to fly away again.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Who are you!?

speaker: Ephidel
text: We meet at last. I am Ephidel. Pleased to make your acquaintance.

speaker: Hector
text: You’re Ephidel? I’ve been looking forward to this.

speaker: Ephidel
text: ...Gallantly spoken. Of course, I know who you are. Marquess Ostia’s younger brother, Lord Hector. And here we have Caelin’s beloved princess, Lady Lyndis.

speaker: Ephidel
text: By the way, the gift I left for you in the forest… Was is to your liking? The corpse of that filthy red-haired traitor?

speaker: Hector
text: Monster! Stay right there! I’m going to crush the life from you with my bare hands.

speaker: Ephidel
text: Now I see! She was an Ostian spy, wasn’t she? Don’t worry, she did not suffer. It only took one blow.

speaker: Hector
text: Die‼

speaker: Eliwood
text: He vanished‼

speaker: Ninian
text: What--!?

speaker: Ephidel
text: This girl is needed for my master’s ceremony.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian!

speaker: Ninian
text: Lord Eliwood! Let me go!

speaker: Lyn
text: Vanished...

speaker: Hector
text: Blast!!

speaker: Darin
text: Lord Ephidel! Is the girl with you?

speaker: Ephidel
text: As you can see...

speaker: Darin
text: Oho! The ritual can take place at last!

speaker: Ephidel
text: Yes. However, we have an infestation of mice to deal with… They should be scurrying in here momentarily. They must be dealt with before the ritual takes place. May I entrust this task to you?

speaker: Darin
text: Of course. Who do you think I am?! I am Darin, Marquess Laus! Ruler of this world!

speaker: Ephidel
text: Very well, I leave it to you.

speaker: Darin
text: Ruler of the world... Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha!

speaker: Ephidel
text: Humans… They are so very fragile.

speaker: Nergal
text: Ah... you’ve done well. Precious Ephidel. Shall we prepare for the ritual?

speaker: Elbert
text: Nergal!!

speaker: Nergal
text: Does it gall you, Marquess Pherae? It’s destiny. There could be no other outcome. Despite all of your mischief, the girl was fated to return to me.

speaker: Elbert
text: My son... Where is Eliwood?

speaker: Nergal
text: He’s still alive. Of course, it’s only a matter of time before the Black Fang finishes him.

speaker: Elbert
text: ...Nergal! Prepare to die!!

speaker: Nergal
text: Eh!?

speaker: Elbert
text: Urrgg... grrr... haa...!!

speaker: Nergal
text: ...That was a surprise. When did he undo his bonds? Heh heh... Why do you not heed my warnings, Lord Elbert? You cannot alter destiny. Stop this foolishness.

speaker: E Lbert
text: ...Urrgh... grraa...

speaker: Nergal
text: Jaffar, take Marquess Pherae and the girl to the far chamber. I will begin preparations for the ritual.

speaker: Jaffar
text: Thy will be done.

speaker: Cameron
text: I’ve been waiting for you, son of Pherae.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Where is my father?

speaker: Cameron
text: Inside… He’s farther inside. You will never see him, though. Even if you break through here, the path you seek is guarded my Marquess Laus. Will you not withdraw? It’s too late for that, isn’t it? You’ll never leave here alive. Ha ha ha ha ha!

speaker: Sain
text: Tactician! The final battle is approaching. That traitor, Laus… He harmed Lord Hausen, caused grief to Lady Lyndis… As a true knight of Caelin, I will make him pay! Leave him to me!!

speaker: Kent
text: Mark, let me take the point. I will break through, even though it may cost me my life. If something does happen to me, Mark... Lady Lyndis... Please watch over her. Now, Mark, give me my orders!

speaker: Enemy
text: Hey, you! What are you doing here?!

speaker: Legault
text: What am I doing? Is that a proper greeting? If you don’t know me, you must be a new recruit, yes?

speaker: Enemy
text: Uh... I was assigned to the Dragon’s Gate about one month ago.

speaker: Legault
text: I thought as much. I am Legault. You’ve heard my name, yes?

speaker: Enemy
text: Legault... Ah! You... You’re the Hurricane? Second in ability to none but the Four Fangs?

speaker: Legault
text: Yes, yes. That’s me.

speaker: Enemy
text: I... I beg your pardon.

speaker: Legault
text: No worries.

speaker: Legault
text: ...Now then, time to fill my purse with treasure and leave the Black Fang behind. No sense staying on a sinking ship. No sense at all.

speaker: Legault
text: Well now, a welcome visitor, indeed. I must thank you for coming so far.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What!? You’re a...

speaker: Legault
text: Mmm... To be accurate, I would say a former Black Fang member.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Black Fang‼

speaker: Legault
text: Ha, no! "Former" Black Fang. Now I’m simply a thief.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Huh? So you’re not my foe, is that what you’re saying?

speaker: Legault
text: Correct. So let’s pretend we never saw each other.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hold on!

speaker: Legault
text: Hm?

speaker: Eliwood
text: If you’re not my enemy, may I ask for your aid?

speaker: Legault
text: Me? Help you?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I want to know about the Black Fang. ...Please.

speaker: Legault
text: This is a surprise. Are you really going to battle the Black Fang?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes.

speaker: Legault
text: Your enemy is not Brendan Reed, but a horrible man named Nergal.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes, I know this already.

speaker: Legault
text: You’re quite plucky. I like you! However, I know almost nothing of the current Black Fang. If you still want my aid...

speaker: Eliwood
text: I do! Thank you. My name’s Eliwood.

speaker: Legault
text: I’m Legault. I’ll help you as long as I feel safe.

speaker: Legault
text: Well now, a welcome visitor, indeed. I must thank you for coming so far.

speaker: Lyn
text: What!? You’re Black Fang, aren't you?

speaker: Legault
text: Mmm... To be accurate, I would say a former Black Fang member.

speaker: Lyn
text: Former...

speaker: Legault
text: Yes. Now I’m simply a thief.

speaker: Lyn
text: Huh? So you’re not my enemy, is that it?

speaker: Legault
text: Correct. So let’s pretend we never saw each other.

speaker: Lyn
text: Hold on!

speaker: Legault
text: Hm?

speaker: Lyn
text: If you’re not my enemy, please help me.

speaker: Legault
text: Me? Help you?

speaker: Lyn
text: Not everyone in Black Fang is evil. I'll not grant mercy in battle, but any information you can provide may help us avoid unneeded fighting.

speaker: Legault
text: You surprise me. Are you really looking not to hurt people?

speaker: Lyn
