text: The first person we fought on this island was Uhai... I don't believe he was a bad man. There must be some way we can get by without fighting.

speaker: Legault
text: Hmmm... I know a few like that. Did you know that your enemy isn't Brendan Reed? It's a creepy fellow by the name of Nergal...

speaker: Lyn
text: I was aware of that. That's the man we've come to defeat.

speaker: Legault
text: ...Plucky, aren't you? I like that. I like you! However, I know almost nothing of the current Black Fang. If that's OK...

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you. My name’s Lyn.

speaker: Legault
text: I’m Legault. I’ll help you as long as I feel safe.

speaker: Legault
text: Well now, a welcome visitor, indeed. I must thank you for coming so far.

speaker: Hector
text: You’re Black Fang, aren’t you?!

speaker: Legault
text: Mmm... To be accurate, I’m Black Fang no mo–

speaker: Hector
text: I thought as much! Take this!!

speaker: Legault
text: Whoa! A touch hasty, aren’t you? Hear me out, will you? Black Fang no more! No more! I have only recently severed my ties with them. Now, I’m merely a thief. Satisfied?

speaker: Hector
text: Huh... So you’re just looking for an easy way out?

speaker: Legault
text: Nothing better than being carefree, is there? I will admit that everyone has his own set of values, though. Well then, I’ll take my leave of you.

speaker: Hector
text: Hold it!

speaker: Legault
text: Hm?

speaker: Hector
text: If you’re not one of them, why don’t you help me out?

speaker: Legault
text: Me? Help you?

speaker: Hector
text: You’re not with the Black Fang anymore, right?

speaker: Legault
text: Are you seriously going to fight them?

speaker: Hector
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Legault
text: Let me tell you a little something, OK? Your enemy here isn’t Brendan Reed. There’s this creepy fellow named Nergal......

speaker: Hector
text: I don’t care!! They’re all responsible for attacking my homeland and my friends. I’m going to rip them apart with my bare hands!

speaker: Legault
text: You sound tough, but are you anything more than a little lordling?

speaker: Hector
text: What did you say?

speaker: Legault
text: I’ve always been fond of simple, honest children. They’re so sincere... Things are never boring when they’re around. ...You know, I think I will help you. However, I know almost nothing about the current Black Fang. If that’s OK...

speaker: Hector
text: No problem.  Any little thing you can tell me will help.

speaker: Legault
text: I’m Legault. I’ll help you as long as I feel safe.

speaker: Darin
text: Hah... hah ha ha! You dare challenge me? I, who will rule the world!?

speaker: Darin
text: Blood? Is this... my blood? Ephidel! Come to me!! Your master... calls you! I am the ruler... of... the... world...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Darin! Your treachery ends here!!

speaker: Darin
text: Ha ha ha ha. I will never fall to the likes of you!!

speaker: Darin
text: Oh... You’re Marquess Ostia’s younger brother...

speaker: Hector
text: I couldn’t care less if you’ve a grudge against Ostia. I’ll put up with your treachery no longer!

speaker: Darin
text: Heh heh heh… Ostia is no longer my main concern... Nor is the whole of Lycia... The only goal worthy of my attention is the entire world!

speaker: Hector
text: You’re mad!!

speaker: Lyn
text: Are you Darin? My grandfather… You tried to…

speaker: Darin
text: What? Who are you?

speaker: Lyn
text: I am Marquess Caelin’s granddaughter, Lyndis!

speaker: Darin
text: Oh… that senile fool? …That doddering wreck dared disagree with me… I was so happy to be rid of him.

speaker: Lyn
text: You’re a dead man!

speaker: Lyn
text: He was mad.

speaker: Hector
text: Consumed by his own lust... Pitiful fool.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Lord Darin.

speaker: Hector
text: C’mon, Eliwood! This is no time for sentiment.

speaker: Lyn
text: Your father needs you!

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Let’s go!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Father! Father!? It’s me! Eliwood!! I’ve come to save you! ...Father?

speaker: Hector
text: It’s dark in here. Can’t see a thing...

speaker: Elbert
text: Eli... Eliwood...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah!! Father! Where are you?

speaker: Lyn
text: Back there! Eliwood!! His voice is coming from back there!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah! Father! You... You’re all right...

speaker: Elbert
text: Eliwood... Wait! For-Forget me! Take that girl and flee!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian?!

speaker: Elbert
text: That girl... She’s the key to the Dragon’s Gate. Hurry! Go, before Nergal notices you!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian! This way! We must flee!

speaker: Lyn
text: Something’s wrong with her... Yet we’ve no time to hesitate.

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! I’ve got your father! You take Ninian!

speaker: Eliwood
text: I understand!

speaker: Hector
text: Lord Elbert! I’m going to move you a little. Be strong.

speaker: Elbert
text: Hector...you came, too? ...Thank you.

speaker: Hector
text: Don’t worry about that. Come, let’s leave this place.

speaker: Lyn
text: Eliwood! Hector!! Hurry! This way!! Ah!!

speaker: Jaffar
text: ......You will not pass here.

speaker: Lyn
text: When did you?

speaker: Elbert
text: You must not fight that man!!

speaker: Lyn
text: What!?

speaker: Elbert
text: That man...is dangerous. You cannot defeat him on your own.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Father, there’s no time. This danger must be faced.

speaker: Ephidel
text: ...Be a good boy, and listen to your father, young master Eliwood.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ephidel!!

speaker: Ephidel
text: Even among the Black Fang, this man is feared for his skill... You are no match for him, not even as a group. ...You’ve done well, Jaffar. That is all. Return to Bern and begin your next assignment.

speaker: Ephidel
text: Hear my word! I have an invitation from my master. In honor of your hard-fought arrival, he’s prepared a special show for you.

speaker: Elbert
text: Stop it! You cannot release the dragons!!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Father? What’s all this about?

speaker: Ephidel
text: ...You will know shortly. At the expense of your father’s life!

speaker: Elbert
text: Guwaah! ...Gaa...ghaa...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Father! What’s wrong? Father!

speaker: Hector
text: Lord Elbert! Hold on!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Huh? ...Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: Pow...pow...er... ...power...

speaker: Elbert
text: Gahaaa!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Father!!!

speaker: Nergal
text: Now, Ninian...at last. Open the Dragon’s Gate.

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Gate... Open...gate...

speaker: Nergal
text: Yes...that’s it... This way, dragon...

speaker: Hector
text: Whoa! What’s... What’s this rumbling!?

speaker: Lyn
text: Unh! I can barely keep my feet!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nergal... What... What’s happening!?

speaker: Ninian
text: Here... Come, children of...flame. Come...to me...

speaker: Hector
text: ...It can’t be.

speaker: Lyn
text: Ah... No... It isn’t...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Is that...truly........ a dragon?

speaker: Nergal
text: Ha ha ha ha ha! Yes! Use all your strength! Squeeze every drop from your body! You will call dragons!
...I will not allow this!!

speaker: Ephidel
text: Who’s there?! ...You!

speaker: Lyn
text: Nils!

speaker: Nils
text: Ninian! Come to your senses! You must not do what they want!

speaker: Nergal
text: Nils? Not now! Grrr...Ephidel! Stop him!!

speaker: Ephidel
text: Desist, Nils! The power... It runs wild!!

speaker: Nils
text: Ninian!!

speaker: Nils
text: Here! Hurry!! The dragon is crumbling. Everyone flee!!

speaker: Ephidel
text: Hyaaaa! Stop... You mustn’t come here!! Lord Nergal! Lord Nergal! Please......!!! Guwaaaaaaahhh!!!!!!

speaker: Hector
text: ...Something...happened.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Is it...gone?

speaker: Nergal
text: No! I’ve failed! Nils, you whelp! If not for your interference...... Come! Both of you!

speaker: Ninian
text: What? No!

speaker: Nils
text: Never! We will not follow you!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian! Nils!

speaker: Nergal
text: Eh!!

speaker: Elbert
text: You will...not!

speaker: Nergal
text: What!? ...Impossible... Not...by your hand...

speaker: Elbert
text: ...I told you. I will...oppose... you always......

speaker: Nergal
text: ...Why... won’t...you...die? Nnn...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Father!!

speaker: Elbert
text: ...Eliwood. Be prepared. He will return...

speaker: Eliwood
text: All right, but for now... Let’s leave this island... Let’s go home.

speaker: Elbert
text: No, my son... I’m done here. You, Eliwood... You must finish this.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Don’t say that! Mother is waiting in Pherae... She’s waiting for you, Father!

speaker: Elbert
text: Ah... Eleanora... She will be cross with me. Eliwood... Your mother... I’m sorry... Tell her... I’m...sorry...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Father?

speaker: Eliwood
text: No... Please, not now... Not after all we’ve done to find you again... Father... Please... Open your eyes...... Faaaatherrrrrrr!!!!

speaker: Lyn
text: Mark! Over here! This is Bulgar, the biggest city in all of Sacae. We should purchase supplies for our journey.
Oh, my heart! What a dazzling vision of loveliness!

speaker: Lyn
text: Hm?

speaker: Sain
text: Wait, O beauteous one! Would you not favour me with your name? Or better yet, your company?

speaker: Lyn
text: Where are you from, sir knight, that you speak so freely to a stranger?

speaker: Sain
text: Ha! I thought you’d never ask. I am from Lycia. I hail from the Caelin canton, home to men of passion and fire!

speaker: Lyn
text: Shouldn’t that be home to callow oafs with loose tongues?

speaker: Sain
text: Ooooh... You’re even lovely when you’re cruel.

speaker: Lyn
text: Let’s go, Mark. I‘ve nothing more to say.

speaker: Sain
text: Wait! Please...

speaker: Kent
text: Sain! Hold your tongue!

speaker: Sain
text: Ah, Kent! My boon companion! Why so severe an expression?

speaker: Kent
text: If your manner were more serious, I wouldn’t have to be so severe! We still have a mission to complete, Sain!

speaker: Sain
text: I know that. But how could I remain silent in the presence of such beauty? It would have been discourteous!

speaker: Kent
text: What do you know about courtesy!?

speaker: Lyn
text: Excuse me! You’re blocking the road. If you would be so kind as to move your horses...

speaker: Kent
text: Of course. My apologies...

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you. You, at least, seem honourable enough.

speaker: Kent
text: Hm? Pardon me, but... I feel we’ve met before.

speaker: Lyn
text: I beg your pardon?

speaker: Sain
text: Hey! No fair, Kent! I saw her first!

speaker: Lyn
text: Tsk! It seems there are no decent men among Lycia’s knights! Let’s go, Mark! I’ve run out of patience!

speaker: Kent
text: Wait, please! It’s not like that! ...... Sain, you lout!

speaker: Sain
text: Huh? Not like that? I thought you were...

speaker: Kent
text: I am NOT you!!! Come, we must follow her! I suspect she might be—

speaker: Sain
text: Be what? She’s our mission? You’re joking! Wait!

speaker: Lyn
text: Run!!! We’re being pursued! Could it be those knights from town? No... It’s not them. These men are out for blood!

speaker: Zugu
text: Heh heh hehhh... Aren’t you the pretty one! Your name is Lyndis, is it not?

speaker: Lyn
text: What did you call me? ...Who are you?

speaker: Zugu
text: Such a waste. An absolute waste. The things I’d do for gold... Ah, well. Time to die, darlin’! C’mon out, boys!

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh no! There are more than I can handle... But I’ll not give up!
Hey! There she is!

speaker: Zugu
text: Huh?

speaker: Lyn
text: What?

speaker: Sain
text: Whew... Finally caught up... Hold! You there! What is your business? Such numbers against a girl? Cowards, every one of you!

speaker: Lyn
text: You! You’re from—

speaker: Kent
text: We can discuss that later. It appears these ruffians mean to do you harm. If it’s a fight they want, let them look to me!

speaker: Sain
text: Stand back! I’ll take care of this!

speaker: Lyn
text: No! This is my fight! Stay out of my way!

speaker: Sain
text: Well, I can’t just stand here and do nothing...

speaker: Kent
text: I have a solution. You there, command us. I am Kent, a knight of Lycia. My companion is Sain. We will follow your orders in this battle. Is that acceptable, milady?

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, it is. Mark and I will lead! Let’s go!

speaker: Sain
text: You! You are called Tactician? I want to impress my beauteous one! Let me attack first!

speaker: Sain
text: Direct my arm!

speaker: Sain
text: O fair and beauteous one! And... Tactician, is it? Allow me to show you the might of a knight of Lycia! Let me be the first to strike a blow in your honor!

speaker: Sain
text: Sain is your faithful servant! Command me!

speaker: Tutorial
text: Blue units are allies. Direct them on the field as you did with Lyn before. Be warned: if Lyn is defeated, your journey is over, as is your game. If other blue units are beaten, the game will continue, but fallen companions will be unable to return to battle for the rest of the tutorial. Use caution and good judgement. After all blue units have been moved, it automatically becomes the enemy's turn. To begin with, select Sain. Place the cursor on Sain, and press the A Button.

speaker: Sain
text: Attack! Move me to a space next to my foe!

speaker: Sain
text: Move me up next to the enemy!

speaker: Sain
text: Whoa! I missed!?

speaker: Kent
text: Sain! Why aren't you using your sword?

speaker: Sain
text: The lance is more heroic. A knight should look heroic, don't you think?

speaker: Kent
text: You're hopeless. If you don't take fighting more seriously, you're going to find yourself on the end of a blade!

speaker: Sain
text: Truth be told, I...forgot to buy a sword.

speaker: Kent
text: Forgot? Or were you simply too busy dallying with the ladies?

speaker: Sain
text: Don't be so mad! I'll be fine with a lance. I'm that good!

speaker: Kent
text: I'd prefer to rely on your skill, not your empty bragging! Take my spare blade and use it to attack next time!

speaker: Sain
text: Are you sure? My thanks Kent!

speaker: Kent
text: You're almost more trouble than you're worth. Almost.

speaker: Kent
text: Tactician! Allow me to make up for my companion's blunder. I am at your command!

speaker: Tutorial
text: Weapons possess a unique hierarchy. Swords best axes. Axes best lances. Lances best swords. This is called the weapon triangle. Remembering this is of the utmost importance. First, let's illustrate that swords are strong against axes. Select Kent.

speaker: Kent
text: Command me to attack!

speaker: Kent
text: The enemy wields an axe. Use a sword for my attack!

speaker: Kent
text: He’s almost defeated. Now, let’s deliver the final blow!

speaker: Lyn
text: I must be next to the enemy!

speaker: Lyn
text: I want to fight! I must be closer to my foe!

speaker: Sain
text: Tactician! Give me another chance!

speaker: Sain
text: I failed you once before, but give me another chance... I'll not fail you again!

speaker: Sain
text: Move next to the enemy and attack!

speaker: Sain
text: Axe-wielding foes should be met with swords. Brandish your blade!

speaker: Sain
text: Gah!

speaker: Kent
text: Sain! Are you all right?

speaker: Sain
text: Yes. Yes, I am. I was able to dodge in time. I can't believe he evaded my sword stroke so easily. This is no jest.

speaker: Kent
text: Look closely. The enemy is hidden in the woods. The branches make it difficult to attack, don't they?

speaker: Sain
text: You're right. I was so focused on attacking... I didn't see.

speaker: Kent
text: Your lack of attention may someday cost you your life!

speaker: Sain
text: Fine! I understand already! Let it go, Kent!

speaker: Kent
text: If you truly understand, then act like it!

speaker: Sain
text: Kent worries too much. ...He's going to grow old before his time.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Each type of terrain has unique characteristics. For example, look at woods and plains. Battle an enemy from the woods, and the enemy will probably miss you. However, your attacks will be unimpeded, giving you a distinct advantage. The same is true for foes. If an enemy is in the woods, he is more difficult to hit. Factoring in your terrain benefits and the weapon triangle is vital in combat. The window at the bottom of the screen gives information on the terrain the cursor is placed on. Check to see what terrain type is advantageous by using the cursor. Now, let's put this to the test. Select Kent.

speaker: Kent
text: I'm ready for battle. Command me as you will!

speaker: Kent
text: Move me next to the enemy.

speaker: Kent
text: Let's use my sword to attack!

speaker: Lyn
text: It seems like a wise decision to leave that bandit to the knights.

speaker: Lyn
text: For my part, if I'm going to take care of the other foe, I'll need to close the distance between us. The knight said that woods are advantageous, right? In that case...

speaker: Lyn
text: That looks good. Let's move there, Tactician!

speaker: Lyn
text: You... Your name is Sain, right?

speaker: Sain
text: Yes! Sain the gallant of Caelin. That's me!

speaker: Lyn
text: If you insist... Why have you not healed yourself?

speaker: Sain
text: Huh? Hey! I've been injured? What a cad I am! To wrinkle that perfect brow of yours with worry for me...

speaker: Lyn
text: Uh... I was thinking of giving you a vulnerary, but... It looks like you're fine. So, never you mind.

speaker: Sain
text: No, wait! I'll take it! Please! I'll take it!!

speaker: Tutorial
text: To give away an item, use the trade command. Trade can only be used by units that are adjacent to one another. Let's use the trade command right now. Select Sain and move him next to Lyn.

speaker: Sain
text: I must use the vulnerary and put my lady's mind at ease! Tactician! Bring me to her!

speaker: Sain
text: I mustn't worry my lady any longer. Come, Tactician! Direct me to her!

speaker: Sain
text: I can't keep such a generous offer waiting! The healing power of love awaits with yon angel! Tactician! Tarry no longer!

speaker: Sain
text: Move me next to her! I implore you!

speaker: Tutorial
text: Now select the trade command. Sain's and Lyn's possessions will be displayed together Use the cursor to select a vulnerary from Lyn's items, and give it to Sain. After you finished your trade, press the B Button to end the process. The B Button is the cancel button. It can be used to rescind mistaken commands and other things.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Place the cursor on Lyn's items. Press right on the + Control Pad.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Press up or down on the + Control Pad, and select a vulnerary. Then, press the A Button.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Press the A Button to accept the vulnerary from Lyn.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Press the B Button to stop trading.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Sain can now use Lyn's vulnerary. Select the vulnerary from the items and use it.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Furthermore, mounted units have the unique ability to move again. Essentially, this allows cavalry to move the number of spaces left in their movement range if they haven't done so already. However, the attack command, among others, nullifies the move again ability, so be careful. Select Sain and order him to move again.

speaker: Sain
text: Ah, much better! Thanks, Tactician! And you have my gratitude as well, my angel!

speaker: Sain
text: Ah, much better! You have my gratitude, young ladies.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Mission goals change from chapter to chapter. This chapter's goal is to defeat all enemies. Check the chapter goals in the window to the upper right of the screen. To open the map menu, place the cursor on an unoccupied space and press the A Button. You can confirm the chapter goals here by choosing Status from the menu. The map menu also has the Suspend command. This is useful if you have to stop a chapter midway. Time to continue this chapter! Best of luck!

speaker: Zugu
text: Accursed knights, always tampering in others' affairs.

speaker: Zugu
text: Blast... There was only...supposed to be a lone...girl...

speaker: Lyn
text: That’s the last of them! Fantastic work, Mark!

speaker: Lyn
text: And now for these knights of Lycia. You were going to share your story with me?

speaker: Kent
text: Yes. We have ventured from Caelin, in Lycia, in search of someone.

speaker: Lyn
text: Lycia... That’s the country beyond the mountains in the south-west, isn’t it?

speaker: Kent
text: Correct. We’ve come as messengers to the lady Madelyn, who eloped with a nomad some 19 years ago.

speaker: Lyn
text: Madelyn?

speaker: Kent
text: Our lord the marquess of Caelin’s only daughter. He was heartbroken his own daughter would abandon him so. Eventually, the marquess simply declared that he had no daughter.

speaker: Sain
text: And then, this year, we received a letter from Lady Madelyn. It said she, her husband, and their daughter were living happily on the Sacae plains. The marquess was ecstatic to learn he had a granddaughter of 18 years. I remember the smile on his face when he announced that he’d suddenly become a grandfather. The granddaughter’s name is Lyndis. This was also the name of the marquess’s wife, who passed away at an early age.

speaker: Lyn
text: Lyndis?

speaker: Sain
text: That she should bear this name thawed the marquess’s heart. Now, his only wish is to meet his daughter’s family at least once. This is why we’re here. We didn’t know that Lady Madelyn died a few days after sending her letter... We only learnt this shortly after arriving here in Bulgar.

speaker: Kent
text: But we also learned all was not lost. Her daughter yet lives. We heard that she was living alone on the plains... I... I knew it immediately. You are the lady Lyndis.

speaker: Lyn
text: Why would you think that...

speaker: Kent
text: Your resemblance to your departed mother is remarkable.

speaker: Lyn
text: What? Did you know my mother?

speaker: Kent
text: I’m sorry to say that I never met her directly, but I saw her portraits in Castle Caelin.

speaker: Lyn
text: To the rest of my tribe, I was always Lyn. But when I was with my parents... When it was just the three of us, I was Lyndis. It’s all so strange. I was all alone in the world, and now I have a grandfather. Lyndis... I never thought I would hear that name again.

speaker: Lyn
text: Wait! That bandit! He called me Lyndis, too!

speaker: Kent
text: What? How could he have–

speaker: Sain
text: He was a henchman of Lord Lundgren, wasn’t he?

speaker: Lyn
text: Lundgren? Who’s that?

speaker: Kent
text: He’s the marquess’s younger brother. Everyone assumed the lady Madelyn was gone forever. This made Lord Lundgren heir to the marquess’s title.

speaker: Sain
text: To be blunt, milady, your existence is an obstacle to your granduncle’s ambitions.

speaker: Lyn
text: That’s– But I have no interest in inheriting any title!

speaker: Sain
text: Unfortunately, your granduncle is not the sort of man to believe that. I believe the attempts on your life will persist.

speaker: Lyn
text: What should I do?

speaker: Kent
text: Accompany us to Caelin. Continuing on this way is dangerous.

speaker: Lyn
text: I feel I have little choice. I will go with you.

speaker: Lyn
text: Mark... I’m sorry. This changes everything. What do you want me to do, Mark? You... want me to decide? Of course, your companionship would do much to ease my journey, but... It’s going to be so dangerous.

speaker: Lyn
text: You’ll come? Are you sure? Thank you! Let me ask once again for your friendship and your aid.

speaker: Marcus
text: Lord Eliwood, we leave on your word.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I see. Thank you, Marcus.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mother, it’s time for us to go.

speaker: Eleanora
text: Eliwood... Promise that you will return to me safely. I’m worried about your father, but... If anything were to happen to you... My heart could not bear that sorrow.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I know, Mother. Please do not worry. Father is alive, I know it. I vow that I will find him and return him to your side.

speaker: Eleanora
text: I have your word then.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes, of course. Isadora, I entrust my mother to you in my absence.

speaker: Isadora
text: Yes, milord. I will guard over her well.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mother, I will return. Rest easy.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Well, Marcus, it looks like it’s just the two of us.

speaker: Marcus
text: Not so, milord. My man Lowen will be traveling with us.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lowen? That’s reassuring.

speaker: Marcus
text: I’ve sent him ahead to the village. He hopes to seek out a few able men who are skilled at arms. Normally, I wouldn’t venture forth without a larger company, but... I bow to your will on this matter, Lord Eliwood.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I’m sorry, Marcus, but I would rather not deprive my mother of even a single guard. The best knights in the realm disappeared with my father. If anything were to happen to my mother while I am gone, I...

speaker: Marcus
text: I understand, milord. Hmph! What’s keeping Lowen!?

speaker: Groznyi
text: We’ve all heard that the knights of Pherae have vanished, right? Well, your misfortune is my good luck! I have an announcement to make! As of now, this village is mine! Groznyi is your new liege! Now bring every last piece of gold, down to the smallest fleck!

speaker: Lowen
text: Lord Eliwood! Co-Commander Marcus! I...

speaker: Marcus
text: Lowen! Calm yourself! A knight must be in control at all times.

speaker: Lowen
text: The village is under attack! It’s bandits!

speaker: Marcus
text: What? Bandits? Here!?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Are you sure, Lowen?

speaker: Lowen
text: This girl has more details.

speaker: Rebecca
text: My lord Eliwood? I’m the daughter of the village magistrate. My name’s Rebecca. The bandits came without warning. They’re stealing everything! I beg you! Please help us!

speaker: Eliwood
text: I see. Marcus! Lowen! We must aid the village!

speaker: Lowen
text: Yes, milord!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Rebecca, stay here, and keep out of sight.

speaker: Rebecca
text: If it please you, milord, I would rather fight. I hunt almost every day, and I have some skill with a bow.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Is that so? Very well, but be careful!

speaker: Rebecca
text: Yes, milord.

speaker: Lowen
text: Lord Eliwood, one more thing. There is another in the village who has offered to help. A traveling tactician who was staying at the inn.

speaker: Eliwood
text: A tactician?

speaker: Lowen
text: Yes, milord. This is Mark.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mark!

speaker: Lowen
text: Do you know this person, milord?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes. I met Mark during the trouble in Caelin last year. A fantastic military advisor, if memory serves. If not for Mark, the marquess of Caelin and his granddaughter, Lyn, might not have survived Lundgren’s uprising. What brings you to Pherae, my friend? Ha! Still traveling about, honing your skills? Of course... A worthy pursuit. Let’s give thanks to providence for our chance reunion. We have need of your aid. Please lend us your skill.

speaker: Bartre
text: Look, Dorcas! Can you believe it? It’s just like that knight said! That’s Lord Eliwood!

speaker: Dorcas
text: So it seems.

speaker: Bartre
text: What’s he doing? Hey, he’s taking on those bandits. Protecting innocents? That’s a right lordly thing to do, isn’t it? Right, Dorcas?

speaker: Dorcas
text: You talk too much. The lordling needs our help.

speaker: Bartre
text: Right! Leave these mountain weaklings to me! I’m Bartre the Brave!

speaker: Woman
text: Is Lord Elbert well? We’ve heard nothing but foul rumors hereabouts... All of Pherae is worried for his well-being. We hear tell that Lord Eliwood is going to find the marquess. This dragon shield is our village treasure... It boosts the defenses of the one who uses it. Take it, please. And may it see you and Lord Elbert home safely.

speaker: Man
text: There’s a young traveler been stayin’ with the magistrate. Been stayin’ in the village for a few days now. I know, you’re thinkin’ it’s just another good-for-nothing courtier lookin’ for a handout. But there’s somethin’ more to this one... Those eyes... They miss nothing. Got a mission, that one has.

speaker: Man
text: You’ve got some skill with weapons, but do you understand weapon levels? The more you use a weapon, the more skilled you become. Still, you can only reach the highest level with a single weapon.

speaker: Groznyi
text: What is this, a pack of children coming to play? You think you can challenge me? What? Pheraen knights!? But that’s impossible!!!

speaker: Groznyi
text: Ugh... I thought my luck... was finally turning around...

speaker: Elder
text: Ah, you would be Lord Eliwood, yes? Our deepest thanks for coming to the aid of our fair village.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Think nothing of it. It’s a lord’s duty to protect the citizenry.

speaker: Elder
text: Would that were true, milord. The good folk of Laus know no such protection. Their marquess, Lord Darin, is too busy preparing for war. He ignores all complaints of bandits and thieves.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Preparing for war? Are you sure?

speaker: Elder
text: I would not lie, milord. My brother lived in Laus until a few days ago. His home was torched, and he had no choice but to flee here. According to him, Laus could go to war any day now. It’s all the people of Laus are talking about.

speaker: Marcus
text: Lord Eliwood, if this is true, the situation is a grave one. If Marquess Laus is readying for war... His target is most likely another Lycian territory. Perhaps this is connected to Lord Elbert’s disappearance.

speaker: Eliwood
text: My father and Marquess Laus? It seems a tenuous connection, but it’s as good a start as any. Let us travel to Laus. We must learn more.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Thank you for your guidance, Mark. Where are you bound for next? If you have no destination in mind, perhaps you could travel with us. Ours is a small group, with a single purpose–to find my father. I do not know where our road will lead, but... We would be stronger with you in our company. You will travel with us? Splendid! Thank you! I pray we give you no cause to regret your decision.

speaker: Elder
text: Rebecca! Where do you think you’re going, young lady?

speaker: Rebecca
text: Father, I... I intend to accompany Lord Eliwood.

speaker: Elder
text: Don’t be ridiculous, girl! Lord Eliwood is not going on a picnic. He’s riding into danger.

speaker: Rebecca
text: I know that, Father. That’s why I want to go. We owe him our lives, and I want to repay him. My bow may not be all that much, but I know I can be of service!

speaker: Elder
text: But...

speaker: Rebecca
text: And, Father... I may meet up with my brother somewhere. You’re the magistrate–you have responsibilities. I... This is all I can offer. I need to do this! Please, Father! Let me go!

speaker: Elder
text: Dear me... You’re just as stubborn as your mother was.

speaker: Rebecca
text: I’m sorry, Father...

speaker: Elder
text: You must bow to Lord Eliwood’s wishes on this matter. If he consents, you may go.

speaker: Rebecca
text: Thank you, Father!

speaker: Elder
text: Lord Elbert has always been kind to us. Follow his son with a true heart, Rebecca. Serve Lord Eliwood well, as I have served his father.

speaker: Rebecca
text: I will, Father!

speaker: Eliwood
text: So here you are, Mark! Will you attend my ascension ceremony? Hector and everyone else is coming... What? These clothes? I look silly, don't I. Formal dress is so stiff, I can't stand it... Ah... Everything's finally resolved. I'll succeed my father as Marquess Pherae. I don't know if I'm equal to the task, but I'm going to do my best for all the people who live here. Mark, you... Do you really have to go? No, I understand. I'm sure that you have things you must do. Thank you for supporting me in everything.

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Lord Eliwood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Here I am, Ninian!

speaker: Ninian
text: Ah, hello, Mark. Um, Lord Eliwood, is Mark...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mark will be at the ceremony of ascension but must leave shortly thereafter.

speaker: Ninian
text: Is that so? I’m disappointed.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Oh, Mark, I want you to know something. When things are a little more settled, Ninian and I plan to be married. And...this may be a bit premature but, Mark, we’d like you to name our first child. Ninian and I talked it over. You’ve done so much for us and we truly want this.

speaker: Ninian
text: Please, Mark.
...Eliwood? Where are you?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I'm over here, Lyndis.

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh, Mark! You're here, too. So, Eliwood, have you spoken to Mark?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mark will be at the ceremony of ascension but must leave shortly thereafter.

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh, no... Really? That's too bad.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Oh, Mark, I want you to know something. When things are a little more settled, Lyndis and I plan to be married. And...this may be premature but, Mark, we'd like you to name our first child. Lyndis and I talked it over. You've done so much for us and we truly want this.

speaker: Lyn
text: Please, Mark.

speaker: Fiora
text: ...Lord Eliwood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I'm over here, Fiora!

speaker: Fiora
text: Oh, and you're here too, Mark. So, ...Lord Eliwood, is Mark...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mark will be at the ceremony of ascension but must leave shortly thereafter.

speaker: Fiora
text: Is that so? How disappointing...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Oh, Mark, I want you to know something. When things are a little more settled, Fiora and I plan to be married. And...this may be a bit premature but, Mark, we'd like you to name our first child. Fiora and I talked it over. You've done so much for us and we truly want this.

speaker: Fiora
text: Please, Mark.

speaker: Eliwood
text: So, Mark, this is farewell. If it weren't for you, I wouldn't... This world wouldn't be here. You have my heartfelt gratitude. Mark... I'll see you again. It's a promise...my friend.

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector! You came.

speaker: Hector
text: Of course. It’s my friend’s gala occasion. I wouldn’t miss it for the world. Are you ready for this?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes... I think I am. I’ll succeed my father as Marquess Pherae. I don’t know if I’m equal to the task, but I’m going to do my best for all the people who live here.

speaker: Hector
text: You’ll be just fine. You’ll be a marquess to rival your father. I guarantee it.

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Lord Eliwood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I’m over here, Ninian!

speaker: Ninian
text: Ah...Lord Hector. It’s nice to see you, again.

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, and here is Marquess Pherae’s wife. I’m happy for you, Ninian. Standing there together, you make a handsome couple.

speaker: Ninian
text: Oh...thank you...

speaker: Hector
text: So tell me, Eliwood, when can we expect an heir?

speaker: Eliwood
text: He-Hector!

speaker: Hector
text: Ha ha... It’s nothing to be embarrassed about!

speaker: Lyn
text: ...Eliwood? Where are you?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Over here, Lyndis!

speaker: Lyn
text: Well, if it isn’t Hector!

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, and here is Marquess Pherae’s wife. I’m happy for you, Lyn. Standing there together, you make a handsome couple.

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you, Hector.

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, and Eliwood, be careful not to make her mad, or she’ll let you have it!

speaker: Eliwood
text: He-Hector!

speaker: Lyn
text: That’s enough out of you!

speaker: Hector
text: Ha ha ha!

speaker: Fiora
text: Lord Eliwood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Over here, Fiora.

speaker: Fiora
text: Hello, Lord Hector. It’s nice to see you again.

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, and here is Marquess Pherae’s wife. I’m happy for you, Fiora. Standing there together, you make a handsome couple.

speaker: Fiora
text: Thank you, Lord Hector.

speaker: Hector
text: But you know, I never expected you two to be wed at all. During our journey, what were you two doing when I wasn’t around?

speaker: Eliwood
text: He-Hector!

speaker: Fiora
text: I... I did nothing...

speaker: Hector
text: Ha ha...I’m joking! Joking!!

speaker: Marcus
text: I beg your pardon. Lord Eliwood, it’s time.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Oh, thank you, Marcus.

speaker: Hector
text: Get going, Eliwood. Lady Eleanora and the people of Pherae are waiting to see you. As, no doubt, is your father. You are the guardian of Pherae’s future now, Marquess.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mm!

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, Mark! You made it! Come, relax! ...What? You came to say good-bye? I haven’t seen you in so long, and you’re leaving? Hm? Oh, you heard, too? Now that word of my brother’s death has spread, the throne can’t be left empty forever. Being the leader of all Lycia doesn’t really suit me... My brother let me play around for quite a while. If I don’t grow up soon, my brother won’t be able to rest. The burdens Uther carried as Marquess Ostia, his feelings for the citizenry of Ostia and all of Lycia... I’ll succeed him at everything. Easy to say, but I’m sure it’s going to be difficult.

speaker: Florina
text: Lord Hector... Ah... Mark... It’s nice to see you again.

speaker: Hector
text: Ah, but Mark’s not here for long though. Some friend, eh?

speaker: Florina
text: Is... Is that so? Ah... Uh, Mark... I... We...

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, out with it! I’ll ask for you. Just say it.

speaker: Florina
text: O-OK... That’s not...

speaker: Hector
text: Listen, Mark. We’ve got a favor to ask of you. This may seem somewhat premature, but would you be our first child’s godparent?

speaker: Florina
text: P-Please... He-Hector and I... We would never have met were it not for you, Mark.

speaker: Hector
text: If it’s a boy, we’re going to name him Uther, after my brother. I’ll teach him how to fight and raise him to be a strong man. We’ll pit him against Eliwood’s son to see who’s the strongest.

speaker: Florina
text: Um... So, Mark... If it’s a girl...

speaker: Lyn
text: Hector...Well if it isn’t Mark! It’s been a long time.

speaker: Hector
text: Ah, but Mark’s not here for long though Some friend, eh?

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh... That’s too bad. Oh yes, Mark! We’ve a favor to ask of you. It’s a little bit premature, but... Would you be our first child’s godparent? You are the patron to our romance after all.

speaker: Hector
text: Name? We’ve already decided on that. We’re going to name him Uther after my brother. ...I beg your pardon? What if it’s a girl? It’s my child. It will be a boy! We’ll pit him against Eliwood’s son to see who’s the strongest.

speaker: Lyn
text: This is all he ever talks about. Honestly, I don’t know if he’ll ever grow up. So, Mark, if it is a girl...

speaker: Farina
text: Lord Hector... Oh, is that you, Mark? Wow! It’s been such a long time!

speaker: Hector
text: Right? But Mark’s not here for long though. Some friend, eh?

speaker: Farina
text: Hmm... Is that true? Oh yes, Mark! We’ve a favor to ask. It may seem a little premature, but would you be our first child’s godparent? I mean if you hadn’t insisted, Hector might not have hired me. If you think about it, we owe everything to you, Mark.

speaker: Hector
text: Name? We’ve already decided on that. We’re going to name him Uther after my brother. ...I beg your pardon? What if it’s a girl? It’s my child. It will be a boy! We’ll pit him against Eliwood’s son to see who’s the strongest.

speaker: Farina
text: Did you get that, Mark? I would like to have a girl, of course. Now, if we do have a girl...

speaker: Hector
text: Are you leaving? Say, Mark, do you remember Athos’s final words? I sealed Armads away, like it used to be, but... I can still feel its power pulsing inside me. War is coming. Someday, a terrible war... When that day comes... I want you to be there when that day comes. I want you to guide my children and me.

speaker: Hector
text: We’ll meet again. I’m sure of it!

speaker: Hector
text: Hey, Eliwood! You made it.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I would never turn down an invitation from you. So, are you ready? You once told me being the leader of Lycia wasn’t for you.

speaker: Hector
text: Well...yes. Now that word of my brother’s death has spread, the throne can’t be left empty forever. My brother let me play around for quite a while. If I don’t grow up soon, he may start screaming at me from the grave.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ha ha! You’re probably right.

speaker: Hector
text: The burdens Uther carried as Marquess Ostia, his feelings for the citizenry of Ostia and all of Lycia... I’ll succeed him at everything. Easy to say, but I’m sure it’s going to be difficult.

speaker: Lyn
text: Hector... Well, if it isn’t Eliwood!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Well met, Lyndis. You’ve grown even more fair than when I saw you last.

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh... Did you hear that, Hector. That’s the biggest difference between you and Eliwood.

speaker: Hector
text: Give me a break.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector may not say it, but more than anyone else, that is what he thinks. Isn’t that so, Hector?

speaker: Lyn
text: Really?

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! You...

speaker: Farina
text: Lord Hector... Hm? Is that you, Lord Eliwood? Wah! It’s been such a very long time!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nice to see you again, Farina. We didn’t have too many chances to talk during our journey, but...

speaker: Farina
text: That’s true.

speaker: Hector
text: Well, you’ll have plenty of opportunity from now on. Let me introduce you... This here’s the 20,000 gold woman.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Huh?

speaker: Farina
text: Hold it! Are you still angry about that? That was a reasonable sum, and it included hazard pay!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hm?

speaker: Florina
text: Lord Hector... Ah... Lord Eliwood... It’s, um, nice to see you again.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hello, Florina. Have you grown used to life here in Ostia?

speaker: Florina
text: Yes, yes...

speaker: Hector
text: Truly? You still get tongue-tied in front of crowds.

speaker: Florina
text: Ye-Yes...

speaker: Hector
text: As the wife of Marquess Ostia, you must be able to speak in public. That has me somewhat worried.

speaker: Florina
text: I-I’m sorry... I’ll...do...better... Sniff...

speaker: Hector
text: OK! OK! I understand, so don’t cry! It’s all my fault! Please!

speaker: Florina
text: OK...

speaker: Oswin
text: I beg your pardon. Lord Hector, shall we?

speaker: Hector
text: Yeah, OK. Say, Eliwood, do you remember old Athos Graybeard’s final words?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Of course.

speaker: Hector
text: I sealed Armads away, like it used to be, but... I can still feel its power pulsing inside me. War is coming. Someday, a terrible war... When that day comes...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mm, I understand. When it comes, we’ll fight together. For our future and for our children’s.

speaker: Hector
text: Thanks for coming, Eliwood!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector! Long time, no see!

speaker: Hector
text: First time since my brother's funeral--fifteen years now. And look at us. We've both grown older, haven't we?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Uh-huh. Time certainly does speed right by. My father's disappearance...his death...the fight with Nergal...those fire dragons... The memories are so vivid, it might have happened yesterday.

speaker: Hector
text: Nergal... What a blackheart he was. I've had enough of battles like that. Hm? Is that your son over there?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I've been wanting to introduce you, but there's been no chance. Roy! Come here!

speaker: Roy
text: Did you need something, Father?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Say hello to Marquess Ostia!

speaker: Roy
text: Ye-Yes, sir! A pleasure to meet you, Lord Hector. My name is Roy.

speaker: Hector
text: Roy, is it? Nice to meet you, lad. Well, I guess that means I should introduce my daughter then! Lilina!

speaker: Hector
text: What? Are you being shy? You don't have to be nervous. This is your father's old friend and his son.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hello, Lilina. This is Roy. He's the same age as you.

speaker: Lilina
text: Nice to meet you...

speaker: Roy
text: Lilina? Let's be friends. We can play over there.

speaker: Hector
text: It's OK. Go on.

speaker: Lilina
text: Ah!

speaker: Eliwood
text: What a cute child. Good thing she took after her mother.

speaker: Hector
text: What? She looks just like me, doesn't she?

speaker: Eliwood
text: You're a sarcastic one, Marquess Ostia!

speaker: Hector
text: Come on, now you're the one putting on airs, Marquess Pherae!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ha ha ha ha! The only thing older about you is your appearance. Don't tell me you still behave like that even now that you're the marquess!

speaker: Hector
text: I'm always on top of my duties as marquess. But when I'm around you, I want to relax, so, please...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector... By the way, I heard that the king of Bern died. It was fairly sudden, too.

speaker: Hector
text: I can't be certain, but according to one of our spies, he was killed in an assassination attempt on Prince Zephiel.

speaker: Eliwood
text: The prince? I trust he was unharmed.

speaker: Hector
text: It's a strange tale... At first, I'd heard that the prince was killed. Then new information came three days later saying that it was the king who had died.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Do you remember Archsage Athos's prediction? Is something happening in Bern?

speaker: Hector
text: I don't know.

speaker: Lilina
text: Father! Can I show Roy my pony?

speaker: Hector
text: Yes, go ahead. Be careful!

speaker: Lilina
text: OK!

speaker: Hector
text: For the sake of our children's futures, I'll stop anything that may happen. I'll sacrifice my life to make it so.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Once again, Lycia brings hope. ...If that turns out to be wrong? No. It must happen...

speaker: Enigmatic Man
text: For what reason have you awakened a demon dragon?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Who are you?

speaker: Enigmatic Man
text: ...Dragon.

speaker: Vaida
text: Look at that! Bowmen as far as the eye can see! Mark! Do you have something against me? Heh, you know better than that. Let me tell you, Vaida is not your average wyvern rider! Mark! Sit back and watch me perform!

speaker: Farina
text: Wow! Why do there have to be so many archers? Oh well... As long as I've been paid, I can't complain. This is my chance to show you what Farina of the Great Wing can do! But listen, Mark... This goes beyond hazard pay!

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Hector! We’re pleased to see you home alive and well!

speaker: Hector
text: Where’s my brother?

speaker: Soldier
text: Ah... He departed yesterday for a conference in Etruria. He’s scheduled to return in a half month’s time.

speaker: Hector
text: ...Etruria? That’s a pity. Go and prepare rooms for my companions. They need rest.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, my lord.

speaker: Hector
text: My brother’s away... Oswin, did you know about this?

speaker: Oswin
text: Uh... Yes, I was aware of his trip.

speaker: Hector
text: Why did he choose to go to Etruria now? I don’t get it. It’s not like him.

speaker: Hector
text: Graybeard, you know something, don’t you? Tell me! What are we supposed to do now?

speaker: Athos
text: A moment, lad... Yes, I suppose you’ve a right to know...... I first met Nergal some 500 years ago, wandering the Nabata wasteland. Like me, his only drive was the search for truth in this world. We were equals in power and knowledge, and we became fast friends. We believed we could solve the mysteries of the world. We truly believed...

speaker: Lyn
text: So what happened?

speaker: Athos
text: A...disagreement, made at the height of our quest. One day, as I charted the mysteries of Nabata, I came across the most amazing village... It was unbelievable, but in that place, humans and dragons lived together in cooperation.

speaker: Hector
text: Dragons and humans? Are you telling me they could live together in peace?

speaker: Athos
text: At first, I doubted what my own eyes showed me. But yes, the village truly did exist.

speaker: Lyn
text: That’s... ...amazing.

speaker: Athos
text: The dragons that I beheld there... They were both similar to and different from the dragons I had fought hundreds of years before.

speaker: Hector
text: ...Ah! Eliwood...are you...

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...... Please go on...

speaker: Athos
text: ...As you wish. They had refused to fight humans in the war, and instead, they retreated to this wasteland. They desired nothing but to remain hidden from the outside. Nergal and I crafted a barrier and created an oasis for them. Upon their invitation, we lived there with them. Our life there... It was calm and satisfying. At some point, the village became known as Arcadia, a place of perfect peace for travelers gone astray.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Arcadia...

speaker: Athos
text: The dragons’ libraries were a dream come true to us. We studied their language and history with unbridled passion. A century, then two... Time passed in an eye’s blink. And yet, slowly, our thoughts turned down different paths.

speaker: Lyn
text: In what way?

speaker: Athos
text: I wanted to share the dragons’ wisdom with others. My hope was for our earthly paradise to spread outward.

speaker: Hector
text: And Nergal?

speaker: Athos
text: Ah, Nergal... He took the dragons’ knowledge... He learned the art of stealing the essence from living creatures and turning it into power. ...It was terrible. When we discovered what he was doing, the elders and I tried to persuade him to stop. But the power bewitched him, and he was deaf to our pleas. He started with small creatures and grew ever more confident. Then, he began draining the quintessence of humans. The villagers and I joined forces and...defeated him. Or so we thought, but...

speaker: Athos
text: After he was banished from Arcadia, Nergal fled to Bern. He increased his power slowly to avoid our eye. Using quintessence, he made his puppets, the morphs. They’re bewitching in form, with intellects beyond human. I’m sure you’ve laid eyes on them yourselves. Jet black hair, pale complexion, and blood-red lips... Their most striking features are their glittering gold eyes.

speaker: Soldier
text: Attack! We’re under attack!

speaker: Hector
text: What!?

speaker: Soldier
text: L-Lord Hector! It’s bad! An unknown group has breached the castle walls!!

speaker: Hector
text: How did they get in the castle without anyone noticing them!?

speaker: Soldier
text: They just appeared out of nowhere! The attack was so sudden, the castle guards were annihilated!

speaker: Hector
text: Castle Ostia is famed far and wide as being impregnable... If it’s been breached so easily, can we save it!?

speaker: Athos
text: It’s Nergal. His magic created an entrance for his thugs within the castle.

speaker: Hector
text: Blast! That arrogant– No matter what, the throne must be protected! I’ll not let the castle fall while my brother’s away!!

speaker: Lyn
text: Hold on, Hector! I’m going with you!

speaker: Hector
text: Mark! We need you! We need a plan!! If we can hold them back for a while, reinforcements will come!

speaker: Denning
text: This is a message from Lord Nergal. “I await you on the Dread Isle.”

speaker: Hector
text: Tell all the soldiers!! Take your posts, and don’t move. Hold your positions! All we can do is hold on until reinforcements arrive!!

speaker: Lyn
text: Eliwood!

speaker: Eliwood
text: What?

speaker: Lyn
text: Don’t overexert yourself.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I’m fine... I’m not that weak.

speaker: Soldier
text: You! You’re one of Lord Hector’s guests, aren’t you? You shouldn’t be out here, it’s too dangerous! Go and hide in that room! Do you understand?

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Hector! Are you unharmed!? Protect Lord Hector! Knights of Ostia! Attack!!

speaker: Hector
text: Hey Graybeard! Are these guys...

speaker: Athos
text: Yes, I’m sure of it. They are his morphs...

speaker: Lyn
text: It’s true... They’re all eerily similar. That reminds me... That man on Valor, Ephidel... Black Fang’s Sonia, too... Are you saying that he made them all?

speaker: Athos
text: It is an abomination. A crime against all that is natural. When Nergal began using morphs to carry out his plans, his power had grown beyond our ability to contain him. After humans, his next target became the essence of dragons. His next target had to be Arcadia. I concealed our paradise behind a curtain of sandstorms. I then hid in the underground ruins and waited for him. I did not hope to defeat him. Just to exchange blows... and then draw him into the desert, which would be his end.

speaker: Eliwood
text: But Nergal never showed up, did he?

speaker: Athos
text: Correct. I’ve no idea how he managed it but... He called those siblings through the Dragon’s Gate. And now... he plans to call a horde of dragons to this land.

speaker: Hector
text: What do we have to do to stop him?

speaker: Athos
text: Our last hope is the power of the legendary items. It would take too long for us to gather all of them. I will go to the Shrine of Seals and tell Bramimond everything. We must have his power, no matter the cost.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Then we should go to the Dragon’s Gate ahead of you.

speaker: Athos
text: What!?

speaker: Hector
text: That’s a good idea. Even though you cannot harm Nergal himself, you can certainly do some damage to his troops.

speaker: Lyn
text: If we don’t answer Nergal’s invitation soon... He’ll continue to send out troops after us. If that’s going to happen, we might as well take the fight to him! I won’t have Lycia ravaged by any more of his acts!

speaker: Athos
text: ...You... You truly are Roland’s children. I am old... I did not expect anything to surprise me again, and yet...

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Lord Athos.

speaker: Athos
text: It takes the strongest of bonds to alter the course of fate. Go... Go, my youthful friends. Set your sights on the Dragon’s Gate and keep moving. ...Eliwood, Hector, where are the legendary items?

speaker: Hector
text: They’re right here.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mine, too. I’m sorry. ...I simply couldn’t bring myself to wield it.

speaker: Hector
text: Neither could I... Eliwood said it felt like Durandal moved by itself. A weapon with a will of its own? Can I really control a weapon like that? Frankly, I wasn’t sure.

speaker: Athos
text: Let me take them from you for a while. May I?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes.

speaker: Hector
text: It’s fine, but...

speaker: Athos
text: Eliwood, Hector, I understand how you both feel. But without these weapons, we won’t be able to stop Nergal. ...You know that, don’t you?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Yes. When next I wield it, ...I won’t hesitate.

speaker: Hector
text: Confidence is just a matter of time. I’ll use it when I need to. You’ll see, Graybeard!

speaker: Athos
text: I know.

speaker: Hector
text: ...Oswin.

speaker: Oswin
text: I’m here, Lord Hector. We won’t be able to contact Fargus about traveling to Valor ’til the day after tomorrow. The guards are rotating watches to protect the castle. Lord Hector. For this one night, please get some rest.

speaker: Hector
text: Who needs rest!? Do not talk to me of rest when Ostia needs me! There is...something that you need to tell me, isn’t there?

speaker: Oswin
text: I can think of nothing, my lord.

speaker: Hector
text: Stop this foolishness!! It’s plain that everyone is avoiding me! What you’re all hiding... I know what it is!

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector, you must calm yourself.

speaker: Hector
text: Say it! I command you!! Tell me what has happened!!!

speaker: Hector
text: ...If you don’t answer right here, right now, I will cut you down, knave!

speaker: Oswin
text: ...Do as you must.

speaker: Hector
text: ......I...see. ...My brother... He’s...gone...isn’t he?

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector!!

speaker: Hector
text: I was sure... He was recuperating... That he’d gone somewhere to recover his strength. I thought that was what you were hiding... But......you won’t confess even now. ......That means......

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector! Wait!! Please......!!!

speaker: Limstella
text: Welcome home, Master.

speaker: Nergal
text: Limstella, look at this.

speaker: Limstella
text: The children’s dragon stone. What will you do with it?

speaker: Nergal
text: I will infuse it with quintessence.

speaker: Limstella
text: This is...

speaker: Nergal
text: The dragon girl... Ninian’s essence. Beautiful... Absolutely beautiful...... With this, I will be able to call dragons whenever I please.

speaker: Limstella
text: Shall we begin the process right away?

speaker: Nergal
text: No, I lost some quintessence from the injuries I took from Athos. To summon the numbers I need, I must have more essence. One must be fully prepared when dealing with dragons. If they wrested free from my control and killed me, all would be for naught.

speaker: Limstella
text: I fear to report... that the quintessence from the Black Fang has all been used. Where shall the next harvest come from?

speaker: Nergal
text: Heh heh heh... All the materials we need are heading this way even now.

speaker: Limstella
text: ...I see. Eliwood and friends.

speaker: Nergal
text: That’s right. I will crush them, steal their essences, and call forth my dragons!! Heh heh heh... Haaa haa haha haha hah!!!

speaker: Hector
text: Listen! We need a boat to Valor!

speaker: Villager
text: You want a boat to the Dread Isle? You're mad! No way! Never! There's no one in this village who'll sail there!

speaker: Lyn
text: Please, we're in a hurry. Can you give us passage?

speaker: Eliwood
text: If you won't help us, can you take us to someone who will? Please.

speaker: Villager
text: You must be on urgent business, that's certain. ......There may be one way...

speaker: Eliwood
text: What is it? Tell us, please!

speaker: Villager
text: Pirates.

speaker: Lyn
text: Eh? Pirates?

speaker: Villager
text: Uh-huh. They're fearless, or as close as makes no difference, and they'll go anywhere for a fee. Who knows? They might decide to accept your mad offer.

speaker: Hector
text: Pirates... Looks like we've no choice.

speaker: Lyn
text: Are you serious, Hector? Working with pirates? That's unbelievable! You're considering it, aren't you, Eliwood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: If there's no other way, what else can we do?

speaker: Lyn
text: You, too, Eliwood? I've misjudged you... It's foolishness to trust the goodwill of pirates! I'm finding another way! (Lyn leaves)

speaker: Hector
text: Why is she so angry?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I heard that Lyndis's parents were slain by bandits. Bandits at land, pirates at sea... They're all the same to Lyndis. Lawbreakers and murderers.

speaker: Hector
text: I see... My parents died of illness... But I can appreciate her feelings. Shall we abandon the pirate plan?

speaker: Eliwood
text: But...

speaker: Villager
text: Too bad about the girl, but there's no other way.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let's meet the pirates. We can't decide until then.

speaker: Hector
text: That's true.

speaker: Villager
text: That inn over there is a known favorite of the local freebooters. They're reckless and unpredictable. Best be prepared.

speaker: Fargus
text: What do you want, whelps? You're here to see me, aren't you?

speaker: Eliwood
text: You're commander of the pirate armada, aren't you?

speaker: Fargus
text: Gwah hah hah! "Commander of the pirate armada!" I like the sound of that! Are you lads that naive? Or are you just dumb? Which is it?

speaker: Hector
text: You insolent...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Peace, Hector!

speaker: Eliwood
text: If I've insulted you, I apologize. How should I address you?

speaker: Fargus
text: Hmph... You don't frighten easily, do you? Well, at least it seems you're not stupid. "Captain" will do, whelp. I'm Fargus, captain of the Davros.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Fargus... Master Fargus? Or should I call you Captain?

speaker: Fargus
text: You're not one of my mates. Call me Fargus. Now, what do you want?

speaker: Eliwood
text: We want to book passage to Valor.

speaker: Fargus
text: How much will you pay?

speaker: Eliwood
text: We don't know the current rates. Tell us how much you want.

speaker: Hector
text: Wait, 100,000 gold?

speaker: Fargus
text: Well? Will you pay?

speaker: Eliwood
text: We've no choice, but we need a little time. We'll get the gold and return as quickly as possible. Come, Hector.

speaker: Hector
text: Wa-Wait a moment! Eliwood!

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! Hold on! Where do you think you're going to get 100,000 gold?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I'm sure there's an arena here. We can raise gold somehow...

speaker: Hector
text: What? You're not serious!?

speaker: Eliwood
text: We've no other way, do we?

speaker: Hector
text: Well, no. (Steps back) Sometimes you surprise me, Eliwood.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Did you say something, Hector?

speaker: Hector
text: No, nothing. Let's go earn some gold!

speaker: Dart
text: (Appears) Ahoy! Hold your ground, boys!

speaker: Hector
text: What now? We don't have the money yet.

speaker: Dart
text: Fool! Of course you don't! I know that. The captain's got a message for you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: A message?

speaker: Dart
text: All of my mates in this village are going to attack you. If you can beat us all and get to the ship unharmed, he'll give you passage.

speaker: Eliwood
text: For free? No gold?

speaker: Dart
text: The captain's a tad off-kilter. He'd rather have a bit o' fun with you than take your gold. Smooth sailing to you.

speaker: Dart
text: Hey! Landlubbers! Over here! I'm over here!

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, for... This is a joke, isn't it?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Looks serious enough. Here we go!

speaker: Dart
text: Listen! The captain's waiting at the docks. Talk to him and you're the winner! Trust me, though.... Don't make the mistake of attacking him! You anger the captain, and there's no turning back! Don't forget!!

speaker: Lyn
text: (Comes out of a nearby house) I couldn't find a ship after all. But we have to get to that island... Looks like I'll have to endure pirates. Hm? What was that? Commotion in the village?

speaker: Hector
text: Oh! Lyn! Nice timing. We need your help!

speaker: Lyn
text: You're battling the pirates?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Fighting and... Look, we have to reach the docks and speak to the captain! This is a test to see whether or not he'll give us passage.

speaker: Lyn
text: I don't understand, but.... I'm here, so let me help!

speaker: Lucius
text: Good to see you again, Mark. Our reunion is surely the work of blessed Elimine. I’m most pleased to travel with you once more. Your commands, please.

speaker: Raven
text: So you’re the tactician, huh? I’m Raven. I’m just a mercenary. I work for these guys now, so it looks like I’ll take your orders. What are you waiting for? What do you need me to do?

speaker: Fargus
text: What mooncalves! I would've just let them sit there if they hadn't come any closer! Rush 'em, boys!

speaker: Canas
text: Pardon me! I was speaking with an old sailor a few moments ago. He told me that you’re planning to travel to Valor. Is that so? Really? And that’s why you’re playing tag with these pirates? ......I see. In that case, would you mind if I joined you? My name is Canas. I’m a scholar of sorts... I’ve been seeking passage to Valor, but none will take me. My proposal probably sounds somewhat selfish, no? You should know, I can help in combat. I’ve some skill with a form of elder magic... Some call it dark magic, a rather biased term, if I must be blunt. But at the very least, I can take care of myself, and perhaps others.

speaker: Anna
text: I heard about your contest with the pirate captain, Fargus. You’ve got nerve, I’ll give you that! Let me give you some advice. Don’t try to overpower the pirates. Take the narrow path next to us, and follow the wall toward the sea. Pass in front of the last house, and stay close to the sea wall. You should be able to get to Fargus and win your game! Why do I know all this? Well, my sweetie’s a pirate. His name’s Jake, and he’s the best. If you see him, tell him Anna’s worried about him!

speaker: Damian
text: What an interesting diversion. Maybe we should join in. Lord Eliwood of Pherae... You don’t yet know to fear the Black Fang. Start grieving...for I will teach you that fear.

speaker: Damian
text: You’re about to die. Scream if you must.

speaker: Damian
text: Gaa...ha... Crow in...triumph... you’ve–

speaker: Fargus
text: Hey, there! What are you on about? Do you think to test me? Gwa ha ha ha ha ha! You’re a daft lot. I respect your courage, but you’ve chosen the wrong foe. If you can’t judge your enemy’s skill, you’ll wind up fish food. You’ll do well to remember that if you’re lucky enough to live.

speaker: Fargus
text: Uugwoh... Can’t believe... you...beat... me... You’ve...lost... your way... to...the Dread...Isle... for good...

speaker: Fargus
text: What’s this? Are you spent already? Hm? Attacking someone you’re asking a favor of? Insolent louts! I thought you smarter than that. You disappointed me. Go on! Away with you!! There’s no ship that’ll carry such conceited half-wits as you!! Never show your faces here again!

speaker: Fargus
text: What mooncalves! I would’ve let ’em sit there if they hadn’t come any closer. Up and at ’em, mates! Attack!

speaker: Man
text: Are you interested in this sword here? It’s called a lancereaver. It’s an incredible sword to take against lances. Still, it is a little weak against axes. Go ahead, take it. You’re going to the Dread Isle, right? If you want to avoid the pirates, go behind the shop. From there, just head straight down the alley. Good luck to you.

speaker: Man
text: You’re a brave soul to come to such a perilous place. Here. You should have this staff. You can use it to make those whose magical resistances are weaker than your own fall asleep for a while. Whether it works or not depends on the skill of the wielder. Ho, yes. Looks like those pirates are bearing down on you. Maybe this staff will help you get away.

speaker: Man
text: This road leads to danger. The pirates are waiting for you. Do you not think it would be better to find another route? You’ve risked much to come here. I can’t let you leave empty-handed. Take this axe. What do you think? Nice, isn’t it? However...it’s cursed. It’s a mighty weapon, but if one with bad luck wields it... Ooooh! Terrible, terrible, I tell you. Don’t use it unless you have to.

speaker: Woman
text: You’re being tested by pirates, with passage to the Dread Isle hanging in the balance? Here, use this bow. It’s a rare beauty, eh? A Sacaen friend gave it to me, but I can’t use it. Don’t get yourself killed out there, OK?

speaker: Man
text: Have you been to the arena yet? It’s filled with toughs and bravados. You can get rich there... All you have to do is wager and win. If you’re beaten, however, you lose both money and life. If you think you’re going to lose, press the B Button to give up. Remember, you can’t give up if you’re dead, so don’t wait too long.

speaker: Fargus
text: Aha! You made it, whelps!

speaker: Hector
text: That was... hard...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Haa...haa...You'll give us passage now, won't you?

speaker: Fargus
text: I'm a man of the sea. I always keep my word.Are my old eyes lyin' to me? Is this beauty really with you? Gwaa ha ha ha!! My lucky day!

speaker: Hector
text: Listen, I know how you feel, but you have to accept it. We've no other choice!

speaker: Lyn
text: I know that! I haven't said a word, have I?

speaker: Eliwood
text: We can go to the Dread Isle now. Please, Father... be well.

speaker: Hector
text: Looks like there are still a lot of Laus soldiers in the castle.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis, where are the Caelin guards?

speaker: Lyn
text: I think about half of them were killed in the surprise attack. The survivors must be here somewhere…

speaker: Hector
text: They’re probably locked away as prisoners. Right. Well, let’s find and rescue them too!

speaker: Eliwood
text: I wish we had more power to make up for our poor numbers.

speaker: Lyn
text: Hold on, Grandfather… We’ll be there shortly.

speaker: Hector
text: Time to get inside! Let’s reclaim the castle! The key to victory is seizing the throne! That’s where we’ll find their commander I’m sure.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Um, hellooooo!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hm?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Are you from Castle Caelin?

speaker: Lyn
text: I am. May I ask your business in the castle?

speaker: Merlinus
text: I am Merlinus. I am a traveling merchant with goods beyond compare. If you would be so kind to hire me, I…

speaker: Lyn
text: My apologies. Now is not the time.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Please, my lady… I’ve dreamt of working for a noble house for so long. By all means, please call on my services!

speaker: Hector
text: Old man! Are you truly a merchant?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Old… Old man?

speaker: Eliwood
text: You’re being rude, Hector!

speaker: Hector
text: Right, right. Old…gentleman. Is it true you aspire to work for a noble house?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Yes, my boy. Yes, I do.

speaker: Hector
text: In that case, we’d like to hire you.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Really?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector?

speaker: Hector
text: This journey could last a while, and we’ve acquired many items. It would be quite convenient if we had someone to manage our things.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Leave it to me! Managing…things is my specialty!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Our journey is dangerous, and has no end in sight. Is that acceptable?

speaker: Merlinus
text: Did you say da-dangerous?

speaker: Hector
text: I’m brother to Marquess Ostia. He’s Marquess Pherae’s son. You can come with us if you so desire.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Oh? Ostia and Pherae? Nobility beyond compare! I’m coming! Most definitely!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mark. The captured Caelin soldiers are most likely exhausted. I'd like to protect them and keep them from having to fight. I realize that makes it difficult for you to plan a strategy, but... I will do my best to take up their share of the fighting. Now, please tell us what we should do, Mark.

speaker: Hector
text: Mark. We can't count on the captured Caelin soldiers to be able to fight. We'll have to protect them as much as possible. What!? That chill feeling... Someone's watching... and wants me dead! No sense in worrying, though. I'll deal with it when it happens. Let's go, Mark!

speaker: Raven
text: Hey, you. Let me out of here.

speaker: Laus Soldier
text: What?

speaker: Raven
text: Marquess Ostia’s brother is among your enemy, right? Let me out, and I’ll help you. But I must have the brother. I’ve a score to settle with House Ostia.

speaker: Laus Soldier
text: Do you think me a fool? You work for house Caelin! I cannot trust your word!

speaker: Raven
text: Then I’ll have to break down this door and go through you. You were using Lucius as a hostage, but now he’s here with me…

speaker: Laus Soldier
text: Uh…

speaker: Lucius
text: No, Lord Raven! You mustn’t! You cannot betray your debt to Marquess Caelin.

speaker: Raven
text: Shut up, Lucius. You think me foolish, but you don’t understand… How about it?

speaker: Laus Soldier
text: Very well. You! Get out! Remember, if you betray us, your companion dies.

speaker: Raven
text: I see. Just remember, if that happens, you die next.

speaker: Laus Soldier
text: Urr…

speaker: Lucius
text: Wait! You can’t go alone! It’s too dangerous!

speaker: Raven
text: Lucius, stay here and be quiet. I’ll be back for you.

speaker: Lucius
text: Lord Raven!

speaker: Caelin Soldier
text: What in blazes!? It’s getting even noisier than before.

speaker: Lucius
text: Isn’t that the sound of combat?

speaker: Caelin Soldier
text: It must be Lady Lyndis! She’s found reinforcements! It’s time…

speaker: Lucius
text: Hm? What… What are you doing?

speaker: Caelin Soldier
text: I thought aid might come, so I hid keys and weapons here.

speaker: Lucius
text: Oh, I see.

speaker: Caelin Soldier
text: What are you going to do?

speaker: Lucius
text: Uh…

speaker: Caelin Soldier
text: Your master… He’s betrayed us. Lucius, I must ask. What will you do?

speaker: Lucius
text: I… I want to stop Lord Raven. However… In his current state, I…doubt he will lend me his ear. And so…I will…wait. I will wait for Lord Raven here. I’m sorry… I cannot fight. …Please understand.

speaker: Caelin Soldier
text: I do. Here, these are for you.

speaker: Lucius
text: For me? Vulnerary and a book of light magic?

speaker: Caelin Soldier
text: You don’t have to fight, just protect yourself. I’ve known you only a short time, but you’re a friend. I don’t want to see you die.

speaker: Lucius
text: Thank you… Thank you.

speaker: Caelin Soldier
text: All right, lads! Open that door!! On our honor as Caelin knights, we will save the marquess!

speaker: Raven
text: You…

speaker: Priscilla
text: Hm?

speaker: Raven
text: Can it be?

speaker: Priscilla
text: I…

speaker: Raven
text: You don’t… recognize me. That’s not surprising. You were so young when we were separated.

speaker: Priscilla
text: What? Are you… Raymond? My brother, Raymond?

speaker: Raven
text: You’ve grown, Priscilla…

speaker: Priscilla
text: Brother! My brother!!

speaker: Raven
text: What are you doing here? It’s been ten years since Count Caerleon of Etruria took you in as his foster daughter…

speaker: Priscilla
text: That’s right. My adopted father has treated me with much kindness. But I am of Caelin’s House Cornwell by birth. I still remember Father and Mother.  I’ve never forgotten them. Or you, Raymond.

speaker: Raven
text: …Priscilla.

speaker: Priscilla
text: ……When I heard that House Cornwell was lost…I… I was so worried about you.

speaker: Raven
text: So that’s why you left Etruria? You’ve come quite a way.

speaker: Priscilla
text: Dear friends of mine in Etruria helped me. They provided a young mage to be my escort. Then we passed through Laus… The marquess learned of my lineage and refused to let me leave. I would be there still if not for Lord Eliwood and his companions.

speaker: Raven
text: His…companions?

speaker: Priscilla
text: Lord Hector, Lady Lyndis… They’re all such kind people. I’m so glad I came to Lycia. And now I’ve found you…

speaker: Raven
text: You’ve become friends with…him?

speaker: Priscilla
text: Raymond?

speaker: Raven
text: ……I see. Then I will join you.

speaker: Priscilla
text: Dear Brother! Will you truly come with us?

speaker: Raven
text: I could not refuse my little sister. And besides…

speaker: Priscilla
text: What is it?

speaker: Raven
text: It’s nothing. You’re better off not knowing. Tell me, your lineage… Do Eliwood and his friends know of your heredity?

speaker: Priscilla
text: No, we’ve never spoken of it.

speaker: Raven
text: I see… That is best.

speaker: Priscilla
text: Brother?

speaker: Raven
text: Priscilla, we must keep our relationship secret. OK?

speaker: Priscilla
text: All right… If you say we must…

speaker: Raven
text: Another thing, my name is Raven now. Raymond is…a name I’ve discarded.

speaker: Priscilla
text: Brother… You have your reasons, don’t you? I understand. As long as we can travel together, I’m happy.

speaker: Priscilla
text: If we continue on, we’ll be able to see Father and Mother, too!

speaker: Raven
text: …Priscilla… That’s……

speaker: Lyn
text: Are you all well?

speaker: Soldier
text: Lady Lyndis! You’re unharmed!

speaker: Lyn
text: Please, I need all of you to help!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, my liege! We are yours to command!

speaker: Wil
text: Is everyone OK?

speaker: Soldier
text: Wil! Glad to see you’re well!

speaker: Wil
text: Yes, against all odds. Laus has some tough soldiers, but they can’t defeat us, can they?

speaker: Soldier
text: NEVER!!! Let’s show them the might of the Caelin knights!

speaker: Kent
text: Is everyone well?

speaker: Soldier
text: Commander Kent! You’re safe!

speaker: Kent
text: Can you fight?

speaker: Soldier
text: Of course, sir!

speaker: Kent
text: Then let’s drive these knaves out of Castle Caelin!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Sain
text: Rejoice, one and all! Your beloved subcommander is here to rescue you!

speaker: Soldier
text: Subcommander! You’re unharmed!

speaker: Sain
text: Are you ready to fight?

speaker: Soldier
text: Absolutely, sir!

speaker: Sain
text: All right! Direct your energy on your foes and drive them out!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Florina
text: Everyone… Are you well?

speaker: Soldier
text: Oh! Florina! You’re unharmed!

speaker: Florina
text: Yes, uhm… I’m with Lady Lyndis.

speaker: Soldier
text: Nice work! Leave the rest to us!

speaker: Florina
text: Now, I’ll…uh…take you to Lord Eliwood. ……Huh? Wa-Wait for me!

speaker: Lucius
text: Lyn! Are you well?

speaker: Lyn
text: Lucius?! Why are you here?

speaker: Lucius
text: Actually, I’ve been here for a few days as a mercenary.

speaker: Lyn
text: I didn’t know. Why didn’t you send word?

speaker: Lucius
text: Well…I’m… I’m traveling with someone, and… More importantly, I apologize for not being able to protect Castle Caelin. My lack of… strength… is truly shameful.

speaker: Lyn
text: It’s no one’s fault. The attack came so quickly. I was forced to flee myself. Now I simply want to rescue my grandfather as soon as possible. That is all I wish…

speaker: Lucius
text: May…I offer… my assistance?

speaker: Lyn
text: It’s not necessary.

speaker: Lucius
text: Pardon?

speaker: Lyn
text: Your hands are shaking terribly. I thank you for your offer, but you cannot fight in this condition.

speaker: Lucius
text: I… I’m sorry.

speaker: Lyn
text: It’s all right. I do ask that you help me when you’re able.

speaker: Lucius
text: Yes… Of course.

speaker: Lucius
text: Lyn! Are you well?

speaker: Lyn
text: Lucius?! Why are you here?

speaker: Lucius
text: Actually, I’ve been here for a few days as a mercenary.

speaker: Lyn
text: I didn’t know. Why didn’t you send word?

speaker: Lucius
text: Well…I’m… I’m traveling with someone, and… More importantly, I apologize for not being able to protect Castle Caelin. My lack of …strength… is truly shameful.

speaker: Lyn
text: It’s no one’s fault. The attack came so quickly. I was forced to flee myself. Now I simply want to rescue my grandfather as soon as possible. That is all I wish…

speaker: Lucius
text: I truly hope I can be of service.

speaker: Lyn
text: You can, Lucius. I’m counting on you.

speaker: Raven
text: Lucius.

speaker: Lucius
text: Lord Raven! I’m so pleased to see you well!

speaker: Raven
text: Things have changed. For the time being, we side with Caelin.

speaker: Lucius
text: That is good… So you’ve had a change of heart?

speaker: Raven
text: No, I will still have my revenge against House Ostia. The closer you are to your enemy, the easier it is to strike, right?

speaker: Lucius
text: Lo-Lord Raven…

speaker: Raven
text: Let’s go, Lucius.

speaker: Lucius
text: Yes…

speaker: Bernard
text: I am Bernard, Knight Commander of Laus! I would test the might of those who bested Bauker!

speaker: Bernard
text: This is a just reward… for Laus’s brutality…

speaker: Lyn
text: Grandfather! Grandfather! Where…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Hausen? Where are you?

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood. Here, on the throne… It’s blood.

speaker: Lyn
text: Blood? No! It can’t be!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis! Calm down. He might only be injured. Come, let us find him.

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, you’re right. I must be calm. There! Over there! There’s someone…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Who’s there? Show yourself!

speaker: Hector
text: You… Leila!

speaker: Leila
text: Yes, it’s me, Lord Hector. It’s been a long time.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You know her?

speaker: Hector
text: Yes, her name’s Leila. She…works for Ostia… All right, she’s a spy.

speaker: Leila
