text: Lord Eliwood of Pherae and Lady Lyndis of Caelin, correct? I am Leila. Pleased to make your acquaintance. Lady Lyndis, Marquess Caelin is back there receiving treatment.

speaker: Lyn
text: My grandfather is safe?!

speaker: Leila
text: …His life is yet his own.

speaker: Lyn
text: Ah! Father Sky and Mother Earth! I thank you for your mercy!!

speaker: Hector
text: Leila, what are you doing here?

speaker: Leila
text: I… I’m following Lord Uther’s orders. I’m investigating Marquess Pherae’s disappearance.

speaker: Eliwood
text: My father? What have you learned?

speaker: Leila
text: Come with me. We should talk in private.

speaker: Hector
text: Huh? Come on, Eliwood.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah…

speaker: Hector
text: Worrying about things won’t change them.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I know. I’m fine. Let’s go!

speaker: Leila
text: Let me start with my conclusion.

speaker: Leila
text: Marquess Pherae… is alive.

speaker: Hector
text: Whooooo! Eliwood!

speaker: Lyn
text: That’s wonderful!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Leila
text: I’ve been posing as a member of the Black Fang for several months. That’s where I got this information. I believe it is true.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Black Fang… They’re the assassins guild that Erik spoke of.

speaker: Leila
text: Yes, we’ve known of their existence for quite some time.

speaker: Hector
text: Explain.

speaker: Leila
text: The Black Fang is a guild of assassins founded about ten years ago by Brendan Reed. They’re based in Bern. Their arms reached quickly in several other countries. Originally, they targeted only nobles who abused their positions. The masses saw them as chivalrous, defenders of the common man. Their activities found wide support.

speaker: Hector
text: Chivalrous…

speaker: Leila
text: Then about a year ago, Brendan got married again. Black Fang’s operations have slowly changed since then. Now, they’ll take on any target, no matter how difficult, as long as they’re paid. And they’re no longer killing only criminals; anyone is a fair target.

speaker: Lyn
text: Is this Black Fang responsible for what’s happened to my grandfather?

speaker: Leila
text: Yes. We’ve learned of a mystery man named Nergal, behind Reed’s wife. It seems the Black Fang is performing secret tasks across Lycia for Nergal. Nergal’s trusted retainer Ephidel is with Marquess Laus. He manipulated Laus into hatching the rebellion plot against Ostia. The first to answer Laus’s call for rebellion was… Marquess Santaruz.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Helman… Why would you…

speaker: Leila
text: Next was Lord Elbert, Marquess Pherae.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You’re telling me that my father endorsed this plan?

speaker: Leila
text: I cannot say. I do know that he is with Marquess Laus currently. In a place called… the Dragon’s Gate.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Dragon’s Gate? Where is that?

speaker: Leila
text: On an isle called Valor, off the southern coast of Lycia. I apologize, but that is all the information I have.

speaker: Hector
text: Of all places to be, Valor… Blast!

speaker: Lyn
text: What kind of place is it?

speaker: Eliwood
text: It’s said that those who step onto the island never return. The common folk call it the Dread Isle. If that’s where my father is, however,  I will go and find him.  And this “Dragon’s Gate,” too!

speaker: Hector
text: I’m going with you. I’ll tell you right now, you can’t stop me.

speaker: Lyn
text: I’m also going.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis, I appreciate your kindness, but… Shouldn’t you stay with Marquess Caelin?

speaker: Lyn
text: Laus must be stopped. Otherwise, they might target my grandfather again. I also wish to help Eliwood’s father. Losing a parent… It’s an unbearable pain. It’s something I’d rather you didn’t have to feel yet.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis… Hector… Thank you. You give me strength.

speaker: Hector
text: Don’t mention it.

speaker: Lyn
text: We’re friends. It’s what friends do, Eliwood.

speaker: Leila
text: I’m also going to continue searching. Lady Lyndis, I think it would be prudent to let the world think Marquess Caelin is dead.

speaker: Lyn
text: I understand. I’ll do that. Thank you.

speaker: Leila
text: No thanks necessary. If you’ll excuse me.

speaker: Hector
text: Leila!

speaker: Leila
text: Yes?

speaker: Hector
text: Nergal and this…Ephidel? What are they like?

speaker: Leila
text: I’ve yet to lay eyes on Nergal. I’ve spoken to Ephidel on several occasions, however. He’s…eerie. He always wears a cloak that covers his face. And yet…

speaker: Hector
text: What is it?

speaker: Leila
text: His eyes glow golden… You can’t miss them. They seem…inhuman.

speaker: Matthew
text: Is that you, Leila?

speaker: Leila
text: Matthew. It’s been a long time.

speaker: Matthew
text: What have you been doing? More dangerous work?

speaker: Leila
text: We’re spies, Matthew. Everything we do is dangerous.

speaker: Matthew
text: That’s true. So how long do you think this mission’s going to last?

speaker: Leila
text: My objective is the same as yours: to rescue Marquess Pherae. If things go well, I’ll be in Ostia at the same time as you are.

speaker: Matthew
text: Is that so? You need to visit my hometown.

speaker: Leila
text: Is this where you were born? Why?

speaker: Matthew
text: …To meet my parents.

speaker: Leila
text: Hm? Matthew…

speaker: Matthew
text: Ha ha. Well, that’s that! See you.

speaker: Leila
text: As slippery as ever… Didn’t even wait for my reply.

speaker: Soldier
text: Lady Lyndis!

speaker: Lyn
text: Everyone… I’m happy to see you all well. I’m going after Marquess Laus. Protect my grandfather.

speaker: Soldier
text: One moment, Lady Lyndis. Please take this jewel before you leave.

speaker: Lyn
text: Jewel?

speaker: Soldier
text: We were able to move it before Laus’s men ransacked our vaults.

speaker: Other Soldier
text: We will take care of Lord Hausen. Please, Lady Lyndis, return to us safely.

speaker: Lyn
text: I will. Thank you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We're in Bern now. I wonder what's happened? The village seems so busy.

speaker: Lyn
text: I spoke to some villagers on the way here. They said Prince Zephiel's coming-of-age ceremony is in ten days. There's no helping all the excitement.

speaker: Hector
text: They've no idea what's happening. Carefree fools.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ......Tell me, Hawkeye, do you know the location of the Shrine of Seals?

speaker: Hawkeye
text: I've heard it's north of Bern. But the location of the shrine itself is secret. I doubt if anyone outside the royal family knows how to reach it.

speaker: Lyn
text: So, if we want to reach the shrine, we'll have to contact the royal family, is that it?

speaker: Hector
text: Without revealing our identities or our motives? There's got to be another way to find where it is.

speaker: Pent
text: ...I can provide you with its general location.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Pent?

speaker: Pent
text: I'm privy to the highest secrets of military information in Etruria. When we learned of the shrine's existence, we investigated. However, none of our operatives returned. Bern's defenses are formidable.

speaker: Hector
text: So, even if we reach the shrine, we're as like as not to be captured?

speaker: Pent
text: Most likely. And if your identities are discovered, Bern will see it as an excuse to invade Lycia.

speaker: Eliwood
text: That, above all else, must be avoided.

speaker: Pent
text: That's where I come in.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Pent
text: Duty demands that I attend the post-ceremony festivities. However, I will greet the queen privately before the ceremony.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Privately? You can do that?

speaker: Louise
text: Queen Hellene was born in Etruria. She and I are related, albeit a distant relation.

speaker: Pent
text: When we meet, I will discreetly ask about the Shrine of Seals. Most like, she'll not say much, but anything will help, will it not? Rest assured, even if I fail, I will not reveal your presence.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Pent! That's--

speaker: Pent
text: If we do not return by tomorrow, return to Lycia and come up with a new plan. Understood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...If you fail, what will become of you?

speaker: Pent
text: Everything will work out. It wouldn't be a bad life. Abandoning my position... Living on the run with Louise...

speaker: Louise
text: If I'm with you, my Lord Pent, I care not where we go.

speaker: Hector
text: I pray for your success.

speaker: Pent
text: Please do! Let us proceed, Louise.

speaker: Lyn
text: Come back safely! We'll be waiting for you!!

speaker: Hawkeye
text: ...Pent, hold on.

speaker: Pent
text: What is it, Hawkeye?

speaker: Hawkeye
text: I was holding this for the master.

speaker: Pent
text: It's a... Heaven seal!

speaker: Hawkeye
text: Mm...There are only three in existence.

speaker: Pent
text: What is Archsage Athos's plan?

speaker: Hawkeye
text: I'm to give it to them when the time is right.

speaker: Pent
text: ...I see.

speaker: Hawkeye
text: I... I might not know the right time when it comes. I want you to take care of it.

speaker: Pent
text: Thank you, but what if we do not return?

speaker: Hawkeye
text: You will. You and Louise... .......without fail.

speaker: Pent
text: ...I understand.

speaker: Louise
text: Lord Hawkeye, we... we will most certainly return.

speaker: Linus
text: Well, if it isn't Nino.

speaker: Nino
text: Yeah! Lloyd! Linus! What is it? Are you working?

speaker: Lloyd
text: I suppose we are.

speaker: Linus
text: How about you? Where are you off to in such a hurry?

speaker: Nino
text: I have a job to do, too! I'm carrying messages for Mother, so I have to do my best! See you! Let's do something when your job is finished.

speaker: Lloyd
text: She's a good lass.

speaker: Linus
text: Yes. Hard to believe she's that woman's child.

speaker: Eliwood
text: This waiting is hard. There must be something we can do.

speaker: Hector
text: I know what you mean, but we have to lay low...

speaker: Legault
text: Why don't we try and gather some information on the Black Fang?

speaker: Lyn
text: Hm? Information?

speaker: Legault
text: Yes. Black Fang's headquarters are here in Bern. The location was never disclosed to me, though. The Black Fang is so much different than it once was. Any information we could gain would be beneficial.

speaker: Eliwood
text: That's a good idea. Thanks, Legault.

speaker: Legault
text: Think nothing of it.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What do you think, Tactician? ...You're right. Any information we find would be a starting place. Then it's settled. Let's get started.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let's split up and go. Try to blend in.

speaker: Hector
text: We'd better be careful.

speaker: Lyn
text: Especially you, Hector.

speaker: Hector
text: What!?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Those two... I can't tell if they're friends or not.

speaker: Ninian
text: Tee hee...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Is something funny, Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: It's just... Listen to you grumble, Lord Eliwood! You sound like you're their chaperon!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Really? Is that what it sounds like to you?

speaker: Ninian
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Eliwood
text: That's great...

speaker: Ninian
text: Ha ha ha.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...I like it when you laugh.

speaker: Ninian
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Oh, nothing. Come on! Let's go!

speaker: Lloyd
text: ...Can it really be them? I thought they were in Nabata!

speaker: Linus
text: What does it matter where they've been? We found them, so let's take care of them.

speaker: Lloyd
text: I guess you're right... Yet the timing's not right. Attacking them while they're in town is against our creed. ...Shall we tell Father and await his orders?

speaker: Lloyd
text: Linus, I'll go and tell Father. You stay here and watch them.

speaker: Linus
text: Why don't you and I finish them now?

speaker: Lloyd
text: We can't! You have to be patient. All you need to do is watch where they go. Understand?

speaker: Linus
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Linus
text: ......Even so, I can't ignore game when it's nibbling on my line. Hey! Igor!

speaker: Igor
text: What is it, Linus?

speaker: Linus
text: We're going hunting! We'll taunt them and pull them to the center of the town.

speaker: Igor
text: Hold on a minute. You're not really going to ignore Lloyd's orders, are you?

speaker: Linus
text: ...He doesn't want the villagers harmed. That's what he said, right? So we make sure they're not.

speaker: Igor
text: I understand, but...

speaker: Linus
text: Come on, Igor! We want to show my brother we can do this, right? I'm counting on you!

speaker: Igor
text: ...Grrr! You just never, ever listen to anyone!

speaker: Igor
text: You are Eliwood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Who--Ah, you're Black Fang?

speaker: Igor
text: That's right. You have the honor of dying at the hands of the Four Fangs. Our commander is Linus, the Mad Dog.

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! Is that the enemy?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes. Let's meet his challenge!

speaker: Igor
text: ...Come. You'll get your throats ripped out...

speaker: Heath
text: Bern... ...Hm? Oh, Mark. I have few fond memories of my homeland. I'm a deserter. Yet...I can't say I'm not a little glad to be here. I hope that, someday soon, I can clear my name and return home.

speaker: Legault
text: ...... Who? Oh, it's you, is it, Mark? You caught me unawares and looking stupid. It's just that I AM a former Black Fang member. And I was a bit wrapped up in some silly emotions. Nothing for you to worry about. Direct me as you will.

speaker: Nino
text: Let's see... I'm sure this is the place, but... I guess he's not here yet. ... ... Hmm! Beautiful weather. It's perfect for taking on evildoers! Yet here I am again, running errands... I wish I were more worthy, so that I could help out in battle.

speaker: Nino
text: Waah! Don't... Don't scare me like that, Jaffar. What's wrong? You're never late for anything.

speaker: Jaffar
text: ...My last job took longer than expected.

speaker: Nino
text: What? There are things that can slow you down? I would never have expected that.

speaker: Jaffar
text: ...If you've my next mission...let me hear it.

speaker: Nino
text: Oh, right. Mother gave this to me... Huh? Oh! Wha-What happened? You're covered in blood!

speaker: Jaffar
text: ...It's a scratch. Pay it no heed...

speaker: Nino
text: Scratches don't bleed like that! Let me see.

speaker: Jaffar
text: Forget it. Next target...hurry... .......

speaker: Nino
text: Jaffar! Come on, wake... Wake up! What should I do?

speaker: Nino
text: Er... Is there something I can help you with? I have an injured man here. Please keep your voice down! No, I don't know anything about the Black Fang! Leave, please! You'll upset my patient!

speaker: Woman
text: Tell me, traveler, have you heard of the Four Fangs? The folk of Bern know all about them. They're the four strongest members of the righteous Black Fang. The one they call the Mad Dog is a great man. When I was being attacked by bandits, he rescued me. It was night, so I really couldn't see his face, but... I've heard some troubling rumors about the Black Fang lately, though. I wonder what's going on.

speaker: Old Woman
text: Long ago...the lord who ruled this area was an awful man. Every night he would hold an extravagant feast below the castle. Meanwhile, we villagers slowly starved to death. One day, though, it ended. The lord was dead. The Black Fang had given him a death sentence. To us, the Black Fang were heroes. It matters not what others said. That's what makes it so hard... Why did they have to change? Helping you...means that I'm betraying the Black Fang. And yet...I want you to have this.
...Stop right there.

speaker: Unit
text: Who?
No need for alarm. For reasons of my own, I wear the garb of the Black Fang, but I'm a loyal citizen of Lycia, and I am not your enemy.
A woman now leads the Black Fang around by the nose. When at last you confront her, use this staff. This woman is the ringleader you seek. Her name is Sonia. Do not forget. Sonia.

speaker: Old Man
text: Long ago, I used to work in Bern's royal palace. I was Prince Zephiel's teacher of history. The prince is a wise lad. He's the royal family's first prodigy. Yet King Desmond ignores the boy's talents, and they wither. Here...I'd like you to take this. This is an Earth seal. This one item contains the powers of many: Knight crest, Guide ring, Hero crest, Elysian whip... I am unsure why I would entrust this treasure to a complete stranger. I cannot explain it, but I have a feeling. For some reason, I believe you will aid the prince... Strange... Go on! Humor an old man and take it.

speaker: Soldier
text: I will repeat it as often as necessary, Lord Murdock! If we let the king's tyranny continue, Bern will--

speaker: Murdock
text: Hold your tongue.

speaker: Soldier
text: But--

speaker: Murdock
text: Be still.

speaker: Dart
text: Wait a minute. I've seen you before.

speaker: Geitz
text: What? Do you think you can just come up and start--

speaker: Dart
text: Ah, I know! You're that guy who worked for Belger...Geitz!

speaker: Geitz
text: Dart!? Is that you? What are you doing here?

speaker: Dart
text: I like to raise some trouble on land every now and then. How about you? What are you doing? Working for your father?

speaker: Geitz
text: Don't mention the old man!! As far as I'm concerned, I'm no part of that family anymore!

speaker: Dart
text: Well then, what are you doing here?

speaker: Geitz
text: Nothing... I was wandering about when this battle erupted. ...Say, Dart, do you think I could join up with you?

speaker: Dart
text: Huh? Of all the stupid...

speaker: Geitz
text: You're "raising trouble," right? So, let me in on the action.

speaker: Dart
text: It's fine with me. We're up against a pretty touch bunch, though.

speaker: Geitz
text: I've nothing else to do. I'll fight 'til I get bored!

speaker: Dart
text: Let's go then.

speaker: Geitz
text: Yeah!

speaker: Linus
text: Pray. I'll give you that much time. All the evil you've done up to now... Repent it, and sleep.

speaker: Linus
text: Hey! You're Eliwood, right?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Are you the leader of this group?

speaker: Linus
text: I am.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I've a question for you... I heard that the Black Fang possessed strong convictions. If so, then why do you follow a man like Nergal?

speaker: Linus
text: ...Nergal? Oh, that eerie man Sonia introduced my father to. This has nothing to do with him. I merely complete the missions given me!

speaker: Eliwood
text: And you never question the justness of your missions?

speaker: Linus
text: Question? What's to question? Neither my father nor my brother makes mistakes!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yet, the...

speaker: Linus
text: Will you stop yammering! I don't need my brother to finish you off. I will crush you myself, in the name of the Fang!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah!!

speaker: Hector
text: Hey! You the leader of this pack of curs?

speaker: Linus
text: I am Linus Reed! Son of Brendan Reed, head of the Black Fang! Evildoers! Prepare to receive the Fang's justice!

speaker: Hector
text: Evildoers? You've no room to speak! You're a bunch of murderers serving Nergal's every whim!

speaker: Linus
text: Are you so base that you bandy insults with your foe? Or are you frightened, knowing you face your doom? We are the Black Fang! You do not insult my family so!

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Are you well?

speaker: Linus
text: ......I lost. My brother tried to warn me... You're...strong... Too strong.

speaker: Linus
text: But... I will not die quite so easily!

speaker: Eliwood
text: What!?

speaker: Linus
text: You'll go with me!!

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood!

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Do as you must.

speaker: Linus
text: Huh!? ...What did you...

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...I noticed something during the battle. You did your best to keep the villagers clear of the fighting.

speaker: Linus
text: Of course. They've nothing to do with this. You are our target, not them.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You are not evil. The Black Fang fights with honor. So why is it that we are enemies?

speaker: Linus
text: It's your fault! You're evil... ......Bah!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Huh!?

speaker: Linus
text: None of this makes sense! Sonia told Father that you're a band of criminals. Father agreed and I obeyed, but...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Sonia? Isn't that...?

speaker: Linus
text: ...I'm going to withdraw for the moment. I'll be back when this is all straightened out.

speaker: Hector
text: That was close.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Forgive me. I wanted to speak with him at least once.

speaker: Lyn
text: Don't worry. It's fine. After all, we learned a little something about our opponent.

speaker: Eliwood
text: The Black Fang seems to have some honor after all. Perhaps they really are just being used by Nergal. We should talk to their leader, Brendan Reed.

speaker: Lyn
text: Perhaps we can resolve this without any more fighting.

speaker: Hector
text: I don't like it sounds like a terrible plan.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector?

speaker: Hector
text: Let's get back to camp. We might have some word from Pent and the others.

speaker: Lyn
text: I wonder what that was all about.

speaker: Linus
text: ...I've got to talk with my brother... ...I'm not sure it's wise to trust that woman... !!

speaker: Linus
text: ...Uhh...how...

speaker: Linus
text: You...I never felt you... .......nothing......

speaker: Limstella
text: ...Mad Dog Linus. Such wonderful quintessence.

speaker: Linus
text: ......Curse...s... ...I've...blu...blundered... Brother...I'm sorry... ... ...

speaker: Nino
text: Are you awake? Thank goodness...

speaker: Jaffar
text: You... I know you...

speaker: Nino
text: Uh-huh. We've met many times. I don't think I told you my name, though. I'm Nino! Sonia's daughter.

speaker: Jaffar
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Nino
text: Huh?

speaker: Jaffar
text: Have you forgotten the law of the Fang? "Sacrifice the wounded to salvage the strong."

speaker: Nino
text: That's not...

speaker: Jaffar
text: I was unconscious and alone outside of our safe halls. You should have obeyed the law... Killed me, and then fled. Yet you didn't. Why?

speaker: Nino
text: Bu-But... Letting a comrade die? I...couldn't do that.

speaker: Jaffar
text: Don't be a fool!

speaker: Nino
text: Sniff...

speaker: Nino
text: Don't move! Here! Lean on me!

speaker: Jaffar
text: ...Don't...touch...

speaker: Nino
text: Please, don't move. So much blood... You're bleeding again. What do I do? It won't stop.

speaker: Nino
text: PLease...don't die. You mustn't die.

speaker: Lloyd
text: ...... Linus... You fool, after all I told you... ...... ...Wait for me. I'll be joining you soon enough. And I'll bring you their corpses as a gift.

speaker: Soldier
text: Your Royal Highness, His Majesty the king has arrived.

speaker: Desmond
text: Where's Zephiel?

speaker: Hellene
text: Your Majesty... 'Tis a pleasure to see you. What a glorious day that sees you grace us with your presence.

speaker: Desmond
text: ...Enough. Call the boy!

speaker: Hellene
text: Your son is practicing his falconry.

speaker: Desmond
text: You knew I was coming, and yet you sent him away. Hmph... As crafty as ever, woman. Very well, you will have to do. It's ten days until the boy's coming-of-age ceremony. I would speak of it.

speaker: Hellene
text: At last... Once the ceremony ends, our son, so long lingering in the shadows, will be received by all as the legitimate heir to your throne. Do you know how he has longed for this day?

speaker: Desmond
text: Cease your complaints. You and Zephiel, queen and heir of Bern, have never wanted for anything.

speaker: Hellene
text: We are here in this manse, while you live in the palace with... that woman. You must be so disappointed that she bore you not a prince but a princess.

speaker: Desmond
text: Hellene! You go too far!!

speaker: Hellene
text: My child, who through me carries the noble blood of Etruria in his veins, will in ten days be named as the right-born heir to the throne. Ha ha ha! No matter how you may dote on her, your illegitimate daughter, Guinivere, is destined to be nothing more than a baseborn shadow... It is my son who shall reign in Bern! My son, Zephiel! Ha ha ha ha ha! How it gives me such pleasure to say those words!

speaker: Desmond
text: Have you said your mind? Well, I have something for you to hear as well.

speaker: Hellene
text: What could it be?

speaker: Desmond
text: Last night, from the palace, the Fire Emblem was stolen away by some villain.

speaker: Hellene
text: It can't be! ...Ha ha ha. You are so wicked, Your Majesty. Pray tell, who would believe such a tale? The Fire Emblem is Bern's greatest national treasure. No gem in existence is its equal. Stealing such a heavily guarded object is impossible, is it not?

speaker: Desmond
text: Unfortunately, I speak true.

speaker: Hellene
text: No...

speaker: Desmond
text: You know of the importance of the Fire Emblem. It's the symbol of the heir, the heart of the ceremony. Without the Emblem, the ceremony must be canceled.

speaker: Hellene
text: No!! Thi-This was your doing, wasn't it? How can you despise Zephiel so? He is of your blood. He is your beloved son, is he not?

speaker: Desmond
text: I have heard that Zephiel is... a gifted student, a stunning fighter, excelling in all he tries. And I've also heard that he is much loved by the people.

speaker: Hellene
text: Yes! It is true. All of it! He is a worthy son.

speaker: Desmond
text: I...excelled at neither books nor blades.

speaker: Hellene
text: What do you--

speaker: Desmond
text: I cannot say that I command the love of my subjects... Zephiel and I are opposites in every way. It is hard to believe that he is my son.

speaker: Hellene
text: Zephiel is Your Majesty's child! Your Grace, you know this is truth!

speaker: Desmond
text: Mine or not, without the ceremony... He will not be named heir. Mark my words, and prepare yourself, woman.

speaker: Hellene
text: Your Majesty! King Desmond!! Please... Please wait! He is your heir! Your son! Please... What am I to do? Zephiel...

speaker: Servant
text: I beg your pardon, Your Hgihness. You have a visitor...

speaker: Hellene
text: I will see no one. Send him home.

speaker: Servant
text: Your Highness, I...
It's all right. You may go. I will take care of this.

speaker: Servant
text: Yes, my lady.

speaker: Hellene
text: Who?

speaker: Louise
text: Lady Hellene, it's been far too long. It is I, Louise.

speaker: Hellene
text: Louise!? Is it truly you? Ah... Louise...

speaker: Louise
text: What is it? Your eyes are so red. It's a shame to see such beauty marred by tears.

speaker: Hellene
text: There is something... I...

speaker: Louise
text: If it please you, I would hear your troubles. My husband is here with me. Perhaps he will be able to lend you his aid.

speaker: Hellene
text: Lord Pent is also here? I see... ...... ...To be honest...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Pent! Lady Louise!!

speaker: Pent
text: Sorry to have kept you waiting.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...How did everything go?

speaker: Pent
text: ...I can't say it was a complete failure, yet...

speaker: Lyn
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Louise
text: We've a task to perform.

speaker: Hector
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Pent
text: Queen Hellene is looking for something. If we find it for her...

speaker: Eliwood
text: She will listen to our request, is that it?

speaker: Pent
text: We have until the morning of the tenth day from today. ...What will you do? The decision is yours.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...We'll do it. It is most certainly a test we were destined to take.

speaker: Wallace
text: Grrrr!! Not again! This is the 75th time! I could have SWORN Caelin was in this direction! Grrr... Eh? Something's wrong... Is it a sneak attack!? You cowards, waiting in the fog!! My name is Wallace! The boldest knight in all Caelin (wherever it is)! If you're not afraid to die, show yourselves!!! Bwah ha ha ha ha ha ha!!!

speaker: Lloyd
text: In the name of the Fang, I sentence you to death. Do not blame me for your fate. It is your own doing.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Are you the leader of this group?

speaker: Lloyd
text: Yes.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I heard that the Black Fang possessed strong convictions. If so, then why do you follow a man like Nergal?

speaker: Lloyd
text: This has nothing to do with Nergal or Sonia. We simply complete the missions given us.

speaker: Eliwood
text: And you never question the justness of your missions?

speaker: Lloyd
text: Who are we to pass judgment on the commands given us? We are the jaw that bites. We act without question.

speaker: Eliwood
text: But...

speaker: Lloyd
text: Granted, you don't seem like a bad sort. However, the Fang's judgment cannot be undone. It is time for you to die.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah!!

speaker: Hector
text: ...And you would be the leader of this pack of curs?

speaker: Lloyd
text: Aye. That I am.

speaker: Hector
text: I've no mercy for Nergal's hounds of the hunt! Stand and prepare to be beaten.

speaker: Lloyd
text: You... You wish to challenge me with that axe of yours? ...You're amusing, I'll grant you that. I'm sure you'd have Linus laughing if he were here. Be warned, you would do well not to take me lightly.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Are you well?

speaker: Lloyd
text: ......I'm beaten. You are strong. Stronger than I'd realized

speaker: Lloyd
text: You're foolish as well. To waste sentiment on me, your enemy...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah!

speaker: Lloyd
text: This is what happens!

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood!

speaker: Lloyd
text: Peace. I've no plans on fleeing with a hostage. After I deal with you, I'll let the rest of them go.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Uhai said the same thing.

speaker: Lloyd
text: What?

speaker: Eliwood
text: We battled your comrade Uhai on the Dread Isle... He told us he'd do nothing so cowardly as take a hostage. He fought with honor. You Black Fang are not evil by nature. So why is it that we fight?

speaker: Lloyd
text: Uhai... You spoke with him?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes. With. his dying breath, he told us the way to the Dragon's Gate.

speaker: Lloyd
text: I see...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah!

speaker: Lloyd
text: Go. Don't worry. I too, have my honor. I will not attack again.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Will you join our cause?

speaker: Lloyd
text: No... However, something is amiss. You have been granted a brief reprieve until I have my answers.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Tell us, what is your name?

speaker: Lloyd
text: I'll tell you next time we meet. Be seeing you. Watch out for the woman named Sonia.

speaker: Hector
text: That was close.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Forgive me. I wanted to speak with him at least once.

speaker: Lyn
text: Don't worry. It's fine. After all, we learned a little something about our opponent.

speaker: Eliwood
text: The Black Fang seems to have some honor after all. Perhaps they really are just being used by Nergal. We should talk to their leader, Brendan Reed.

speaker: Lyn
text: Perhaps we can resolve this without any more fighting.

speaker: Hector
text: I don't like it sounds like a terrible plan.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector?

speaker: Hector
text: Let's get back to camp. We might have some word from Pent and the others.

speaker: Lyn
text: I wonder what that was all about.

speaker: Lloyd
text: ...As I suspected. They are not the gang of thugs Sonia made them out to be....How do I unmask that woman for what she truly is? Ah!!

speaker: Lloyd
text: Impossible... Not a sound... .......nothing......

speaker: Limstella
text: Lloyd, the White Wolf. Such strong quintessence.

speaker: Lloyd
text: ......Li...Linus...Tell......Father...

speaker: Nino
text: Are you awake? Thank goodness...

speaker: Jaffar
text: You... I know you...

speaker: Nino
text: Uh-huh. We've met many times. I don't think I told you my name, though. I'm Nino! Sonia's daughter.

speaker: Jaffar
text: What are you doing?

speaker: Nino
text: Huh?

speaker: Jaffar
text: Have you forgotten the law of the Fang? "Sacrifice the wounded to salvage the strong."

speaker: Nino
text: That's not...

speaker: Jaffar
text: I was unconscious and alone outside of our safe halls. You should have obeyed the law... Killed me, and then fled. Yet you didn't. Why?

speaker: Nino
text: Bu-But... Letting a comrade die? I...couldn't do that.

speaker: Jaffar
text: Don't be a fool!

speaker: Nino
text: Sniff...

speaker: Nino
text: Don't move! Here! Lean on me!

speaker: Jaffar
text: ...Don't...touch...

speaker: Nino
text: Please, don't move. So much blood... You're bleeding again. What do I do? It won't stop.

speaker: Nino
text: PLease...don't die. You mustn't die.

speaker: Linus
text: Lloyd... Brother? Lloyd!! This...is unforgivable! I will kill them all!! Not a one will survive!!!

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector! We're under attack!

speaker: Hector
text: Is it Marquess Laus? He's come back to take the castle? Perfect! We'll catch him easily.

speaker: Oswin
text: No, it's not him... The attackers aren't regular army. Maybe they're mercenaries hired by Laus...

speaker: Hector
text: Mercenaries?

speaker: Oswin
text: Their movements are very rapid... Coordinated. They've already made their way into the castle.

speaker: Hector
text: For mercenaries, they're very, very good. Eliwood, do you have any ideas?

speaker: Eliwood
text: My father told me something once... There's a mercenary group extremely loyal to house Laus. Their leader is named Eubans, but he's called the Hurricane. He's famed for surprise attacks and lightning-swift strikes.

speaker: Hector
text: Hmmm... This could be interesting. Protect the throne! We will not lose this castle!

speaker: Heath
text: Sealen.

speaker: Sealen
text: Is that you, Heath?

speaker: Heath
text: I've secured a retreat path, as Commander Eubans ordered. Just in case something goes wrong...

speaker: Sealen
text: I don't need you to tell me when to retreat. If we lose the element of surprise, we fall back.

speaker: Heath
text: I've heard there are Ostian knights among the enemy forces. Watch yourself, Sealen.

speaker: Sealen
text: Are we friends now? Worrying so about a complete stranger... Heath, you weren't meant to be a mercenary.

speaker: Sealen
text: Our goal is the throne. We’ll attack from the front and send another unit behind. We want to drive the enemy into a state of chaos. The ambush units are concealed as ordered. When the enemy splits its forces, we strike. That’s all. Go.

speaker: Sealen
text: I’ll meet any challengers here. Someone else go after the throne.

speaker: Sealen
text: So this is a mercenary’s death…

speaker: Hector
text: Yes! We survived!

speaker: Oswin
text: The rest of the enemy units have begun to retreat. It must be part of their plan. Half of them are already gone.

speaker: Hector
text: Blast! You have to admire their efficiency, though. Eubans’s mercenaries… I won’t forget this. We’ll likely cross paths again someday. And there’s the assassins I fought in Ostia…..

speaker: Oswin
text: Hector? Is something wrong?

speaker: Hector
text: No, nothing special. We simply have to tighten our belts and prepare. It appears we have more than one enemy. Oswin!

speaker: Oswin
text: We’ll see to the castle defenses at once...

speaker: Hector
text: No. I grow weary of defending things. Let’s get out of here and pursue Marquess Laus. It’s time to put him on the defense!

speaker: Lyn
text: Look, Mark! The mountains seem so far away now. We've come such a long way...

speaker: Sain
text: Milady Lyndis! Mark! We can't be far from the castle now!

speaker: Kent
text: By my reckoning, we can reach Castle Caelin in two days if we hurry.

speaker: Lyn
text: Two more days... Hold on, Grandfather. Please...

speaker: Florina
text: Cheer up, Lyn. If they see you looking so sad, the entire company will lose heart.

speaker: Lyn
text: Florina... You're right. There's nothing to be gained by worrying. We just have to press onward.

speaker: Florina
text: That's the spirit!

speaker: Nils
text: Lyn... Danger approaches...

speaker: Lyn
text: What did you say?

speaker: Sain
text: I don't see anything. Are you sure?

speaker: Ninian
text: I feel it, too. I'm sure of it. Ah! Milady, don't move!

speaker: Lyn
text: Hm?

speaker: Lyn
text: What in--Where did this bolt come from?

speaker: Kent
text: They have a ballista!

speaker: Sain
text: Lord Lundgren is getting serious. Deploying siege engines is no mean feat.

speaker: Lyn
text: What is a ballista?

speaker: Kent
text: It's a weapon designed for long-distance attacks. Only archers can use them, but they can be devastating.

speaker: Sain
text: Florina! You must stay aground! Do not take to the air! The ballista would target you in an instant.

speaker: Lyn
text: Is there a way to combat it?

speaker: Kent
text: The safest course is to use someone with good defense as bait, so the enemy wastes arrows.

speaker: Sain
text: Then you can walk up and knock the fool on the head.

speaker: Lyn
text: Wil, can you use a ballista?

speaker: Wil
text: I've never tried, but... It's just a really big bow, right? I should be able to figure it out.

speaker: Lyn
text: All we can ask is that you try... Let's see what we can do!

speaker: Matthew
text: Ah, Lady Lyndis! Mark! I have some minor... business... to attend to. I'm unable to join you. If you need any of my possessions, please take them now.

speaker: Tutorial
text: On the far side of the hill to the south is a ballista. As Kent said, it's a weapon intended for trained archers. The attack range of ballistae is extremely large, so they can fire on enemies at great distances. As they can attack without fear of counterattack, they're quite useful. To use one, move an archer onto an unoccupied ballista, and select the ride command. After that, you can attack as usual. ballistae can also be moved while in use. Additionally, ballistae can be used by any archer in the field. So, if you can remove the enemy manning the ballista and move one of your group onto it... you'll find it most useful.

speaker: Yogi
text: What are you curs waiting for? They're nothing but fleas! Call up for reinforcements, and rush 'em!

speaker: Villager
text: Do you remember the weapon triangle? Axes over lances and whatnot? This is important, so pay attention. There are some weapons that don't follow the normal rules. This here lancereaver is one of those. It's a sword that reverses the triangle. So if you wield this blade, you can best a lance with it. Of course, there's a downside... Axes can best this sword. Take this as a gift. It's your reward for listening to an old man ramble. Don't be so shy. It's not like I can use the thing. Not everyone can wield a sword of this caliber. I'm sure you know someone who can use it, though.

speaker: Yogi
text: Curses! The ballista must have been taken... What's going on here!? Somebody, get that girl!

speaker: Yogi
text: Lord Lundgren... I've failed you... I pray you hurry...with those reinforcements...you promised.

speaker: Lyn
text: Is it over?

speaker: Kent
text: Yes. I see no more enemy soldiers. However, something is bothering me.

speaker: Lyn
text: What is it?

speaker: Kent
text: I noticed it during the fighting. Our opponents... They were soldiers of Caelin. I even recognized some of those we fought. I trained with many of them... Amd yet they attacked us without hesitation.

speaker: Sain
text: They're black-hearted traitors who've joined Lord Lundgren. Good riddance, I say. It also means less resistance at the castle.

speaker: Kent
text: I hope you're right...

speaker: Lyn
text: I'm just glad Nils and Ninian were with us. If that first shot had hit me, I might not have survived.

speaker: Ninian
text: We are honored to have served you well.

speaker: Nils
text: We won't let you down!

speaker: Lyn
text: I know. I'm relying on you.

speaker: Matthew
text: What's this? You dealt with the ballista, too? Nicely done!

speaker: Lyn
text: Matthew, where were you during all this?

speaker: Matthew
text: I went to the village to sniff about for information. I got some interesting news for my trouble, too.

speaker: Lyn
text: Let's hear it!

speaker: Matthew
text: First, about Marquess Caelin's illness. He really is unwell. He's been abed for nigh on three months.

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh, no... Grandfather...

speaker: Matthew
text: I heard an interesting rumor about his condition, though. The people believe that someone's been poisoning the marquess...

speaker: Lyn
text: He's being poisoned!?

speaker: Matthew
text: And this someone... Well, everyone's too afraid to mention a name. However, they say that as soon as the marquess took ill, a certain noble took control of the castle as though it were his own. I fed a hungry inkeeper some coin, and he fed me a name. The marquess of Caelin's own brother, Lord Lundgren.

speaker: Lyn
text: How can this be? How can they allow him to get away with this? The villagers know he's the one poisoning my grandfather, and yet no one raises a hand against him? Why?

speaker: Kent
text: They are afraid, and they lack proof. The whisperings of the common people means nothing.

speaker: Matthew
text: That's the truth of it. And of the marquess's loyal retainers who might have lent credence to these rumors, there is no sign.

speaker: Lyn
text: Are you saying they've been silenced?

speaker: Matthew
text: It's a fair assumption.

speaker: Kent
text: This is beyond believing.

speaker: Matthew
text: The worst news is yet to come.

speaker: Sain
text: What? There's more?

speaker: Matthew
text: An imposter's appeared, claiming to be the marquess's granddaughter. At least, that's the story Lundgren's telling to all who'll listen.

speaker: Lyn
text: What does that mean?

speaker: Matthew
text: It means that people are waiting for two traitorous knights and a baseborn child to appear and lay claim to Castle Caelin.

speaker: Sain
text: But... But that... It can't be!

speaker: Kent
text: Traitors? Us? Ridiculous!!!

speaker: Lyn
text: He says... I'm an imposter?

speaker: Matthew
text: Don't you have anything that proves your lineage?

speaker: Lyn
text: When my mother joined the Lorca, she brought nothing of Lycia with her.

speaker: Sain
text: Milady, Marquess Araphen himself remarked at your resemblance to Lady Madelyn! Your face is your proof!

speaker: Kent
text: They'll say we found a look-alike somewhere... We're seen as betrayers of our knightly vows. Our word means nothing. No, our only hope is to see Marquess Caelin himself.

speaker: Lyn
text: We must hurry. If not, my grandfather... I must see him! With my last breath if need be.

speaker: Matthew
text: But we must formulate some manner of plan! Even if we set out for the castle, the troops patrolling the area will cause no end of problems. You have been branded as oathbreakers, after all.

speaker: Lyn
text: I've got it! Eliwood... He seemed sympathetic to our plight. He should still be in Khathelet. If we can talk to him, he might help us!

speaker: Kent
text: Of course! A sound idea!

speaker: Sain
text: Let's hurry!

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes! Back to Khathelet!!

speaker: Helman
text: What? Eliwood is here?

speaker: Ephidel
text: Yes. He has set camp up on a hill south of here. He seeks permission to enter Santaruz. He seeks an audience with you.

speaker: Helman
text: Could it be... Do you think Eliwood’s come to ask of his father? If that’s the case... I... I know not what to tell him.

speaker: Ephidel
text: Tell him you know nothing, and let him be on his way.

speaker: Helman
text: Yet... I know young Eliwood well. His father, Elbert, and I are old friends. I’ve no children of my own, and I’ve always treasured Eliwood... I do not believe I could look him in the eye and... I could not lie to him. I could not.

speaker: Ephidel
text: We’ve no choice then. Let us chase the boy away. If you do not speak with him, you need tell no lies.

speaker: Helman
text: Wait! Do you mean to harm Eliwood?

speaker: Ephidel
text: Not harm. Frighten. A scratch or two will leave no scars. He will run home to Pherae and be done with his adventure. He is, after all, all that Pherae has left...

speaker: Marcus
text: Instead of entering Laus with such a small group, we should meet with Marquess Santaruz and request his assistance... I see the sense in that. It’s a good plan, Mark.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Truly so. I tell you again, I’m pleased to have you with us. Lord Helman... He’s not only my father’s friend. I’ve known him since I was a child. I’m sure that he will help us.

speaker: Marcus
text: What? Lord Eliwood! Beware!

speaker: Zagan
text: Heh heh heh... Noble sirs. Alms for a poor villager.

speaker: Marcus
text: Poor villager? You look nothing like an honest man. Clear the road. Step quickly or...

speaker: Zagan
text: Step quickly? Heh heh... Good advice. Maybe it’s you who should follow it!

speaker: Marcus
text: What?

speaker: Zagan
text: Someone wants the boy in an early grave. A shame if you ask me, but he’ll die here today. C’mon, boys! Earn your keep!

speaker: Dorcas
text: Here we go again, eh, Mark? Just like old times... Seems our fates are bound. Natalie? Oh, she’s still in Pherae. I’m working for you this time, so she’s not too worried. Guide my axe, Mark.

speaker: Matthew
text: Lord Hector! I have it! I know where Lord Eliwood is. He entered Santaruz not far from here.

speaker: Hector
text: Is that so? We've read his movements fairly well, then. Let's move due south and cross the border. We'll meet up with him in Santaruz!

speaker: Serra
text: Ah! There you are! Lord Hector!

speaker: Matthew
text: Oh, no...

speaker: Hector
text: Serra? W-What... What are you doing here?

speaker: Serra
text: You're going to meet Lord Eliwood, right? Well, I want to go, too!

speaker: Hector
text: Go home! This is no game.

speaker: Serra
text: But Oswin told me it was all right to come!

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin?

speaker: Oswin
text: Yes, my lord. On the marquess's orders. Serra and I will be accompanying you.

speaker: Hector
text: Bah. This is ridiculous. Always have to have the last word, eh, Brother?

speaker: Oswin
text: No matter what you think, he's just worried about you, Lord Hector. You're the only family he has.

speaker: Hector
text: I know...

speaker: Matthew
text: Lord Hector! Up ahead! There appears to be fighting.

speaker: Hector
text: Where? Is it Eliwood? Come! Let's get closer! Hurry! Oswin! Matthew!

speaker: Matthew
text: Yes, my lord!

speaker: Serra
text: Oh! Wait for me! I'm coming, too!

speaker: Hector
text: Hey! What's going on over there? Looks like some rough business. You! Soldier! Are you just going to stand there and watch?

speaker: Soldier
text: Who do you think you are? This is Santaruz. What occurs here is no affair of any foreign lordling!

speaker: Hector
text: I believe I'm going to have to disagree with you. You see, the man they're attacking happens to be a friend of mine.

speaker: Soldier
text: A friend? What? ...Urrrgh!!

speaker: Hector
text: Sorry, but I'm in a hurry.

speaker: Serra
text: Ewww! That's terrible! I loathe violence!

speaker: Matthew
text: Nicely done, my lord! You're a fighter born.

speaker: Oswin
text: I cannot condone resorting to force so quickly...

speaker: Hector
text: Chastise me later, Oswin. First, we deal with these brigands! Come! We must help Eliwood!

speaker: Oswin
text: Help Eliwood? Sounds like a convenient excuse for more violence.

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin!

speaker: Oswin
text: Yes, yes. I'm coming!

speaker: Hector
text: Matthew! Bring Serra and follow along.

speaker: Matthew
text: What! With...Serra?

speaker: Serra
text: No! I want to go with you now!

speaker: Hector
text: Absolutely not! You'll slow us down! zzz

speaker: Serra
text: Oh! How rude!

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin! Let's go!

speaker: Zagan
text: Bah! He puts up a good fight for a pampered noble pup. It’s up to me to finish him.

speaker: Eliwood
text: How many are there? This looks–

speaker: Hector
text: Hey! What’s going on over there? Looks like some rough business. You! Soldier! Are you just going to stand there and watch?

speaker: Soldier
text: Who do you think you are? This is Santaruz. What occurs here is no affair of any foreign lordling!

speaker: Hector
text: I believe I’m going to have to disagree with you. You see, the man they’re attacking happens to be a friend of mine.

speaker: Soldier
text: A friend? What? ...Urrrgh!!

speaker: Hector
text: Sorry, but I’m in a hurry.

speaker: Serra
text: Ewww! That’s terrible! I loathe violence!

speaker: Matthew
text: Nicely done, my lord! You’re a fighter born.

speaker: Oswin
text: I cannot condone resorting to force so quickly...

speaker: Hector
text: Chastise me later, Oswin. First, we deal with these brigands! Come! We must help Eliwood!

speaker: Oswin
text: Help Eliwood? Sounds like a convenient excuse for more violence.

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin!

speaker: Oswin
text: Yes, yes. I’m coming!

speaker: Hector
text: Matthew! Take Serra and find someplace to hide.

speaker: Matthew
text: What! With...Serra?

speaker: Serra
text: No! I’m going with you!

speaker: Hector
text: You are not! You’ll slow us down!

speaker: Serra
text: Oh! How rude!

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin! Let’s go!

speaker: Villager
text: Hmm... You look like you’ve some experience with battle. No need to conceal it. I’ve fought in many a battle in my time, I assure you. Let me tell you one thing about combat, though. The most important thing is technique. If you’ve no skill, you’ll rarely strike your enemy. My instructor gave me this secret book long ago. It will improve the fighting prowess of the one who reads it. I’m too old to make use of it, so why don’t you take it?

speaker: Girl
text: It’s really important to trust your companions, yes? If you have a boon companion fighting at your side, you feel stronger and more confident. Hm? Who do I think make good companions for whom? Well, I am a fortune-teller, so I could do a reading, but...

speaker: Man
text: I saw them, I did. About a month ago...Marquess Pherae and his men passed right through here. They’ve all gone missing, haven’t they? A group as strong as that just up and vanishing...Couldn’t have been bandits, but...I don’t believe it. Must’ve been something terrible. The world’s become a dangerous place, it has.

speaker: Woman
text: The marquess who leads Santaruz is Lord Helman. He doesn’t ask for much, and he’s a nice enough fellow. I wouldn’t call him weak, but he is more follower than leader. Lately, he’s been meeting with Marquess Laus quite a lot. I hope nothing bad comes of it, but...

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! Are you all right?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector! What are you–

speaker: Hector
text: Later! First let’s take care of these louts.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Right!

speaker: Zagan
text: Curses! What are you waiting for!? Let me show you boys how it’s done!

speaker: Zagan
text: Oh...aaurr...This...was not...so easy...as it seemed...

speaker: Hector
text: Whew...Is that all of them?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector! Where did you come from?

speaker: Hector
text: Well met, Eliwood.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes, but...what are you doing here?

speaker: Hector
text: You wound me!

speaker: Eliwood
text: How do you mean?

speaker: Hector
text: You’re looking for your father, right? Why didn’t you send word?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Your brother was just named Marquess Ostia. He’s going to be very busy setting up his court council. Lord Uther must need your support. You are his brother, after all.

speaker: Hector
text: My brother is not so weak. Oh, he has mentioned some things in public, but...He knew exactly what I was planning, and he let me go.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Is that so? Well then, it would be unwise to refuse his kindness! It does me good to see you, Hector. Thank you.

speaker: Hector
text: Think nothing of it. You know Oswin, don’t you?

speaker: Oswin
text: Well met, Lord Eliwood.

speaker: Eliwood
text: It is good to see you again, Oswin. So you came as well?

speaker: Oswin
text: Yes. Lord Uther was worried about Lord Hector traveling alone. I’ve been ordered to keep a close eye on him.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ha ha ha! Of course! Good to have you with us.

speaker: Serra
text: Lord Hector! Why didn’t you tell me the fighting was done!?

speaker: Matthew
text: I apologize for the interruption. I couldn’t restrain her any longer!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Are these your companions, Hector?

speaker: Hector
text: Oh...Yes, I suppose they are. One might have hoped for better, but...

speaker: Serra
text: That was uncalled for! I can’t believe you said that! Matthew, did you hear what he said about you?

speaker: Matthew
text: Me? He was talking about you!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector, why don’t you introduce us?

speaker: Hector
text: The noisy one is Serra. Believe it or not, she’s a cleric.

speaker: Serra
text: Yes, I am Serra, my lord. Pleased to meet you.

speaker: Hector
text: And that’s Matthew. He does a lot of...sneaking around.

speaker: Matthew
text: My lord.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Sneaking...around.

speaker: Matthew
text: Well...I, er...gather information, open doors, chests, and such. I’ve got...nimble fingers.

speaker: Eliwood
text: That sounds...like a thief’s work...

speaker: Hector
text: Well...Don’t let it worry you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: But...

speaker: Hector
text: This journey...I suspect it will be harder than you imagine. You may have to accept things like this if you want to survive.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What is it, Hector? Do you know something?

speaker: Hector
text: Nothing specific. Rumors abound, though. A league of assassins from Bern has been moving around in Lycia. Experienced bounty hunters and mercenaries are vanishing...

speaker: Eliwood
text: That reminds me. One of the men who attacked us said something odd.

speaker: Hector
text: What was it?

speaker: Marcus
text: Lord Eliwood, if I may?

speaker: Hector
text: Marcus! Good to see you!

speaker: Marcus
text: Lord Hector, it’s been far too long. Your assistance is greatly appreciated.

speaker: Hector
text: Come now, Marcus. No need for such formalities. Tell me what you heard.

speaker: Marcus
text: Of course. The apparent leader of that gang of thugs...He indicated that someone was watching Lord Eliwood...That someone needed him dead.

speaker: Hector
text: Hmm...That is troubling. Actually, a captain of the guard was watching the fight when we arrived. He was a knight of Santaruz, and yet he just stood there and let a lord be attacked. I think he was planning on seeing you die.

speaker: Eliwood
text: So, Mark. What do you think? ...You might be right. Something may have happened to Lord Helman, too. Come! We must hurry to the castle!

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! Who is this?

speaker: Eliwood
text: This is Mark. I required tactical aid in the search for my father, and...

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, I see. So this is who directed the battle plan back there, hm? You know, Mark, you’re very young. We’ve many strategists in Ostia, but none so young. Eliwood, are you sure about this one?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mark is still a student of military strategy, but...We’ve received nothing but sound advice so far. Mark has my trust.

speaker: Hector
text: All right. I suppose I shall witness your skills firsthand. Well met, Mark.

speaker: Matthew
text: Hello! How have you been, Mark? Eh? My secret’s revealed? Oh, that. Yes, it’s true. My guise as a common thief was but a ruse. I’ve served House Ostia for some time as a spy of sorts! Surprised? Well, regardless, it looks like we’ll be traveling together again. Here’s to our mutual survival!

speaker: Serra
text: Eeeeeeee! Mark! Is it really you? It’s been far, far too long! You missed me, didn’t you? Of course you did. I knew it. Hm? Didn’t I tell you before? I’m in the employ of Ostia, Lycia’s ruling territory. I’ll be here to help you just like before! Aren’t you lucky!

speaker: Linus
text: Wait for the opportunity, and bring them down... That's the way, right, Brother? And now the time has finally arrived.

speaker: Black Fang
text: Lord Linus, the enemy draws near.

speaker: Linus
text: At last! Everyone, scatter! This fight will be Lloyd's wake! Let none of them escape!

speaker: Second Black Fang
text: Sir!

speaker: Eliwood
text: I can see it... That's the Shrine of Seals.

speaker: Hector
text: This is strange. We've made it so far without seeing a single soul.

speaker: Lyn
text: I'm afraid that's no longer the case.

speaker: Hector
text: What!?

speaker: Eliwood
text: They're out for blood! Who could they be?

speaker: Black Fang
text: You're Lord Eliwood of House Pherae, correct?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...And if I am?

speaker: Black Fang
text: We are the Fang, and we serve the Mad Dog, Linus. You will atone for your sins with blood!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: What!?

speaker: Nino
text: It's the The Black Fang... They're all Fangs. They're alive!

speaker: Jaffar
text: Wait!

speaker: Nino
text: What? What is it?

speaker: Jaffar
text: Their battle lust... It's not normal. Get too close, and they'll tear you apart!

speaker: Nino
text: Why? Why do we have to fight? If we talk to them, they'll see.

speaker: Jaffar
text: We are no longer Fangs. No... We served Nergal. We were never Fangs. To them, we were never companions. Never.

speaker: Nino
text: No... No... That's not true! That man mentioned Linus! Linus must be here! I need to talk to him! Linus will understand! I won't give up so easily!!

speaker: Lloyd
text: I've been waiting. And now, at last, the time to bring you down is here. The Fangs let none escape.

speaker: Black Fang
text: Lord Lloyd, the enemy draws near.

speaker: Lloyd
text: So they're finally here... Our opponents are strong. If anyone here is afraid to die, leave now.

speaker: Black Fang
text: For the Reed brothers' Fang must not fear dying.

speaker: Second Black Fang
text: We are all with you. Lord Lloyd! Do us the honor of leading us 'til the end!

speaker: Lloyd
text: I shall. In the name of the Fang, we will stop them though it cost our very lives. Go!

speaker: Nino
text: Mark! Let me go! I can talk to my brother! I know it might not work, but...

speaker: Jaffar
text: Do you need something, Mark? That's right. They're Black Fang. The man he named, like me, is one of the Four Fangs. He is an assassin, my equal... Or better... .....

speaker: Murdock
text: Ah! You…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Huh!?

speaker: Murdock
text: Go. I saw nothing. I met with no one. Wait. Take this staff. Thank you…for Prince Zephiel.

speaker: Vaida
text: Here they come again, those little Lycian nobles. I’d love to take them on, but… Prince Zephiel insists it was they who saved him… Pah… What’s this world coming to?

speaker: Hector
text: You!

speaker: Vaida
text: So we meet again, boy. Are your little playmates doing well?

speaker: Hector
text: Take this!

speaker: Vaida
text: Whoa! Hold on. My, aren’t you quick to action... I like that. But I think you’ve got that axe pointed in the wrong direction.

speaker: Hector
text: What!?

speaker: Vaida
text: I’m not with the Black Fang. I serve only Bern. I’m here on my own personal agenda. Tell me, boy. Are you the one who stopped Prince Zephiel’s assassin?

speaker: Hector
text: How... Why do you ask?

speaker: Vaida
text: Hmph. So it’s true, is it? That settles it. From now on, I’m traveling with you.

speaker: Hector
text: Now, hold on...

speaker: Vaida
text: You saved Prince Zephiel. So, I owe you.

speaker: Hector
text: Why do you owe us anything?

speaker: Vaida
text: I told you. I serve Bern. Prince Zephiel is our future, our hope. You saved him when he needed saving, and now I will serve you.

speaker: Hector
text: You expect me to believe all that?

speaker: Vaida
text: You don’t trust me? My word?

speaker: Hector
text: Of course not!

speaker: Vaida
text: Yeah, I see your point. Wait for me then. The Black Fang and I are on opposite sides. I’ll prove it to you right now.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You!

speaker: Vaida
text: So we meet again, boy. Are your little playmates doing well?

speaker: Eliwood
text: You’re that wyvern rider... You’re working for the Black Fang, aren’t you?

speaker: Vaida
text: You’re wrong there. I serve only Bern. I’m here on my own personal agenda. Tell me, boy. Are you the one who stopped Prince Zephiel’s assassin?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...What? How did you–

speaker: Vaida
text: Hmph. So it’s true, is it? That settles it. From now on, I’m traveling with you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What are you...

speaker: Vaida
text: You saved Prince Zephiel. So, I owe you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: But why?

speaker: Vaida
text: I told you. I serve Bern. Prince Zephiel is our future, our hope. You saved him when he needed saving, and now I will serve you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I see. I’ll take you at your word.

speaker: Vaida
text: Really... Then look for me. I’ll be joining you shortly.

speaker: Linus
text: Was it you? It was you, wasn't it?! You're the one who killed my brother!!

speaker: Linus
text: Wha… I’ve lost… At least…I can see my brother again...

speaker: Linus
text: You’re Eliwood, right?! I’ve been looking for you!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hey!! Hold on! We need to talk about things…

speaker: Linus
text: I am Linus Reed, son of Brendan Reed. I am the vengeance of Lloyd, whose life you stole! Prepare yourself! I’m coming for you!!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Wait!!!

speaker: Linus
text: Hey, you! You think you’re tough, don’t you?

speaker: Hector
text: Tough enough to cleave you in two.

speaker: Linus
text: I am Linus Reed, son of Brendan Reed. You killed my brother, Lloyd! Take this! Rrraahh!!!

speaker: Hector
text: I am Marquess Ostia’s brother, Hector!! And I don’t know about Lloyd, but I’ll sure kill you!

speaker: Nino
text: Linus! Stop!! Please listen to me!!

speaker: Linus
text: I will kill anyone who aids my brother’s killers! Nino, that includes you!!!

speaker: Nino
text: No!! …My…brother…

speaker: Linus
text: Jaffar!! You traitorous scum!

speaker: Linus
text: Repent your sins, Jaffar! I bring you the Fang’s justice!

speaker: Legault
text: Hello… Linus.

speaker: Linus
text: Legault!? You… You disloyal filth! You of all people…siding with them!?

speaker: Legault
text: Calm down. Your brother’s murder… It wasn’t by our hands… Hey!!

speaker: Linus
text: Draw your sword. I won’t miss again.

speaker: Legault
text: Remember how good the old days were? Your father, old Jan, Uhai, you, and me and your brother. When did the Black Fang lose its honor?

speaker: Linus
text: Be quiet!!! Stop your pathetic whimpering and fight!!

speaker: Legault
text: I knew this would happen. Nothing’s going to change. I knew it, and yet here I am. I couldn’t leave well enough alone… I’m a fool.

speaker: Lloyd
text: It matters not who you are. It's too late... I will avenge my brother's death. One by one...

speaker: Lloyd
text: ......No more waiting, Linus. I'm...coming...

speaker: Lloyd
text: We meet at last, Eliwood.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah! Hold on! Let’s talk! We…

speaker: Lloyd
text: I’m Lloyd Reed, son of Brendan Reed. My brother, Linus, whom you killed, longs for you to join him…….Prepare to die.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Wait!!!

speaker: Lloyd
text: You there, who are you?

speaker: Hector
text: Marquess Ostia’s brother, Hector! And you, lout?

speaker: Lloyd
text: The Black Fang commander’s son, Lloyd Reed… You remind me of my brother. Something about you…

speaker: Hector
text: Huh? What are you talking about?

speaker: Lloyd
text: My brother, whom you killed. My brother, Linus….It’s none of your business……

speaker: Hector
text: I have a brother, too. If someone killed him, I would make sure his killer paid dearly and suffered long…

speaker: Lloyd
text: ……Well spoken. If you don’t want to give your brother cause to mourn, you’d best fight well…….Prepare yourself.

speaker: Hector
text: Ah!!

speaker: Nino
text: Lloyd!

speaker: Lloyd
text: Nino…

speaker: Nino
text: Listen to me, please. This is all a mistake…

speaker: Lloyd
text: Do not speak. We are enemies now… I can show you no mercy.

speaker: Nino
text: Lord Eliwood is not a bad man! You’ll fight knowing that?

speaker: Lloyd
text: They were Linus’s enemies… That is why I fight.

speaker: Nino
text: Lloyd, please…

speaker: Lloyd
text: Don’t cry, Nino. You must live for the future. I am bound to this course. Kill me, and don’t look back.

speaker: Nino
text: No! I don’t want to! Lloyd!!!

speaker: Lloyd
text: The “Angel of Death." Since the day I met you, I’ve always wondered… If we met in straight combat, who of us would win?

speaker: Lloyd
text: I think it’s time that question was answered.

speaker: Legault
text: Hey… Long time, no see.

speaker: Lloyd
text: The Hurricane… I heard you’d quit the Fang, but… Seeing you with them is…

speaker: Legault
text: Unexpected? Shouldn’t be. As soon as that skulking shadow Nergal showed up, I knew the Fang was as good as finished.

speaker: Legault
text: You know… You’re the one thing I can’t figure out. Lloyd, what are you doing here? Why this?

speaker: Lloyd
text: Who knows… But my brother’s dead. And at the hands of your newfound friends…

speaker: Legault
text: We’re not responsible for Linus’s death.

speaker: Lloyd
text: It does not matter. I believe you are, and that is enough.

speaker: Legault
text: ……All right. I see. Nothing’s going to change. I knew that, and yet… I had to try. It’s a bad habit of mine.

speaker: Lloyd
text: Farewell, Legault. My old friend.

speaker: Legault
text: I’ll see you again, Lloyd. With Linus…and Uhai… Even if it won’t be in this world.

speaker: Nino
text: ...Why? Why did it...have to...come to this...? I... I don't understand. ... ... ... ...

speaker: Hector
text: ...You were a strong man. Under different circumstances, I think we'd......

speaker: Athos
text: Do you regret the outcome of your actions?

speaker: Hector
text: ...Graybeard. He only wanted to avenge his brother. I can't... ...Maybe it's regret... I'll carry it with me forever. When I'm alone and dying, what will I be thinking of?

speaker: Athos
text: You're a powerful man. I doubt such power will let you live a life of peace. Yet you should not fear. For perhaps that is the path of your life.

speaker: Hector
text: ...The path of my life...

speaker: Lyn
text: Lord Athos? When did you arrive?

speaker: Athos
text: Just now... I warped in, you know? I was watching you in my scrying crystal. The most important thing is that you've made it here.

speaker: Hector
text: If that's true, why didn't you just magic us here in the first place?!

speaker: Athos
text: What would that have proven? You cannot hope to succeed if you cannot trust your own strength. Your own power must drive you. That is the most important thing. Now then, shall we go? Underground... Where Bramimond awaits.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Bramimond? One of the eight legends? Is that who you're talking about?

speaker: Athos
text: That's right. Of the eight legends, only Bramimond and myself remain. Your journey here was a bit of a test, I'm afraid. I had to see if you were worthy of wielding a legendary item.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Legendary...item?

speaker: Athos
text: That's right. It's a weapon that we, the eight legends, used to defeat the dragons. With it, you will be able to sever Nergal's power at its roots.

speaker: Eliwood
text: A weapon to defeat Nergal...

speaker: Athos
text: The legendary items are sealed in lands across this continent. The only one capable of removing those seals is Bramimond. Now if only we will be granted this one request.

speaker: Eliwood
text: It's so dark...

speaker: Hector
text: It's creepy... Can't see a thing.

speaker: Lyn
text: Shh! ...Someone's here.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You're Bramimond...

speaker: Bramimond
text: ...Yes, I...suppose that is me. What do you want of me, you who live above ground?

speaker: Lyn
text: We have a favor to ask. We seek something to help us defeat Nergal...

speaker: Bramimond
text: That is unfortunate, for I cannot grant that which you seek. Humanity would suffer were I to remove the seals.

speaker: Hector
text: What do you mean!? The entire world is on the brink of destruction as it is!!

speaker: Bramimond
text: The entire world!? Why would I care about that!? The whole world can burn for all I care!!

speaker: Hector
text: By Father Sky... Your voice... The way you talk. It keeps changing. How many...

speaker: Athos
text: Bramimond has no self. He... She... It... Yes, it is a mirror that reflects the person addressing it. It projects no personality of its own. There are as many Bramimonds as there are people facing him. ...Bramimond, do you remember me?

speaker: Bramimond
text: ...Athos. Hmm, it's been many ages. I cannot fathom why you brought these people here. Why I sealed everything away... Do you forget why? The legendary items are not meant for human hands.

speaker: Eliwood
text: But...we can't stop Nergal like this! We need your power to help us save the world!

speaker: Athos
text: Bramimond, remember... We, too, are human. These people, they will not be seduced by power. They came here without my aid, using their own abilities. You observed them, did you not?

speaker: Bramimond
text: ...It's true... They seem better, stronger than most humans. And yet, humans are frail. What guarantee do I have... that they will not succumb to that frailty, Athos?!

speaker: Eliwood
text: A guarantee? There is none. We simply ask that you believe in us.

speaker: Bramimond
text: ...... ...Once... There was a man much like you. His gaze never wandered. It was ever fixed straight ahead... ...... ...........

speaker: Bramimond
text: ...The seals have been released. You may now do as you please. I'm tired. You will let me rest.

speaker: Hector
text: Ah! It's good to breathe the outside air again!

speaker: Lyn
text: Bramimond is certainly a mysterious figure.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mm... I wonder what convinced him to release the seals.

speaker: Athos
text: Interesting that... I believe it was darkness. A completely impenetrable darkness, the nature of which is beyond the comprehension of normal men. Regardless, you must hurry. The seals have been broken. Nergal has surely sensed this already... You must get to the blazing blade as soon as possible...
How unfortunate... You're too late.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nergal!

speaker: Nergal
text: At last... At last, my power is restored. Come, Ninian, Nils. This way. Open the Dragon's Gate for me.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You mustn't go! Neither of you!!

speaker: Nergal
text: Would you like to see my powers here and now? You may choose, Ninian. Obey me, or...

speaker: Ninian
text: ...If I go with you, will you let my brother go?

speaker: Nils
text: Ninian!?

speaker: Nergal
text: One of you should prove sufficient. ......As you wish.

speaker: Nils
text: No! Ninian! Why!?

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Look after Lord Eliwood...

speaker: Nils
text: Ninian!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian! You must not!

speaker: Nergal
text: The gate will open, and I will gain unlimited power.

speaker: Nils
text: Niniaaaaaaaan!!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Don't move! Nergal!!!

speaker: Athos
text: No! Get down! Both of you!!

speaker: Hector
text: Are you awake, Eliwood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Where...

speaker: Hector
text: Camp. You and Nils were both knocked unconscious by Nergal's parting gift. Do you remember?

speaker: Eliwood
text: His power... It's so much more than before.

speaker: Lyn
text: If Lord Athos hadn't erected a barrier when he did... We would have lost both you and Nils......

speaker: Athos
text: If he'd truly wished to kill you, even my power could not have saved you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian... To protect us, she...

speaker: Athos
text: Even if you catch him, you can't defeat him. Not as you are. If you wish to save the girl Ninian... The power to topple Nergal lies within the sacred weapon. Do you understand, Eliwood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Yes, I know what I must do.

speaker: Athos
text: You must go to Ostia and take possession of Roland's blade. But before you go... take this, Eliwood.

speaker: Eliwood
text: This is... It's a...

speaker: Athos
text: That's right, it's a Heaven Seal.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I'm sorry, Lord Athos. These seals... They do not find me worthy.

speaker: Athos
text: Trust me. Take it, and hold it in your hands.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Athos!

speaker: Athos
text: Hm. As I thought. It finds you suitable.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...This is incredible. My body is overflowing with power.

speaker: Hector
text: Way to go, Eliwood!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let's go. We have to get that weapon. We will defeat Nergal and rescue Ninian!!

speaker: Athos
text: To find the legendary item, you must travel westward. But before that... Hector, this is for you.

speaker: Hector
text: Huh? This is...

speaker: Athos
text: That’s right, it’s a Heaven seal.

speaker: Hector
text: Listen, Graybeard... I tried one of these earlier and... Well, nothing happened, OK?

speaker: Athos
text: Trust me. Take it, and hold it in your hands.

speaker: Hector
text: No, I... Oh, all right... ...... ...... ...What’s happening...!?

speaker: Hector
text: What’s going on?! ...Incredible.

speaker: Athos
text: Hm. As I thought. It finds you suitable.

speaker: Hector
text: It feels like there’s a beast running wild through me... ...What’s... What’s going to happen to me?

speaker: Athos
text: For a short while, the newly awakened power will run rampant. Yet this power is your right by birth. You’ll be able to harness it and use it shortly.

speaker: Hector
text: ...Power running rampant... through...my body...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector! Are you all right!? Your arms are trembling...

speaker: Hector
text: It’s true... I feel like I can overcome anything. Nothing can stop me. Come on, Eliwood! Let’s go get that weapon and tear that Nergal to pieces!!

speaker: Oswin
text: Regarding this particular issue, please convey to Lord Uther that consent has been given.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, sir!

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Uther, your judgment... It’s too... ............

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin! Where are you?

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin! There you are. You just received a message from Ostia, didn’t you? What word from my brother?

speaker: Oswin
text: Nothing of any import... A simple...relaying of recent events is all.

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin? What is it? What’s happened? I’ve never seen you look like this before.

speaker: Oswin
text: Is that so? I must be more tired than I thought.

speaker: Hector
text: If that’s all... Get some rest, will you?

speaker: Oswin
text: Yes. I thank you for your concern. ...By the way, did you finish speaking with Lord Athos?

speaker: Hector
text: Yeah, we’re really moving toward something spectacular.

speaker: Oswin
text: Spectacular?

speaker: Hector
text: There are legendary items buried throughout the world. But we don’t have time to gather each one. We’ve settled on collecting a sword and an axe. The sword is for Eliwood or Lyn. I think the axe is to be mine.

speaker: Oswin
text: The legendary axe... The berserker Durban’s thunder axe, Armads?

speaker: Hector
text: Impressive, Oswin. You’re so knowledgeable. To get this Armads, I’m going west with old Graybeard Athos.

speaker: Oswin
text: Just the two of you?

speaker: Hector
text: Yeah, at first. Then I have to pass some sort of trial. Bramimond had to break the seal protecting the weapon, but now, if I’m to gain it, I have to pass a negotiation of strength, or something.

speaker: Oswin
text: ...I see. The weapon’s an axe, so you have to prove your strength.

speaker: Hector
text: ...I will get it. That’s the only way we can defeat Nergal.

speaker: Oswin
text: I believe in you. I pray for your swift return.

speaker: Hector
text: ......Oswin. I’m going to ask one last time. Look me in the eye when you answer. My brother... There’s nothing you need to tell me, is there?

speaker: Oswin
text: ......Nothing. The message... It said that there was nothing new with the marquess.

speaker: Hector
text: I understand. I will believe that. The vow you swore to me in Laus... That’s still in effect, right?

speaker: Oswin
text: Yes, the service I vowed still holds true.

speaker: Hector
text: ...Forgive me. When it comes to my brother, I...

speaker: Oswin
text: That is only natural.

speaker: Hector
text: ...Oswin, this is for your ears alone. If something happens in Ostia. ...No matter what, I will return to my brother’s side. I’ve been irresponsible and foolish in the past, but... As the marquess’s brother, I will do anything required of me. ...So, while I’m away in the west, and anytime thereafter, if you have any worries concerning my brother... No matter how trivial they might seem, I want you to tell me. ...Please.

speaker: Oswin
text: I understand... ...I’ll do as you ask...

speaker: Hector
text: Then I’d better get going. Take care of things.

speaker: Fargus
text: Ahoy, laddie! You don't get seasick, do you?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I'm fine, sir. This is a beautiful ship.

speaker: Fargus
text: Gwaa ha ha! For a sea rover, eh?

speaker: Eliwood
text: May I ask you a question?

speaker: Fargus
text: What is it?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Why did you agree to give us passage? When we said that we wished to travel to Valor, the people in the harbor treated us as though we were mad.

speaker: Fargus
text: I'm sure they did. It is the Dread Isle, after all. If not for good reason, we wouldn't want to go either.

speaker: Eliwood
text: And yet... you've given us free passage. Why is that?

speaker: Fargus
text: Listen to me, laddie. Man are strange beasts. We can't resist a challenge. Something appears on the horizon, and we immediately set sail. Some dreams we conquer, others we abandon... I've grown old. I haven't had a good challenge in many a year. Then you mooncalves appear seeking passage to the Dread Isle. I was impressed with your courage. I think you may be the ones to survive the Dread Isle.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We won't disappoint you. We will return.

speaker: Fargus
text: All right. Then we'll weigh anchor and wait for you. Light a signal fire when you want to return, and we'll pick you up.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Thank you.

speaker: Dart
text: Captain! There's a dory adrift to port! It looks like there's someone aboard. What're your orders?

speaker: Fargus
text: Bring 'em aboard..... Looks like we've got a visitor. Odd though, finding a boat adrift near here...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Odd? Why is that?

speaker: Fargus
text: The sea currents in this area... Anything drifting around here must've come from the Dread Isle.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Oh...

speaker: Fargus
text: Shall we greet our guest?

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! ...Huh?

speaker: Lyn
text: If you're looking for Eliwood, he's talking with the captain.

speaker: Hector
text: Oh. I won't bother him then.

speaker: Lyn
text: ....... ...Do you need something?

speaker: Hector
text: I'd like you to stop pouting. This pirate ship is the only way for us to get to the Dread Isle. I thought you understood that. Was I mistaken?

speaker: Lyn
text: How I feel or what I think is no concern of yours!

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood told me...about your parents and those bandits. But these pirates? They don't seem like bad fellows.

speaker: Lyn
