text: It wasn't just my parents! My entire tribe! Everyone was killed! They poisoned our drinking water... My people were in such pain, they could hardly stand... That's when the bandits attacked! They waited until we were defenseless!

speaker: Lyn
text: My father put me on his horse, and I escaped... Just me. My poor father... The pain must have been terrible. He lifted me up...his arms shaking... ...with his last breath... Now do you understand? I was found unconscious by another tribe...and I awoke ten days later. When I awoke... What I felt... The bodies of my people had already been buried. I never even had the chance to say farewell. My last memory of my father... He was...broken...dying. I can still see the axes rising and falling. It... It's not........

speaker: Lyn
text: Hey!! What are you doing?

speaker: Hector
text: You're a strong woman, Lyndis. I thought you would not want anyone to see you cry.

speaker: Lyn
text: You're such a fool! If you think that's what I want, then why not just leave!

speaker: Hector
text: I... I lost my parents, too.

speaker: Lyn
text: You...

speaker: Hector
text: It was illness that took them. Nothing like what happened to you. Still, I wanted nothing more than to cry like a little baby. And yet, I couldn't cry... Not in front of others. And when I was alone, I found I still couldn't. So...I simply thought...I don't know...

speaker: Lyn
text: You really are a fool. That's no way to... You can't just... ... .... ...

speaker: Pirate
text: Ahoy! There's a small dory adrift to port!! Someone's on board! Tell the captain!

speaker: Lyn
text: A boat? What's going on?

speaker: Hector
text: Let's go see!

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! You done talking to old man Fargus?

speaker: Eliwood
text: You saw us?

speaker: Hector
text: No, I heard you'd gone off with him. You learn anything?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...We can trust him. We got lucky, finding him.

speaker: Hector
text: Hmmm. If you say so.

speaker: Lyn
text: Hey, you two! Come here! They've pulled the dory aboard! I wonder who's on board. It's... It's a girl!?
...Uh...uhnn...

speaker: Dart
text: Oy! You there!

speaker: Lyn
text: Me?

speaker: Dart
text: Give me a hand, will you? I don't know where to... grab her.

speaker: Hector
text: Such the gentleman.

speaker: Dart
text: Stow it!

speaker: Lyn
text: Hm? Ninian!? Ninian! Wake up!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Unbelievable... What are the chances?

speaker: Hector
text: Do you know her?

speaker: Eliwood
text: She's how Lyndis and I met a year back. I rescued Ninian from a band of villains.

speaker: Lyn
text: Please, Ninian! Open your eyes!!

speaker: Lyn
text: Ninian, can you hear me?

speaker: Lyn
text: Are you well? Why were you on that boat? Where is Nils? Why wasn't he with you?

speaker: Lyn
text: Ninian?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis, something's wrong with her.

speaker: Ninian
text: Who...Who..

speaker: Dart
text: Captain! Pirate ships approaching from the northwest!

speaker: Fargus
text: Do they dare attack Captain Fargus and the Davros? They must be mad!

speaker: Dart
text: What flag are they flying? I've never seen that pattern before.

speaker: Fargus
text: These seas belong to us! Whoever they are, they're in our waters! This is a day for strange occurrences, it seems. You whelps watch your own hides. We've no time to waste on you!
Uwaaaaaaa!! Water!!! The hull's been breached! We're taking on water!!!

speaker: Fargus
text: Breached? Those scum are more dangerous than I'd thought!

speaker: Dart
text: It's bad, Captain! We need all hands belowdecks, or we'll sink!!!

speaker: Fargus
text: Take care of it! I'm going to carve these scallywags some new gizzards!
We need your help! The water's up to the galley! You must come below, Captain!

speaker: Fargus
text: Grrr...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Fargus! Leave the enemy to us!

speaker: Hector
text: Fighting is something we're good at! But a sinking ship? That's your affair! You have to do something, or we'll all drown!

speaker: Lyn
text: We'll deal with things up here. Please! Hurry!

speaker: Fargus
text: Fine!! The deck is yours! I'll be back as soon as we've plugged the breach in the hull!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Go! Lyn! Take her to that room!

speaker: Lyn
text: I will.

speaker: Hector
text: Here they come!

speaker: Zoldam
text: All we want is the girl. Kill the rest.

speaker: Jake
text: Ahoooy! Can you hold the deck until reinforcements arrive? Who? Me? I’m Jake. Hm? Aye, I’m new to the Davros’s crew. Huh? You heard about me from Anna? Oh… So she’s worried about me? That warms my heart, my friend! Let me give you some information. We’ve got merchants aboard. Buy what you need from them. This is the armory. This is the shop. You won’t be able to stock up once we reach the Dread Isle. Buy as much as you can carry while you’ve got the chance!

speaker: Dart
text: Ahoy! We’ll leave the fighting to you. Hold on until we can help! Oh, and we’ve merchants aboard. This is the armory. This is the shop. You won’t be able to stock up once we reach the Dread Isle. I suggest you buy as much as possible while you’ve the chance!

speaker: Guy
text: Ohhh... I'm going to be sick. Doesn't this bother you, Mark? This ship moves too much... I... I can still fight, though. My sword arm's fine!

speaker: Priscilla
text: Mark? What is it? No, I'm fine. I'm not seasick at all. Thank you for your concern.

speaker: Zoldam
text: Move ’round to the enemy ship’s stern. That’s where they should be waiting… That’s where they’ll die.

speaker: Zoldam
text: Don’t worry about any ambush. Board their ship. You don’t know how to fight? Go now, or die here...

speaker: Zoldam
text: You possess...this much...power...? Must warn... Must –

speaker: Fargus
text: Ahoy! I’m back! Now, who wants to die first? What’s this? You’ve routed ’em already? Nicely done, whelps!

speaker: Hector
text: Those sea dogs were no match for us!!

speaker: Lyn
text: Ah! Ninian! You can’t come out yet! There’s blood everywhere!

speaker: Ninian
text: …Blood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Look out!

speaker: Ninian
text: …Ah! I’m sorry.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Are you OK? Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: Ninian? Is that…me? Is that…my name?

speaker: Lyn
text: Ninian! What’s happened to you…

speaker: Ninian
text: …I… My head…is so foggy. Am I…at sea?

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes. We found you adrift in a small boat.

speaker: Fargus
text: Those scum were after the girl, it seems. Will you take her with you? The men are afraid she, well, she might be cursed, you know?

speaker: Hector
text: Cursed…?

speaker: Lyn
text: Are you suggesting we leave Ninian behind?

speaker: Hector
text: We can’t take her with us, can we? We’re heading for the Dread Isle. It’s dread for a reason, you know!

speaker: Lyn
text: Regardless…she goes with us!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis?

speaker: Lyn
text: When I saw her, I remembered something. The last time I saw Ninian… She and her brother were being hunted by some dark-robed men.

speaker: Hector
text: Dark-robed? Are you sure?

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, I think it must be the Black Fang. It didn’t occur to me before, but now I’m certain.

speaker: Eliwood
text: How can you be sure?

speaker: Lyn
text: I can’t explain… There’s something in the air that hints at their involvement.

speaker: Eliwood
text: If it’s true, then she’s likely to be attacked again.

speaker: Lyn
text: Almost certainly. We can’t leave her behind. I will watch over her. Please…

speaker: Eliwood
text: I understand. We should be by her side to protect her.

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We’re all going to that island. Will you come with us?

speaker: Ninian
text: Yes… Please…take me with you.

speaker: Hector
text: “Something in the air”… Are you some sort of hound?

speaker: Lyn
text: Ah! Are you mocking me?

speaker: Hector
text: No, the opposite. I’m in utter admiration. …Say, Eliwood. When I left Ostia, I was attacked by a dark-robed group.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What? Why didn’t you tell me this before?

speaker: Hector
text: Many people hold a grudge against Ostia. I didn’t think it had anything to do with this. Until now…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector, do you think…

speaker: Hector
text: They were all wearing very distinct black robes. I don’t know about “something in the air,” but… I’m convinced they were related.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What in the world is happening in Lycia? …Father……

speaker: Fargus
text: We’ve arrived.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: Fargus
text: We’ll wait two weeks. Finish up by then.

speaker: Hector
text: That’s more than enough time!

speaker: Fargus
text: And I’ve got a half-wit sailor who wants to go sightseeing. C’mere, Dart!

speaker: Dart
text: I’m here, Captain! Ready to serve!

speaker: Eliwood
text: We’re pleased to have you.

speaker: Fargus
text: His only redeeming feature is his sturdiness. Maybe he’ll come in handy.

speaker: Dart
text: Come on, Captain! I’m better’n that!

speaker: Eliwood
text: You’ve done so much… I can’t thank you enough…

speaker: Fargus
text: Come back alive! That’s all the thanks I need.

speaker: Eliwood
text: All right. Farewell!

speaker: Hector
text: We’ll be back before you know it!

speaker: Lyn
text: …There are good people, even among pirates.

speaker: Hector
text: I don’t think the old man and his group are your average pirates.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Somewhere within that forest is the Dragon’s Gate.

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! No matter what it takes, we’re coming back with your father!

speaker: Lyn
text: …We’ll surely find him. We’ll all do our best to make it so.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You’re right. Let’s make preparations to enter the forest.

speaker: Hector
text: Oh!

speaker: Ninian
text: Dragon’s Gate…

speaker: Lyn
text: Ninian? What is it?

speaker: Ninian
text: It’s…nothing……

speaker: Lyn
text: Mark, hold a moment, and allow me a short detour. There is a sacred sword enshrined in an altar east of here. The people of Sacae go there to pray for safety at the onset of a long journey.

speaker: Sain
text: Oh, how quaint!

speaker: Kent
text: The teachings of Elimine have the most followers in Elibe. It is nice to see that, here at least, the ancient customs are still observed.

speaker: Glass
text: Old Man! Stay where you are, and hold your tongue!

speaker: Priest
text: Threaten me as you will, but I’ll not give up the Mani Katti. The Mani Katti is a sacred blade, under divine protection. It cannot be removed from its place of rest!

speaker: Glass
text: You’re a fool, old man. What good’s a sword if you don’t use it?

speaker: Priest
text: Use it? In combat? Sacrilege!

speaker: Glass
text: Sacrilege? I am Glass! The gods fear my name! My swordplay is peerless! And if I want this sword, this sword I shall have! Now, get out of my way!

speaker: Priest
text: Oof!

speaker: Glass
text: This is it! It’s more magnificent than I’d imagined! This sword was made for a swordsman of my skill. Hmm? What’s this? I can’t... draw the sword... from its scabbard?

speaker: Priest
text: The spirits of the blade have judged you. You have been found waiting. They have rejected you.

speaker: Glass
text: What? Listen, you senile old fool, if you value your own life, you’ll get out of my sight!!!

speaker: Glass
text: Curses! Miserable spirits! I care nothing for you! I’ll tear this altar down stone by stone!

speaker: Woman
text: I beg your pardon, milady. Are you headed east? To the altar?

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, we are indeed.

speaker: Woman
text: Then you must hurry and help the priest there. I saw a band of local ruffians head in there not too long ago. They seemed intent on stealing the altar’s sacred sword!

speaker: Lyn
text: The Mani Katti... They’re going to steal it? I cannot allow this to happen!

speaker: Woman
text: You look like a virtuous group. Please, help him!

speaker: Sain
text: Lyndis, what are you planning?

speaker: Kent
text: If you go to the priest’s aid, you’ll need to prepare.

speaker: Lyn
text: You’re right... Say, Mark... There are some homes to the south of us. Perhaps we should go there and question the residents.

speaker: Tutorial
text: The three buildings to the south are homes. You can speak with the people who live there. They sometimes give you combat hints or useful information about the land and the people. It pays to listen!

speaker: Lyn
text: Shall I take the lead? All right. Tell me what you would like me to do, Mark.

speaker: Tutorial
text: The three buildings to the south are homes. You can speak with the people who live there. They sometimes give you combat hints or useful information about the land and its people. It pays to listen!

speaker: Lyn
text: Shall I take the lead? All right. Tell me what you would like me to do, Tactician.

speaker: Lyn
text: I'm going to visit that home, right? Just point me in the right direction!

speaker: Lyn
text: You want me to visit that home, right? I understand.

speaker: Lyn
text: First, I'm going to visit that home, right? Well, let's go!

speaker: Woman
text: Say, aren't you the... Oh! You're going to help the priest! Well, perhaps you could benefit from something I saw earlier... The bandits may have the main entrance guarded. However, one of the altar's walls is cracked and in poor repair. You might be able to create another entrance by hitting that section with your weapons. We're all counting on you!

speaker: Tutorial
text: Next, send Sain to visit another home. Start by selecting Sain.

speaker: Sain
text: It's my turn to speak with the locals, is it? That's right!

speaker: Sain
text: Please, I would like to help out however I can. Tactician, direct me to the next residence!

speaker: Sain
text: I'm next, am I? Well, I'm ready to go!

speaker: Sain
text: It's my turn next? I'm ready to go?

speaker: Sain
text: It's my turn to speak with the locals, is it? That's right!

speaker: Sain
text: Please, I would like to help out however I can. Tactician, direct me to the next residence!

speaker: Man
text: Mountains make it more difficult to be hit, but they're difficult to traverse. If you're riding on horseback, you can't cross them at all. Be careful.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Remember, your mounted units possess the ability to move again. After moving, cavalry can move the rest of their movement range, unless they've received attack or staff commands. This also goes for units mounted on pegasi and wyverns. Now, give Sain his orders.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Finally, let's send Kent to visit the remaining home. This visit isn't necessary for combat purposes. However, its residents may have useful knowledge. I recommand stopping by. Select Kent.

speaker: Kent
text: I'm next to move, am I not? I await your command.

speaker: Kent
text: Am I not supposed to visit that home? Please, give me your guidance.

speaker: Girl
text: Do you know much about the sword held at the altar? It's called the Mani Katti, blessed by the spirits. According to the priest, the Mani Katti is waiting for its rightful owner to appear. It's so odd, don't you think? The idea that a sword can choose who will wield it?

speaker: Tutorial
text: You should know something about fortresses. Fortresses offer more protection than woods do. Fighting from a space in a fortress is beneficial. Remember, this holds true for friend and foe alike. Keep this in mind before engaging your enemy. Fortresses also allow injured units to regain hit points. Your units automatically regain some HP at the beginning of your turn. The HP you recover in one turn is fairly small. As long as you remain in a fortress, you'll regain HP every turn, so a full recovery is possible. There are other places where units can recover HP, including castle gates, thrones, and areas where bosses are found.

speaker: Tutorial
text: This chapter's goal is to seize the throne. The leader of the enemy is on the throne now. Defeat him and have Lyn seize the throne to finish this battle. His name is Glass. He's a sword-bearing mercenary. Think of the weapons triangle... What weapon is able to best a sword? Correct! The lance! Using the right weapon is like a shortcut to victory. To get to the altar, try using the method that you heard earlier. It's up to you, Tactician. Good luck.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Sometimes, you'll get items after defeating enemies. A single unit can carry a maximum of five items.You might need to drop some old items to pick up new ones. Bear this in mind. You can see what items your enemies will drop by checking their inventories. Place the cursor on an enemy or ally, then press the R Button to view their personal data. This data screen contains information about the unit you've selected. Press the + Control Pad left and right to change pages and view items. If any of the items are glowing yellow, you will get them if you defeat the unit. Don't forget!

speaker: Glass
text: Who do you think you are? What chance do you think you have against me?

speaker: Glass
text: You... You... Urr...urgh...

speaker: Priest
text: Ah, your clothing... Are you of the Lorca tribe?

speaker: Lyn
text: I’m Lyn, the chieftain’s daughter. Are you hurt, sir?

speaker: Priest
text: Thanks to you, I am unscathed. You have my gratitude.

speaker: Lyn
text: And the sword? Is it safe?

speaker: Priest
text: Yes, I have sealed the sword safely away. Until I remove my spell, the sword cannot be drawn. Now, as a token of my gratitude, I shall allow you to lay hands upon the Mani Katti. Touch the blade’s pattern, and pray for a safe journey.

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh, thank you so much!

speaker: Priest
text: Hm?

speaker: Lyn
text: What? Did—

speaker: Lyn
text: The sword... It’s... glowing.

speaker: Priest
text: Ah. Hm... It’s the power of the spirits. Lyn, they have looked into your soul, and they call out to you.

speaker: Lyn
text: What does that mean?

speaker: Priest
text: You are its rightful owner. You are to wield the Mani Katti.

speaker: Lyn
text: No... I can’t... I couldn’t...

speaker: Priest
text: It is the sword’s wish. If you require proof, draw it from its sheath.

speaker: Lyn
text: It came out... effortlessly.

speaker: Priest
text: I never dared hope that I might meet the wielder of the Mani Katti in my life. I am indeed fortunate to see your sword reach your hands.

speaker: Lyn
text: My sword?

speaker: Priest
text: It is time for you to go, Lyn. You face a great many ordeals. Grip this sword, and meet your destiny head-on.

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes... Yes, sir!

speaker: Sain
text: So this is the Mani Katti... A blade with no equal.

speaker: Lyn
text: This is all so unbelievable. Perhaps the most famous sword in all of Sacae... in my hand.

speaker: Kent
text: It’s not so strange. In fact, many legends tell similar tales... Special blades all over the land call out to their proper owners. And yet, when I saw you draw that blade, Lyndis... I felt something extraordinary. That sword was waiting for you. You were meant to draw it.

speaker: Lyn
text: Stop it! I... I’m nothing special!

speaker: Sain
text: Think of it this way: Some weapons feel more comfortable in your hand, right? Well, the Mani Katti itself feels very comfortable with you. Does it make it any easier for you to accept? It doesn’t appear that either of us can use it.

speaker: Lyn
text: It... does feel right in my hand. A blade that only I can wield. That seems reasonable enough. I can understand that. Look at it, Mark. This is the Mani Katti. This is... my sword. I must care for it well.

speaker: Lundgren
text: What? Madelyn’s daughter is still alive?

speaker: Soldier
text: Uhh... Yes, Lord Lundgren. The girl is traveling with Kent and Sain. What are your orders? If we let them be...

speaker: Lundgren
text: Bah! I’ve heard that northern Bern is full of bandits. She’s just a girl. She’ll not survive her journey here. I’m more concerned with my older brother. His life must be ended quickly. The poison... There must be no blunders.

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, m’lord. He suspects nothing and continues to drink it. The marquess’s death, due no doubt to sudden illness, is not far off.

speaker: Lundgren
text: Heh heh heh. Soon... Soon Caelin will be mine!

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Nergal should be back there. Should we wait for Lord Athos?

speaker: Athos
text: If you're looking for me, I'm right here.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Athos!

speaker: Hector
text: You're late, Graybeard!

speaker: Lyn
text: ...Well? Were you successful?

speaker: Athos
text: I was. Use this magic tome.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What is it?

speaker: Athos
text: A legendary item, Aureola. The strongest light magic, wielded by Saint Elimine herself. With this, we should be able to rend Nergal's dark cloak and do him much harm. And these, too, have been infused with magic that makes them more effective against Nergal. Durandal for Eliwood. And for Hector, Armads.

speaker: Eliwood
text: It's... I can feel it already... Its power is beyond words.

speaker: Hector
text: Incredible! With this, I know I cannot fail.

speaker: Athos
text: ...And Lyndis, this is for you.

speaker: Lyn
text: Hm? What blade is this?

speaker: Athos
text: A spirit-inhabited sword, the partner of the Mani Katti. This is the Sol Katti. It's not a legendary item, but its blade contains much power.

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you!

speaker: Athos
text: Nils, is Nergal back there?

speaker: Nils
text: Unn... I sense tremendous power. ...What could it be? I feel something really odd.

speaker: Athos
text: He should have lost most of his henchmen in that last battle. But.... Mm. I read energy, too... if only a little. Nils is right. The sense of it is different than before. Brace yourselves. He is...formidable!

speaker: Eliwood
text: We understand. Let's go, everyone!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Tactician, this is it. The last battle. Lord Athos spoke the truth about Nergal... Average men cannot hope to stand against him. Ordinary weapons hold no power against him. Those who go with us... They must be chosen carefully.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Eliwood... Lord Hector...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Merlinus... Thank you for everything.

speaker: Hector
text: You're made of sterner stuff than I'd imagined. Thought you'd've fled by now.

speaker: Merlinus
text: ...Sniff sniff... I thought as much. You're not taking me with you...... ...Sniff ooh...

speaker: Hector
text: That's disgusting. Cry if you must, but do something about that runny nose. What are we supposed to do? You can't fight, so we can't afford to take you with us.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Take this and return to Fargus's ship.

speaker: Merlinus
text: ...Wh-What is this, may I ask?

speaker: Hector
text: A letter of introduction. Take this to Ostia, and you'll be able to do good business there. Of course, if we fail in our mission, it's just a worthless slip of paper.

speaker: Merlinus
text: But... ...I must protest!! For the rest of my days, I've vowed in my heart to continue serving you both! Please, oh please! Do not abandon me.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Merlinus... ......

speaker: Hector
text: Then go get on the boat and pray for our safe return!

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Please. Have faith in us. Wait for us.

speaker: Merlinus
text: ...Sniff sniff... ...I... I under...stand. Until the end of time, my lord. I will wait for you until the end of time. Please...come back... safely... Please!

speaker: Hector
text: Yeah, OK. We're going. Bye.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We'll be back.

speaker: Merlinus
text: ......Oh, Lord Eliwood... Oh my...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nergal!

speaker: Nergal
text: Pah...you're here. But you're too late. The gate is already opened. I will claim the mighty quintessence of dragons. I will become stronger and move ever closer to perfection.

speaker: Eliwood
text: How many lives must you steal before you're satisfied!? And it's not only those who die. What about the ones left behind in pain and sorrow? What about them?

speaker: Nergal
text: I am who I am. The pain of others, I do not feel. The sorrow of others does not touch me. Death feeds me. Death pleases me. I am the essence I consume. You fools will become corpses here, because I wish it to be. Rise and come forth, my servants!

speaker: Eliwood
text: This...

speaker: Nergal
text: You seem impressed with my work. Or perhaps it's just that you've seen a familiar face?

speaker: Eliwood
text: That's... Marquess Laus! And... Those are Black Fang members. What have you done, Nergal?!

speaker: Nergal
text: These morphs you see before you, I've given them the abilities and appearances of the people whose essences I used to craft them. Well, that's not entirely true. I've made them far more powerful. This is the ideal plan for hypocrites like you. Especially you, Eliwood. You continue to regret causing harm to anyone, even enemies. However, no matter the reason, once the deed is done, it's done. Whether you enjoy it or not is irrelevant--the result is the same.

speaker: Eliwood
text: It is not the same! If you feel no horror for taking someone's life... then you...you yourself are not alive!

speaker: Nergal
text: Heh heh heh... Your weakness runs deep in you. You can never understand. The concepts of good and evil are devoid of any meaning, any value. These ideas prevent humans from liberating their own strengths. Such foolishness... The ultimate foolishness of the human race!!

speaker: Athos
text: Nergal, after all these years... You have not stopped to reconsider your ideas at all.

speaker: Nergal
text: The same is true of you, Athos. You must see the truth of it! All living creatures take energy from somewhere. We all use it to create, to change it into something better. The knowledge of Arcadia has shown us the road to the ultimate transformation. And yet you will not take that road! Why do you reject the obvious?

speaker: Athos
text: I am not opposed to the quest for power, for greater knowledge. However, that quest must be driven from within. To fuel your quest with the stolen lives of others, this brings not wisdom but abomination.

speaker: Nergal
text: Heh heh heh... I remember. I still remember! Those words are unchanged from when you first said them ages back. When you and the dragons conspired to bury me!

speaker: Nergal
text: Look at this wound! The wound I took from your magic!! It was a mistake. The only person who understood... The man I thought my truest friend... It was a mistake to try and destroy me. Heh heh heh heh... It confirmed some things for me. That trust brings betrayal. That friends bring weakness!

speaker: Eliwood
text: If that is what you learned from your encounter, then you are a fool. Do you believe for a moment that, when wise Athos struck down his dearest friend, he felt nothing!? His heart was torn in two, and yet you refuse to understand that!

speaker: Athos
text: Eliwood...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nergal! I will defeat you! Here! Today!! But...even now, there is no hatred in my heart. You who were born human, you who lost the heart that defines your humanity... For you, I have nothing but pity.

speaker: Nergal
text: ...Pity? Heh heh heh... Amusing. A weak fool like you has "pity" for me? Interesting... Now, if you hope to defeat me, you may have your chance. Of course, you will have to best my morphs first!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Listen to me! This is my fight now! Mine alone! Everyone, stay back!

speaker: Hector
text: Hey! What are you talking about? We've come this far together, haven't we?

speaker: Lyn
text: That's right! I've said it before. We all feel the same way.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector... Lyndis...

speaker: Nils
text: Don't forget me, Lord Eliwood! And...Ninian. I'm sure she's here as well.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nils... Ah! Tactician, you, too?

speaker: Marcus
text: I’ll show you the strength of a knight of Pherae.

speaker: Lowen
text: Knights should fight, not speak! …Was that right?

speaker: Rebecca
text: I'll do whatever I can to help!

speaker: Dorcas
text: …Winning this battle means protecting my family.

speaker: Bartre
text: Whooooooooooa! I’m burning up!

speaker: Oswin
text: For the honor of the knights of Ostia.

speaker: Matthew
text: Let me handle this! There’s much I can do.

speaker: Serra
text: Blessed Saint Elimine, grant us strength to win this with ease.

speaker: Guy
text: Let me show you how much my blade has matured!

speaker: Priscilla
text: I don’t want to lose anyone, so I will fight my strongest.

speaker: Erk
text: For years, I’ve studied. Now, let those studies show their worth!

speaker: Florina
text: I... I...I'll do my best!

speaker: Kent
text: I will gladly volunteer to protect Lycia with my life.

speaker: Sain
text: I won’t hold back! This is for all the lovely ladies I’ve yet to meet!!

speaker: Wil
text: We’ve made it this far. Let’s get out there and win!

speaker: Raven
text: If I die here… so be it.

speaker: Lucius
text: Blessed Saint Elimine, please grant us a miracle...

speaker: Canas
text: Let this battle be forgotten by history... That is all I ask.

speaker: Dart
text: I’m Dart, brave crewman of Fargus’s pirates, and I fear nothing!

speaker: Fiora
text: For the honor of the Pegasus knights of Ilia, I will annihilate the foe!

speaker: Legault
text: My oh my… Fools aplenty. That includes me, too.

speaker: Heath
text: For Bern, land of my birth… May I return to it soon!

speaker: Rath
text: For those whose reasoning is bent. I will straighten it with my bow.

speaker: Isadora
text: My pride shall not be broken! My strength holds true!

speaker: Hawkeye
text: …I, too, will join you in this final glory.

speaker: Farina
text: Hey! There’s no doubt we’ll win! Just don’t forget my bonus!

speaker: Pent
text: If he has power to rival Athos, then I must test that power myself.

speaker: Louise
text: No matter what happens, I’ll be at Lord Pent’s side.

speaker: Harken
text: Lord Elbert… I will protect your son.

speaker: Karel
text: As long as there’s someone to cut, you will have my aid.

speaker: Wallace
text: I’m trembling with anticipation!

speaker: Geitz
text: This looks like fun! This is what I’ve been waiting for!!

speaker: Nino
text: ...Father... Brothers...... For all that I've lost... I won't let him get away!

speaker: Karla
text: I’ve lived long enough. I’ve no regrets…

speaker: Vaida
text: What are you worried about? With me here, we can’t lose!

speaker: Renault
text: It is for this moment that I have lived…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Everyone... Let's go! We've got to stop Nergal!

speaker: Hector
text: Everyone… Here we go! Give it your all, and beat this knave!

speaker: Lyn
text: Eliwood! Wait!

speaker: Eliwood
text: What is it, Lyndis?

speaker: Lyn
text: Is it true what Nergal said?

speaker: Eliwood
text: You mean about Lord Uther?

speaker: Lyn
text: He said he’s dead... When– Did you know, Eliwood?!

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Hector has been acting a little strange... So I forced Oswin to tell me. It was the same illness that took his father. The sickness came on suddenly. It took less than a year for the disease to spread.

speaker: Lyn
text: So when we met him in Castle Ostia, he was...

speaker: Eliwood
text: He was dying. ...Yet...he... He didn’t want Hector or us to know... He pushed himself too far. I’m sure he was told he shouldn’t be moving about...

speaker: Lyn
text: Hector...when... when did he...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Only recently... He figured it out when he saw Lord Uther wasn’t at the castle. He pressed Oswin to tell him. ......After that, so as not to distract us, Hector pretended that nothing was amiss...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector... Do you have a minute?

speaker: Hector
text: It’s about my brother, isn’t it? Sorry I didn’t tell you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: It’s all right. I understand you better than anyone. More importantly, have you settled things with Oswin?

speaker: Hector
text: ...Don’t talk to me about him.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector... You’re not angry with Oswin. When Lord Uther was in trouble, you weren’t at his side. You’re angry with yourself. It’s true, isn’t it? I was the same way. I couldn’t save my father... I couldn’t save Ninian... Over and over, I blamed myself...

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood...

speaker: Eliwood
text: But, you know, that’s just a way of running from the sadness of loss. I think you’ve realized that already. Lord Uther...and Oswin... They were thinking of you above all else. You must see that, but if you continue to pretend you do not, you will lost sight of something terribly valuable. That’s all I have to say.

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin!

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector. What is it?

speaker: Hector
text: ...It’s OK. I, uhm... I don’t have any more doubts! Nergal’s time is up!

speaker: Oswin
text: Yes, sir! And I, Oswin, will be at your side no matter what!!!

speaker: Hector
text: ...What is it?

speaker: Lyn
text: Hector... I’m certain...that... you did not...cry... So, I will... This...is your share...of tears... Don’t say...anything. Just, for a little while, let me lean on you. For a little while...

speaker: Hector
text: Hm?

speaker: Lyn
text: ...Don’t die... Please, you–

speaker: Hector
text: ...I know.

speaker: Legault
text: …Huh, even as a monster, you are a handsome one, Lloyd. But you know something? I can’t let this continue!!

speaker: Nino
text: Ah…Lloyd… …Sniff…oh…… Why does this have to happen again?

speaker: Legault
text: Oh… We meet again. …Linus… This stinks!!

speaker: Nino
text: Linus… I’ll…see you again… I’m sure you’re angry, but… Please be my friend…again…

speaker: Legault
text: …Uhai…why did this blasphemy occur? …I’ll put an end to it right away!

speaker: Legault
text: …Commander… I really didn’t want to see you like this. …All I can give you is one last act of rebellion.

speaker: Nino
text: Father… Fa-Father… I… I’ll…end this……I’m sorry…

speaker: Nergal
text: Be prepared. You are to be witness to a power that overwhelms all!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nergal!

speaker: Nergal
text: So you're here, Eliwood. I thought losing Ninian might distract you. Have you forgotten her so quickly? How heartless.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I haven't forgotten. I'll never forget. It was my mistake that killed Ninian. Because of that... I will fight. I will not run away and hide in sorrow... I'm going to put an end to all this!

speaker: Nergal
text: Did you know, Eliwood? What happened to your friend Hector? What he was thinking as he fought by your side?

speaker: Nergal
text: Heh heh... It's a pity. If only he had been free to return to Ostia.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I know that I've caused much pain for my friends. But that is why... I will not lose here today!!

speaker: Nergal
text: Little girl from Sacae... You'd do well to vanish. One such as you is no match for me.

speaker: Lyn
text: The nomads of the plains do not abandon their fellow tribespeople. Eliwood and Hector are my dear friends... Their sorrow is my sorrow. Their anger is my anger.

speaker: Nergal
text: Pah...

speaker: Lyn
text: Nergal! In my friends' names, I will cut you down!

speaker: Nergal
text: Uhn? Who do you think you are?

speaker: Nino
text: You will pay! You stole my family from me, and you will pay, Nergal!!! I will avenge them all!

speaker: Nergal
text: Now, I see... You're Sonia's...

speaker: Nergal
text: Hmph... It's you, Jaffar? Turning your sword against me, your master? Do you forget who raised you? You are worthless.

speaker: Jaffar
text: ...Wrong. I am a man.

speaker: Nergal
text: Oh, really? If so, then I will give you a man's death!

speaker: Renault
text: ...Nergal, do you remember me?

speaker: Nergal
text: Hah. You are... Renault. So you're still seeking out a wretched existence?

speaker: Renault
text: I went astray. I listened to your honeyed words... I dreamt of the impossible... the return of a lost soul. But...what you gave me was... a puppet... It was soulless...nothing more than an empty vessel!!

speaker: Nergal
text: Just an empty vessel... Isn't that what you wanted? You desired to bring back your dead friend. You were my experiment, and I completed my morph. I'm grateful, Renault. Thanks to you, I gained power.

speaker: Renault
text: You villain... You cursed him! Your crime can never be forgiven! I will end you with my hands. In the name of my lost friend!

speaker: Hector
text: Nergal!

speaker: Nergal
text: So you've come, Hector of Ostia. Your existence itself was my greatest miscalculation. If it had only been Eliwood, this could have been over. So, my little miscalculation, I will erase you. And leave no trace remaining.

speaker: Hector
text: Do your worst!!

speaker: Hector
text: Nergal!

speaker: Nergal
text: I cannot understand you, Hector of Ostia. Why would you do all this for Eliwood? Is this miserable thing called friendship worth dying for?

speaker: Hector
text: I don't expect you to understand. You've forgotten what it means to be human! Nergal! My connection to you… it's over! I'm finishing everything up right here!!

speaker: Athos
text: Nergal...

speaker: Nergal
text: Heh heh... Athos... Take a good look at me! At my tremendous power!

speaker: Athos
text: Already...words are useless. As an old friend... I will fulfill my duty.

speaker: Nergal
text: Why? Why must I lose? More power… I must be… stronger… I… Why? Why did I… want power? ……Quintessence? …Don’t…under…stand… but… Gaa… Not like this… I will not die…like this. With my last breath… tremble…and…despair. Hwah ha ha… Ha…ha ha ha…

speaker: Lyn
text: ...Nils? What is it?

speaker: Nils
text: ...I...don’t know... Why...am I.........crying...?

speaker: Hector
text: Don’t worry. You’ve been through a lot.

speaker: Eliwood
text: It’s just relief. You’ve done well, haven’t you?

speaker: Lyn
text: Everything’s OK. The world’s been saved. And I know that Ninian is happy, too.

speaker: Hector
text: It’s…finished.

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes… At long last…

speaker: Eliwood
text: …Father…

speaker: Hector
text: What was that!?

speaker: Lyn
text: What on earth… What happened?

speaker: Eliwood
text: It can’t be…

speaker: Hector
text: Ah!

speaker: Lyn
text: Th… Are those… Dragons?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nergal’s final warning… This is what he meant!

speaker: Athos
text: What a calamity! If dragons return to this world… The continent will be ash in less than a month!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: This must end at any cost! I will stop it!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: So these are dragons.

speaker: Hector
text: Look at the size of them. I’ve got a bad feeling about this. My… My legs are trembling just standing here.

speaker: Lyn
text: There are three of them… I don’t know if we can do this. I… We need some kind of help.

speaker: Athos
text: I’ll do what I can. I’ll halt the dragons. Strike there!!

speaker: Athos
text: Ahh… So powerful. Can they be stopped?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Athos! Flee! The dragons are getting closer!!

speaker: Athos
text: …If we can’t stop them here, we are…lost.

speaker: Athos
text: Bramimond!

speaker: Bramimond
text: … Preparations…took time… …OK. I require everyone’s strength. Gather here the legendary power!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah!! This light…

speaker: Hector
text: Uwaa! What… What is it!?

speaker: Lyn
text: Look! There…!

speaker: Bramimond
text: Bring her back… Let the dragon girl’s soul be restored.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian!!

speaker: Nils
text: …Ah! Ninian…

speaker: Ninian
text: Where… Where am I?

speaker: Bramimond
text: Girl with the exalted blood of dragons. Use that power to appease them.

speaker: Ninian
text: …Ah…it’s not …possible. Use my power… in this world……

speaker: Bramimond
text: Do you not feel it? Your power returning?

speaker: Ninian
text: …What? ……Ah…… …Yes… … … … …I will try.

speaker: Ninian
text: That’s enough. I’m sorry… This is not your fault… …I’m sorry.

speaker: Ninian
text: No… no more……

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian!!

speaker: Nils
text: It’s OK. She only fainted. Thank goodness… Ninian……

speaker: Bramimond
text: One dragon still remains. Leave the girl to me. I shall tend to her.

speaker: Athos
text: Chosen ones! You must stop the final dragon! You must save us all!!

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! Are you all right?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes. Thanks to you, Hector. If it weren’t for you, I wouldn’t be here. I truly thank you.

speaker: Hector
text: Ninny, I don’t need your thanks. Friends help friends.

speaker: Athos
text: Well done, brave successors to Roland. It’s finally over. Finally, everything is...

speaker: Hector
text: Graybeard!?

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood!!

speaker: Lyn
text: Eliwood!

speaker: Nils
text: Lord Eliwood!

speaker: Eliwood
text: I’m here! I’m right here!

speaker: Athos
text: Well done, brave successor to Roland. It’s finally over. Finally, everything is…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Athos!?

speaker: Athos
text: Ha… Looks like I’ve exhausted my strength. I… I’ll die before you, friend.

speaker: Bramimond
text: …I may well follow you soon. For now…I will sleep again.

speaker: Athos
text: Eliwood…Hector, Lyn…I’ve lived a long, long time, but now…I’m done. Do not grieve. Soon, I will be with long-absent friends. … I have no regrets.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Athos!!

speaker: Athos
text: Now…my friends, my family. Let me give you a parting gift… As I lay dying… I see many things. I see the future… Oh… Why? Why… is this not now? Neither Bramimond nor I… will be…here… to help a land…in need…

speaker: Lyn
text: What…do you see?

speaker: Athos
text: An evil star…rises in Bern…All of Elibe will be once again awash in blood… But do not fear. Once again, Lycia brings hope. Children of fire… …Everything… …

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Athos… Even at the end…he thought of us…

speaker: Hector
text: …Graybeard…

speaker: Lyn
text: …Look, both of you. Lord Athos… It’s almost as though he’s smiling.

speaker: Ninian
text: …This world will once again be enveloped by darkness…But… at the end… a saving light shall rise.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian!

speaker: Ninian
text: Lord Eliwood…

speaker: Eliwood
text: I’m so happy…I can’t believe you’re back. I feel like this is all a dream. Once I lost you… I knew for sure. I need you. I want you by my side forever.

speaker: Ninian
text: Lord Eliwood…I… …I must go home…

speaker: Eliwood
text: What do you mean?!

speaker: Ninian
text: I’m…the cause of all of this. It was my weakness that invited this tragedy…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: Here on Elibe… …we were nurtured for ages in the land of our birth. Even after humans invaded and drove us out….. Not a day passed that I did not think of it…..I yearned to see it once again… Our homeland… Those children… the fire dragons…They were like me…..

speaker: Ninian
text: We knew that it was forbidden. And yet we answered Nergal’s call and opened the gate… We didn’t intend to stay long… Just to see home one last time. But Nergal captured us and… it led to this.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We humans, we took control of the continent like it was our right. We never considered who or what we drove away… …Ninian, Nils, the blame for this was never yours alone. While we can claim ignorance, we still bear some responsibility.

speaker: Nils
text: …Lord Eliwood, do you truly believe that?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I do. If my father were here, he would say the same thing. Let’s work together and think about the future. If the entire continent were made a place where dragons and humans could live together like the hidden city Lord Athos spoke of, Arcadia…

speaker: Ninian
text: What a wonderful world that would be…But that’s certainly something that won’t happen for a long, long time. So we… we can’t stay here. The gate is still open. If it remains so, other dragons will certainly pass through. Before that happens, we must return to our world. We must regain our power and seal the gate…from that side.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Are you saying I’ll never see you again? That can’t be!

speaker: Ninian
text: Lord Eliwood…I am truly blessed that I have had the chance to meet you. Please… Please… Don’t forget me!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian!!

speaker: Ninian
text: ….. Come, Nils. Let us go. We must return to our world…

speaker: Nils
text: Ninian… The air of this world, it’s changed so much from what we knew. No matter how much time passes, our strength will never return. If we stay here, we will not survive long.

speaker: Ninian
text: Nils? Why do you…

speaker: Nils
text: But even knowing that your life will be short…Ninian…You truly wish to remain here, don’t you? I understand… Stay here. Stay with Lord Eliwood.

speaker: Ninian
text: Nils?

speaker: Nils
text: Lord Eliwood… Ninian… No…My sister… Please cherish her.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I will. I will make her happy. …I swear it.

speaker: Ninian
text: Nils! You… Are you…

speaker: Nils
text: Mm. I’m going alone. I want to live a long time. I don’t have your curiosity.

speaker: Ninian
text: …Nils…..

speaker: Nils
text: …Ok then, I’m going.

speaker: Hector
text: Be well, Nils!

speaker: Lyn
text: I’ll miss you…

speaker: Eliwood
text: I’ll never forget you.

speaker: Ninian
text: … …..Nils…

speaker: Nils
text: Don’t cry, Ninian… Even if we’re apart, if we never see each other again, our bond will never, ever be cut… More importantly, Sister…Live as long… and be as happy as you can, for as long as you can.

speaker: Ninian
text: Nils!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Thank you, Nils.

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, daybreak!

speaker: Lyn
text: Beautiful, isn’t it. The start of another day.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian… You’ll come with me, won’t you?

speaker: Ninian
text: Yes!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Good to see you, Ninian.

speaker: Ninian
text: Lord Eliwood…I worried you…Uhm…I…I…wish to apologize…..

speaker: Eliwood
text: What? What do you mean?

speaker: Ninian
text: I was…the cause for all of this. It was my weakness that invited this tragedy…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: Here on Elibe… …we were nurtured for ages in the land of our birth. Even after humans invaded and drove us out….. Not a day passed that I did not think of it…..I yearned to see it once again… Our homeland… Those children… the fire dragons…They were like me…..

speaker: Ninian
text: We knew that it was forbidden. And yet we answered Nergal’s call and opened the gate… We didn’t intend to stay long… Just to see home one last time. But Nergal captured us and… it led to this.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We humans, we took control of the continent like it was our right. We never considered who or what we drove away… …Ninian, Nils, the blame for this was never yours alone. While we can claim ignorance, we still bear some responsibility.

speaker: Nils
text: …Lord Eliwood, do you truly believe that?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I do. If my father were here, he would say the same thing. Let’s work together and think about the future. If the entire continent were made a place where dragons and humans could live together like the hidden city Lord Athos spoke of, Arcadia…

speaker: Ninian
text: What a wonderful world that would be…But that’s certainly something that won’t happen for a long, long time. So we… we can’t stay here. The gate is still open. If it remains so, other dragons will certainly pass through. Before that happens, we must return to our world. We must regain our power and seal the gate…from that side.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Are you saying I’ll never see you again? That can’t be!

speaker: Ninian
text: Lord Eliwood…I am truly blessed that I have had the chance to meet you. Please… Please… Don’t forget me!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian!!

speaker: Ninian
text: ….. Come, Nils. Let us go. We must return to our world…

speaker: Nils
text: Lord Eliwood! Lord Hector! Lady Lyn! …Thank you! My opinion of humans has changed since meeting all of you. There are humans in the world we’re returning to, too. Finding a way to live together may be hard… but we’re going to try.

speaker: Hector
text: Ok! Good luck!

speaker: Lyn
text: I’ll miss you…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Take care! Both of you!

speaker: Ninian
text: Thank you. Be well, everyone…

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, daybreak!

speaker: Lyn
text: Beautiful, isn’t it. The start of another day.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let’s go home. To Lycia!

speaker: Lyn
text: ...Ninian, are you feeling better?

speaker: Ninian
text: Yes…

speaker: Lyn
text: That’s good. ...Long time, no see, Nils. You’ve grown, haven’t you?

speaker: Nils
text: ...Is it really you, Lyndis? It seems like it’s been so long.

speaker: Lyn
text: Even though it’s only been a year since I saw you last?

speaker: Nils
text: So much has happened since we left you and Caelin.

speaker: Hector
text: Hey, care to talk about things the rest of us can follow?

speaker: Nils
text: Hmph. Who’s he?

speaker: Lyn
text: This is Hector. He’s Marquess Ostia’s brother. Don’t let his attitude fool you. He acts mean, but he’s decent enough.

speaker: Hector
text: Acts mean seems pretty mean to me!

speaker: Lyn
text: Heehee… And you might remember this one. He’s...

speaker: Nils
text: Yep, I remember. He’s the man who helped Ninian. You’re Elbert’s son, aren’t you? Your red hair, gentle eyes, and even voice. You’re just like him.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Where did you meet my father?

speaker: Nils
text: At the Dragon’s Gate. He set us free after we’d been captured. We escaped in a small boat, but I was thrown out in a storm. When I woke up, I was back on Valor. For a time, I hid in the ruins by myself. Then... I sensed something really dangerous. When I raced to the Dragon’s Gate, I... I saw everything.

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Nils.

speaker: Lyn
text: When we pulled Ninian from the boat, she’d lost her memory. I can’t believe we brought her right back to her captors. What a horrible thing to do. ...I’m sorry.

speaker: Ninian
text: Lady Lyn... Lady Lyn, you did nothing wrong...... When Nils fell overboard, I didn’t know what to do. ...I became lost within myself. If only I’d been stronger... ......All of this could have been avoided... I am... truly... sorry.

speaker: Nils
text: …Ninian’s power is greater than mine, but it costs her physical and emotional strength. ......Nergal exploited that... weakness...

speaker: Lyn
text: ...Ninian... Nils...

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Was he after you because you have the power to call dragons?

speaker: Nils
text: ...I think it’s because we can open the Dragon’s Gate. Just calling them? Nergal can do that on his own.

speaker: Hector
text: Are you serious?

speaker: Nils
text: Yes, but it requires a tremendous amount of quintessence.

speaker: Lyn
text: Quintessence?

speaker: Nils
text: That’s what Nergal called it. The substance of the human spirit... Power. Energy. The essence of life itself. ...Nergal, he stole this quintessence.

speaker: Hector
text: ...What happens to those whose quintessence is stolen?

speaker: Nils
text: ...They... They die...

speaker: Nils
text: Neither Ninian nor I have that power. Lyn knows. We only have our special power... Anyway, Nergal needed to gather a large amount of quintessence. So he sent his henchman, Ephidel, to get close to Marquess Laus. He sought to plant the seeds of war in Darin’s power-hungry heart.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...To what end?

speaker: Nils
text: It seems the quintessence in each person varies in strength. A person of strong mind and body has hundreds of times more energy than the average person. It sounds like there aren’t many people like that, though. It took too long for Nergal to find people with enough strength. Although it would take time, Nergal said the easiest way to get that much quintessence was by starting a war.

speaker: Hector
text: ...So he planned to make up for quality with quantity? Is that it? Black-hearted fiend! Are all men nothing but pawns to him?

speaker: Nils
text: ...Ephidel brought Elbert to the Dragon’s Gate. He said he’d found the ideal source they had sought. Nergal’s plans for war had been stopped, and yet... he was happy. He’d taken so much energy from the knights traveling with Elbert. He was sure he’d get even better quintessence from Elbert...

speaker: Lyn
text: Nils!

speaker: Nils
text: Oh, I’m sorry... Lord Eliwood.

speaker: Eliwood
text: It’s all right... ...When I found my father at the Dragon’s Gate, I knew his knights were no longer alive...

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood...

speaker: Nils
text: ...Your father told us that he had a son. He said you were blessed with natural fighting ability. But he also told us you were compassionate and disdained fighting. He told us that his son would be a better ruler than he was.

speaker: Nils
text: He told us that he would sooner sacrifice himself than see his homeland, Lycia, embroiled in the flames of war.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...That’s...

speaker: Nils
text: When we’d lost all hope at the Dragon’s Gate, your father always spoke to us of happy things. ...Well, he mainly spoke of his cherished son and his dear wife, but Ninian and I... We loved him very much. His stories about his family... ...They saved us.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Oh, Fa-- ...Father... ......

speaker: Lyn
text: ...Hector?

speaker: Hector
text: We should let him be alone for a while…

speaker: Lyn
text: ...Sure. Come on, Ninian, Nils.

speaker: Nils
text: …As you say.

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Lord Eliwood...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hm? Ninian... I didn’t see you. I’m sorry about before. I just... needed some time to think.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Should you be up? You’ve had a rough time... Your coloring’s not very good. You should rest.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Look at you, all scratches and bruises... You need to be properly taken care of...

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Why?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hm?

speaker: Ninian
text: Why was Lord Elbert so… Lord Eliwood, why were you both... so kind to us? It's... This is… This is all my fault… These nightmares... All these terrible things...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian, crying ill suits a girl of your beauty. I’m fine... Please don’t cry.

speaker: Ninian
text: I’m sorry... So... sorry...

speaker: Eliwood
text: There’s something you must hear. You’re not responsible for what happened to my father. You suffered as much as he did. Please don’t punish yourself further.

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Lord Eliwood... I... I... Ah!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Huh? What is it?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Enemies... ......Enemies draw near!!

speaker: Hector
text: So, what do we do now?

speaker: Lyn
text: I wonder what happened to Nergal. Lord Elbert gave him a grievous wound when he stabbed him.

speaker: Nils
text: His wounds will not kill him.

speaker: Hector
text: That’s what Lord Elbert said, too. Do you know what he meant?

speaker: Nils
text: Nergal uses quintessence on himself as well. His wounds heal quickly. …His body does not age.

speaker: Lyn
text: So he isn’t... human?

speaker: Nils
text: ...If nothing else, he’s... Ah!!

speaker: Hector
text: What is it?

speaker: Nils
text: Call everyone! Enemies approach!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Bah. Eliwood deserves a little more time to rest...

speaker: Lyn
text: Well then, we’ll handle this ourselves, shall we?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Here you all are!

speaker: Hector
text: Ah!

speaker: Lyn
text: Eliwood!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Listen! Get ready for battle! I want to get this over with quickly to protect villagers. Meet the enemy commander, and drive them out of here!!

speaker: Hector
text: Het, little guy! Go hide in the village!

speaker: Nils
text: No way! I can help you out!

speaker: Lyn
text: Nils, you really are a big help, but... shouldn’t you be with Ninian now?

speaker: Nils
text: Ah... All right!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let’s go!

speaker: Nils
text: Ninian! Stop! Where are you going?

speaker: Ninian
text: I... I’m going to help!

speaker: Nils
text: Oh, no, you’re not! You’re still too weak!

speaker: Ninian
text: But... I merely wish to help Lord Eliwood… Even if just a little. I... I stole his father’s life from him... ...I know this... this will never make up for it... Nils! Please...

speaker: Nils
text: ...I understand. Give me your hands.

speaker: Ninian
text: Nils?

speaker: Nils
text: I’ll give you some of my power. You’ll just get in the way if you go out like this.

speaker: Ninian
text: Nils, I’m sorry.

speaker: Nils
text: ...Whew! That should do it. Help them for me, too.

speaker: Ninian
text: Thank you.

speaker: Ninian
text: Lord Eliwood!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian!? You shouldn’t be here!!

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Please allow me to help.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Help? I’ve no intention of making you fight...

speaker: Ninian
text: ...I’m no mere dancer. My dances... They will help you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...This is...... I’m wrapped in... some sort of... energy...

speaker: Ninian
text: I used Ninis’s Grace and danced for you, Lord Eliwood. It will only last a short while, but while it does, you are protected. ...Please... allow me... to remain at your side.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian... Of course. If it will make you feel better. Let’s rejoin the battle. Don’t leave my side.

speaker: Ninian
text: OK!

speaker: Ninian
text: Mark, please tell me what you want me to do. I cannot fight, but... I can aid with my dance. I ask for your understanding and assistance.

speaker: Man
text: Can’t believe Badon’s under attack. If only Fargus were here... Say, I’ve got something here you can use to buy some time. Set this Light Rune, and it’ll block the enemies’ advance. Only thing is, it’ll stop allies, too. So... watch your step!

speaker: Man
text: Ah... Those emerald eyes, that lustrous blue hair... She was... so beautiful, beautiful beyond words… If only I could see her again... A lovely knight of Pherae, searching for her lord... ...I wonder why she’s a knight. A famed knight and me, that’s a dream of a dream... Wah! You... I... I was just thinking out loud... You... didn’t hear anything, did you? Waaaaaaaaa! You mustn’t tell anyone! Promise me! You mustn’t!!

speaker: Woman
text: Why all the noise? It’s the middle of the night!! What? A fight? Are you going to do something? Really? Then... here, take this. It should aid you. It’s a Restore staff. It’ll wake you from sleep and cure poison. Basically, it’ll cure what’s wrong and bring you back to normal. Now I’m tired... Why can’t you people fight at a decent hour?

speaker: Man
text: Are you a mercenary? You all look like you’ve been fighting for years and years. What kind of tactician would put together a group like yours?

speaker: Man
text: Hey! Wasn’t that a wyvern rider that flew by here a while back!? I want to know what Bern’s wyvern riders are doing here! Are we under attack? C’mon, do something! I’ve heard that wyvern riders are fast and really tough. Sure, arrows and magic can bring them down, but... This’ll cause ‘em trouble, too! It’s a wyrmslayer. Here! Take care of ‘em!

speaker: Man
text: You need special items to change classes. The item’s different for different units, too. Cavaliers and knights need a Knight crest. Folks skilled in magic and staves need a Guiding ring. And wyvern riders and Pegasus knights need this: an Elysian whip. You can have it. Don’t be shy now. It’s not like I’ll ever be able to use it. Now, if I were a cute little Pegasus knight, I’d use it in an instant!

speaker: Oleg
text: It ends here. Your journey is over, and only oblivion awaits you.

speaker: Oleg
text: In defeat... there is only... death. Urgh......

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Black Fang?

speaker: Oleg
text: I bring an invitation from my master, Nergal. "Return the children to me." Seems foolish to deliver the message... After all, I can take them both myself and go now!

speaker: Eliwood
text: You’ll never take them!!

speaker: Hector
text: Hey, are you OK?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mm. Sorry to worry you.

speaker: Lyn
text: You don’t have to push yourself so.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We’ll have time for mourning when this is all finished. For now, in my father’s name... I will do everything I can to stop Nergal and protect our lands.

speaker: Hector
text: I see. So what do you have in mind?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...We need to see Marquess Ostia.

speaker: Hector
text: My brother?

speaker: Eliwood
text: After all we’ve learned... We can’t not tell him, can we?

speaker: Hector
text: Sure, I guess...

speaker: Lyn
text: Hector? Why that odd expression?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector doesn’t want to meet Lord Uther. He’s been lax in contacting him and is afraid to face him, right?

speaker: Hector
text: What! And how did you expect me to send him messages when we’re traipsing about the isles like merchants on holidays?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ha ha ha! He is going to be so mad!!

speaker: Hector
text: C’mere!

speaker: Lyn
text: Ha... They’re both in good spirits. ...It’s a lot better than giving in to despair, I suppose.

speaker: Marcus
text: Lord Eliwood... Are you feeling better?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Marcus... I’m fine. I know I worried you.

speaker: Marcus
text: About Lord Elbert... At my own discretion, I sent a messenger to Lady Eleanora.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...I see. Thank you, Marcus. That was well done.

speaker: Marcus
text: ...I thought she should know as soon as possible. The marquess’s final moments were so... very noble...
Lord Eliwood! Commander Marcus!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah!!

speaker: Marcus
text: Is... Is that you, Isadora?!

speaker: Isadora
text: I’ve finally found you. I’m glad you’re well...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Isadora, what are you doing here? Don’t tell me something’s happened to Mother...

speaker: Isadora
text: No, Lady Eleanora is well. Do not worry. When word of Lord Elbert’s death reached her yesterday... She said not a word... She merely gave her full attention to the messenger.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Mother.

speaker: Isadora
text: Then, she issued me orders without hesitation. She commanded I deliver this sword to Lord Eliwood and remain at his side.

speaker: Eliwood
text: But... the castle defenses will be shorthanded.

speaker: Isadora
text: Lord Eliwood... please... Understand your mother’s feelings. Lord Elbert is not coming home. All your mother can do now is pray for your continued safety. "Obey your father’s dying wish." That is her message to you, and I have delivered it.

speaker: Marcus
text: Why not petition Ostia for reinforcements to help ward Castle Pherae?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Good idea. I guess it would ease my mother’s fears and bow to her wishes.

speaker: Isadora
text: It’s that thinking that makes you Lord Eliwood.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Our battles are like nothing you’ve ever prepared for. ...Are you ready to face them, Isadora?

speaker: Isadora
text: Yes. I will serve with my very life.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Tactician? Is something wrong? Oh, you were worried about me. I apologize for all of the trouble. I’m fine now. I have my friends to lean on. Hector, Lyndis, and you, Tactician... Thanks to all of you, I’m getting stronger. I am coming to believe that together, we can overcome anything!

speaker: Nergal
text: Sonia. Limstella.

speaker: Sonia
text: You called, Lord Nergal?

speaker: Nergal
text: My wound... needs time. It was a deep cut, and my strength is not what it was. The man who did this to me is dead. I’d like his son’s death as compensation. Sonia. You will use Brendan to move the Black Fang. I do not need mere underlings now. I need the Four Fangs.

speaker: Sonia
text: Hee hee, leave it to me. I’ll have them bowing their heads to you, my lord.

speaker: Nergal
text: Limstella. I want you to gather me quintessence. For this injury to heal, I will need much. You are the strongest of all my morphs. Kill all those who bear signs of great power.

speaker: Limstella
text: As you will...

speaker: Ursula
text: So the brother escaped, and the sister was rescued by a band of strangers. Do I understand you?

speaker: Beyard
text: Yes... They ambushed us, and...

speaker: Ursula
text: Hold your excuses. The end is all that matters.

speaker: Beyard
text: Yes, ma'am.

speaker: Ursula
text: And your plan for recovering the siblings is?

speaker: Beyard
text: We've word the entire group is heading this way, with the brats in tow.

speaker: Ursula
text: They're coming here? Why would they do that?

speaker: Beyard
text: They may well be after this ring... It's a rare piece. We took it from the girl. It was a stroke of luck that we did, especially if it brings them to us now. I'll grab the whole lot of 'em with this to bait the trap.

speaker: Ursula
text: I see... Very well, I'll give you another chance. I've business elsewhere, but I shall return once it's finished. You have until sunrise tomorrow. Do you understand?

speaker: Beyard
text: Yes.

speaker: Ursula
text: If you do not have the children when I return...my hand will deal you the fang's punishment. Remember that. Bear it closely in your mind.

speaker: Lyn
text: I believe they went in there.

speaker: Nils
text: Milady, are you really going in there to get the ring back?

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, we are.

speaker: Nils
text: But this is their stronghold! They're bound to be well defended, not to mention well armed!

speaker: Ninian
text: Please forget about the ring. It's OK...

speaker: Lyn
text: Tactician's agreed to attempt this...recovery. I wouldn't be here if not for that. Tactician believes we can do this, and I'm sure that decision was not made lightly. With Tactician at my side, I'm confident we can win. Let's get you ring back, Ninian.

speaker: Nils
text: Milady...

speaker: Sain
text: Milady Lyndis! There are more of the foe inside than we thought.

speaker: Lyn
text: This is their stronghold. It's imperative we move carefully.

speaker: Kent
text: Exactly, milady. This narrow corridor can be used to our advantage. If we draw the enemy through here, we can engage them in small numbers and remain relatively safe. If time is a concern, we can always rush them... If we do that, we'd better be sure we can win.

speaker: Lyn
text: So, Tactician. What do you think? How we move forward is completely up to you.

speaker: Beyard
text: How? This can't be... They should be dead! Everyone, get in there and finish them! This is our final chance!

speaker: Beyard
text: I musn't fail. I cannot fail. The consequences are too--

speaker: Beyard
text: Earghh...

speaker: Beyard
text: Aaah... No... I... I cannot...

speaker: Lyn
text: Give us the ring! And swear us this oath... You must promise to leave these two alone. If I have your vow, I'll spare your life...

speaker: Beyard
text: Failure...means death...

speaker: Lyn
text: What?! Poison? He took his own life...

speaker: Kent
text: These are no common brigands we're dealing with. This man was trained by a well-organized group.

speaker: Lyn
text: What do they want with Nils and Ninian?

speaker: Lyn
text: Nils, Ninian. Everything's going to be fine. As long as you're with us, you'll be safe.

speaker: Nils
text: But...

speaker: Lyn
text: You witnessed our victory, right? With Tactician's planning and my sword, you've no worries. If we all work together, there's nothing we can't overcome. I don't care who comes after you; I'll not let you be taken.

speaker: Nils
text: Really?

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, on my honor. Right, Tactician?

speaker: Ninian
text: Milady...

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh, yes... This is yours.

speaker: Ninian
text: Ah... It's...

speaker: Lyn
text: You called it Nini's Grace, did you not? That lout had it.

speaker: Nils
text: Milady Lyndis! Thank you so much!

speaker: Ninian
text: I have no other words, save thank you.

speaker: Kent
text: We’ve almost reached the Lycian border.

speaker: Lyn
text: Once we cross, we’ll be safe from the bandits, right?

speaker: Wil
text: We should be. I doubt they’ll be willing to pursue us across the border.

speaker: Sain
text: Lycia at last! It’s been a long time. Tomorrow, we’ll dine on a feast of Lycia’s finest foods! And the mistress of the inn at the crossing is said to be a beauty. Ah, yes… Food and love. No better way to restore a man’s soul! This is going to be a fine evening, eh, Kent?

speaker: Kent
text: If your behavior is as deplorable as ever, we’d best stay elsewhere. We’re not here for sightseeing!

speaker: Sain
text: Oh, come now! That’s not fair!

speaker: Lyn
text: Kent, the inn will be fine.

speaker: Kent
text: As you say, milady.

speaker: Sain
text: Lyndis! You are truly an angel from on high!

speaker: Lyn
text: It’s nothing. Forget it.

speaker: Florina
text: Ah! We’ll finally be able to get a good night’s sleep.

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh, no… Those bandits are persistent, I’ll give them that much.

speaker: Bug
text: Ah! Here they are! I’ve found ’em!!

speaker: Wil
text: What? Not again! They’re still after us?

speaker: Bug
text: Heh heh heh. Don’t think you’re getting away so easily!

speaker: Bandit
text: You leave alive, and everyone’ll think the Ganelon Bandits have gone soft!

speaker: Lyn
text: So? We care nothing for you or your reputations! We must get to Lycia! Get in our way, and you’ll pay!

speaker: Bug
text: Cheeky little thing, aren’t you? Let’s get ’em, lads! And no holding back just ’cause there’s women with ’em! Wipe ’em out!

speaker: Serra
text: Oooh… We’re lost. This makes me so mad!

speaker: Erk
text: You told me you were certain this was the correct path.

speaker: Serra
text: What’s your point, Erk? What are you trying to say?

speaker: Erk
text: …I swear, you are NOT the woman I agreed to escort…

speaker: Serra
text: What? What’s that supposed to mean?

speaker: Erk
text: I heard someone was needed to escort a frail Lycian priestess to Ostia…

speaker: Serra
text: Yes, and I’m that priestess.

speaker: Erk
text: Frail? You? Serra, you have no need of any escort to protect you. Even the most hardened criminal would flee in terror after five minutes in your company. I’ll return your money. Gladly. Now, will you please go on to Ostia alone?

speaker: Serra
text: NO! You’re MY escort, Erk! MINE! You’re so clean and tidy. A noblewoman like myself can’t be seen without a proper escort. Your personality’s nothing special, but you’re not bad to look at.

speaker: Erk
text: I believe that’s my line. And I have to take you all the way to Ostia? I only hope my nerves can endure the journey.

speaker: Serra
text: What are you mumbling about? You’re so gloomy! Hm? Something’s happening over there. Let’s take a look!

speaker: Erk
text: Ah. Of course. The first opportunity to get involved in trouble, and she jumps right in. No amount of money is worth this. Hoo…

speaker: Serra
text: Wow! A fight! A fight! Erk! Take a look! Fighting those bandits… It’s a young girl!

speaker: Erk
text: Fool! Keep your voice down!

speaker: Bandit
text: Eh? What’s this? You in league with that she-devil?

speaker: Serra
text: Hm?

speaker: Erk
text: Ah… This is so wrong…

speaker: Bandit
text: Gyaaa! I’ll take care of you with one swift stroke!

speaker: Serra
text: Eeeeeek! Eeeeeek! Eeeeeeeeeeeek! Erk! Help me!!!

speaker: Erk
text: So…loud… Serra! Behind me! You there! See if you can match me!

speaker: Lyn
text: That scream… Look! Tactician, someone’s over there!

speaker: Tutorial
text: Sometimes, you can talk to different NPCs . The process is the same as talking to enemies. Give it a try. Please select Lyn.

speaker: Lyn
text: You want me to talk to that person? Understood.

speaker: Lyn
text: I’m supposed to talk to that person, right? Give the order.

speaker: Lyn
text: Um, excuse me… Hello?

speaker: Serra
text: Hm?

speaker: Lyn
text: Why are you fighting these bandits?

speaker: Erk
text: … It just happened.

speaker: Serra
text: That’s not true! Those ruffians thought that we were with you!!! You got us into a terrible situation! Now, how are you going to get us out?

speaker: Erk
text: Serra, if you’d not been so meddlesome, this all could have been avoided. My apologies. Please trouble yourself with us no more.

speaker: Lyn
text: But…if you’re going to have to fight anyway, shouldn’t we team up? It will end things faster, right?

speaker: Serra
text: That’s true. Yes! That’s a good idea. Erk! Go and help these ladies.

speaker: Erk
text: But I… Fine!

speaker: Lyn
text: Very good. My name’s Lyn. SO tell me, will you join arms with us?

speaker: Serra
text: Yes, we’d be glad to. My name is Serra. This is my escort, Erk. Be a good boy, and go fight now, Erk.

speaker: Erk
text: …Sigh…

speaker: Tutorial
text: Erk, a mage, and Serra, a cleric, have joined your group. Mages use the magic of truth to attack and damage their enemies. Clerics use staves to restore HP to their allies. Let’s try them both. First, select Serra.

speaker: Serra
text: Hello. You’re Tactician, right? I’m Serra. Nice to meet you. By the way, see this contrary mage here with me? His name is Erk. I think he’s been hurt. I am Erk’s employer. “Master,” I suppose you could say. What I’m getting at is… I was thinking of healing him free of charge. I know, I know. I’m generous to a fault. Hm? Why are you looking at me like that? Praise my generosity! Anyway, that’s the deal. Please direct me to him.

speaker: Serra
text: Please direct me.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Press the A button, and select the staff from the menu.

speaker: Serra
text: I’m going to use my staff. Watch in wonder!

speaker: Serra
text: My staff! Let me use my staff!

speaker: Tutorial
text: Clerics cannot wield weapons; therefore they can’t engage in combat. However, they can use their staves to restore HP to allied units. Besides healing staves, which restore HP, there are other staves with different abilities. It’s always a good idea to test out any new abilities you receive, so let’s do that now. Have Erk demonstrate his magic. Begin by selecting Erk.

speaker: Erk
text: You are Tactician? I am Erk. I’m not sure how I got in this mess. If I’m going to fight, however, I will show you the true power of magic!

speaker: Erk
text: I will show you the true power of magic!

speaker: Tutorial
text: Magic, like Dorcas’s throwing axes, can strike enemies in adjacent squares as well as those at a distance. It’s very useful. Magic can penetrate even the strongest defenses, so it can be used in many situations. However, mages have few HP and low defensive abilities. To avoid counter-attacks, move in close to archers, and attack other fighters from 1 space away. Try and formulate combat strategies like this to be successful on the field of combat.

speaker: Old Man
text: Magic can be used to attack enemies both near and far. Plus, you might find that magic can hit an enemy that normal weapons do not harm. However… Mages are notoriously susceptible to physical attacks. Just because they’re versatile doesn’t mean you should put them in harm’s way. It does you no good if they are lost because of your carelessness.

speaker: Man
text: Tell me, are you using the R Button? If there’s something you don’t understand, use the R Button to investigate. It’s essential. Place the cursor on a unit and press the R Button. This displays detailed information on the unit. You knew that, right? While that information is displayed, press the R Button again. That will get you even more detailed information. Did you know that? The R Button can be used in many other places, too. Anyway, when you come across something unfamiliar, try pressing the R Button! Won’t hurt to remember that!  Ah, so you’re a traveler? Listen to my advice: handle your money wisely. If you spend too much too soon, you’ll run out early and suffer later. There are other shops, so save about, oh, half of your money.

speaker: Bug
text: You’re gonna learn why people fear the Ganelon Bandits!

speaker: Bug
text: Blaaaaah… Scum… You’re all scum…

speaker: Lyn
text: Nicely done, Tactician. That should just about do it.

speaker: Serra
text: What a surprise. You are very strong, Lyn.

speaker: Lyn
text: Your staff is a wondrous thing. Healing powers amaze me.

speaker: Serra
text: Only those in the service of good can wield them.

speaker: Lyn
text: You helped us tremendously. Well, it’s time for us to go.

speaker: Serra
text: Take care. Good-bye, Lyn.

speaker: Lyn
text: Fare you well. You, too, Erk.

speaker: Erk
text: Good-bye.

speaker: Serra
text: Well, let us be on our way, Erk.

speaker: Sain
text: What have we here? Another wildflower? Perhaps a butterfly?

speaker: Sain
text: What an absolutely delectable creature!

speaker: Serra
text: Oh my! Are you one of Lyn’s companions?

speaker: Sain
text: Please, call me Sain.

speaker: Serra
text: I’m Serra. I serve House Ostia.

speaker: Sain
text: Serra… What a lyrical name. I am in service to Castle Caelin.

speaker: Serra
text: Oh! So is Lyn a member of the marquess’s family?

speaker: Sain
text: She is the granddaughter of our lord, the marquess.

speaker: Serra
text: Hmmm… Such an important person.

speaker: Erk
text: Serra…what deviousness are you contemplating now?

speaker: Serra
text: Tee hee! Having a person of power in your debt is never a bad thing!

speaker: Erk
text: You can’t be serious…

speaker: Serra
text: Oh, Sain! Do you think we could join the lady Lyndis’s company? She seems like such a nice person, and I would ever so much like to help her.

speaker: Sain
text: Of course! We couldn’t be happier!! Why, we were only just saying how we need some more fighting power!

speaker: Serra
text: Are you being hunted or something?

speaker: Sain
text: Yes, it’s an inheritance dispute. Assassins everywhere.

speaker: Serra
text: Oh my! In that case, my healing staff and Erk’s magic should come in handy.

speaker: Erk
text: Well, I, er… It sounds…dangerous…

speaker: Sain
text: Your staff and magic would be extremely helpful! Please wait here! I will go and speak with Lady Lyndis on your behalf.

speaker: Erk
text: Unbelievable…

speaker: Serra
text: This is fantastic, Erk! Our good deeds will earn us gratitude beyond imagining!

speaker: Erk
text: I… I… I think I’m going to be ill.

speaker: Lundgren
text: That little girl crossed the border!?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, Lord Lundgren. She’s en route to Araphen…

speaker: Lundgren
text: Fool! Send out soldiers to meet her! Hold nothing back! Do anything to finish this now! First the old man, and now the girl… They cling to life like a drowning man to a rock! Double the poison’s strength! If he struggles, hold him down and pour it down his throat! Once the girl is gone, Caelin is mine. I will let no one stand in my way!

speaker: Hector
text: Hey, it's pitch black in here! Agh, and it's full of smoke... Hey, Graybeard Athos, you sure this is the right place?

speaker: Athos
text: Yes. Armads, the legendary weapon of Durban the Berserker, who took its name as his own. Armads is here.

speaker: Hector
text: If I've got that, I can help out Eliwood, can't I?

speaker: Athos
text: This battle axe is so tremendous that normal men cannot even lift it. However, it's possible that you might be strong enough.

speaker: Hector
text: C'mon, let's go. I want to get my hands on it!

speaker: Athos
text: Slow down, you fool! The spirits of the soldiers who once fought at our side against the dragons now guard the legendary weapon even in death.

speaker: Hector
text: ...and if I can get through them, I can take the axe, right?

speaker: Athos
text: There are more of them than I'd imagined. You can't do this alone. You must have help.

speaker: Hector
text: Fine with me, but how many people can come with me?

speaker: Athos
text: Too many will simply serve to excite the guardians. Call as few allies as possible.

speaker: Hector
text: Bah... I don't get it, but I'll do as you say.

speaker: Athos
text: ...Be on guard, Hector. Every act of strength you perform has consequences...

speaker: Hector
text: Don't worry. I'll get that axe! Now if we're calling allies, let's call them and get moving!
