speaker: Athos
text: Hmph... You are a bold one. That is your strength, but also your weakness. Your recklessness may one day be your undoing...

speaker: Kaim
text: I am Kaim. You who search for power... You...must prove your worth to me...

speaker: Kaim
text: Tremendous...strength... Truly...like...his...

speaker: Kaim
text: …Seal… ….. could not… …protect …Such regret…..

speaker: Hector
text: All right! This is the throne. Athos Graybeard! I made it!

speaker: Hector
text: What was...
...Let me fight... Me... Let me fight...

speaker: Hector
text: Wha-What are you supposed to be?
My name is... Durban... I am called... Armads...

speaker: Hector
text: What is going on here?

speaker: Durban
text: I am power. Power without peer. I am the dragonhunter. I am the fleshbiter, the bonecrusher, the skullbreaker, the doombringer.

speaker: Durban
text: I require no seals. I have no need of this idleness called peace. Power unused is power wasted. Better to lie spent in the grave than to sit in wait. I care not who... I would fight someone...

speaker: Hector
text: This is one dangerous-looking fellow... Hey, Durban... I mean, Armads... Whatever. Doesn't matter. Hey, you, lend me your strength!

speaker: Durban
text: You desire strength? Then prepare yourself. Once you have gained such power... Your life will not end in a comfortable bed. You will die on the battlefield. In the savage garden of war's bloody delights.

speaker: Hector
text: ...I don't care. I will help my friend. That's why I've come this far. Armads! Your power! Lend it to me.

speaker: Durban
text: ...It is yours.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector!

speaker: Lyn
text: What have you been doing? I'm glad to see that you're well...

speaker: Hector
text: Hey, I told you not to worry. Here, look at this. It's the thunder hammer.

speaker: Athos
text: So, you have acquired Armads, have you, Hector?

speaker: Hector
text: Yep. Okay Eliwood, now it's your turn.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mm, let's go!

speaker: Athos
text: We will not leave Eliwood to his task, and wait outside.

speaker: Lyn
text: I wonder if Eliwood is all right.

speaker: Hector
text: He is. No need to worry about Eliwood.

speaker: Lyn
text: You're right.

speaker: Hector
text: Aha! Look! He's coming out!

speaker: Hector
text: So this is the legendary blade...

speaker: Lyn
text: Durandal, the sword of sacred fire. ...It's strange, isn't it? I've never seen it before, but it feels so familiar...

speaker: Eliwood
text: I will use this to battle Nergal. Come! To the Dragon's Gate... What?!

speaker: Nils
text: Please! Somebody... Somebody, please help!

speaker: Innkeeper
text: That's enough! Get out now! I want none of your trouble!

speaker: Nils
text: But, sir... Why? You were so kind yesterday...

speaker: Innkeeper
text: I thought you were just two kids, a couple of traveling performers... If those men are chasing you, you must be up to no good! Now get up and get out! You're a plague on decent folk!

speaker: Inkeeper
text: Whew... What a mess.

speaker: Lucius
text: Hmmm...

speaker: Lyn
text: Where are we, Kent?

speaker: Kent
text: This is Kathelet. If we head due south, we'll pass into Caelin.

speaker: Sain
text: From here, I'd say we're about ten days' ride to Castle Caelin. Assuming we don't run into any delays, of course.

speaker: Lyn
text: Ten days...

speaker: Nils
text: Pardon me, but...

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes? Can I help you?

speaker: Nils
text: You and your friends... Are you mercenaries?

speaker: Lyn
text: And if we are?

speaker: Nils
text: I need your help!

speaker: Kent
text: Milady Lyndis, you mustn't let your guard down. Not even for a child.

speaker: Lyn
text: I know. Forgive me, but we're in a hurry. Is there someone else you can ask?

speaker: Nils
text: There's no time! Ninian's been... It's my sister! Some men have taken her away!

speaker: Sain
text: Your sister? Did you say your sister's been accosted?

speaker: Kent
text: Sain...

speaker: Nils
text: That's right! By some cruel, awful men. I don't know what I'll do without Ninian.

speaker: Sain
text: Milady Lyndis! We must help him!

speaker: Kent
text: Nonsense! We haven't the time! If the marquess is as ill as we've heard, we must proceed!

speaker: Lyn
text: Kent, I... I want to help this child.

speaker: Kent
text: Milady?

speaker: Lyn
text: I'm worried about my grandfather, of course. But this! I cannot stand by and let a child be taken from her home!

speaker: Kent
text: I see...

speaker: Lyn
text: I'm sorry, Kent.

speaker: Kent
text: I am your loyal retainer. You owe me no apologies. You must do as your heart dictates, milady. I will follow you, no matter where that may lead.

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you.

speaker: Sain
text: Hah! Such a noble speech! Ever the true knight, that one! Ah, well. You're in luck, laddie! Let's go get your sister!

speaker: Lyn
text: Will you lead us to the men who've done this?

speaker: Nils
text: Uh huh. They're really tough, so be careful.

speaker: Lyn
text: Leave them to us. We're pretty tough ourselves. Right, Mark?

speaker: Nils
text: Ah! Oh, no...

speaker: Ruffian
text: Heh heh heh... Found him! C'mon, it's back to Nergal with you. Quiet now.

speaker: Nils
text: No! Let Ninian go!

speaker: Ruffian
text: We ain't supposed to kill you, but we sure can rough you up! Get 'em!

speaker: Ruffian
text: Huh? Who do you think you are?

speaker: Nils
text: Lyn!

speaker: Lyn
text: Let the boy's sister go.

speaker: Ruffian
text: Ah... So you want to help the kid, huh? What a shame. You're gonna die for something that don't concern you.

speaker: Lyn
text: You think so, do you? Do we look so meek to you? I think you're in for a terrible shock!

speaker: Ruffian
text: Stupid girl... You'll regret those words. Take 'em down, boys!

speaker: In-Game Message
text: Starting with this chapter, you'll be able to use the preparations screen. On this screen, you can choose who will fight, equip different items, and arrange your formation, among other things. If you have no special preparations to make, simply press START. This starts the chapter with the same group you were using at the end of the last chapter.

speaker: Lyn
text: I see we're facing a shaman, Mark. I've heard that practitioners of the dark arts are fearsome foes. We'll have to be careful... What!? Who are you?

speaker: Lucius
text: Please forgive me. I never meant to startle you.

speaker: Lyn
text: Your robes... They look like religious vestiary. Are you an Elimine bishop?

speaker: Lucius
text: Yes... Well, no. I'm only an acolyte, an Elimine monk, to be specific. My name's Lucius.

speaker: Lyn
text: Do you have business with us?

speaker: Lucius
text: I was at the inn when this child came seeking help. The innkeeper was afraid to get involved. He was...unpleasant.

speaker: Nils
text: I wasn't afraid of him! I'm used to being treated that way.

speaker: Lyn
text: That's awful.

speaker: Lucius
text: May I please lend you my services? I truly wish to help the boy. If only a little.

speaker: Lyn
text: Of course.

speaker: Lucius
text: Thank you very much. The blessings of St. Elimine be upon you.

speaker: Tutorial
text: The monk Lucius has joined your group. Monks are users of the magic of light. Whose who wield magic are highly attuned to its flow, so they have a high magic resistance. Units with high magic resistances can reduce the damage caused by magical attacks. When magic users battle each other, they often find it hard to inflict damage. The light magic of monks is strong against the dark magic favored by shamans. Lucius should come in handy here. Let's put his magic to the test. Have Lucius attack the shaman nearest him.

speaker: Lucius
text: Mark, isn't it? I am Lucius. I await your orders.

speaker: Lucius
text: You wish for me to attack the shaman? Very well.

speaker: Lucius
text: I beg your pardon, but I would prefer to attack from here.

speaker: Nils
text: I can help, too!

speaker: Lyn
text: Nils! Can you fight?

speaker: Nils
text: No... But I'm a bard, and bards are useful to have around!

speaker: Lyn
text: A bard? Do you mean you're a minstrel? This is no place for a ballad or a saltarello.

speaker: Nils
text: C'mon, trust me! I'm all yours, Mark.

speaker: Tutorial
text: It's time to see what Nils can do. The music played by bards allows your allies to move twice in the same turn. However, bards cannot engage in combat, so be careful not to expose them to danger.

speaker: Nils
text: Mark? I'm Nils! I'd like to perform for youm so give the word.

speaker: Nils
text: You'd like me to play for Lucius, right?

speaker: Nils
text: I have to be next to him, so he can hear my tune!

speaker: Nils
text: What do you think?

speaker: Lyn
text: That was lovely... invigorating, even. You ought to play for me sometime. I could use the boost!

speaker: Nils
text: Everyone could! My music can refresh you all!

speaker: Tutorial
text: Through the power of Nils's music, Lucius can move again this turn. Bards gain experience by playing music. Use Nils's powers often, and increase his skill.

speaker: Girl
text: Hmmm... Maybe I could get some firewood out of it... Hm? Who's there? Who are you? Ah, you're just passing through? Pay me no mind. I was just thinking out loud. You see, there's an old tree on the other side of this mountain. It's just a dead old snag, really. I was just thinking of some way I could put it to good use. As I said, it's nothing that need concern you.

speaker: Innkeeper
text: That's quite a group you've gotten yourself involved with. You do know you're facing the Black Fang, right? Anyone they target winds up... Well, you know. No one escapes the Fang! That's what they say, anyway. You and those odd children? I'd say you're finished. Not that I'll have any part of it. Course not!

speaker: Hector
text: Blast! Eliwood's late. I wonder what's keeping him... ...Starting to think my axe'll rust over before he finds his way here.

speaker: Serra
text: Excuse me! Is anyone home? An empty house... how dull!

speaker: Hector
text: Whew... I thought she would find me for sure. She's been working for my brother in Bern. And now she's returned... Ahh...

speaker: Matthew
text: Huh? Milord! What brings you here?

speaker: Hector
text: Ah, Matthew. Eliwood and I are here for our monthly bout.

speaker: Matthew
text: You're still testing one another's fighting prowess, eh? It's a solid friendship you two share, that you can practice so faithfully.

speaker: Hector
text: If you don't sharpen your blade, you lose your edge. So tell me, what are you doing here?

speaker: Matthew
text: Milord Uther was curious about the succession issue here.

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, the long-lost granddaughter thing, right? So which way does my brother lean?

speaker: Matthew
text: By my assessment, he will back the granddaughter's claim. The marquess's brother, Lundgren, is too ambitious by far. Left alone, we might wake to find him at Ostia's door before long.

speaker: Hector
text: Sound advice, I think.

speaker: Matthew
text: My return to Ostia is going to be delayed a bit. Would you mind letting Lord Uther know?

speaker: Hector
text: What? So the marquess's brother is now your personal messenger?

speaker: Matthew
text: You always did have a good sense of humor, milord. Don't forget my message!

speaker: Hector
text: What impudence!

speaker: Villager
text: So how much do you know about magic, huh? Magical attacks are special. You can't just avoid 'em like a sword or an axe. Not even if you're wearing armor. Who's tough against magic? Let me think... Well, anyone who uses magic or staves. Pegasus knights, too. Hm? You got others who need to battle magic users? I got something for 'em. It's a special kind of water. "Pure water," it's called. Just sprinkle a bit on you. It'll protect you and lessen the damage you take a bit. Go on, take it. Don't be so shy. It'snot like I'm givin' you gold or anything. This stuff's strongest when you first put it on. It gets weaker as time passes, so be careful.

speaker: Heintz
text: Who are you supposed to be? Playing the heroes in some foolish knightly romance? You may think you're helping the children, but you're only rushing to your doom!

speaker: Heintz
text: You were only... striking at air... You are...too late. The girl is already--

speaker: Lyn
text: Nils! Where's your sister?

speaker: Nils
text: Ninian! Ninian... She's not here. Why? Where could she be?

speaker: Kent
text: My lady Lyndis! A villager spotted a group of men riding south.

speaker: Sain
text: The boy's dear sister... They must have her!

speaker: Lyn
text: Come! We must give chase!

speaker: Nils
text: But... But... We won't make it! What if they've already...
Are you looking for this girl here?

speaker: Nils
text: Ninian! Ninian!

speaker: Eliwood
text: She'll be fine. She's just lost consciousness.

speaker: Lyn
text: Who are you?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I'm Eliwood, of Pherae. My father os the marquess.

speaker: Lyn
text: The marquess's son...

speaker: Eliwood
text: She was with a band of ruffians. She seemed upset. She looked in need of rescuing... Was I wrong to involve myself?

speaker: Lyn
text: No, you saved her life. Thank you. My name is Lyn. I'm from Sacae. I'm Marquess Caelin's granddaughter.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Marquess Caelin?

speaker: Lyn
text: And that's my story. It's not an easy tale to believe, I know...

speaker: Eliwood
text: No, I do believe you.

speaker: Lyn
text: What?

speaker: Eliwood
text: At first glance, all I saw was a daughter of the plainsfolk. Now I can see it, though. You have your grandfather's eyes.

speaker: Lyn
text: Do you know my grandfather?

speaker: Eliwood
text: The marquess, Lord Hausen, is my father's good friend. I also know that the proud people of Sacae tell no lies. It's true, isn't it?

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes... Thank you. I would not have expected any Lycian noble to be so courteous to a Sacaean nomad.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You seemed to be in trouble. May I be of assistance?

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you for your kind offer. This is my problem, though, and I'll deal with it.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I see. I'll be in the area for a few days longer. If you need anything, please let me know. Lyndis, I'm on your side.

speaker: Lyn
text: Eliwood... Thank you.

speaker: Nils
text: Ninian! Are you awake?

speaker: Ninian
text: Nils? Is it really you? Oh, you're safe!

speaker: Nils
text: Uh-huh. These people helped me.

speaker: Ninian
text: Who are they?

speaker: Nils
text: Uh...

speaker: Lyn
text: I'm Lyn. I'm glad you're feeling better.

speaker: Ninian
text: Milady Lyn... Thank you. I'm called Ninian. My brother, Nils, and I are traveling performers.

speaker: Lyn
text: Both of you? Your borther's a musician. How about you, Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: I... I dance.

speaker: Sain
text: What? Oh my... you're a dancer!

speaker: Lyn
text: Sain... Later, please.

speaker: Sain
text: Um, yeah. Of course.

speaker: Lyn
text: A dancer? Your clothes don't look like those of a dancer.

speaker: Nils
text: Ninian dances to honor life. It's special... Sacred.

speaker: Lyn
text: A sacred dance? What does that mean?

speaker: Ninian
text: I... The dance I perform when we travel is just a normal dance. My other dance, though... When they caught me, I twisted my ankle. I cannot dance to aid you... I'm sorry.

speaker: Lyn
text: Please don't worry. We're just happy to see that you're out of harm's way.

speaker: Ninian
text: Thank you.

speaker: Lyn
text: But I am concerned about your leg. You can't travel on it...

speaker: Nils
text: I've an idea. Would it be too much to ask that we travel with you?

speaker: Lyn
text: I can't allow that! It's far too dangerous. We're being hunted. We never know when we're going to be attacked.

speaker: Nils
text: We wouldn't be a hinderance. We could even help you. Right, Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: Yes. We might be able to repay our debt using our...special talents.

speaker: Lyn
text: Special abilities?

speaker: Ninian
text: When something poses a threat to us, we can sense its approach.

speaker: Lyn
text: Truly? That's amazing!

speaker: Nils
text: We can feel it coming, but we can't do anything to stop it. You're warriors, though, so you don't have that worry.

speaker: Lyn
text: What do you think, Kent?

speaker: Kent
text: I think leaving them here would cause Lady Lyndis more worry than having them travel with us.

speaker: Lyn
text: Sain? Oh, never mind. I know what your answer is. Do you really want to travel with us?

speaker: Nils
text: Of course!

speaker: Ninian
text: You have our gratitude, milady.

speaker: Ninian
text: Oh...

speaker: Nils
text: What's wrong, Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: I've lost my ring.

speaker: Lyn
text: Your ring?

speaker: Nils
text: Not Ninis' Grace?

speaker: Ninian
text: The very one.

speaker: Nils
text: They stole it? Those curs!!!

speaker: Lyn
text: Was it valuable?

speaker: Ninian
text: It was a keepsake from our departed mother.

speaker: Nils
text: It was blessed by the spirit of Ninis... There's no other like it in the world. And now we have lost it to those villains. There's nothing we can do.

speaker: Ninian
text: You're right.

speaker: Lyn
text: Can I talk to you, Mark? You heard all of that, right? What do you think? I'd really love to retrieve Ninian's ring for her. But if Nils is right, those thieves might prove to be too strong for us. What should we do?

speaker: Tutorial
text: When you fulfill certain conditions, side quests may make themselves apparent to you. Side quests allow you to learn things that aren't part of the main story. You might meet tough new enemies or find new companions to travel with. However, side quests are very difficult, and once you begin one, you must see it through to its end. If you plan to challenge a side quest, I suggest you keep the save data from the previous mission. Not accepting side quests will not effect your ranking. If you're in a hurry to pursue the main story, skip the side quests.

speaker: Lyn
text: You want to help them? That's great! I was hoping you'd say that, Mark. Kent! Sain! Those men were headed south. We must give pursuit!

speaker: Sain
text: On your word, milady!

speaker: Lyn
text: There's no turning back now. Let's ride!

speaker: Hector
text: Brother! Brother!! Where is he!? He's here, isn't he?

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector! Calm yourself!

speaker: Hector
text: No words, Oswin! Just move!

speaker: Uther
text: That's enough, Hector! What is the meaning of this?

speaker: Hector
text: You know full well! The disappearance of Marquess Pherae!

speaker: Uther
text: We've discussed this time and time again. This matter is none of Ostia's affair. We have no reason to involve ourselves. It would be folly to do so.

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood's father is missing, for goodness' sake! We know that Marquess Laus is connected in some way. I say we use Ostia's might to end this mystery and find the truth!

speaker: Uther
text: Calm yourself, you fool! An invasion would be madness! Lycia can ill afford the chaos such an action would bring. Surely even you must understand that!

speaker: Hector
text: Bah... I understand all too well, Brother! Stay there on your throne. Sit there until it rots beneath you! I will do this alone!!

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector! You should watch your tone...

speaker: Uther
text: Peace, Oswin. Let him go. There's no reasoning with him when he gets like this.

speaker: Hector
text: Matthew! Matthew! Blast it! Where could he be?

speaker: Matthew
text: I'm right here.

speaker: Hector
text: You... You're not a wraith. Stop skulking in the shadows like one.

speaker: Matthew
text: Hm? A wraith? And here I thought I was a spy. Be that as it may. As milord ordered, here are your travel rations and your beloved axe. And I've purchased the silence of some royal guardsmen. You're free to slip out the rear entrance and vanish.

speaker: Hector
text: Well done, Matthew. Try not to let my brother discover my absence too quickly.

speaker: Matthew
text: What? I thought I was going with you.

speaker: Hector
text: You're a bigger fool than I'd imagined! Did you think I would trust my brother's spy? Who knows when you would turn me in for some favor! Where I go, I go alone!

speaker: Matthew
text: Shh! You keep on shouting, and you'll go nowhere! Every guard in the palace must have heard that!

speaker: Hector
text: Enough... Do not try and follow me!

speaker: Matthew
text: I did not imagine you would find me so untrustworthy. Professional hazard, it seems. Watch yourself, young master.

speaker: Hector
text: Huh? He... He gave up too easily. I don't trust him... The time has come... I've got to get out of here and rendezvous with Eliwood. These bags! What did Matthew put in these things?

speaker: Hector
text: This is ridiculous even if he was packing for two! Huh? .......Come out. I know you're there.

speaker: Hector
text: Who are you?

speaker: Hector
text: Too dumb to speak? Makes no difference to me. Move out of my way, or I'll run you through!

speaker: Hector
text: Hah!

speaker: Matthew
text: Whoa! M-Milord! Stay your arm! It's me!

speaker: Hector
text: Who? Matthew? I was sure you were one of them.

speaker: Matthew
text: Well, I'm not! I'm one of me. And I would prefer to remain in one piece.

speaker: Hector
text: Your fault for jumping out of nowhere. Now tell me, what are you doing here?

speaker: Matthew
text: Hm? I... I sensed that something was wrong and...came to your aid.

speaker: Hector
text: My aid... I'll accept that answer for the time being.

speaker: Matthew
text: So, what should we do?

speaker: Hector
text: About what?

speaker: Matthew
text: About the fellows between us and the way out. I'd say there are 7 or 8 of them. To make matters worse, they seem highly competent. I know you're confident in your martial abilities, but... I'm not the strongest sword arm around, and, well...

speaker: Hector
text: If you've something to say, Matthew, then say it!

speaker: Matthew
text: We could abandon the rear entrance. I'm sure the royal guardsmen would be happy to aid us, and...

speaker: Hector
text: Never!

speaker: Matthew
text: That's what I thought you would say. All that's left is to avoid getting killed, right?

speaker: Hector
text: You can go back if you want.

speaker: Matthew
text: In your own words, milord, never. I'm with you, wherever that may lead.

speaker: Hector
text: Right. Then let's give them a good thrashing and get out of here!

speaker: Wire
text: Fuh...Fuh...Forgive me...Lord...Nergal...

speaker: Hector
text: You're not Marquess Laus's assassins, are you? You're too good, too professional. Nothing like those idiots over there.

speaker: Wire
text: You've no need to know, little Lord Hector. A fool like you, sneaking out of the country alone... You'll go missing, never to return. Your body will never be found. Tidy story, eh? Ha ha...

speaker: Hector
text: Tsk tsk... Looks like your luck's run out.

speaker: Wire
text: Our luck? What are you...

speaker: Hector
text: You see, I'm about as angry as I've ever been. I doubt that even a dozen of you could slow me down. Prepare to die!!!

speaker: Wire
text: The Ostian spy. Why did you return?

speaker: Matthew
text: I've known you were here for some time. I also knew you were after Lord Hector, not me. You're all professional assassins. You wait for your chance, and you don't miss it. You were waiting for me to leave Lord Hector alone. That's when you were planning to attack, right?

speaker: Wire
text: Ah... So that's why you came back, is it? I was sure you'd gone back to play with the guards.

speaker: Matthew
text: If I had, I would've taken Lord Hector with me. No matter what it took.

speaker: Wire
text: Cheeky fellow, aren't you? But you're out of your league.

speaker: Matthew
text: How so?

speaker: Wire
text: You think to challenge me? Prepare to die, you witless fool!

speaker: Matthew
text: Ghaa...

speaker: Matthew
text: Whew... That was close. Glad we're both all right. Come, milord, we must fly! The castle guard must have heard all the noise.

speaker: Hector
text: Matthew, you rogue. You knew this was all going to happen, didn't you?

speaker: Matthew
text: What else could I do? Those assassins wouldn't show themselves until you were alone.

speaker: Hector
text: I suppose... Mark my words, Matthew! You're coming with me. But from this point forward, you are no longer my brother's spy. You are my man now, to the bitter end.

speaker: Matthew
text: Yes, milord! Shall I swear a knightly vow?

speaker: Hector
text: To what purpose? Your own words will hold you well enough.

speaker: Matthew
text: True enough!

speaker: Hector
text: Let us go then! To Eliwood!

speaker: Soldier
text: My lord! Marquess! It's Lord Hector! He's--

speaker: Uther
text: He's gone, isn't he?

speaker: Soldier
text: Ye... Yes, milord! We are gathering men now to give chase.

speaker: Uther
text: Attend me. We will let him go.

speaker: Soldier
text: Milord?

speaker: Uther
text: A... Headstrong fool... Oooh... Cough...cough...

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Uther! Are you well?

speaker: Uther
text: ... ...I'm fine. It has passed. There is no need for concern.

speaker: Oswin
text: You must not rely so much on physical strength alone. It has been most trying these past few weeks. The affairs of the court have not let you sleep. You might endanger your health if you keep on...

speaker: Uther
text: Yes, Oswin. I understand. I will speak with a physician on the morrow. Will that allay your fears?

speaker: Oswin
text: Yes, my lord. I shall make the arrangements.

speaker: Uther
text: Oswin... About Hector... I can entrust him to you, yes?

speaker: Oswin
text: Of course, my lord. I will guard him with my very life's blood.

speaker: Man
text: ...You hide and wait here. There's food and water in this pack. ...If you ration yourselves, it should last about ten days.

speaker: Young Girl
text: ...What about you, Daddy? Are you going away?

speaker: Man
text: Daddy has to go to Aenir. ...I'm going to get Mommy.

speaker: Young Girl
text: ...Mommy? Where is she?

speaker: Man
text: Some bad men took her away. They can't have gone very far, though. I have to go after them and save Mommy. You wait ten days... If Daddy's not back by then, take your brother and go to the other side. You're a clever girl. You know the way, right?

speaker: Young Girl
text: ...Daddy...

speaker: Young Boy
text: Daddy... Don't go...

speaker: Man
text: ...You're good children. Both of you. I'll come for you. I'll be back...

speaker: Teodor
text: I am Teodor the Shrike, of the Black Fang. You will die now.

speaker: Teodor
text: This is what... I spoke of. If I had... more power...

speaker: Hector
text: That about wraps this up. Eliwood? How about over there?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Fine. But...where is Ninian? Has anyone seen her?

speaker: Lyn
text: I found her! She's inside.

speaker: Hector
text: Hm? Why isn't she with you?

speaker: Lyn
text: There's a library filled with ancient books inside. She's been in there, staring at a picture. I can't get her to move.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What kind of picture?

speaker: Lyn
text: A picture of a dragon and a human.

speaker: Hector
text: From the Scouring? We've got a lot of those in Castle Ostia.

speaker: Lyn
text: No, it's not a picture of the actual fighting. It shows a single human and a single dragon. ...It's a very eerie picture.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...It must have belonged to the dark sorcerer who used to live here.

speaker: Lyn
text: I wonder what kind of person that magic user was...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian! Are you ready?

speaker: Ninian
text: Yes, um... I'm sorry for the trouble...

speaker: Lyn
text: Well? Did you...remember something?

speaker: Ninian
text: There's... No, nothing. I'm sorry......

speaker: Eliwood
text: Don't push yourself. You'll remember soon enough.

speaker: Lyn
text: That's right! Cheer up!

speaker: Ninian
text: Yes...

speaker: Hector
text: Let's get moving! We've been fighting since we got here. If we make it to the Dragon's Gate, we win. We've got to rescue your father!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Right!

speaker: Nergal
text: What is this place? I was supposed to be at the Dragon's Gate. Why am I here? Ah... Now I remember. I was here a long, long time ago... During the Scouring... I studied dark magic here. This... I left something here. Something valuable... Urrgg... My head... The pain... Bah. It must not be worth much if I never bothered returning for it. I have power now. Nothing else matters. I will open the Dragon's Gate and get even more power... The power to defeat anyone. Power...

speaker: Nino
text: The prince's room... Is that the door?

speaker: Nino
text: General Murdock, the prince's bodyguard, should be away. The king concocted some errand to call him from Zephiel's side... There are no guards around. This is an...easy job, isn't it? I... I can do this! This is my first mission, you know? I guess I'm a little nervous, but... I mustn't fail. Mustn't let Mother down.

speaker: Nino
text: Are you ready, Jaffar?

speaker: Jaffar
text: I've...no desire to be a part of your blundering... If you fail, I will, without hesitation, finish the target and then you.

speaker: Nino
text: What!?

speaker: Jaffar
text: Do not be so naive as to expect help from "friends." ...Remember that.

speaker: Nino
text: I...I knew that. Don't have to tell me... I'm a member of the Black Fang, after all. Ha ha...

speaker: Nino
text: ...I won't fail. I will become worthy... I will. Mother will be proud of me. She will see the daughter I've become, and she will love me.

speaker: Nino
text: ...There are no guards. It's just like we were told, but...something's strange.

speaker: Nino
text: Listen! A voice! Someone's talking in the room!

speaker: Jaffar
text: No... Someone's praying.

speaker: Nino
text: You're right... It's the prince, isn't it? I wonder what he's praying for.

speaker: Zephiel
text: I offer this prayer unto thee: My coming-of-age ceremony is tomorrow. As the prince of Bern, I've tried... I've tried my best not to be an embarrassment to my father. I know I've not met with his expectations. But I will try harder. I will please him. I vow to do better. For him.

speaker: Zephiel
text: ......Hear me: Tomorrow, I will be a man... So this is my last wish as a foolish child. It's the same one I've asked of you every night for all these years, but... Please, bring Father and Mother together again. Please, let the day come when Guinivere and I and her mother... When all of us can live together happily in the castle.

speaker: Jaffar
text: It's time...

speaker: Nino
text: Oh! Jaffar...

speaker: Zephiel
text: What!? Villain... ...

speaker: Jaffar
text: That will leave him unconscious for some time. Now, the time has come for you to do your part...

speaker: Jaffar
text: ...Do it.

speaker: Nino
text: I...cannot.

speaker: Jaffar
text: What!? What did you say?

speaker: Nino
text: Listen to him... All he wants is his parents' love... To be accepted... That's all...... He's just like me. No matter how I try, Mother always looks at me as if I were nothing. Her eyes are so filled with disappointment. She's never held me... not even once.......

speaker: Jaffar
text: Stop this foolishness! I told you! I will not permit you to ruin my opportunity!

speaker: Nino
text: I know... Do as you must, Jaffar. I won't resist. You can do it easily. But...please don't hurt the prince. ...For pity's sake...

speaker: Nino
text: ...I'm ready to die.

speaker: Nino
text: What?

speaker: Jaffar
text: We're leaving. Hurry.

speaker: Nino
text: Jaffar?

speaker: Jaffar
text: ...This is it. Come here.

speaker: Nino
text: Bu-But if you do this... Jaffar, you'll...

speaker: Jaffar
text: Don't worry about me. Hurry up. ...No!

speaker: Ursula
text: Hello, Jaffar. Finished already? Such magnificent skill. Is this why they call you the Angel of Death? Sonia told me that you were behaving oddly, but... It appears her fears were groundless.

speaker: Nino
text: I'm sorry! It's not Jaffar's fault! It was me! The prince... I couldn't...

speaker: Jaffar
text: Nino!

speaker: Ursula
text: What's all this? Why is the girl still alive?

speaker: Nino
text: What?

speaker: Ursula
text: You received Lady Sonia's orders, did you not? You were to dispose of the worthless little--

speaker: Nino
text: No!!

speaker: Jaffar
text: Hold your tongue. You will not speak another word.

speaker: Ursula
text: ......So that's how it is? Jaffar, do you plan on betraying Lord Nergal?

speaker: Jaffar
text: I will not let Nino die. Get in my way, and I'll kill you.

speaker: Nino
text: Jaffar!

speaker: Ursula
text: Ha ha... So you have some human emotion in you after all. You always seemed just like those creepy morphs. I bet you didn't kill the prince, either. ......Maxime!

speaker: Maxime
text: Yes! I'm here!

speaker: Ursula
text: Take your men and put out all of the lights. Block all the entrances. Your targets are Prince Zephiel and two traitors. Finish this before we draw attention to ourselves. Go!!!

speaker: Jaffar
text: Go now... I will buy you time.

speaker: Nino
text: N-No! You must come, too, Jaffar!

speaker: Jaffar
text: Nino... You must live. You are worthy of living.

speaker: Nino
text: No! Wait! Don't go! Jaffar!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: This is the royal manse.

speaker: Lyn
text: The lights have been doused. That's the sound of fighting. What's going on?

speaker: Hector
text: I don't know, but if they're still fighting, we might not be too late! Let's hurry, Eliwood!

speaker: Eliwood
text: We have to get inside! We have to protect the prince!!

speaker: Harken
text: Are you our tactician, Mark? I am Harken. I beg your forbearance. Lord Eliwood has ordered me to follow your commands in combat. I care not where I meet death. Just guide me wisely.

speaker: Karel
text: Your name is Mark, correct? A tactician? I see. You use wisdom as your blade… Interesting… Mark… I will remember your name.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Ahh... Ow... What's... My room... That man... He's gone. What's going on? Ah! We're under attack! Coming this way... 10...20... I have to get away... No... That's wrong. That's not the way. If I run, they'll simply follow and surround me... Rather than run, I should wait and face them here.

speaker: Nino
text: You! Are you from the palace? The prince is in his room! Save him! I’ll take care of anything that happens out here!!

speaker: Hector
text: Wait, hold on! You’re Nino, right?

speaker: Nino
text: What!? How–

speaker: Hector
text: I heard something...

speaker: Nino
text: ...What? But... you must be lying...

speaker: Hector
text: I’m not. It’s all true. The Black Fang’s responsible for the death of countless innocents. They’re dancing on strings for Nergal, while he laughs in shadows.

speaker: Nino
text: ...It can’t be...

speaker: Hector
text: I know you don’t want to believe all this, but it’s true. Don’t hide yourself from reality. You should come with us. You saved the prince. I think you’ll see what’s right.

speaker: Nino
text: You! Are you from the palace? The prince is in his room! Save him! I’ll take care of anything that happens out here!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Wait! You... You’re Nino, aren’t you?

speaker: Nino
text: What!? How–

speaker: Eliwood
text: We overheard some things...

speaker: Nino
text: ...What? But... you must be lying...

speaker: Eliwood
text: I’m sorry... It’s the truth. The Black Fang is no longer the group you thought it was. Nergal is using it to his own ends!!

speaker: Nino
text: Mother... ...It can’t be...

speaker: Eliwood
text: I’m not asking you to believe this all at once. But...it’s the truth. The only truth. Come with us! You’re no assassin... You must know the best thing for you.

speaker: Nino
text: Jaffar!

speaker: Jaffar
text: Nino? ...... I told you to flee.

speaker: Nino
text: No, these people came and helped me! Hurry, Jaffar! Come with me!

speaker: Jaffar
text: Go. There’s no need to save a life without worth.

speaker: Nino
text: Jaffar...

speaker: Jaffar
text: I am a corpse. I have been dead since the day I was born. Leave me...

speaker: Nino
text: No! If you’re not coming, then I’m staying! I do not want you to die, Jaffar!

speaker: Hector
text: Prince Zephiel?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Ah! Who are you?!

speaker: Hector
text: I’m from Ly... Um... I’m here to rescue you.

speaker: Hector
text: We’ll drive back the foe. Get back!

speaker: Zephiel
text: I will not.

speaker: Hector
text: Huh?

speaker: Zephiel
text: I know neither your name nor your motives. Why should I trust you?

speaker: Hector
text: Well, I guess you have a point. But...I can’t tell you who we are. We’ve got...reasons.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Reasons?

speaker: Hector
text: Mm. Complicated reasons.

speaker: Zephiel
text: ......I see. I place my life in your hands.

speaker: Hector
text: What? Are you sure?

speaker: Zephiel
text: If you were assassins, I would already be dead. I must trust you.

speaker: Hector
text: You’ve my word of honor!

speaker: Ursula
text: Tell me...are you afraid to die?

speaker: Ursula
text: ...Uww...gaa... ......This can't...Lady...Son...ia...

speaker: Ursula
text: I cannot understand you. You serve perfection in the form of our masters. Yet you abandon such happiness?

speaker: Jaffar
text: ……I ensure that Nino lives. That’s all.

speaker: Ursula
text: Why won’t you die as Lady Sonia wishes? You, born of garbage. This was your one chance to be useful.

speaker: Nino
text: My mother… She would not say such things. I…don’t believe it.  I don’t believe anything you have to say!

speaker: Ursula
text: Stupid child… I’ll see that you don’t suffer at least.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Ah! The lights are back. ...The rebels...What's happened? I have to make sure Mother is well! Hello! Is anyone there!?

speaker: Nino
text: Jaffar!!

speaker: Jaffar
text: Nino...

speaker: Nino
text: I'm...glad you're well...

speaker: Jaffar
text: Why do you not kill me?

speaker: Eliwood
text: If we did that, Nino might die as well.

speaker: Lyn
text: You didn't take the prince's life. So we won't take yours. It's that simple.

speaker: Jaffar
text: So naive. Do you know how many of your friends I've killed?

speaker: Hector
text: You monster! I'll--

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector!! Calm yourself!

speaker: Hector
text: Bah!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Some sins cannot be forgiven, but now... We need all the help we can get to defeat Nergal.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Jaffar... You were planning on throwing your life away, correct? If you've come to regret so many of your past actions, then fight with us.

speaker: Jaffar
text: Regret? Such emotions mean nothing...

speaker: Nino
text: Jaffar!

speaker: Jaffar
text: ......If you want me to...I will...do it.

speaker: Nino
text: Jaffar!!

speaker: Lyn
text: That's good, isn't it, Nino?

speaker: Nino
text: Mm! Thank you! Thank you!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah! Hector...

speaker: Limstella
text: Ursula... Beyond hearing so soon?... ......This is quite excellent quintessence. I believe Lord Nergal will be pleased.

speaker: Limstella
text: Ursula...

speaker: Ursula
text: Limste--my lady Limstella. I am prepared. The only reward for failure is death. However, I must give my report to Lady Sonia...

speaker: Limstella
text: That won't be necessary.

speaker: Ursula
text: Urrgh!!

speaker: Limstella
text: This is quite excellent quintessence. I believe Lord Nergal will be pleased.

speaker: Murdock
text: ...What could His Majesty be thinking? Detaining me for so long, with no just cause! What!? No... It can't be... The prince...

speaker: Soldier
text: Co-Commander! Commander Murdock!! You... You must come...

speaker: Murdock
text: What's happened!?

speaker: Servant
text: My apologies for the wait. The queen will see you now.

speaker: Pent
text: Very well.

speaker: Louise
text: Let us proceed.

speaker: Hector
text: The queen of Bern... Even if it is a private audience, courtly niceties aren't my strong suit.

speaker: Lyn
text: Mine, either.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Let's go.

speaker: Hellene
text: Ah, so you've returned. And you were successful? You recovered the Fire Emblem safely?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Queen Hellene. Has no one told you? Last night in the manse...

speaker: Hellene
text: Oh, something about assassins sneaking in, wasn't it? I've no time for such trifles. Quickly, the Emblem.

speaker: Hellene
text: Ah... Without a doubt, this is the Fire Emblem. Ha ha! With this, my Zephiel holds rightful claim to the succession! Now, it will never pass to that annoying Guinivere... Ha ha ha.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Queen Hellene...

speaker: Hellene
text: Oh, yes. I'd forgotten. Your promised reward. The road to the Shrine of Seals, was it not?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I have a pressing question to ask of you first. What is His Royal Highness Prince Zephiel to you?

speaker: Hellene
text: I...beg your pardon?

speaker: Eliwood
text: HIs Highness Zephiel is your trueborn son, isn't he? Or is he, like the Fire Emblem, nothing more than a tool for securing the throne?

speaker: Hellene
text: How dare you! Such insolence! To whom do you think you are speaking!?

speaker: Eliwood
text: This has nothing to do with title! You are free to possess your desires and aspirations. But your own innocent son... How can you do anything that places His Highness's life at risk!?

speaker: Hellene
text: What? What do you mean? Of what do you speak...

speaker: Lyn
text: Didn't you hear us? Assassins nearly killed--

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis. That's enough. ...I beg your leave.

speaker: Hellene
text: Wait right there! We are not finished! Someone! Someone stop those insolent children! Someone!

speaker: Murdock
text: My lady Queen.

speaker: Hellene
text: Murdock! I thought you'd been summoned to the castle by His Majesty.

speaker: Murdock
text: That's correct. I've only just returned. One of my men told me all that happened last night. There's something that I must inform you of, Your Majesty.

speaker: Hector
text: Well, that's that, huh?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ......Lord Pent, Lady Louise, I ruined a perfectly good opportunity. I'm terribly sorry.

speaker: Pent
text: You said nothing that I did not agree with. Do not think long on it.

speaker: Louise
text: Lady Hellene has changed. Before she got married, she was a kind woman who wanted to be a good wife and a good mother.

speaker: Pent
text: She and the king are ill matched. She has suffered much. And now, she is obsessed with the succession. Such a sad life...

speaker: Lyn
text: ......His parents are alive. Yet they're both awful. I feel so sorry for him.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Even if it was just, I should have left it unsaid. I angered the queen, and in doing so lost the only aid we had in Bern.

speaker: Hector
text: It's over and done with. No sense worrying about it now. Let's consider our next course of action. Wait, who's there?

speaker: Hellene
text: Go no farther.

speaker: Hector
text: Queen Hellene?!

speaker: Eliwood
text: What are you... Where are your guards?

speaker: Hellene
text: Your name... It is Eliwood, yes? Take this book and this seal. My reward to you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Your Majesty?

speaker: Hellene
text: This book contains the road to the Shrine of Seals. The seal was a wedding present from Count Reglay from Etruria. I was saving it for Zephiel, but... I believe at this time that you need it more. Furthermore, your path will remain clear for the next three days. No matter what happens during that time, Bern's soldiers will not move. I can make no promises about the king's own troops, though.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You've done more than enough. You have my heartfelt gratitude. But, Your Majesty...why all of this for us?

speaker: Hellene
text: I want to thank you, not as a queen, but as a mother. For saving my son, I am forever in your debt. Now, you should get going.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Queen Hellene.

speaker: Hellene
text: Zephiel.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Mother. Is something amiss?

speaker: Hellene
text: You... You've endured much heartache because of me. ...I'm sorry.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Th-That's not so!

speaker: Hellene
text: Zephiel... My dear, irreplaceable son. From this day forward... I want us to live together as one loving family. Your father and I...and your sister, Guinivere, too.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Mother...

speaker: Hellene
text: I am ashamed of the way I have behaved. The king may not forgive me for the woman I have been. Yet I shall make recompense, no matter the time. I want to change. If I speak to him from the heart, someday, he will understand. After all...we are a family.

speaker: Zephiel
text: That's right! He will see.

speaker: Hector
text: So the book is a map, but what's this..."seal"?

speaker: Eliwood
text: This is a...Heaven seal. To receive something so valuable...

speaker: Hector
text: She really listened to you, didn't she? Let's take them and go!

speaker: Eliwood
text: She listened to us, didn't she?

speaker: Lyn
text: That's right. All of us!

speaker: Hector
text: I guess...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let's make for the Shrine of Seals. Once we make it there, something's bound to happen!!

speaker: Sonia
text: Jaffar. Ursula. Lloyd. Linus. That's everyone, is it not? If I have you, the Four Fangs, together, I need no one else. I have need of you to eliminate a man whose living plagues me. His name is Eliwood, a noble of Pherae.

speaker: Ursula
text: ...Pherae's located in Lycia, is it not?

speaker: Sonia
text: That's right. But he is no simple country lord. He has friends. Other Lycian lords. Individually, they are no match for you, and yet... Carelessness invites death.

speaker: Ursula
text: Do not make that mistake.

speaker: Sonia
text: Lloyd, Linus... I have work for you, the Reed brothers, as well. All right?

speaker: Lloyd
text: One question. Are these our father's ord--I mean... the orders of the head of the Black Fang?

speaker: Sonia
text: Hee hee... Why, naturally. Isn't that right, my beloved?

speaker: Brendan
text: Mmm... Ah...yes.

speaker: Sonia
text: There! Are you satisfied? Remove Eliwood. Your orders come from the head of the Black Fang, Brendan Reed. As members of this group, you will follow that order, yes? Or...does your opponent frighten you into immobility, Lloyd?

speaker: Linus
text: Sonia! How dare you speak to my brother in such a...

speaker: Lloyd
text: Linus.

speaker: Linus
text: ...I know.

speaker: Lloyd
text: Sonia, we do not need to be chastised by you. Under our father, we are the ones who've carried out the law of the Fang. If Eliwood is an evil person, there is no reason for us to hesitate.

speaker: Linus
text: The Fang lets none escape.

speaker: Lloyd
text: We, the brothers Reed, dispense the Fang's justice.

speaker: Sonia
text: ......Ursula, Jaffar, you understand your orders, yes? Once you find the target, you eliminate him at once!

speaker: Ursula
text: It will be as you say, Lady Sonia. Anything for you.

speaker: Jaffar
text: ...I've received my orders. I will do my duty.

speaker: Sonia
text: Your target's name is Eliwood, noble of Pherae! Bring him down. On the Black Fang's honor!

speaker: Hector
text: ...I've heard word from my brother. He's already on his way here. We're to wait for him.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lord Uther is coming here himself?

speaker: Hector
text: So it appears. I told you of this before, but Castle Ostia, not to mention the city itself, is filled with countless foreign spies. I assume he thinks it will be easier to speak freely here.

speaker: Eliwood
text: But...wouldn't leaving Ostia generate even more attention?

speaker: Hector
text: He's traveling in secret with very few attendants. He's skilled at this sort of thing. There's no need to worry.

speaker: Lyn
text: How unconventional. It must run in the family.

speaker: Hector
text: ...And what exactly is that supposed to mean?

speaker: Lyn
text: Nothing. I'm very much looking forward to meeting him.

speaker: Ninian
text: Nils, are you well? You seem...distant.

speaker: Nils
text: I'm fine. Just a little tired. If we can sit still for one night, I'll be bet...ter...

speaker: Ninian
text: No! Nils!? Nils!!

speaker: Lyn
text: Nils!?

speaker: Hector
text: Nils! You all right?

speaker: Ninian
text: Nils!! Open your eyes!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian! Calm down!

speaker: Hector
text: Let's move him into the back room and call a healer.

speaker: Ninian
text: You mustn't move him!

speaker: Hector
text: Huh?

speaker: Lyn
text: Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: I'm sorry, I... Um... Please, just for now... Don't move him.

speaker: Hector
text: But...

speaker: Ninian
text: Please...

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Let's do as Ninian says. She must have her reasons.

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Please, just one night's rest... That should...make things right.

speaker: Hector
text: If it's going to make him feel better, fine. Whatever you do, don't move him. I'll let the others know.

speaker: Ninian
text: Lord Hector.......My apologies.

speaker: Hector
text: No worries.

speaker: Eubans
text: ...So this is where the Pheraen noble and his friends are, eh?

speaker: Heath
text: Yes, Commander Eubans.

speaker: Eubans
text: Very well, Heath, your unit will attack from west of the fortress. Your mission is to put an end to the entire group. Make no mistakes.

speaker: Heath
text: ...Are you serious? Marquess Laus abandoned us and just vanished. We've no reason to engage this group.

speaker: Eubans
text: We answered Marquess Laus's call, and we will honor our duty. Regardless, we cannot remain in Lycia any longer. We rebelled against Ostia, and our entire mercenary force is hunted... If we take their heads, we can join the Black Fang in Bern.

speaker: Heath
text: I'm opposed to this plan. There are women and children in their group. What you would ask of us... It's something no knight... no man could do without shame.

speaker: Eubans
text: Listen well, Heath. You're a wanted man, a fugitive from Bern. How about we take you and hand you over to Bern's wyvern riders? We might even be knighted as a reward, given honest work.

speaker: Eubans
text: Hah! Thought as much. Everyone wants to protect his own skin. Now, get your unit together. We attack!!

speaker: Soldier
text: Sir! We're under attack! It's the east gate! The foe is already inside!

speaker: Hector
text: Blast! They would show up now.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We can't move Nils. Let's try and hold them off! Protect Nils! Don't let them near him!

speaker: Isadora
text: You're Tactician, correct? Lord Eliwood has told me much about you. I'm a knight in service to House Pherae. My name is Isadora. I'm under your command. Please instruct me.

speaker: Wil
text: Shall I join the battle this time, Mark? I can’t wait! Ah, this brings back memories, doesn’t it? Kind of like we’re back with Lyndis’s Legion again. OK, Mark! Guide my arrows true!

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Hector! We’ll serve as your reinforcements. We’re a small group, and we’ve some mercenaries among us. Rath of Sacae! Take charge of the mercenaries!

speaker: Rath
text: ...Understood.

speaker: Soldier
text: Hear me!! We’re here to protect Lord Hector, Lord Eliwood, and Lady Lyndis!

speaker: Rath
text: Lyn...

speaker: Rath
text: ...So you're being hunted again, are you, Lyn of the Lorca?

speaker: Lyn
text: Rath! Rath of the Kutolah! Well met! What are you doing here?

speaker: Rath
text: ...After we parted company, I've made my way as a mercenary here.

speaker: Lyn
text: I see... You haven't changed at all. It's...good to see you again.

speaker: Rath
text: ...Do you need my help?

speaker: Lyn
text: Are you offering?

speaker: Rath
text: ...You...If you desire it.

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, please! Lend us your strength! We're...involved in something terribly dangerous!

speaker: Rath
text: I see. When this is finished, I will end my service to this place.

speaker: Heath
text: Do you command this group?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Who are you?

speaker: Heath
text: I'm Heath, a wyvern rider serving Eubans's mercenaries. I wish to surrender.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Surrender? Why?

speaker: Heath
text: I've no wish to harm women and children. I'm a soldier, but... I'm trying to be human, too.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...I understand. However, as you know, we're under attack. It will be hard to guarantee your safety.

speaker: Heath
text: No, that's fine. I will fight alongside you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yet...

speaker: Heath
text: I will stop Commander Eubans when the moment comes... With this, my lance.

speaker: Heath
text: Do you command this group?

speaker: Hector
text: Who are you to ask?

speaker: Heath
text: I'm Heath, a wyvern rider serving Eubans's mercenaries.

speaker: Hector
text: In that case, you're my enemy. You're gutsy, aren't you? Prepare yourself!

speaker: Heath
text: Hold. I've not come to fight you. I wish to surrender to your group.

speaker: Hector
text: Surrender?

speaker: Heath
text: I've no wish to harm women and children. I'm a soldier, but... I'm trying to be human, too.

speaker: Hector
text: ...You're an odd one. Right, well. We could use all the help we can get. You'll fight under my command.

speaker: Heath
text: Understood.

speaker: Heath
text: You're...a woman?

speaker: Lyn
text: What!? Underestimate me, and you'll find you die regretting it! Now come, if you've the nerve!

speaker: Heath
text: Hold, I am not here to fight you. I'd sooner surrender.

speaker: Lyn
text: Surrender? You're giving up? Why?

speaker: Heath
text: I've no wish to harm women and children.

speaker: Lyn
text: ......I understand. We're no army. I won't hold you prisoner. If you're not going to fight, go someplace where you'll be safe. However, you are welcome to join us and fight at our side. We're trying to protect a sick child traveling with us.

speaker: Heath
text: I see...and I will help you protect this child.

speaker: Ninian
text: Ah...

speaker: Heath
text: A girl... This place is dangerous, you should flee quickly.

speaker: Heath
text: ...Wait! Do you know the commander of these forces?

speaker: Ninian
text: Ah...Yes...

speaker: Heath
text: Then deliver a message for me, please. I am Heath, a wyvern rider in Eubans's mercenaries. Tell him I want to join your group. I will fight with you.

speaker: Ninian
text: Wait... Why?

speaker: Heath
text: I've no wish to harm women and children.

speaker: Eubans
text: …I didn’t imagine they were this capable… Heh! Still, I won’t lose! I live and breathe the air of war! I can’t be beaten!

speaker: Eubans
text: No regrets... My life...and death...are my own!

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: Commander Eubans has gone down… Uh… Sound the retreat!! We’ve no more reason to fight!!

speaker: Eubans
text: You are a traitor, Heath. You know nothing of honor!

speaker: Heath
text: I... No. I simply must live a life of which I am not ashamed. Commander Eubans... It is not too late. Give the order to stop. If you do...

speaker: Eubans
text: Ha ha... You're so naive! You're no knight. And you're no mercenary, either, you dolt! You know nothing! You can carry your precious morals straight to the grave!

speaker: Uther
text: So, brother, you're alive after all. You were so long gone that I feared you dead. Another day, and I might have arranged you a funeral rite.

speaker: Hector
text: ...My apologies. Been a little busy.

speaker: Uther
text: Yes...Leila's final report covered much. ...Eliwood. I am sorry about Lord Elbert. I was powerless to help.

speaker: Eliwood
text: No... Nothing could have been done. ...More importantly, do you know of Nergal?

speaker: Uther
text: Only what was reported to me. He appeared a year ago and seized control of the Black Fang. Then he ensnared Laus in a plot of rebellion against Ostia. I can't see what he's after...

speaker: Eliwood
text: The dragons that vanished after the Scouring... He wants to...bring them back again.

speaker: Uther
text: What!? Can that be done?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes. Let me explain.

speaker: Hector
text: This has even got my brother brooding. He's always been a firm believer in quick decisions. Yet he wishes for more time...that's never happened before.

speaker: Lyn
text: ...It's gone from a simple rebellion to a threat to the human race. We saw it with our own eyes, and yet... It's all so unbelievable.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yet...it's all true.

speaker: Hector
text: Yes. I wonder what will happen next. Ideally, we could bring the whole of our lands together to fight as one. It would be a return to the time of the Scouring...

speaker: Eliwood
text: However, this all hinges on the existence of dragons themselves. Unless dragons are seen in the skies, I doubt anyone will believe us.

speaker: Lyn
text: Right. And once the dragons are here it'll be too late.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We must stop all of this now. And we're the only ones who know enough to do it!

speaker: Hector
text: Right!

speaker: Lyn
text: I agree.

speaker: Hector
text: There we have it! Come on, let's speak to my brother!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Tactician. Ninian. Will you go with us?

speaker: Ninian
text: Ye-Yes...

speaker: Uther
text: I would sooner not place this burden on your shoulders alone. And yet, I can see no other choice before me. Listen, my brother... Eliwood, Lyndis, are you determined to act on your resolve?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes, we're prepared.

speaker: Lyn
text: Me, too... I don't care for sitting back, waiting for others to act.

speaker: Uther
text: And you, Tactician. My brother and his friends are in your debt. What role will you play? Will you help them? See them through their coming trials? ...I see. Then I have no more to say. I will aid you as much as I can. ...Good luck to you all. ...And what of the girl? The one we spoke of earlier?

speaker: Ninian
text: Oh, Ninian.

speaker: Ninian
text: It... It's an honor to meet you, Marquess Ostia...

speaker: Hector
text: Both Ninian and her brother, Nils, possess a special power.

speaker: Uther
text: Is that so? Then I would ask you. Do you know where Nergal is at this moment?

speaker: Ninian
text: Yes, I can sense him... To the east... He is...very far.

speaker: Lyn
text: East... Is he targeting Bern next?

speaker: Uther
text: That bodes ill. Bern is a powerful and militant country. If Nergal ensnares it... We're done for.

speaker: Ninian
text: ...There's still time. He is still... very weak...... Now... We must act......

speaker: Lyn
text: So, Nergal can't act right away, is that it? Yet, what can we...

speaker: Hector
text: We've no choice but to depart for Bern.

speaker: Uther
text: ...If there's time, make your destination Missur.

speaker: Hector
text: Missur!? That's the wrong direction!

speaker: Uther
text: Go to the Nabata desert... You may find aid there.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Uther
text: Go and meet the living legend.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Living...legend?

speaker: Hector
text: Well, we’re going, Brother.

speaker: Uther
text: ...Hm, take care of yourself. And Marquess Pherae, too. You must be Eliwood’s support and strength.

speaker: Hector
text: I know. This has all gotten so out of hand. Still, it’s not entirely hopeless. Lord Elbert’s death need not be in vain. We won’t lose.

speaker: Uther
text: You’re beginning to sound reasonable...

speaker: Hector
text: Hey!

speaker: Uther
text: What is it?

speaker: Hector
text: Your coloring. You don’t look so good. Is something wrong?

speaker: Uther
text: ...I just heard a tale that would frighten anyone. When I think that the future rests on the shoulders of a man like you, who lives so haphazardly, I realize that my life’s been too short.

speaker: Hector
text: Bah! Is that any way to be? And I was worried about you, too!

speaker: Uther
text: You should get going. Your friends are waiting.

speaker: Hector
text: Ha ha... Pardon my overlong visit. I will take my leave of you then! Most honored elder brother!

speaker: Uther
text: Hector!

speaker: Hector
text: What is it?

speaker: Uther
text: Remember, I have not given you permission to die. Heed the orders of your marquess and return to me alive.

speaker: Hector
text: Mm. I’ll bring you a tale you won’t believe. Mark my words, Brother. I shall return!

speaker: Fargus
text: Well, we’ve arrived!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Fargus, I can never thank you enough.

speaker: Fargus
text: No need to worry about that. Are you sure you don’t need our help from here? Fargus’s pirate crew makes women smile and villains revile! We could be helpful.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Thank you for your concern, but from here, we go alone.

speaker: Hector
text: We don’t have any idea what will happen. We’d like you to deliver a message, if you would.

speaker: Lyn
text: Even if we successfully defeat Nergal, there’s no saying if we’ll survive the battle.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We might... If we don’t return. I apologize for the inconvenience, but...

speaker: Fargus
text: I’ll worry about that when the time comes. Don’t worry.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Thank you. And also... about Nils.

speaker: Fargus
text: I know. I’ll take responsibility for him.

speaker: Lyn
text: ...Nils? We’re going now.

speaker: Hector
text: We’re going to shatter Nergal’s ambitions and bring him down! You wait here and rest until we get back, OK?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nils... I don’t think you’ll forgive me no matter how I apologize, but just hear me out. Our power is no match for Nergal. Even so, we can’t give up. I have to fulfill Ninian’s wish, too. I will never, ever flee from that duty.

speaker: Eliwood
text: So...I want you to face reality as well. It doesn’t have to be now... When you’re past the pain. When you’ve...recovered... I’m sure that’s what Ninian would want, too.

speaker: Eliwood
text: OK, Fargus. We’re going.

speaker: Fargus
text: Hey! Don’t mess this up, pups!!

speaker: Fargus
text: Ahoy, Dart! Hold on a moment.

speaker: Dart
text: Yeah? What is it, Captain?

speaker: Fargus
text: Isn’t there something you want to tell me?

speaker: Fargus
text: ...... All right! Fine! Get going!!

speaker: Dart
text: O-OK...

speaker: Fargus
text: Dart!

speaker: Dart
text: What? What is it?

speaker: Fargus
text: ...Don’t come back dead.

speaker: Dart
text: Heh heh...is that it? Of course I’m not going to die!

speaker: Fargus
text: Oh?

speaker: Dart
text: You saved my life five years back. If I went and lost it now, you’d have my hide for a rug! I’ll do whatever it takes to get back alive!

speaker: Fargus
text: ...Aye, is that so? Then get going! You’d better watch after those whelps, too!!

speaker: Dart
text: Aye-aye, Captain!

speaker: Fargus
text: Well then, time to get back on board and wait. C’mon, lad.

speaker: Fargus
text: ............ Uh-oh! I forgot. I was supposed to give ’em something important!

speaker: Fargus
text: It’s something that’ll come in real handy in battle. Can’t believe I forgot. Nothing to be done but send someone after them...

speaker: Nils
text: ...I’ll go.

speaker: Fargus
text: Oh? Are you sure you want to do it?

speaker: Nils
text: ...I am.

speaker: Fargus
text: ...That’s a relief. Live and return, whelp...

speaker: Nergal
text: So they’re coming...

speaker: Nergal
text: Go, Limstella. Bring their essences to me.

speaker: Limstella
text: Sire...

speaker: Nergal
text: I have given you magic stronger than any seen on the continent. Through this magic, you have gained much power. Perfect strength and perfect beauty. You are my masterpiece, Limstella.

speaker: Nergal
text: Your flesh cannot endure the power of this sorcery. Before tomorrow, your entire body will be corrupted. But this is what you desire, yes? The chance to die for me?

speaker: Limstella
text: As you wish.

speaker: Lyn
text: So far, so good. A little more and we’ll be at the Dragon’s Gate.

speaker: Hector
text: We got here without much trouble. Wonder when Graybeard will show up? What do you want to do? Wait?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let me think...

speaker: Nils
text: Lord Eliwood! Look out! Move!!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nils! You came!!

speaker: Nils
text: I did. I can’t run away any longer. I’ll take Ninian’s place. I have to do her part. No, I have to do Ninian’s part and mine! I’ll fight with you, and we’ll change the course of fate!

speaker: Hector
text: Well spoken! Now you sound like a man!!

speaker: Lyn
text: Nils! Glad to see you.

speaker: Nils
text: Sorry for worrying you. I’m fine now! And now... Stop skulking and come out! I know you’re there.

speaker: Lyn
text: Hm? What?

speaker: Lyn
text: Ah! Who?

speaker: Nils
text: Limstella... The one who’s always at Nergal’s side.

speaker: Lyn
text: Ebony hair...gold pupils... You’re a morph, aren’t you?

speaker: Limstella
text: ...I’ve come for your quintessence. ...Come out, my humble servants...

speaker: Hector
text: We’ll have to fight our way through!

speaker: Lyn
text: No matter how many there are, we cannot retreat!

speaker: Nils
text: ...He hasn’t called any dragons yet. If we go now, we might still have time to stop him!!

speaker: Hector
text: Mark! It begins! The final battle!

speaker: Nils
text: Ah, Lord Eliwood! Here...

speaker: Eliwood
text: This is... an Earth seal! Where did you get this?

speaker: Nils
text: Fargus told me to give it to you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I’m grateful. This should help us out in battle!

speaker: Nils
text: Ah, Lord Hector, this is for you.

speaker: Hector
text: It’s an Earth seal! How did you get this?

speaker: Nils
text: Fargus told me to give it to you.

speaker: Hector
text: Are you telling me the old man had this all along?!

speaker: Nils
text: He did say that it would help you in battle, but... Is it really that special?

speaker: Hector
text: Yeah! It’s as valuable as a Heaven seal. Doesn’t matter where we use it, just so long as we use it!

speaker: Nils
text: Uh-huh!

speaker: Renault
text: …So noisy. I thought I could escape battle here on the Dread Isle. No… I’m not interested in why you’re fighting. I am only looking for tranquility. If helping you will bring it to me, then I will lend you my power. Not that I will be that much help…

speaker: Hector
text: ...It’s just an old ruin.

speaker: Hector
text: Ah!!

speaker: Sophia
text: Arch...sage? ......?

speaker: Hector
text: Who are you?

speaker: Sophia
text: You’re...not...the... Archsage...are you? ......Um...I... I’m sorry...for...my mistake.

speaker: Hector
text: Wa-Wait! Who in the–

speaker: Sophia
text: ...I’m...from...Arcadia... ...I wanted to speak to... ...the Archsage...um... ......but...he’s not... ...here...is he?

speaker: Hector
text: No, he’s not.

speaker: Sophia
text: ...I see... ... ...Um... do you...need...this?

speaker: Hector
text: It’s a talisman. Why would I need it?

speaker: Sophia
text: ...We want... you all...to do your...best... ......For the future... ...please don’t lose... If the light is strong enough... it can dispel...darkness...

speaker: Hector
text: She’s gone. What a mysterious girl.

speaker: Limstella
text: I will take your life and your essence. All for the sake of my master.

speaker: Limstella
text: I am not human. This body and this heart are constructs. Yes, as is this sorrow.

speaker: Eliwood
text: That was a heated battle.

speaker: Hector
text: I thought it was going to go on forever... Phew...

speaker: Lyn
text: It's not finished yet. Nergal is waiting at the Dragon's Gate!

speaker: Nils
text: Nergal. He must pay!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Before we go to the Dragon's Gate... Nils, if you don't mind, would you share your story with us?

speaker: Nils
text: Huh?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I won't force you to if you don't want to.

speaker: Nils
text: ......OK, I'll tell you. I want you all to know about me and Ninian. A millennium ago... Man chased dragonkind from the land, exiled us. We had no place to go... not on this world. So we used the Dragon's Gate to flee into another world. When we passed through this chasm in space and time, many of us were lost. Still, we endured the journey. We found humans there, too, but they were few in number. We had a few skirmishes, but at last, we found a home. We were stable there, happy, even. But some thought back on our former home, and when we did, his voice reached out to us. Ninian was a medium in the other world, an oracle of sorts. She sat at the Dragon Shrine. She held much power. We were in prayer at the shrine when it happened... We heard a voice calling to us from the Dragon's Gate. It was the voice of an old friend... We knew we weren't supposed to open the gate and return to this world. We had no idea that the owner of that voice was Nergal...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nergal...

speaker: Nils
text: But something unexpected happened. When we opened the Dragon's Gate and traveled her again, we had lost almost all of our strength... The quintessence left within us was less even than that of an average human. In order to sustain ourselves, in order to breathe the air of this world, we took human form. We placed our energies within a dragonstone. But our dragonstone was taken...stolen. Nergal hoped to use it as a tool to summon other dragons. ...Until we escaped. We couldn't let our foolishness condemn our friends. Disguised as a dancer and a bard, we fled and wandered from country to country. That's when we first met Lady Lyndis, one year ago.

speaker: Lyn
text: That whole time... Nergal was after you? Why didn't you tell me?

speaker: Nils
text: You were so good to us. We didn't want to cause you any trouble. After we left Lyn at Caelin, we were captured again... ...We decided that the only way to escape was to cut short our own lives. That was when we met Lord Elbert. He was so strong, so kind... He knew what we were...and what we had done, and he never once condemned us. On the contrary, he tried to set us at ease with stories... Stories of his family, of his homeland. Ninian and I... We listened to his stories, and we grew to love his gentle wife and his son. Premonition... No, that is too strong a word, but we felt his son would be the one to save us. ...That's what we felt. That's why... That's why, Lord Eliwood!

speaker: Nils
text: I believe in you. Even though Ninian's gone, I will continue to protect you. I have to. That... That's Ninian's wish. It's our wish. Let's stop Nergal! You're the only one who can do it......

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nils!

speaker: Hector
text: Let's do it! Eliwood!!

speaker: Lyn
text: He's right! It's too early to give up! I mean, we're still here! We're still alive!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Everyone... You're right. My friends are here with me! There's no power on this earth stronger than that! Let's go! The Dragon's Gate awaits!! That's where we'll shatter Nergal's ambitions!!

speaker: Hector
text: We've finally arrived. I can't believe they built a palace in these mountains.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Bern is the only country on the continent where wyverns still fly. With its wyvern-riders, I imagine this castle is the best-defended anywhere.

speaker: Lyn
text: I agree. Look at the path leading up the mountain's face. It would be impossible to scale that in a direct assault.

speaker: Hector
text: Defenders positioned higher up would have a clear advantage. Even the best soldiers would be taken out with ease. Hm... Look at that. They don't have any sentries posted. They must have a lot of faith in their defenses.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Look at these surroundings! They probably make do simply with patrols within the castle. The mighty Bern. I'd not like it as an enemy.

speaker: Lyn
text: And yet, from this impregnable fortress, a treasure was stolen. Perhaps the king really is responsible for all this. It's hard to imagine any thief cracking Bern's defenses.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You're right. But I can't imagine why the king would do this. To find the Fire Emblem, we're going to need clues.

speaker: Lyn
text: Listen, why don't we try sneaking into the castle?

speaker: Hector
text: That's what I was waiting for! I like the way you think.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Whatever happens, we must not be caught. If it looks impossible, turn around and come back here.

speaker: Hector
text: Got it!

speaker: Lyn
text: Of course!

speaker: Lyn
text: This is... An inner garden?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Shh! Someone's coming this way.

speaker: Hector
text: Here! Into this thicket!!

speaker: Guinivere
text: Brother! Hello, Zephiel!

speaker: Zephiel
text: Ah, Guinivere. Have you been well?

speaker: Guinivere
text: Uh-huh! I've been fine. But if you would come and see me every day, I'd be even better! Much, much better!

speaker: Zephiel
text: Every day? Well, that's an awful lot, but I'll come by as often as possible. All for you, dear sister.

speaker: Guinivere
text: Yippee!
Guinivere! Guinivere! Where are you, lass?

speaker: Guinivere
text: Here I am, Father! Welcome home.

speaker: Desmond
text: Ah, there you are. Were you a good girl while I was gone? Come, give your father a kiss. You're as adorable as ever.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Well met, Father.

speaker: Desmond
text: ...Zephiel. Hmph... You take the same unpleasant tone as your mother.

speaker: Zephiel
text: What!? I... I...

speaker: Desmond
text: Silence. What brings you to my castle?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Ah, yes... Murdock.

speaker: Murdock
text: Yes, my lord.

speaker: Zephiel
text: We were hunting in the forest earlier. ...We found this and thought Guinivere might like it.

speaker: Guinivere
text: Eeek! A baby fox!? How cute! It's so very cute!! Is it for me? Really?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Do you like it?

speaker: Guinivere
text: Yes, I do! Thank you. I do love you, Brother!

speaker: Desmond
text: ...Guinivere, go play for a while.

speaker: Guinivere
text: OK! Come on, let's go! You lovely little fox!

speaker: Desmond
text: ...I've told you to stay away from the castle.

speaker: Zephiel
text: Yes...I know... I beg your pardon. I heard that Guinivere was ill and I was...worried.

speaker: Desmond
text: Hah, you mean you came to see if she would die, don't you?

speaker: Zephiel
text: Father...

speaker: Murdock
text: I beg your pardon, Your Majesty, that...

speaker: Desmond
text: Hold your tongue, Murdock! Do not forget whom you serve! The king of Bern!!

speaker: Zephiel
text: It's all right, Murdock...

speaker: Zephiel
text: Father, I would never want to see Guinivere harmed in--

speaker: Desmond
text: You and your mother think of nothing more than stealing my throne. You plague me. Return to the manse!

speaker: Zephiel
text: ...As you wish. I beg your leave...Father.

speaker: Desmond
text: ...No matter how I warn him, he comes. Why is it that the very sight of him tries my patience so? He is truly of my own flesh and blood, yet...
Hee hee hee. It is jealousy, my king.

speaker: Desmond
text: Eh? Who's there?

speaker: Sonia
text: It is I, Sonia.

speaker: Desmond
text: You... Well? Is the Emblem safe?

speaker: Sonia
text: Yes. I have it in my possession. It is all as we planned.

speaker: Desmond
text: It is unlikely, but... The queen might attempt to win the Emblem back. Are you prepared?

speaker: Sonia
text: I will not fail... It is secreted away within the Black Fang's fortress.

speaker: Desmond
text: Keep it concealed until dusk of the tenth day, then return it to me.

speaker: Sonia
text: As you will, Your Grace.

speaker: Desmond
text: And what of my other request...

speaker: Sonia
text: One of the Four Fangs will tend to it. There will be no mistakes. However, General Murdock, the man protecting the prince... He is young, yet well respected. Shall we finish him, too?

speaker: Desmond
text: ...Murdock... His birth is low. And yet his combat skills have won him the title of Wyvern General. It would be a great blow if Bern were to lose him. I'll think of something to remove him from Zephiel's side. Will that do?

speaker: Sonia
text: Yes. It would be a great help. Wait! ......

speaker: Desmond
text: What? What is it?

speaker: Sonia
text: I...sense someone.

speaker: Desmond
text: Where!?
Father! Brother! Where are you?!

speaker: Desmond
text: Do not worry. It is my daughter.

speaker: Sonia
text: Of course. Do not forget the Black Fang's role once we are successful.

speaker: Desmond
text: Of course. Now begone. Quickly.

speaker: Sonia
text: Farewell.

speaker: Guinivere
text: Zephiel! This kit, it... Hm? Where is my brother?

speaker: Desmond
text: He had an errand to perform and left.

speaker: Guinivere
text: Oh, no! No, no, no! I wanted to play!

speaker: Desmond
text: Come, Guinivere. I will play with you.

speaker: Guinivere
text: No! I want to play with him, not you! I'll go and call him back. Here, hold my fox!

speaker: Desmond
text: ......Attend me!!

speaker: Solder
text: Yes, my lord.

speaker: Desmond
text: Take this beast and kill it! Do not let Guinivere know what you do.

speaker: Soldier
text: Understood.

speaker: Desmond
text: ...Zephiel, you knave. Trying to steal my Guinivere's love... ...You will learn your place!

speaker: Hector
text: That was close... I was afraid they'd catch us.

speaker: Eliwood
text: This is worse than I'd imagined. The Black Fang has already reached the king.

speaker: Lyn
text: Their plans for Lycia failed, and now they're targeting Bern.

speaker: Hector
text: If a country as powerful as Bern moves, peace knows no hope.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What Nergal desires is powerful quintessence. Calling dragons back.. Does he wish to embroil the world in chaos? Whatever his plans, he must be stopped at any cost!

speaker: Hector
text: Right. Find the Fire Emblem and return it to the queen. We do that, and she'll point us toward the Shrine of Seals.

speaker: Lyn
text: If we go to the Black Fang fortress...

speaker: Eliwood
text: That's our goal. I must meet with everyone and seek out their fortress.

speaker: Ninian
text: I wonder if Eliwood and the others are well.

speaker: Nils
text: Please, Ninian. That's all you've spoken of since they left. I understand your concern for Lord Eliwood, but...

speaker: Ninian
text: Nils! I...

speaker: Nils
text: You don't have to hide anything from me. But you must not fall in love with him, you know? We...are different from them.

speaker: Ninian
text: ...I know. But I cannot... ......I...

speaker: Nils
text: Ninian! Where are you going?

speaker: Ninian
text: I need time to think. May I be alone, please?

speaker: Nils
text: Ninian...

speaker: Hector
text: We'd better hurry and rejoin the others. Oh, no! Look! It's a wyvern rider!

speaker: Eliwood
text: She's coming closer... Has she seen us?!

speaker: Lyn
text: No, it's not us she's seen. It's... It's Nils!!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let's go! Hector!!

speaker: Hector
text: OK!

speaker: Nils
text: Ahh! Who...who are you?

speaker: Vaida
text: Light green hair, crimson eyes... No mistake. You're one of Lord Nergal's lost toys. Yes! Found you at last!

speaker: Nils
text: ...What are you? Why can't I sense you!?

speaker: Vaida
text: What happened to your bodyguards? I heard they were tough. I wanted to see for myself. Well, you're here, so they can't be too far away, can they?

speaker: Vaida
text: C'mon, boy! Scream! Call your friends to you! I grow weary of waiting. I am not known for my patience!!!

speaker: Lyn
text: I'm the one you're looking for! Unhand the boy!

speaker: Vaida
text: You've come! I've been looking forward to this!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Looking forward... What do you mean?

speaker: Vaida
text: The chance to crush you! Then hand the children over to Lord Nergal.

speaker: Hector
text: Nergal? So you're one of his dogs, are you?

speaker: Vaida
