text: ...I'll not be called a dog by you, blackheart! True, we've a contract with the Black Fang, but... I am loyal to one master only! He who sits on the throne of Bern!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Then why are you in the employ of the Black--

speaker: Vaida
text: There's been far too much talking. Let's get started, shall we? I've long hungered for someone to test my strength against. Make this last awhile, will you? I want to enjoy this!!

speaker: Vaida
text: Listen up, everyone! It's playtime! Come on out!! The palace has promised to stay out of this! Be as wild as you will!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Tactician! Our allies are hidden here and there to avoid being spotted. This is not to our advantage. We must gather everyone quickly!!

speaker: Hector
text: Mark! We’re all scattered about and in hiding. The enemy can pick off our weaker members one by one. We’ve got to get together and protect them!

speaker: Pent
text: We'll help, too. Tell us what to do.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You as well, Lady Louise?

speaker: Louise
text: Of course.

speaker: Pent
text: No need for concern. She is quite skilled with a bow. Those Bern wyvern riders will be sorry to meet her.

speaker: Louise
text: Despite what you may think, I shoot much better than I dance or sing. I believe I can be of some small assistance.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I understand. Thank you for your help.

speaker: Pent
text: ...Now let me give you this. It's from Lord Athos.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What is it?

speaker: Pent
text: A Heaven seal... It reveals hidden strengths. It only works for a select few, but...

speaker: Eliwood
text: It has an air of mystery to it.

speaker: Pent
text: Do you think you can use it?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ... ... ......No, it won't work for me.

speaker: Pent
text: Wait for the proper time, and have the other two try it. It might not work now, but I'm sure that you will all be able to use it at some point. Just keep trying.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I understand. Thank you very much.

speaker: Pent
text: You're Tactician, is that right? Please...forget about my title and standing in my country. You are our tactician, and I will do as you command. Well then, I hope we'll work well together.

speaker: Louise
text: Mark, you are the tactician for this company, are you not? May our battles together be successful ones.

speaker: Man
text: I’ve heard some stories about the Black Fang... I hear they’ve a swordfighter who wields the fearsome Light Brand. No, he’s not here now. But you might run into him somewhere. You should be careful. The Light Brand is a magic sword. It’ll cut you if you’re close and hurl magic at you from afar. Step lightly if you know he’s on the battlefield.

speaker: Woman
text: Do you know anyone named Mark? You see, I once helped out a weary traveler... who just so happened to be a brilliant tactician! Cared for the soldiers... Won battle after battle with no casualties... Ah, I wonder if we’ll meet again...

speaker: Ursula
text: Oh, my. It’s you...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Me?

speaker: Ursula
text: That’s right. You’re with them, right? I know that this isn’t what I’m supposed to do but... I’ll not hand glory over to that newcomer, Vaida... What? Oh, nothing... I’m talking to myself. More importantly, I want to give you this. It’s a hammerne staff. It repairs items. It can make most items like new again. Promise me you’ll bring that wyvern-riding hag down. I’ll be seeing you again, I’m sure. Hee hee...

speaker: Vaida
text: Ha ha... Such a pleasant expression. That settles it. I’ll start with you.

speaker: Vaida
text: I’m...not well... ...... Oh, Prince...Zephiel....

speaker: Vaida
text: Pah! I’ve had it with being pushed here and there! Withdraw!! Ground forces, pull back! And move quickly!!

speaker: Soldier
text: Co-commander Vaida’s been beaten! Run!! While we still have our skins!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: I guess that worked out.

speaker: Ninian
text: Lord Eliwood!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian! Nils! Are you both well?

speaker: Nils
text: What shall we do, Lord Eliwood? Nergal's power... It's returning bit by bit.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Ninian
text: That woman you faced... She was protected by Nergal's magic.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Her strength... It came from Nergal?

speaker: Ninian
text: Yes. It won't be long before he's active again. With all his power restored.

speaker: Nils
text: We must hurry and gain the power to oppose him!

speaker: Eliwood
text: We have to recover the Fire Emblem. If we can do that...

speaker: Hector
text: Come on! The palace is in an uproar. This is our chance to slip away!

speaker: Lyn
text: Wait! I have an idea. Let's follow them.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis?

speaker: Lyn
text: Leave it to me. I think I might be able to find the Black Fang fortress.

speaker: Lyn
text: This way. The signs are fading, but they're really moving. I think I can track them if they keep this pace.

speaker: Hector
text: Are you sure? Really?

speaker: Lyn
text: Remember, I'm from Sacae. Bern's foot soldiers are slow and clumsy... And to a Sacaen, men are easier to track than rabbits.

speaker: Hector
text: What do you want to do, Eliwood.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let's put our trust in Lyndis. If anyone can do this, she can.

speaker: Hector
text: Are you serious?

speaker: Lyn
text: Over here, everyone!

speaker: Lyn
text: What city is this?

speaker: Sain
text: This? This is Araphen. After Ostia, it’s the second-biggest city in Lycia.

speaker: Lyn
text: The second biggest, hm? It does seem awfully busy. By the way, where’s Kent?

speaker: Sain
text: He said he was going ahead to the castle, but... Ah, here he comes now.

speaker: Kent
text: Milady Lyndis! Let us proceed to the castle. They’ve prepared supplies for us. The marquess has agreed to aid us on our journey to Caelin.

speaker: Lyn
text: He’s going to help us?

speaker: Kent
text: Yes. Araphen and Caelin have enjoyed a sturdy friendship for many years. Once I informed the marquess our plight, he agreed to lend us his strength.

speaker: Sain
text: Looks like we’ve got a smooth road ahead!

speaker: Kent
text: If we could pick up some soldiers, the road to Caelin would be that much safer. I’m truly sorry for hardships you’ve suffered so far.

speaker: Lyn
text: Don’t be silly. You are so capable, Kent.

speaker: Sain
text: Kent!?

speaker: Lyn
text: Hm? Oh, and so are you, Sain.

speaker: Sain
text: Of course I am!

speaker: Kent
text: The castle awaits...

speaker: Man
text: This is terrible! The castle is burning!!

speaker: Sain
text: What did you say? What’s happening?

speaker: Man
text: Smoke! From the castle! Hey! What are those men doing?

speaker: Lyn
text: Who are you?

speaker: Assassin
text: You! You’re Lyndis, aren’t you?

speaker: Lyn
text: Ah! What do you–

speaker: Assassin
text: No questions! Prepare yourself!!!

speaker: Lyn
text: Hey!

speaker: Assassin
text: Aaaargg! Aaaaah!!

speaker: Lyn
text: What? An arrow?

speaker: Lyn
text: Who are–

speaker: Kent
text: Milady Lyndis!

speaker: Kent
text: Are you all right?

speaker: Lyn
text: I’m fine. He... This man saved me.

speaker: Kent
text: May I ask your name?

speaker: Lyn
text: Wait! Why did you help me?

speaker: Rider
text: I thought a Sacaean plainswoman was being attacked. I was mistaken.

speaker: Lyn
text: No, you were right! I am from Sacae. I’m Lyn, the daughter of the Lorca chieftain.

speaker: Rider
text: The Lorca? There were survivors?

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes.

speaker: Rider
text: You should leave at once. A blaze has started in the castle, and it’s spreading. Don’t be foolish and waste the life I just saved.

speaker: Lyn
text: You’re from the castle? What’s happening? How severe is the fire? Is the marquess safe?

speaker: Rider
text: The castle is under attack, and the marquess has been accosted. The man who attacked you was probably one of the marauders. As captain of the castle guard, it’s my duty to rescue the marquess.

speaker: Lyn
text: I see... All right then, we’ll help you.

speaker: Kent
text: Milady?

speaker: Rider
text: Why?

speaker: Lyn
text: These brigands are after me. If they’re attacking the castle, it’s because of me. So I must help if I can...

speaker: Rider
text: It sounds like you’re involved somehow... Let’s go.

speaker: Lyn
text: You’ll accept our aid?

speaker: Rath
text: I am Rath of the Kutolah. Our tribes may be different, but I will not abandon a woman of the Sacae.

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you, Rath! A thousand blessings upon you!

speaker: Rath
text: And a thousand curses upon our enemy!

speaker: Lyn
text: Come!

speaker: Woman
text: You! What are you doing in my house?!

speaker: Thief
text: Peace! I mean no danger to you! Your home offers a good view of the battle outside. Look, I’ll pay you for the privilege. Please.

speaker: Woman
text: Like a vulture waiting for the spoils, eh? Terrible! Pay up! I’ll be hiding below, so don’t bother me.

speaker: Thief
text: I wouldn’t dream of it.

speaker: Thief
text: Now then, which side has the most to offer?

speaker: Rath
text: Once the marquess is safe, my men can move in. Perhaps the secret passageway...

speaker: Lyn
text: Secret passageway?

speaker: Rath
text: An underground tunnel leading to the throne room. There are triggers in the barracks that will open the tunnel.

speaker: Lyn
text: Head through the passage to the throne room... and rescue the marquess. Once that’s done, can you drive the enemy from the castle?

speaker: Rath
text: Mmm... If we can release those triggers, my men and I can handle the rest. There are three triggers, though. All three need to be released, or the entrance won’t open.

speaker: Lyn
text: But the doors to the barracks are locked.

speaker: Rath
text: The enemy’s within. If we don’t get inside and finish them, we’re stuck.

speaker: Lyn
text: So opening those doors is our first objective.

speaker: Tutorial
text: The goal of this chapter is to open the doors and reach the 3 triggers located inside. To open doors, you need door keys or the services of a thief.

speaker: Lyn
text: What shall we do, Mark? We don’t have any keys with us. Perhaps some of the marauders are carrying keys...

speaker: Tutorial
text: There may be times when you are unsure how to proceed. Start by checking Status on the Map Menu. Visiting homes or villages is also a good way to get information. Who knows what hints you might find. Let’s try visiting a house. Please select Lyn.

speaker: Lyn
text: What do you want me to do? Tell me, please!

speaker: Lyn
text: Wasn’t I supposed to visit somewhere? Directions, please!

speaker: Thief
text: Hey, you! Can I talk to you?

speaker: Lyn
text: Who are you?

speaker: Matthew
text: I’m Matthew, a specialist in acquisitions of all kinds. Would you like to buy my services?

speaker: Lyn
text: I’ve no need for a thief.

speaker: Matthew
text: Really? And how do you plan on opening the barrack doors?

speaker: Lyn
text: What? How did you know about–

speaker: Matthew
text: Bullseye!

speaker: Matthew
text: Don’t be mad. Hire me. For you, I’ll even lower my normal rate.

speaker: Lyn
text: I do need those doors opened... OK. You’re hired. Why did you choose to ally yourself with me?

speaker: Matthew
text: Hm? I was watching the battle from up above. Your group looked like a lot more fun than the dead guy. Pretty simple, really.

speaker: Lyn
text: You’re so odd.

speaker: Matthew
text: It’s time to get to work!

speaker: Tutorial
text: The thief Matthew has joined your group. Thieves have picks, which they use to open doors and chests. Picks are usable by thieves alone. It’s time to open that door. Select Matthew.

speaker: Matthew
text: Pardon! You’re Mark, right? I’m Matthew.

speaker: Matthew
text: This is no good. Even I’m not so good I can open a door from this distance.

speaker: Matthew
text: I can’t open a door I can’t reach! Move me in front of it!

speaker: Tutorial
text: The door has been opened. With that, you can also see inside the room behind the door. Within the room there’s a different-colored floor tile. Tiles that seem different in some way might be the triggers we’re looking for. Select Rath, move him to that tile, and order him to wait. Triggers can be released by having allied units wait on them.

speaker: Rath
text: You! You’re Mark? Have you found the trigger? If so, direct me to it!

speaker: Rath
text: I don’t see any trigger there. Do you? I didn’t think so.

speaker: Rath
text: That takes care of the first one. Two more to go.

speaker: Matthew
text: Hey! Unless my eyes deceive me, that’s a chest! Say, Mark! Since we came all this way, what say we help ourselves? Huh? What do you mean,No? Don’t be such a bore. If you want to win, you’ve got to use every means at your disposal. That’s an ironclad rule! Yeah, I know stealing’s bad. I’m well aware of that. We’re saving the marquess, right? Let’s just call this an advance on our reward. OK?

speaker: Tutorial
text: Thieves can use their picks to open chests. Move Matthew onto the chest, and the chest command will appear. Choose this command, and the contents of the chest will become yours. Why don’t we see what we can find? Go ahead and select Matthew.

speaker: Matthew
text: Battles aren’t won by virtue and glory alone. No one’s going to miss a couple of chests. Relax.

speaker: Matthew
text: Hey! Changed your mind? Hurrah! Treasure time! Treasure time!

speaker: Matthew
text: Oh, come on! There’s a chest right there in front of us!

speaker: Matthew
text: Hey! This is an angelic robe. This is good for those of us on the...less robust side. Like me, for example. Magic items like this that increase one’s abilities vanish after being used. Give them to the people who need them most. But don’t fret too much about it, or you’ll never use them. Simply holding on to a useful item does no one any good.

speaker: Tutorial
text: An angelic robe increases a character’s max HP by a small amount. Select the item on the item list and use it. To view more detailed information on items, press the R Button on the item list. A thief has the skill to open doors and chests, right? That ability can only be utilized if the thief has a set of picks. The number next to an item is the number of times the item can be used before the item breaks. Keep that in mind.

speaker: Matthew
text: An armorslayer! Just as the name suggests, armorslayers are useful against knights in armor. You want to know something? You need to give weapons to those who can wield them. Otherwise, it’s just a waste of a perfectly good weapon. Take this blade. I mean, I can use it, but... I’m not too strong, and... I just hate being counterattacked. Anyway, think strategically about who you give weapons to.

speaker: Tutorial
text: If you get a weapon or staff you can’t use, don’t worry. Other members of your party might be able to wield them. Items you cannot use appear in gray text. Try trading these items to others in your group. Don’t forget: you can only trade items with one other character at a time.

speaker: Lyn
text: That takes care of the second. Just one more!

speaker: Sain
text: That’s the second trigger. Only one more.

speaker: Kent
text: I guess that was the second trigger. That leaves one more.

speaker: Florina
text: Ah... This must be the second trigger... Everyone! There’s one more trigger!

speaker: Wil
text: Yes! That was the second trigger. I’ve got to find that last one.

speaker: Dorcas
text: There’s the second one... One left to find...

speaker: Serra
text: Hm? So that’s the second trigger? Listen up! Just one trigger left!

speaker: Erk
text: I guess that was the second trigger. That leaves one more.

speaker: Rath
text: That’s trigger number two. Where’s the last one...

speaker: Matthew
text: As I thought, that’s the second trigger. There’s only one more to go.

speaker: Man
text: We can’t do business with all the fighting in town. You’re mercenaries, right? Can’t you do something? Huh? You can’t get the barracks open? I bet a thief with a set of picks could open any door you needed. Hold on. I may have something here to help you... Here it is! This is it. One door key. Door keys can only be used once, but anyone can use them. Here! No charge. Now go get those thugs, will you.

speaker: Old Man
text: So what’s your weapon of choice? Swords, lances, spears? Or do you favor bows or magic? Staves? Whatever it may be, the more you use it, the more skilled you become. Swinging your sword about will allow you to master it. Eventually, you’ll be able to wield weapons of greater power. It’s as they say: Practice makes perfect. You can check your skill level by pressing the R Button.

speaker: Man
text: The captain of the marquess’s guard is a fellow named Rath... I’ve heard tell that he’s a nomad from the plains of Sacae. Odd, considering how the marquess so obviously hates the nomads. I guess the marquess is pleased to have a nomad under his control. The ways of aristocrats are beyond my comprehension.

speaker: Lady
text: The marquess of Araphen’s hatred for the people of Sacae is well known. Nomads are barred entrance to the city on the marquess’s orders. He says he will not allow the nomads’ stench to infect his city. Long ago, the marquess was in love with Marquess Caelin’s daughter. It’s said she spurned him in favor of a nomadic prince. Even so, I think the marquess goes too far in his treatment of the horsemen.

speaker: Serra
text: I feel something... I feel it!!! Someone’s staring at me! It must be some poor fool who’s smitten with me. Alas, my beauty has rendered him speechless. Ah... I’m so cute it’s almost criminal.

speaker: Matthew
text: What in the world is that woman doing here? I cannot let HER find the passageway...

speaker: Bool
text: Bah. Lyndis and her cadre. When did you arrive? No matter. I shall deal with you.

speaker: Bool
text: Gah! Lord Lundgren…

speaker: Lyn
text: So this is the final one. We should be good to go.

speaker: Sain
text: The last trigger. This should do it.

speaker: Kent
text: This must be the last trigger. That should do it.

speaker: Florina
text: Hey... This just might be the last trigger. So, I only need to...

speaker: Wil
text: Aha! Found it! The last trigger... Well, here goes...

speaker: Dorcas
text: The final trigger. If I just press this...

speaker: Serra
text: Eww. Is this the last trigger? Guess I’ll try moving it around.

speaker: Erk
text: This must be the last trigger. That should do it, then.

speaker: Rath
text: This is it. The last trigger. If I press this...

speaker: Matthew
text: OK. This is the last one. This should do the trick.

speaker: Lyn
text: Here it is, Mark! The hidden passageway! Good work! We’ll let Rath take over from here.

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: Ah, it’s Rath! You’ve done well. What a performance!

speaker: Rath
text: Sir... If you have praise, it should be given to this group.

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: Hm? Who are you?

speaker: Lyn
text: My name is Lyndis. I’m pleased you’re well.

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: Oh... It’s you. You’re Marquess Caelin’s– Leave us, Rath. I would speak with this girl.

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: Now... Lady Lyndis. Do you know the identity of those responsible for this uproar?

speaker: Lyn
text: I believe it to be the work of my granduncle, Lundgren.

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: That’s exactly right. Which means my castle has been damaged in your family’s petty inheritance dispute.

speaker: Lyn
text: My-My apologies...

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: When I heard that Lady Madelyn’s daughter was in trouble, I thought to lend my assistance... I find I’ve changed my mind. I withdraw my offer.

speaker: Kent
text: Marquess Araphen! You gave me your word, my lord!

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: ... Your name is Kent, is it not? You failed to inform me of one most vital detail!

speaker: Kent
text: What... What do you mean?

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: This girl does resemble Lady Madelyn, but... I didn’t expect to see her so tainted with the blood of Sacae.

speaker: Lyn
text: What?!?

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: Don’t you feel the marquess of Caelin would be troubled to meet this... nomadic mongrel?

speaker: Sain
text: You–!

speaker: Kent
text: Sain! Hold! My apologies, my lord Marquess.

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: Hm... Your man is poorly disciplined.

speaker: Kent
text: Marquess Araphen! Please... If you would grace us with your aid...

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: ...... I hear Marquess Caelin is ill and abed. I question whether he will survive to meet this girl. In which case, his brother, Lundgren, will claim his title. And I certainly wish to avoid trouble with the coming marquess.

speaker: Sain
text: You scheming...

speaker: Kent
text: Sain!

speaker: Lyn
text: I understand. Kent, Sain, we take our leave at once.

speaker: Kent
text: Milady Lyndis! We–

speaker: Lyn
text: I am proud of the Sacae blood that runs through my veins. I will NOT accept aid from one who disparages my heritage.

speaker: Sain
text: That was well done, milady! The marquess is a lout! Don’t worry about anything. We’re all here for you! Isn’t that so, Kent?

speaker: Sain
text: I beg your forgiveness.

speaker: Lyn
text: Why are you apologizing, Kent?

speaker: Kent
text: I’ve been so concerned with seeing you to Caelin. I failed to take your feelings into account.

speaker: Lyn
text: Is that it? Trouble yourself no more. You have put my safety above all else. I have seen that. Hold your head up and be proud.

speaker: Kent
text: Milady Lyndis...

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: Bah! Arrogant child! If she had but shed a single tear, I would have granted her request. We Lycian nobles will never understand those prideful savages.

speaker: Rath
text: ...... Are those your true feelings toward the nomads of Sacae, milord?

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: What? Oh, Rath! I didn’t see you there. My comments do not reflect on you. You are my captain. I’m proud of your service.

speaker: Rath
text: Of course. As long as we bend our knee to you, you care not where we’re from. But when an equal comes from my lands? What conceit.

speaker: Marquess Araphen
text: Rath! How can you speak to me like that? I have treated you well, have I not? I have paid you well. I have treated you better than your kind deserves.

speaker: Rath
text: You will never understand. My service ends here.

speaker: Lyn
text: The marquess of Araphen... He said my grandfather was ill. We must hurry to Caelin...

speaker: Kent
text: As we approach Caelin, Lundgren’s obstacles will be more difficult to overcome. However, I’ve vowed to see you through to the end, milady!

speaker: Lyn
text: I’m counting on you, Kent.

speaker: Sain
text: I’m with you, too!

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you, Sain.

speaker: Lyn
text: Mark... Thank you for always standing at my side. It’s because of all of you that I... I will persevere! They will never break my spirit!

speaker: Lyn
text: Rath! What is it? What are you–

speaker: Rath
text: I overheard the marquess talking to himself. Lyn of the Lorca... Proud daughter of the Sacae... I would join you. I would add my strength to yours.

speaker: Lyn
text: Really?

speaker: Rath
text: And this... I want you to take it.

speaker: Lyn
text: This is... Gold!? It’s too much. I can’t accept it.

speaker: Rath
text: I have no need for it. And if it will help you...

speaker: Lyn
text: But...

speaker: Rath
text: I cannot take back something once offered.

speaker: Lyn
text: Rath... I thank you.

speaker: Kent
text: Lady Lyndis, you should be able to see Castle Caelin once we pass these mountains.

speaker: Lyn
text: Grandfather… I’ll be with you soon.

speaker: Kent
text: Everything rests on this next battle.

speaker: Sain
text: Lundgren will not be receiving the reinforcements he expected. He’ll move against us with everything he has soon.

speaker: Lyn
text: Let him come! Let them all come! I will not be turned away! I will see my grandfather… I’ve come too far to let anyone stand in my way. This is it, Mark. This is our final test. My friends, for one last time, lend me your strength!

speaker: Lyn
text: Those clouds look bad. It’s going to rain soon. Let’s go, Mark. We should press on while we’re still able.

speaker: Lyn
text: Look! The clouds are breaking. This rain should stop soon…

speaker: Lyn
text: It’s begun to rain, but… the sky looks mostly clear. The rain won’t last long.

speaker: Young Lady
text: Oh, no! If I don’t bring in the laundry now… Oh, hello. Are you a soldier? Sounds like a hard life… Especially when it rains. Rain must make it difficult for you to move around. I used to ride horses when I was little. Oh, I remember how those horses disliked the rain. It’s better to be on foot when it’s wet. Nomadic horses are trained on the plains, so they’re better with rain, but… Well, rain just seems to make it hard for everyone to get around. The weather around here can change in no time at all. I recommend just staying in one place until the rain clears up.

speaker: Young Man
text: You’re here to fight Lundgren, aren’t you? Do you have enough weapons? Lundgren’s no ordinary knight: he’s a general. Iron weapons lack the edge to penetrate his armor. If you need something, visit my father’s armory. You should go to the shop next door to his, too. They’ve many powerful weapons and items you can use against Lundgren. Head south and cross the river. You’ll see them. Lundgren’s a tricky one. He’s destroyed the bridge. There’s an old snag next to the river, though… If you knocked it over, you should be able to cross. Travel well. You fight for us all.

speaker: Man
text: You know, you really should visit the armory next door. They’ve got all you need if you’re fighting knights and generals. You need something to defeat Lundgren, right? Once he’s been beaten, maybe peace will return to Caelin. Good luck to you!

speaker: Old Lady
text: You’ve finally made it here, have you? Such a long way… We’re all behind Lady Lyndis. All of us. Here, take this. Use it in your battle against Lundgren, please. It’s an energy ring. It’ll increase your strength and magic power a bit. There are lots of items that augment your abilities. These are hard to come by, so think carefully before you use them. Of course, not using them at all would be a terrible waste as well, right? Items like this might vanish once you’ve used them. Bear that in mind, and use them wisely.

speaker: Lundgren
text: This is my realm, and you’ve entered without my permission. You will not leave these lands alive!

speaker: Lundgren
text: That annoying little girl… Nothing but a savage from Sacae… The Caelin throne…should be…mine…

speaker: Lundgren
text: So you’re the girl claiming kinship with my brother!

speaker: Lyn
text: You’ll play this farce to the end, won’t you Lundgren?

speaker: Lundgren
text: The royal house of Caelin has no need of a Sacaen mongrel! I’ll put an end to this foolishness here and now!

speaker: Lyn
text: To further your own black ambitions, you’ve harmed my grandfather and the very land you ought to serve. I have neither pity nor mercy for you. Lundgren! Prepare yourself!

speaker: Lundgren
text: Whelp!

speaker: Lundgren
text: Ah. One of the traitors. You must be…Kent, yes?

speaker: Kent
text: Lundgren, your treachery precedes you. I will not listen to any of your poisoned words!

speaker: Lundgren
text: You’re a fool! You’ll wish you’d never turned your coat!

speaker: Lundgren
text: Ah, Sain… You’re not like that stubborn fool, Kent. You’re reasonable. Leave this child, Lyndis, and stand at my side. You will go far in my service.

speaker: Sain
text: That is a gracious offer, my lord…

speaker: Lundgren
text: Quite…

speaker: Sain
text: However, I am rather fond of my friend the stubborn fool. And if I am to pledge my service to any liege, I would choose lovely Lady Lyndis over Foul Lundgren, regardless of the risk!

speaker: Lundgren
text: Fool! I will make you regret your decision!

speaker: Lyn
text: We’ve won… At last, I can see my grandfather.

speaker: Reissmann
text: You are Lady Lyndis, are you not?

speaker: Lyn
text: Who are you?

speaker: Reissmann
text: I am Reissmann, the chancellor of the Caelin royal family. I had receive word from Kent and Sain when you first met, but then Lundgren discovered the message and imprisoned me. It is my great pleasure to welcome you to your true home.

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you. May I see my grandfather now?

speaker: Reissmann
text: Yes, of course. Do not be shocked by what you see. Lundgren has been poisoning the marquess’s meals for some time. His body has been ravaged… He’s been bedridden for months.

speaker: Lord Hausen
text: Who is there? I said no visitors. I will see no one.

speaker: Lord Hausen
text: What are you doing? Leave me…to die…

speaker: Lyn
text: Um… Pardon me… My name is… I’m Lyndis.

speaker: Lord Hausen
text: Eh? Did you say Lyndis? Is that…

speaker: Lyn
text: My father’s name was Hassar, chieftain of the Lorca. My mother was…Madelyn. I was raised on the plains.

speaker: Lord Hausen
text: … Could it be? Come, come here. Let me see your face.

speaker: Lord Hausen
text: Oh… Yes… There is no doubt… You are Madelyn’s trueborn child… Uhhh…ahhhh…

speaker: Lyn
text: Grandfather!

speaker: Lord Hausen
text: Lundgren told me that my daughter had died. My heir…and you, too. He told me you were dead. Thank you… Thank you for living. Ahhhh… I am blessed…

speaker: Lyn
text: Mother and Father were slain last year by brigands. I… I was the only survivor. I lived on, but…

speaker: Lord Hausen
text: Lyndis, please forgive a prideful old man. If I had but accepted your parents’ love… There would have been no bandits. We would have lived here together in perfect peace.

speaker: Lyn
text: Grandfather. My parents… My tribe… Our life was one of love and peace. The end was tragic, but… up until the attack, we were truly happy.

speaker: Lord Hausen
text: Truly? Madelyn had a life of happiness? Knowing that gives me so much joy. Thank you, Lyndis. I can die in peace now…

speaker: Lyn
text: No! Grandfather! You mustn’t say that!

speaker: Lord Hausen
text: There’s no avoiding it, Lyndis. I’ve taken too much poison for far too long. It’s too late…

speaker: Lyn
text: Be brave, Grandfather! You will recover! Believe me! On the plains, we say that illness fails in the face of a strong heart! I am with you now! You mustn’t give up!

speaker: Lord Hausen
text: You’re…with me…

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes. We have so much to talk about. Walks to take, music to listen to. There’s so much I want to do with you, so much lost time we can recover!

speaker: Lord Hausen
text: That does sound… nice.

speaker: Lyn
text: Doesn’t it? And once you’re well, I’ll take you to the plains. I’ll show you the endless sky, the oceans of grass… I want you to know the lands my mother loved so much!

speaker: Lord Hausen
text: The lands Madelyn loved… You’re right. I still have… quite a bit of living to do.

speaker: Lyn
text: You can do it, Grandfather!

speaker: Lord Hausen
text: Lyndis…

speaker: Sain
text: Lady Lyndis! Do you honestly plan on remaining here? Tell me truly!

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, until my grandfather is well. I can’t leave him now. I won’t.

speaker: Kent
text: The physician says that Lord Hausen looks like a new man. It’s like he was never ill. And it’s all thanks to you, milady.

speaker: Lyn
text: He’s the only family I have left. I want him to have a long life.

speaker: Florina
text: Lady Lyndis!

speaker: Lyn
text: What is it, Florina?

speaker: Florina
text: I’ve been taken into service by House Caelin! From here on, Lyn… I mean, Lady Lyndis… We’ll be together always!

speaker: Lyn
text: Really? Oh, that pleases me so…but… Please don’t call me Lady Lyndis. For you, I’m still just Lyn.

speaker: Florina
text: My pegasus and I fly for your house now. I am your servant. There are rules to follow.

speaker: Lyn
text: Florina!

speaker: Florina
text: I’m happiest when I’m with you. That’s more important than how I address you… Please…

speaker: Lyn
text: I suppose I’ll just have to get used to it, right? Very well. I understand.

speaker: Florina
text: Oh, thank you! I do love you, Lyn!

speaker: Florina
text: Oops! I mean… Lady Lyndis!

speaker: Lyn
text: Ha ha ha… Oh, Florina!

speaker: Wil
text: Lady Lyndis! I’ve decided to stay, too!

speaker: Lyn
text: Wil? Weren’t you planning on returning home?

speaker: Wil
text: Well, I was but… I’ve grown quite fond of Lyndis’s Legions, you know… I couldn’t possibly leave everyone behind. I’ll send word to my family regarding my decision.

speaker: Lyn
text: I’m pleased to have you, Wil. Thank you.

speaker: Wil
text: Thank you, milady.

speaker: Lyn
text: Mark… you’re leaving, aren’t you? No, I’m not asking you to stay. It’s just… I’ll miss you. When I found you unconscious on the plains… I had no idea we would be together for so long. You’ve helped us so much, and I’m sure you’ve learned all you can from us. You’ll do just fine on your own. I have the utmost faith that you’ll be a master tactician, Mark. That’s from someone who’s seen you at work!

speaker: Lyn
text: Well then, take care… I… I hope I see you again. I’m sure that I will someday…

speaker: Tutorial
text: As of Chapter 11, Eliwood becomes the story’s main character. Mark’s role will be to act as tactician, aiding his group. Help Eliwood to fulfill the chapter goals and fight his way to the end of the game. You’ll start your first campaign with Eliwood, then meet his friend, Hector, in chapter 12. And who knows? You might even meet Lyn again. If any of these three is defeated, your game will be over. The game will continue if any other allied units are defeated. However, a defeated unit can never take part in combat again, so be careful!

speaker: Lyn
text: This place... It's...

speaker: Sain
text: The entire area is in ruins. Why doesn't their marquess do anything to help?

speaker: Lyn
text: Taliver Mountain is home to a gang of vicious, ruthless bandits. No marquess holds power here. My village was near here, on the other side of the mountain. My people were... The Taliver bandits came at night. It took only one night. The survivors numbered less than ten, including me. They're soulless beasts. I will never forgive them. Never.

speaker: Sain
text: Lyndis...

speaker: Lyn
text: I am not running away. I will be back...someday. I'll be stronger... I will break their swords beneath me like twigs beneath a stallion's hooves. I will avenge my people. I'll do everything in my power.

speaker: Sain
text: When the time comes, bring me with you.

speaker: Lyn
text: Sain.

speaker: Kent
text: Don't forget me, either.

speaker: Lyn
text: Kent...Oh! You, too, Tactician? I... You're... Thank you.

speaker: Migal
text: Wait right there, little lady! What are you going to do to apologize? Huh?

speaker: Florina
text: Uh...I...That is, I...

speaker: Brigand
text: Hey, she's quite a catch, eh, buddy? I bet the boss'd give us a pretty penny for her.

speaker: Migal
text: Yeah. She roughed me up a bit, so I figure fair's fair. It's no more'n she deserves.

speaker: Brigand
text: What are we gonna do with her flying mule?

speaker: Florina
text: Don't you dare touch her!

speaker: Brigand
text: What? You just watch your mouth, girlie!

speaker: Florina
text: Do what you will with me, just... Let her go. Please, I beg of you.

speaker: Migal
text: Ha ha ha! Silly twit! Pegasi can only be found in Ilia. They're rare beasts, worth far more than you by far! We can sell it for a mountain of gold. Let it go? HA!

speaker: Florina
text: No, you can't...

speaker: Migal
text: C'mon! Let's move!

speaker: Kent
text: What's this? Be on your guard, Lyndis. There seems to be some sort of commotion over there.

speaker: Lyn
text: That's... That's a pegasus. Could it be?

speaker: Lyn (Far Off)
text: Florina?

speaker: Lyn
text: Is that you, Florina?

speaker: Florina
text: Ah! Lyn?

speaker: Lyn
text: Florina! What are you doing in a place such as this?

speaker: Florina
text: Lyn! Is it really you? I... I...

speaker: Lyn
text: Come now, no crying!

speaker: Florina
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Kent
text: You are acquaintances?

speaker: Lyn
text: She's my friend. This is Florina, a pegasus knight in training from Ilia. She's a little uncomfortable around men. Tell me, Florina, what happened here?

speaker: Florina
text: Well...um... When I heard that you had left... I decided to follow you. Then I saw this village. I flew down to ask if they had news of you. I didn't see those two, and...well...

speaker: Lyn
text: Did your pegasus land on them?

speaker: Florina
text: Well, I... A little...

speaker: Brigand
text: Aha! You heard her! She admits her fault! She stepped on my friend, and now she's got to pay!

speaker: Lyn
text: Did you apologize, Florina?

speaker: Florina
text: Yes. I told them I was sorry many times over. They just wouldn't listen. ...

speaker: Lyn
text: Don't cry, it's alright.

speaker: Florina
text: Lyn...

speaker: Lyn
text: Listen, she's obviously sorry. Can't we just let this pass? You don't appear to be injured or anything.

speaker: Migal
text: No chance. The girl goes with us—by force if need be!

speaker: Migal
text: Hey! C'mon out now, boys! The men are fair game, but don't put a scratch on the girls!

speaker: Lyn
text: Tactician! We've got to fight back!

speaker: Florina
text: Lyn... I...

speaker: Lyn
text: You're a pegasus knight, aren't you? You can fight, can't you?

speaker: Florina
text: ...Yes!

speaker: Lyn
text: Listen carefully, Tactician. We're facing bandits. They're underlings, but we can't take them too lightly. Let's clear them out of here. Are you ready?

speaker: Lyn
text: The layout around here might make it difficult to fight. The same holds true for our foe, too. If we use these walls just so, they may ensure our victory.

speaker: Florina
text: Lyn... Who's that?

speaker: Lyn
text: This is Tactician. He/She's still an apprentice, but he/she's my tactician.

speaker: Florina
text: Oh, I see... Uh, Tactician? I'm pleased to meet you.

speaker: Florina
text: Oh, I see... Well, Tactician... I'm pleased to meet you.

speaker: Tutorial
text: The red-roofed buildings are villages. Villages are in danger of being attacked. If an enemy unit reaches a village before one of our units does, the village will be destroyed. As quickly as possible, visit the residents and give them warning. Only good can come of it. So, let's visit them. Please select Lyn.

speaker: Lyn
text: You want me to visit a village? Just give me the order.

speaker: Lyn
text: I'm to visit a village, right? Then issue the command.

speaker: Lyn
text: You'd like me to visit a village, right? Just give the order!

speaker: Lyn
text: Is anyone there?

speaker: Villager
text: Leave us alone, you thugs!

speaker: Other Villager
text: Go away! Go away! We've no more gold for you!

speaker: Lyn
text: No, wait! Please! We're not bandits! We want to help the village. Please listen!
Remain inside, everyone. I'll go see what's happening.

speaker: Wil
text: Not bandits, huh? So, who are you?

speaker: Lyn
text: My name is Lyn. My colleagues and I are just traveling through here. We saw some bandits about. We're going to deal with them, but... We need you to go and warn the villagers.

speaker: Wil
text: Hey! Wait! The name's Wil. I'm a traveler of sorts, too. Listen, these villagers have been kind to me. Mind if I fight with you?

speaker: Lyn
text: Not at all. We need all the help we can get! Welcome aboard, Wil!

speaker: Tutorial
text: By visiting a village, we gained a new companion. Wil is an archer. He uses a bow to fight. Bows can be fired at foes more than 1 space away. Obstacles won't affect your line of fire. Attacking enemies without moving next to them is called indirect combat. If the enemy has no weapons capable of indirect combat, there's no fear of counterattack, and that's to our benefit. However, you cannot fire on adjacent spaces. If someone moves next to you and attacks, that's it. Units with bows are best suited to lend assistance from the rear. Let's try some indirect combat, shall we? Select Wil.

speaker: Wil
text: So, you are Mark Tactician? I am Wil, master marksman. No, the pleasure is mine! It looks like there are bandits on the other side of that wall. To the east is another archer. So let's go to that thug to the north. He's all mine! Say the word, Tactician!

speaker: Wil
text: Hey! It's me! Wil, remember? Why don't you issue me a command? I'd love to help!

speaker: Wil
text: Let's take out the bandit on the north side of the wall! Direct me that way!

speaker: Tutorial
text: Next is Florina, a pegasus knight. As you might guess, pegasus knights have the ability to fly. They can move over almost any terrain type. This small wall would stop most units, but it poses no problem for a pegasus knight. Select Florina.

speaker: Florina
text: So...it's my turn now? I expect you'll want me to attack that...man...over there. Well...give me the...order, please.

speaker: Florina
text: To the north... On the other side of the wall. I'm to attack the other guy over there, right? Please give me the order to attack, and I shall do so.

speaker: Florina
text: I... I am ready to fight. I'll follow your orders...

speaker: Florina
text: I won't give up! Please, you must let me join the fight!

speaker: Florina
text: Excuse me... I hate to be a bother, but... If I'm to attack, I'll need to be right next to the enemy. ...I'll shut up now.

speaker: Florina
text: Begging your pardon... I have to be next to an enemy to attack. Please give me the chance to attack.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Knowing your units and their abilities and knowing how to use them in battle is a shortcut to victory. To learn everything about a unit, place the cursor on that unit and press the R Button.

speaker: Florina
text: Lyn! What should I do? There's an archer!!!

speaker: Lyn
text: What? Where!? Oh, that's Wil.

speaker: Wil
text: Hi! You're one of Lyn's friends?

speaker: Wil
text: What... What is it? Are you unwell?

speaker: Lyn
text: I'm sorry, Wil. Her name is Florina. She's timid around men, and you...you've got a bow.

speaker: Wil
text: Oh! I see! You must be a pegasus knight! I apologize for frightening you, but I do understand your fear of bows.

speaker: Florina
text: I...um... ...I'm sorry... Even looking...at a...bow...frightens me ever so much...

speaker: Wil
text: Of course, I understand. But you should really only fear the enemy's archers, not your own.

speaker: Florina
text: Yes...Of course...

speaker: Tutorial
text: Units that fly, like pegasus knights, are very vulnerable to bow attacks. Arrows will deal critical damage to them. If the enemy has bow-wielding units, you must be extremely cautious.

speaker: Girl
text: You came to help the village? That's good. With so many bandits, I wasn't sure what to do. It's not much, but please, take this money. There is an armory to the southeast of us. Equip yourself as you see fit, and help us, please.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Weapons have the strength to be used only a limited number of times. As you fight, their endurance drops. At zero, the weapon breaks and disappears from your inventory. Check your weapon endurance by placing the cursor on a unit and pressing the R Button. You can also check on the item screen. The number next to the weapon is its endurance. Be careful. Without a weapon a unit cannot enter combat.

speaker: Migal
text: Draw your swords! We're not listening to any of your stinking apologies!

speaker: Migal
text: Ugh... You'll live to regret this... My brothers... The Ganelon bandits will not let this stand...

speaker: Lyn
text: Hey, listen! There's something I wanted to ask you.

speaker: Migal
text: Begging for your life so soon, wench?

speaker: Lyn
text: Are you...Taliver bandits?

speaker: Migal
text: Taliver? Those greedy monsters? We're nothing like them!! Those fiends will even kill women and children! We're from Ganelon, and we know a little something of honor. We don't harm women, for one thing. Heh heh heh. After all, why kill what you can sell?

speaker: Lyn
text: If you're not Taliver, then there's no reason for you to die here today. If you would like to tuck your tails and flee, do so now.

speaker: Migal
text: You... You... No more courtesies! You're going to learn to watch your tongue!!!

speaker: Florina
text: Um... Excuse me...

speaker: Migal
text: Uh? It's you! So, you changed your mind about joining us, eh?

speaker: Florina
text: Well...no... But...this really is...my fault... Really... So, can we...

speaker: Migal
text: What?! C'mon, lass, out with it!

speaker: Florina
text: I'm sorry. Can we... Can we just stop fighting now?

speaker: Migal
text: You've got to be kidding. After I've been made to look like a fool? No way!

speaker: Florina
text: Eeek!

speaker: Migal
text: You're coming with us! I promise you that!! Now, if you don't want to get hurt, give yourself up!

speaker: Lyn
text: That's finally taken care of.

speaker: Florina
text: Lyn!

speaker: Lyn
text: Florina... Why did you follow me? It's so dangerous.

speaker: Florina
text: Do you remember the knighting ceremony of the Pegasus Knights of Ilia?

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, you join a band of freelance soldiers to further your training. Is that what brought you here, Florina?

speaker: Florina
text: Uh-huh. I wanted to talk to you before I set out. But when I went to Sacae, I heard you had left with some strangers, and...

speaker: Lyn
text: You were worried for me? Thank you, but I'm more worried about you.

speaker: Florina
text: Me?

speaker: Lyn
text: Listen, most mercenaries are men, right? Bands of men? I can't imagine you being at all comfortable around them.

speaker: Florina
text: I know, I know. It's just... I've always dreamt of being a pegasus knight. I imagined I would just...work it out. Somehow. After today, I'm not so sure. Maybe I should just...give up...

speaker: Lyn
text: Florina, don't cry...

speaker: Sain
text: Yes, there's no reason to give up your dream!

speaker: Lyn
text: Hm?

speaker: Sain
text: Lovely Florina! I have the most brillant idea!

speaker: Kent
text: Sain!

speaker: Sain
text: You should come with us! With the addition of Wil here, we're a fine group of soldiers, and freelance to boot!

speaker: Wil
text: Wait, did you just include me?

speaker: Sain
text: Of course! We were destined to meet here! It's fate! Come now, Lyndis's band of mercenaries is as good a training group as you'll find anywhere!

speaker: Kent
text: Sain... This is no joking matter!

speaker: Florina
text: Lyndis? Um, Lyn? Mercenaries?

speaker: Lyn
text: I can give you details later. This is all a bit rushed. However, Sain is right. Will you come with us, Florina?

speaker: Florina
text: Travel with you, Lyn? Truly? I would be so...so happy!

speaker: Sain
text: Fantastic! Beauteous Florina! I am a knight of Caelin. My name is Sain...

speaker: Florina
text: Eeek! Stay back! Don't get so close.

speaker: Sain
text: Ah... Beautiful, and yet so modest!

speaker: Kent
text: I beg your forgiveness. Calling us mercenaries...

speaker: Lyn
text: No, I approve. We can't leave Florina on her own. She requires special attention though. Can I count on you?

speaker: Kent
text: Yes! You have but to ask.

speaker: Wil
text: So... Is it really all right if I travel with you?

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh, yes. Of course! If you're willing, Wil.

speaker: Wil
text: Actually, I'm very grateful. Truth be told, all of my money was stolen, and I'm...at a bit of a crossroads. I would be honored to count myself one of Lyndis's Legion!

speaker: Lyn
text: Lyndis's Legion? This is getting stranger with every day, Tactician.

speaker: Nergal
text: Shame on you, Marquess Pherae. You freed the boy AND the girl?

speaker: Elbert
text: I will not let you move unopposed!

speaker: Darin
text: Wh-What shall we do, Lord Nergal? With both siblings gone, we can no longer hold the ceremony.

speaker: Elbert
text: How many times must I tell you, Lord Darin? You are being used by this man!! By helping him bring dragons back into this world, you are helping him destroy mankind! Do you understand?!?

speaker: Darin
text: Pah...ha ha ha... Destroy mankind? Dragons may have been a threat to mankind in ages past, but with Lord Nergal's power, we've got nothing to fear! Lord Nergal can control dragons!!! Ha ha...ha ha ha...

speaker: Elbert
text: Lord Darin.... You're already lost.

speaker: Nergal
text: I'd planned to start a war in Lycia. The war I was plotting in Lycia would've generated a glorious amount of FORCE in one blow. You were not equal to the task, it seems. Not to worry, I've other means at hand.

speaker: Elbert
text: Black-hearted fiend! Guuuh!!

speaker: Nergal
text: Hold your tongue. There is still a task you must perform for me. Ephidel! Limstella!

speaker: Nergal
text: My beloved morphs, my beauteous works of art. I've new jobs for you, my pets. First, Limstella. You will go to Bern and contact Sonia. I want you to arrange a meeting with the king.

speaker: Limstella
text: Understood.

speaker: Nergal
text: Ephidel, take this... man, Marquess Laus, and go. I want you to exterminate the mice who've landed on the island.

speaker: Ephidel
text: Yes, master.

speaker: Nergal
text: That leaves you, Marquess Pherae. It seems your legacy is one of endurance.

speaker: Nergal
text: ...The mouse who interfered with my conquest of Lycia is named Eliwood. Should he be congratulated on making it this far?

speaker: Elbert
text: Eliwood? My son is here? Stop! Do with me what you will, but let my son be!

speaker: Nergal
text: Hm? Heh... Hehahahaha!!! Remember the siblings you freed? The girl's here, too. As a matter of fact, she's with your son, Eliwood. Quite a delicious twist of fate, wouldn't you say?

speaker: Elbert
text: ....This can't be...

speaker: Nergal
text: Eliwood will die in these woods. The girl will be returned to me, and the ceremony will take place. Hm... Despite those long hours of torture, you remain undaunted. Such courage will make you the perfect sacrifice, Marquess Pherae.

speaker: Elbert
text: Eliwood... Turn back... Take the girl and flee...... Please.........

speaker: Leila
text: I can't believe it's come to this. I must inform Lord Hector of these events... If I hurry, I may be in time. What!?

speaker: Ephidel
text: Leila... Where are you going?

speaker: Leila
text: Lord Ephidel... The sentries... I'm going to check on...

speaker: Ephidel
text: You overheard, did you not? ...And I had such hopes for you. Jaffar!

speaker: Leila
text: Ah!!

speaker: Jaffar
text: The punishment for traitors is death.

speaker: Ephidel
text: ....Impressive, Jaffar. Your power is beyond compare.

speaker: Ephidel
text: Take this woman's corpse and leave it in the forest. Let it serve as a warning to those fools.

speaker: Lyn
text: Let's get through these woods. It's starting to get foggy... Try not to get separated.

speaker: Hector
text: "Enter and be lost." It feels like we're not coming back.

speaker: Lyn
text: Hector!! Are you trying to curse us?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Are you well, Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: ....Y-Yes... I'm.... I'll be fine.

speaker: Eliwood
text: !? Someone's there!

speaker: Hector
text: Who? A sentry?

speaker: Hector
text: Leila! Is that you? Impressive work, finding your way here!

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Something's wrong. Leila?  Lei--!!

speaker: Lyn
text: She's...dead...

speaker: Ninian
text: No!

speaker: Hector
text: ...This can't be. She was one of our best spies. Leila....

speaker: Hector
text: ...I'm sorry, Matthew.

speaker: Matthew
text: ...Why do you apologize, my lord? Leila blundered. ....That's all.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Matthew... Leila was... She was...

speaker: Matthew
text: After this mission, I was going to ask her to put this life behind her... Waited too long, didn't I? Ha..... .....My lord, might I...rejoin you later? She has to be buried...

speaker: Hector
text: ...Of course.

speaker: Lyn
text: Ah... I'll go with you...

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Let them be alone. There's nothing else we can do....

speaker: Hector
text: Blast! They put her out here for us to find like this!

speaker: Lyn
text: Unforgivable! This is... a foul deed. Beyond foul.

speaker: Eliwood
text: .....Let's go! The foe is somewhere in this forest. We must stop this before any more die!

speaker: Ninian
text: Ah! ....Beware! Something comes!

speaker: Lyn
text: What?  Kyaa!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis!!

speaker: Uhai
text: ...If you value her life, send the girl to me.

speaker: Lyn
text: You, you're Sacaen!

speaker: Uhai
text: That's correct... I am Uhai of the Black Fang. I've been sent to capture the girl... And to kill the lot of you. If, however... you hand over the girl and depart the island at once, I'll grant you your lives.

speaker: Lyn
text: And if we refuse?

speaker: Uhai
text: You know nothing, little lord. Nothing of Nergal's might. Nothing of his terrible power. You are ignorant, and so you hope to oppose him. You are insects railing against the heavens. Your actions will change nothing. Speak no more foolishness and begone!

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Maybe we don't know what it is we're fighting... But if we flee, our loss is assured. So we will continue to struggle, and we may yet prevail!

speaker: Uhai
text: ...Folly.

speaker: Lyn
text: What?!

speaker: Lyn
text: Why are you letting me go? Holding a woman hostage during battle is shameful. You, too, are of Sacae, and I've a mind to show you mercy. I will let you die with a sword in your hands. But rest assured... I will kill you all here. But be of good cheer! In dying, you shall all be spared the calamity that is to come!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian, you must hide. We will meet the enemy!

speaker: Matthew
text: I’m back, my lord!

speaker: Hector
text: Matthew! Are you sure? You don’t have to–

speaker: Matthew
text: What are you talking about? Look at this eerie place, this thick fog... This is exactly why you brought me with you.

speaker: Hector
text: Yet...

speaker: Matthew
text: If Leila... If Leila knew I was shirking my duties, she would never have forgiven me. I’m fine. I will work twice as hard for Ostia in her honor.

speaker: Hector
text: I understand... I’m counting on you!

speaker: Matthew
text: As well you should, my lord! Tell me, Leila... This is what you’d want, right? You wouldn’t want me to give up. I’ll mourn for you when our battle is won. I must fulfill my duty. So rest... I promise I will take care of everything.

speaker: Fiora
text: I found them... These men are Black Fang... Look, everyone. Your sacrifices were not in vain. I’ll fulfill our duty, even if I must do it myself. I am a true knight of Ilia!

speaker: Florina
text: Sister? Fiora!

speaker: Fiora
text: Florina! Why are you here?

speaker: Florina
text: I’m here with Lady Lyndis. What are you doing here?

speaker: Fiora
text: ...I was investigating the Dread Isle for someone.

speaker: Florina
text: By yourself?

speaker: Fiora
text: No... There were others...a full unit of pegasus knights. We were attacked...

speaker: Florina
text: You can’t mean...

speaker: Fiora
text: I misjudged our sitatuon. ...All of my knights are dead because of me... I’m a failure.

speaker: Florina
text: That’s not true! You’re a splendid pegasus knight! I chose this path because I admired you so! Please...don’t do this to yourself!

speaker: Fiora
text: Florina, please don’t cry.

speaker: Fiora
text: No, it’s my fault. The pain of being the sole survivor... It had me trapped. ...Thank you, Florina. I can see clearly now.

speaker: Florina
text: ...Fiora! Come and travel with us! It’s better to travel with friends than to struggle alone.

speaker: Fiora
text: ...You’re right. I hate to admit it, but I can’t do everything alone. Nor can I render my companions’ sacrifices moot by going home. Florina, please introduce me to your commander. I’ll see if I can offer my services for a short while.

speaker: Dart
text: You're Mark, right? I'm Dart, leader of Fargus's suicide squad! The captain's ordered me to follow your commands. So, who do you want me to take care of?

speaker: Rebecca
text: Um, Mark. Can I ask you something? Do you think Dart and I...have anything in common? What? Not at all? Hmmm... I don't know, there's something about him.

speaker: Uhai
text: I am Uhai! I am the Soaring Hawk! Come!

speaker: Uhai
text: Guuu... Well...done...... You are... stronger... stronger than I expected. Out of respect... ...a final gift from me... From here, go south. ...Turn at the rotted tree. Head...west. There lies the path to the... ...Dragon’s Gate... Unnh...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Uhai... I wish we could've met under different circumstances.

speaker: Hector
text: ...Do we trust him?

speaker: Lyn
text: He was a Sacaen. He would not lie. ...I, at least, choose to believe him.

speaker: Hector
text: ...Let's go then.

speaker: Eliwood
text: To the Dragon's Gate!

speaker: Hector
text: I don’t think he was behind Leila’s death. Black Fang! I don’t know who’s responsible, so I’m going to destroy you all!!

speaker: Nino
text: Hey!

speaker: Jaffar
text: It's very late. Where are you going?

speaker: Nino
text: ...Jaffar.

speaker: Jaffar
text: To Sonia?

speaker: Nino
text: ...Unh.

speaker: Jaffar
text: Do you know her whereabouts?

speaker: Nino
text: The mountain fortress has been discovered, so... I think she's in the other place.

speaker: Jaffar
text: The Water Temple? ...... What about them?

speaker: Nino
text: I haven't told them. They're all good people, so they would know I'm not lying. And yet... I want to see Mother. I want to hear the truth from her. So...

speaker: Jaffar
text: Nino... Sentiment will not protect you from that woman.

speaker: Nino
text: I know that! But she's my mother!! I'm her flesh and blood. She's the only mother I have!!

speaker: Jaffar
text: ...That is something I cannot understand...

speaker: Nino
text: Ah! I'm sorry... I didn't mean...

speaker: Jaffar
text: It's nothing.

speaker: Nino
text: Jaffar, I truly am sorry.

speaker: Jaffar
text: I will not let you go alone. If you go, I go with you. OK?

speaker: Nino
text: Jaffar...

speaker: Lyn
text: I wanted to know where she was slipping off to in the dead of night... ...Nino...

speaker: Eliwood
text: I agree with Jaffar. There's no way Sonia will be moved by Nino's feelings.

speaker: Lyn
text: Are we just going to let them go?

speaker: Eliwood
text: No, we're going to follow them right away.

speaker: Lyn
text: Of course we are!

speaker: Lyn
text: What are you doing, Hector? Hurry!

speaker: Hector
text: Jaffar's a killer. He's slaughtered our friends. I can't forgive him. Eliwood, is all this necessary? Do we need his strength so much that we now must rescue him?

speaker: Eliwood
text: No, that's not it. I wanted those two to live on. Their lives... They've been so hard. That's why I said what I did. My feelings were confirmed in Bern. The Black Fang is not all evil. They're being manipulated by Nergal. Some of them must be fighting against their better judgment.

speaker: Hector
text: Is that what you believe about Jaffar?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I don't know. But you've seen how he behaves around Nino... He seems like a completely different person than the man we fought at the Dragon's Gate.

speaker: Lyn
text: I feel the same way. Hector, how about you?

speaker: Hector
text: He has killed my friends. He is my enemy. No matter what happens, that will never change.

speaker: Lyn
text: So you'll let them die?

speaker: Hector
text: That's not what I said! I want him to stay alive. He must live...so that he can suffer for all he's done! There! Satisfied?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector...

speaker: Hector
text: I've said my peace. I'm done. I won't do any more ranting. ......Sorry about that. Now, let's go! Hurry up, you two!

speaker: Lyn
text: Wha--Wai-Wait up!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let's go, Tactician. We can't let the Black Fang go unattended. It's time we turned the tables on Nergal!!

speaker: Limstella
text: Sonia.

speaker: Sonia
text: Pah. Take heed how casually you call a human by name, you puppet. ...Now what do you want?

speaker: Limstella
text: Eliwood is alive. Lord Nergal's orders have not yet been fulfilled.

speaker: Sonia
text: Silence, you abomination!! I know that. Though the Four Fangs are gone, I'm still here... I will finish Eliwood and his friends with my own two hands!
...Sonia! Where are you, Sonia?!

speaker: Brendan
text: Sonia, I must speak... Hm? Who's that?

speaker: Sonia
text: ...Oh, well... I suppose it's best I was done with you anyway. Hee hee... Those annoying brothers were all that prevented me from acting sooner.

speaker: Brendan
text: Sonia...you...

speaker: Sonia
text: I got close to you so that I could take control of the Black Fang. Take a look around you. Not a familiar face to be seen, is there? I've been replacing them one by one... Hee hee. They're all Lord Nergal's puppets. His morphs!!

speaker: Brendan
text: So...you've betrayed me.

speaker: Sonia
text: You've finally noticed... You're a fool, Brendan Reed! Your own sons suspected me right from the beginning. Every minute I spent with you, every caress... It was loathsome!! It was all for Lord Nergal. All to control the Four Fangs. Now it's over. Die for me now, will you? Die for your beloved wife!

speaker: Brendan
text: Sonia! You inhuman monster!!!

speaker: Brendan
text: Aaargh... Lloyd... Linus... Forgive your...foolish...father......

speaker: Sonia
text: Ow... He can't just die... Has to be the Black Fang leader even to the bitter end.

speaker: Limstella
text: Brendan Reed... What magnificent essence. I will deliver it to Lord Nergal at once.

speaker: Sonia
text: Be sure to tell him that it was I who killed Brendan!! ...Ooh!

speaker: Limstella
text: You appear to be injured. Shall I take over your duties?

speaker: Sonia
text: Don't be ridiculous! I will never let a creature like you seize the glory that is mine! I was chosen by Lord Nergal himself! I'm a perfect being!

speaker: Sonia
text: I will take care of Eliwood and his companions. I! Sonia!

speaker: Jan
text: Com-Com...Commander... They... They're monsters......

speaker: Nino
text: Uncle Jan! Is that you, Uncle?

speaker: Jan
text: Nino!? Why have you come back?

speaker: Nino
text: I...wanted to speak with Mother.

speaker: Jan
text: Flee this place!

speaker: Nino
text: Uncle?

speaker: Jan
text: The commander is dead! That woman--

speaker: Sonia
text: What were you going to say about me?

speaker: Nino
text: Mother!

speaker: Jan
text: Aaaah...Soniaaaa!!! Uwaa... Aaaaaaaa!!!!

speaker: Sonia
text: Wretch! I'll smoke you out later. First, Nino... You failed again, and you've tarnished my reputation.

speaker: Nino
text: Um... Mother...

speaker: Sonia
text: Shut up!!

speaker: Nino
text: Ah!

speaker: Sonia
text: A thoroughly and utterly useless little girl. If only I'd known, I would've sent you off to your true parents!

speaker: Nino
text: My true...parents?

speaker: Sonia
text: Ha ha... That's right. What can the truth hurt now? Your true family for generations was the most famed house of magic wielders in all Lycia. They alone guarded the secret of the dragons. Thirteen years ago, Lord Nergal and I stole that secret.

speaker: Nino
text: My...family?

speaker: Sonia
text: Ha ha ha! No matter how wise they were, they were only human. I held a child before me as a shield, and they were powerless to act!

speaker: Sonia
text: The father, the mother, and then the child I carried... After they revealed all of their secrets... And I slaughtered them with these very hands!!

speaker: Nino
text: I... I... I'm not your daughter?

speaker: Sonia
text: There were two children, a boy and a girl. One, the mother fought fiercely to save. She held her daughter tight as I killed her. That girl, Nino, was you!

speaker: Nino
text: No!

speaker: Sonia
text: You were still a mewling little whelp, but we took you with us. Lord Nergal thought you might be useful, so he let you live. I hated the very thought of it, but it was Lord Nergal's wish that I raise you as my daughter.

speaker: Sonia
text: We were so wrong about you! Stupid and useless beyond all reason! A worthless piece of offal! All you were was in the way!

speaker: Jaffar
text: So that's why you wanted her dead. You're inhuman. Your soul is black and devoid of warmth.

speaker: Sonia
text: I never expected to hear such things from you, Jaffar! Once, you killed without hesitation at Lord Nergal's command. What happened to the man all feared, my Angel of Death?

speaker: Jaffar
text: Nino has changed me. I am no longer Nergal's killing engine. For Nino's sake... Sonia, you must die. And I will kill you!

speaker: Nino
text: Jaffar!!

speaker: Jaffar
text: Stay back. I will take care of this woman.

speaker: Sonia
text: Aha ha ha ha ha ha!!! "Stay back"! How rich! How noble! So, shall I pass judgment on you, as the Black Fang must with traitors? Ha ha ha! I sentence you to death! Prepare to be punished!
I won't allow that!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Nino! Jaffar! Are you OK?

speaker: Hector
text: Bah. Look at the trouble you've caused!

speaker: Lyn
text: We're companions now. You mustn't forget that!

speaker: Nino
text: Everyone...

speaker: Sonia
text: Ha ha ha ha ha! Such sweet friends, Nino... Sorry to cut short your little reunion. Ha ha... I won't let you get away. To a man, you will all die!

speaker: Lyn
text: Hm? Wha--!? Eeek!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis! Look out!! This way!

speaker: Sonia
text: Ha ha ha... You are the sinners who hurt my Lord Nergal. I will not let you die swiftly.

speaker: Hector
text: Woah! This place is filling with water!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: The path vanished... This water prevents us from moving forward or back.

speaker: Lyn
text: Nino! Jaffar! Are you all right?

speaker: Nino
text: Yeah! We're fine!!

speaker: Sonia
text: I'll create some paths for you, so please keep coming. Of course, you can stay where you are if you like. I care not, so long as you die in pain and fear. You can't escape from the grave that's waiting for you, though.

speaker: Nino
text: I'm sorry, everyone! All of this, it's... It's all...my...

speaker: Lyn
text: Nino! Calm down. I told you, didn't I? We came because we're friends. There's no need to apologize.

speaker: Nino
text: Lyn...

speaker: Hector
text: Pathways and courtesies? I guess she's being gracious, right?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let's defeat Sonia and sever the connection between Nergal and the Black Fang!! For a better future!

speaker: Sonia
text: Lord Nergal will have your quintessence! Only the chosen few will live to see the new world. Perfect people! People like me!

speaker: Sonia
text: It can't be... I'm...perfect... Lord Nergal said...so...

speaker: Nino
text: I thought for so long that you were my true mother…

speaker: Sonia
text: Ha ha ha! Your mother and father looked so much like you. They were so naive it made me want to vomit. I dressed in rags and entered their house with a child in my arms. They were sincerely concerned. Ha ha… Trusting a stranger is so utterly foolish. Oh, they came to regret their trust, but it was too late.

speaker: Nino
text: Aaahhh!!! You’re no perfect being! You’re a monster in human form! No mercy! No forgiveness!!!

speaker: Jaffar
text: Here I come.

speaker: Sonia
text: Ingrate! You owe your life to Lord Nergal! You and that girl, you’re nothing but filth! But it matters not, as long as your essence remains intact. No other part of you now has any value.

speaker: Jan
text: Dear little Nino.

speaker: Nino
text: Uncle Jan! I'm so glad you're safe!!

speaker: Jan
text: Yes. I didn't even fight. I just hid... I... I... I'm just a cowardly old man... When that woman killed the commander, I could do nothing...

speaker: Nino
text: Father... He's dead, isn't he?... Even though I wasn't his real daughter, he treated me kindly. and yet...Moth--Sonia......

speaker: Jan
text: ......You learned the truth?

speaker: Nino
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Jan
text: I see... Let me return this to you, lass.

speaker: Nino
text: A...pendant?

speaker: Jan
text: It belonged to your real mother. The commander never fully trusted Sonia. He had his agents investigate her past. He uncovered much... Like where you'd come from. He was able to speak to a woman who worked in your house. When he told her about you, she wept with joy. She asked that you be given this.

speaker: Nino
text: ......I loved the Black Fang. Nergal and Sonia have ruined it, but... The Black Fang that my father and brothers made... Everyone was so kind, I thought of them as my family...

speaker: Jan
text: Mmm...mmm. That was a good time.

speaker: Nino
text: Uncle Jan... Thank you. The pendant, I'll cherish it.

speaker: Jan
text: Take care, lass. ...Be happy.

speaker: Nino
text: Goodbye, Uncle. See you again. Someday...

speaker: Lyn
text: Have you said your farewells?

speaker: Nino
text: Yes. Uh...thanks. you all came and... told me that we're friends. ......It made me happy. Can I travel with you?

speaker: Lyn
text: Of course! Right, Eliwood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: If that's what you'd like, we'd be happy to have you. Will you come and help us?

speaker: Nino
text: Yeah! I'll do my best! I promise! Jaffar, too!

speaker: Hector
text: We should be getting back to camp. We've an early start tomorrow.

speaker: Eliwood
text: You're right. We should head out as soon as it's light. The Shrine of Seals awaits!

speaker: Limstella
text: Sonia.

speaker: Sonia
text: ......Lea--Leave me... ...accursed puppet... Lord Nergal... ...Aah...help...me.

speaker: Limstella
text: Puppets have no essence to harvest. You no longer have any use to Lord Nergal...

speaker: Sonia
text: What!? ...What...did... What are you...I am human......

speaker: Darin
text: Are you certain? Pherae’s heir is here?

speaker: Erik
text: Yes, Father. We’ve just received word from our lookouts. He’s still beyond that hill, but he’ll be here before long.

speaker: Darin
text: Lord Ephidel, what is the meaning of this?

speaker: Ephidel
text: Perhaps when they reached Santaruz Castle, Lord Helman was still clinging to life.

speaker: Darin
text: You can’t be serious!

speaker: Ephidel
text: He couldn’t have lasted too long, but…maybe he told them something.

speaker: Darin
text: That’s terrible! Our plan! It’s all for naught, isn’t it?

speaker: Ephidel
text: No need to be so alarmed, my lord. Even if he told young Eliwood something of our schemes, Pherae no longer has any power. All Eliwood could do is perhaps inform Marquess Ostia.

speaker: Darin
text: Ostia?! That would be ruinous! Lord Uther may be young and new to the throne, but he’s dangerous. That addlepated Helman! He was a coward to the end! To betray us now, when we’re so close…We only need a little more time to complete our plans for rebellion!

speaker: Ephidel
text: Then before Marquess Ostia becomes aware of any of this, you would do well to stop them here.

speaker: Darin
text: Yes, you’re right, of course. We do have a chance! They have to pass through Laus to get to Ostia. We can still silence them!

speaker: Ephidel
text: They must not pass. No matter the cost.

speaker: Darin
text: Let us make haste. Call up our finest troops.

speaker: Erik
text: Father! Please, let me take the command.

speaker: Darin
text: Erik! Tell me, Son, can you succeed?

speaker: Erik
text: That clod Eliwood and I studied together in Ostia. He’s a trusting fool. If he sees me, he’ll lower his guard. And when he does, we strike!

speaker: Darin
text: I see.

speaker: Ephidel
text: I beg your pardon… Is this not too much for him? If, by strange chance, he fell, things could turn for the worse.

speaker: Darin
text: No, I know I’m the lad’s father, but Erik’s quite clever, I tell you. Snuffing Pherae’s whelp will be no trouble at all. It’s settled! It’s up to you now, Erik. Bring me the head of Pherae’s darling son!

speaker: Erik
text: Yes, Father! I will not fail you!

speaker: Hector
text: Look around… They truly are preparing for battle. Marquess Laus! What is he scheming?

speaker: Hector
text: You don’t much look like you want to go to the castle.

speaker: Eliwood
text: If we go and learn the truth, we may have to go to war.

speaker: Hector
text: That’s fine with me!

speaker: Eliwood
text: I… I’ve no love for war. If I concentrate on the foe before me, I’m fine. If I picture families, innocents caught up in our foolish politics? If I imagine them… All I can do is pray for a way to solve things peacefully.

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood….

speaker: Marcus
text: Lord Eliwood! A knight has ridden forth from the castle.

speaker: Eliwood
text: A lone knight?

speaker: Marcus
text: Yes, my lord. Our scouts say it’s Marquess Laus’s son, Erik. He is asking to see you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Erik?

speaker: Hector
text: Gah. Why did it have to be that buffoon?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I will see him. Bring him here.

speaker: Hector
text: I’m leaving. I never could abide him. I’ll go for a ride and survey our surroundings.

speaker: Oswin
text: Good day, Lord Hector. Is Lord Eliwood with you?

speaker: Hector
text: No. He's treating with Marquess Laus's son, Erik.

speaker: Oswin
text: Is it wise for you to be away at this time?

speaker: Hector
text: Erik's a contemptuous peacock. He's intolerable. And he made a show of riding from the castle alone. Something feels odd.

speaker: Oswin
text: That is unusual. I've been thinking, my lord... Laus is blessed with clear water and fertile ground. See the shade its tall trees and grasses cast? Ideal for hiding soldiers, don't you think?

speaker: Hector
text: You're right, Oswin. I'm going to take a look around.

speaker: Oswin
text: Very good. Let's split up and double our ground. One thing, my lord!

speaker: Hector
text: What is it?

speaker: Oswin
text: Do not let yourself be distracted. Keep your guard up.

speaker: Hector
text: Ha ha ha. Yes, Mother. I will.

speaker: Erik
text: Hello! It’s been a long time, Eliwood!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Erik… What is your business?

speaker: Erik
text: My business? What do you mean? I heard my old friend was here in Laus. I merely thought I’d ride out to greet you!

speaker: Erik
text: So tell me, friend, what brings you to Laus? Are you…on your way to Ostia?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hm? Why would you think that?

speaker: Erik
text: Well, you were always such good friends with Hector. He and I never… got along very well. For a noble, his behavior was crude, and his manner of speech… You would have thought him a peasant at first glance. You’re still friends with Hector, aren’t you? When did you see him last? How do you communicate?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Erik… You’re after something. What is it?

speaker: Erik
text: Pardon?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Everywhere I look, Laus prepares for battle. What are you and your father planning? I will know the truth!

speaker: Erik
text: Hm… I’d hoped to wait until you’d told me of Ostia. Of whether you’ve spoken with the marquess or not.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Erik
text: Hm heh heh… Eliwood, I have always despised you. How I’ve longed to smash you and your pathetic morality into pieces! I’ve dreamed of this day, and here it is at last!

speaker: Hector
text: Too bad you’ll not live to see the end of it.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector!

speaker: Erik
text: Y-You! Hector! You couldn’t… Have you spoken with Ostia already?

speaker: Hector
text: Maybe we have, maybe we haven’t. Eliwood, this mongrel has troops lying in ambush all around us. Laus regulars, every one. We’re in for a rough time.

speaker: Erik
text: Heh heh… There’s little point in fighting. You’re trapped! My forces will overwhelm you, an unending torrent of soldiers! Laus’s elite knights are at the ready as well. Heh heh… How long do you think you can survive?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Craven cur!

speaker: Hannah
text: Hee hee hee... A world of trouble you've landed yourself in, yes?

speaker: Hector
text: Who--!? You startled me, old woman! You should get out of here. This is going to be a bad place to stay if you plan on living.

speaker: Hannah
text: I want to see the one searching for his father. Marquess Pherae's son.

speaker: Hector
text: Listen up, old woman! You're close to death as it is! Quit your yammering and move on!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector! You should mind your manners. I am Eliwood. May I ask your name, milady?

speaker: Hannah
text: Ho ho ho. What a polite young man. I'm Hannah, a fortune-teller. I came here to help you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Can you tell me where my father's gone?

speaker: Hannah
text: No...but... I can see other things...useful things... I can tell you what weapons to take into battle, as well as who should wield them. Things of that nature.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I see...

speaker: Hector
text: Don't tell me you believe any of this.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I have no reason to believe or disbelieve in Hannah's powers. But I'll not rule out anything if it helps me find my father.

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Eliwood! Lord Hector! I make my living as a humble merchant. If you have any items you no longer need, please let poor Merlinus take them.

speaker: Hannah
text: Heh heh heh. I'm here, too. Speak to me for auguries before you engage the enemy. My services are not free, but they may save you from paying a greater price!

speaker: Serra
text: Uh-oh! I think we've been surrounded! Uh... but I'm not worried a bit. I'm with you after all, Mark. We make quite a team. Right. Come on, Mark! Let's get started!

speaker: Merlinus
text: Lord Eliwood, shall I join you? If you deploy my tent, I can help with equipment. I can switch items for you and hold them if your packs are full. However, my tent cannot be moved about, so if you deploy it, it will require a guard. I beg your understanding.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Merlinus’s merchant tent can be deployed on this map. If you deploy the tent, any items you cannot carry can be sent to the tent. However, the tent is vulnerable to enemy attack. If the tent loses all its HP, it will vanish from the map and remain unavailable until the next map. Merlinus’s tent gains one level for every battle it survives. The tent will be harder to destroy as it increases in level.

speaker: Marcus
text: Mark! Let me take the point. There may be many of them, but numbers are meaningless! We are knights of Pherae. These mice of Laus will never defeat us!

speaker: Erk
text: Hm. We certainly could stand some assistance…

speaker: Man
text: I’m sorry, but it’s just not possible. If we disobey Marquess Laus, who knows what might happen to us?

speaker: Erk
text: I understand. We’ll seek our aid elsewhere.

speaker: Man
text: You’ll find the same answer everywhere you go. Eventually, you’ll have to do as the marquess orders. You would do well to tell your employer the same thing.

speaker: Erk
text: Hm. Good day to you.

speaker: Bandit
text: Eh? What’s all this? Looks like a war’s broken out. Aha ha ha! Perfect! Time for a raid! Up and at ’em, mates! That village is ripe for plunder!

speaker: Man
text: Priscilla. Has your escort returned yet?

speaker: Priscilla
text: No. He left yesterday in search of a way out of here… I just hope the soldiers of Laus haven’t captured him.

speaker: Man
text: His search for help must have been fruitless. Marquess Laus has ordered that no aid be given to you. There’s really nothing that any of us can do. I apologize, but…

speaker: Priscilla
text: No, no. You could turn me over to the marquess, and yet you continue to grant me asylum. I’m grateful for that. Of course, if I simply went to the castle, this would all be over.

speaker: Man
