text: Don’t fret over that. None of us are overly fond of the marquess. He’s always threatening us. He treats us like slaves. All of these war preparations? We want nothing to do with them. We may be divided into territories, but we’re Lycians one and all. We may be invaded by another country one day, but why does he want to start a war here at home? None of us understand what he is doing.

speaker: Erik
text: Blast! They’re stronger than I had supposed! To the castle! I want all the reinforcements available, and I want them now!

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Erik is struggling! He requests reinforcements!

speaker: Darin
text: What? Ready the men.

speaker: Ephidel
text: Unbelievable… These numbers cannot stop them.

speaker: Darin
text: Ephidel? W-Where are you going?

speaker: Ephidel
text: It seems that conquering Lycia might have been too much to ask of you after all. I must inform my master. The Black Fang will be leaving at once.

speaker: Darin
text: No! You… You can’t abandon us! Not at this stage!

speaker: Ephidel
text: Who was it that said Ostia mustn’t learn of our plans? Wasn’t it you, Lord Darin? The marquess of Laus himself?

speaker: Darin
text: Y-Yes, it was. There’s no turning back for me. Not now! P-P-Please! One more… Give me one more chance. I assure you, I will not disappoint Lord Nergal!

speaker: Ephidel
text: Very well… Assemble your men. We will regroup elsewhere.

speaker: Darin
text: Eh? You can’t mean… My son…my home… Am I to abandon them?

speaker: Ephidel
text: Would you fall in disgrace along with your son? Our master, Lord Nergal, is offering you the throne of all Lycia…Surely a few sacrifices are not too much to ask?

speaker: Darin
text: Yes… You’re right. My destiny is greater than this. I was born to be king of Lycia.

speaker: Ephidel
text: And as for an heir? You’re still young, my lord. You will have time. You must not let a moment’s sentimentality cloud your judgment.

speaker: Erik
text: Where are my reinforcements? Why haven’t they come? I’ve no choice. I must attack! You! To the castle! Find more men!

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, my lord!

speaker: Serra
text: Ohmigosh! It’s Erk! It’s been SO long! What are you doing here?

speaker: Erk
text: Oh… Serra. You’re the last person I wanted to see…

speaker: Serra:
text: Oh, that’s so sweet! You wanted to see me again!

speaker: Serra
text: Hey, I know! This is perfect. Come with us and lend a hand, Erk.

speaker: Erk
text: I beg your pardon?

speaker: Serra
text: Come on! I’ll even introduce you to Lords Hector and Eliwood! I know you. You’re probably just wandering about without work.

speaker: Erk
text: No, Serra. I’m afraid I am gainfully employed. However… If you’re fighting Laus… This might work out after all.

speaker: Serra
text: What are you babbling about? Make up your mind, will you?

speaker: Erk
text: My employer is hiding in a village south of here. If you’ll help me protect her, I’ll join up with you.

speaker: Erk
text: Lady Priscilla! I’m glad to see you well.

speaker: Priscilla
text: Erk! Have you joined Lord Eliwood’s company as well?

speaker: Erk
text: Yes. Traveling with them seems to be the safest way for us to continue your search for your family.

speaker: Priscilla
text: Erk!

speaker: Erk
text: Oh, my apologies. This isn’t the place to discuss such things.

speaker: Priscilla
text: I’m sorry, but...

speaker: Erk
text: Lady Priscilla, my teacher entrusted you to my care. Until you have reached your goal, I will not leave your side.

speaker: Priscilla
text: Thank you, Erk.

speaker: Man
text: You’re battling Erik and his men, right? Let me tell you, I’m on your side! My granddaughter… Marquess Laus took her away. He found her pretty, and forced her to the castle. It’s not much, but please take this. It’s a large sword, so you have to be strong to use it. It’s a bit unwieldy, but it is a mighty weapon nonetheless. I hope you can defeat the marquess’s son, Erik. It would make our lives more pleasant. Good luck to you.

speaker: Priscilla
text: Again? Are you another messenger from the marquess? Please, do not waste your time. I will not change my decision. Pardon? Marquess Laus did not send you? I… I beg your forgiveness. It was my mistake. Say… If it’s not too much trouble, might I leave with you? I’m on a journey. Marquess Laus is barring my way, and…I’m trapped. I am trained in the use of staves. Please, help me.

speaker: Erk
text: Lady Priscilla! Are you well?

speaker: Priscilla
text: I should be asking you that, Erk. Have you been wounded?

speaker: Erk
text: I’m fine. Listen, my lady. I’ve found some friends who will help us.

speaker: Priscilla
text: Truly?

speaker: Erk
text: We’ll be joining up with Marquess Pherae’s son. Traveling with them seems to be the safest way for us to continue your search for your family.

speaker: Priscilla
text: Erk!

speaker: Erk
text: Oh, my apologies. This isn’t the place to discuss such things.

speaker: Priscilla
text: I’m sorry, but…

speaker: Erk
text: Lady Priscilla, my teacher entrusted you to my care. Until you have reached your goal, I will not leave your side.

speaker: Priscilla
text: Thank you, Erk.

speaker: Erik
text: Laus is the true throne of Lycia! Taste my lance!

speaker: Erik
text: I am no one’s prisoner! Unhand me! Gwaaa!

speaker: Hector
text: Come on, Erik! Get up!

speaker: Erik
text: You… You peasants… You can’t treat a proper noble like this!

speaker: Hector
text: It’s too late for niceties! Be thankful you’re still breathing!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Erik, you must tell me. Where is your father? We’ve searched the entire castle, and there’s no one here.

speaker: Erik
text: D-Don’t be ridiculous! My father would not abandon… No! He’d never… Ephidel…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ephidel? Who’s that?

speaker: Hector
text: Speak, cur!! Do you want to die here?

speaker: Erik
text: Ah!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector! Erik…please. You must tell us everything you know. I… I just want to know where my father is.

speaker: Erik
text: ………Ephidel… He appeared at the castle one year ago. He came…and my father changed. Ostia’s position had always bothered my father… He felt Laus deserved to rule all of Lycia. But he’d never gone so far as to speak of rebellion.

speaker: Hector
text: Did you say…rebellion?

speaker: Erik
text: Ephidel had something… With it, he convinced my father to set this plan in motion. My father then sent envoys to several other marquesses. Marquess Pherae, he had approved of the idea.

speaker: Hector
text: What?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Never! My father would never agree to such a thing!

speaker: Erik
text: Believe or disbelieve. That is your choice. First was Marquess Santaruz. Then Marquess Pherae’s reply arrived. Marquess Pherae visited here six months ago to seal his approval.

speaker: Eliwood
text: That’s not… possible…

speaker: Erik
text: My father and yours argued vehemently that day. Marquess Pherae always distrusted Ephidel. He tried to convince my father to send Ephidel and the Black Fang assassins out of Lycia. My father would not be persuaded, and Marquess Pherae left the castle. As you know, he then disappeared. I doubt he’s still alive.

speaker: Eliwood
text: No!

speaker: Hector
text: Shut your mouth!

speaker: Erik
text: Eliwood said he wanted to hear everything. My father… He is but Ephidel’s puppet. He’ll listen to anything that villain says. Even watch his own son…die…… Those are the sort of people you’re dealing with. Marquess Pherae betrayed them. They would not let him live! Ha ha…ha ha ha ha ha ha…

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah…

speaker: Hector
text: Wait! Eliwood!

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector.

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin! Did Eliwood pass this way?

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Eliwood? He ran through that gate and went outside.

speaker: Hector
text: I see.

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector! A moment, please.

speaker: Hector
text: What is it, Oswin.

speaker: Oswin
text: Let us return to Ostia. The rumors... I've heard that... Lord Hector, I cannot approve of helping Eliwood...or Pherae...any longer.

speaker: Hector
text: What are you saying?

speaker: Oswin
text: We must think of Ostia's well-being. If Marquess Pherae was involved in a rebellion--

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin. You will take back those words.

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector, I appreciate your feelings...

speaker: Hector
text: I know Eliwood's father very well. I'm telling you that he is a man worthy of our trust. You are in my service! Do you not feel you should follow my orders?

speaker: Hector
text: Heed my words, Oswin. You are my brother's vassal. Your duties to guard me come second to this. Return to Ostia, Oswin. You've done your duty. ........Thank you.

speaker: Oswin
text: .......My remarks about Marquess Pherae were improper. I apologize completely.

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin? Stop! That's enough! You need not bend your knee to me!

speaker: Oswin
text: My lord, I would swear my service to you.

speaker: Hector
text: Service...to me?

speaker: Oswin
text: Please accept my lance as your own. Then return it with your blessings.

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin, you--

speaker: Oswin
text: I am a knight in service to Castle Ostia. Until now, I have only offered my lance to Lord Uther. Yet... I now wish to offer you that same service. Please grant me that honor.

speaker: Hector
text: Oswin...

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood…

speaker: Eliwood
text: My father is alive… And… I cannot believe he supports…rebellion. There must be… There has to be a reason…

speaker: Hector
text: I know. I don’t believe any of this for an instant. My brother trusted Marquess Pherae more than anyone. First, we’ll find your father and uncover the truth. We’ll talk to my brother after that.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector, I’m sorry…

speaker: Hector
text: Don’t look like that. Your father is surely alive. Right?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes, of course… Marquess Laus… Black Fang assassins… Now this mysterious Ephidel… I’ll find them all and prove my father’s innocence!
Are you awake?

speaker: Girl
text: I found you unconscious on the plains.

speaker: Lyn
text: I am Lyn, of the Lorca tribe. You’re safe now. Who are you? Can you remember your name?

speaker: Lyn
text: Your name is Mark? What an odd-sounding name... But pay me no mind. It is a good name. I see by your attire that you are a traveller. What brings you to the Sacae plains? Would you share your story with me? Hm? What was that noise? I’ll go see what’s happening. Mark, wait here for me.

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh no! Bandits! They must have come down from the Bern mountains! They must be planning on raiding the local villages. I... I have to stop them! If that’s all of them, I think I can handle them on my own. You’ll be safe in here, Mark.

speaker: Lyn
text: What? You want to help? Well, can you use a weapon?

speaker: Lyn
text: Ah, I see... So you’re a strategist by trade? An odd profession, but... Very well. We’ll go together!

speaker: Lyn
text: Over here! If you want to help, Mark, I could use your advice. I’ll protect you, so stay close to me.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Unit Information: Lyn is the blue unit. The enemy units are red. Mark, you are green. Essentially, battle consists of blue  units and red  units taking turns moving on the field. You’re only here as a strategist, Mark. You will only appear during special events. Your job as strategist is to place the cursor on blue units to issue their orders. First, select a unit. Place the cursor on Lyn and press the A Button.

speaker: Lyn
text: I need to be closer to the enemy!

speaker: Tutorial
text: You have selected Lyn. When a unit is selected, the map changes color like so. Lyn can move anywhere in the blue area. Move her to the space with the flashing cursor. Place your cursor there, and then press the A Button to finish.

speaker: Lyn
text: Let’s advance on that bandit!

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, this should be close enough.

speaker: Lyn
text: That bandit’s spotted me! He’s coming this way!

speaker: Lyn
text: Let’s close in and attack!

speaker: Tutorial
text: Select Lyn.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Move to one of the areas adjacent to the bandit.

speaker: Lyn
text: I have to be right next to him to attack!

speaker: Lyn
text: Listen, just get me up next to that bandit!

speaker: Tutorial
text: Press the A Button after placing the cursor next to the enemy.

speaker: Lyn
text: Now, strike!

speaker: Tutorial
text: Select attack!

speaker: Lyn
text: Victory! But I’ve been injured. I have need of a vulnerary.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Select Lyn.

speaker: Lyn
text: There’s another bandit over by the ger to the west. You don’t know what a ger is? It’s a type of round hut. Many nomads live in huts like these. Hmm... I would do well to use this time to administer a little first aid.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Move to the space marked by the flashing cursor.

speaker: Lyn
text: I’m carrying a couple of vulneraries in my satchel. They should heal me up. Would you get one for me?

speaker: Tutorial
text: Open the Item menu and select a vulnerary. Next, choose Use.

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you, Mark! Now, let’s go get that brigand over by the ger!

speaker: Lyn
text: Whew! He’s tough… It all comes down to this next blow. Mark, if I fall, I want you to flee. You must escape!

speaker: Batta
text: Who do you think you are? You think you can stand up to Batta the Beast?

speaker: Batta
text: What? How... How did you—

speaker: Lyn
text: Whew... That was close. I sorely underestimated him. Sorry if I worried you. I’ll need to be stronger if I’m going to survive... Strong enough that no one can defeat me.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Lyn gains experience in each encounter. When she has enough experience, she will level up. As she increases in level, her abilities improve. Over time, she will grow much stronger. It’s time to bring this chapter to a close. Select Lyn and move her to the gate where Batta the Beast was standing. Select Seize to complete Lyn’s victory and your own!

speaker: Lyn
text: Good work, Mark! Let’s go home.

speaker: Lyn
text: Good morning, Mark! Are you awake yet? That fight yesterday must have taken a lot out of you. Say, Mark... I want to talk to you about something. You have some experience in the ways of war, I can see. Would you allow me to travel with you?

speaker: Lyn
text: What? You... want me to get permission from my parents?

speaker: Lyn
text: My mother and my father... died six months ago. My people—the Lorca—they don’t... I’m the last of my tribe. Bandits attacked, and... they killed so many people. The tribe was shattered. My father was our chieftain, and I tried to protect our people. But I’m so young, and our people were old-fashioned. They wouldn’t follow a woman. No one would follow me. Sniff... I’m sorry. I’ve been alone for so long... No. No more. I will shed no more tears. ... ... ... ...

speaker: Lyn
text: Thank you. I’m better now. Mark, I want— I must become stronger, so that I may avenge my father’s death! Yesterday’s battle taught me something. I won’t become stronger by sitting here alone. Mark, tell me you’ll train me, that you’ll let me travel with you!

speaker: Lyn
text: You will? That’s just wonderful! Thank you! Oh, thank you! We’ll be better off working together, I know it. You’ll be my master strategist, and I’ll be your peerless warrior! We can do it! Right?

speaker: Tutorial
text: Travel with Lyn, Mark. Give her your aid, and master the art of combat. Complete the tasks set out in each chapter, and help Lyn in her quest. Turn the instruction window on or off by pressing SELECT.

speaker: Sonia
text: You there, open the cell.

speaker: Black Fang
text: Lady Sonia? Bu-But… the prisoner… My orders are that none may see him.

speaker: Sonia
text: Open the cell. …Did you hear me?

speaker: Black Fang
text: Yes… Yes!

speaker: Pascal
text: Oho… Aren’t you a lovely one? I pray you’ll forgive the cramped quarters.

speaker: Sonia
text: Pascal Grentzer, once and former count of Bern’s Landskron. A man whose battlefield prowess was feared far and wide… Until you invited your citizens to your castle and slaughtered them. Stripped of your title, you fled the king and joined the Black Fang. Is that an accurate summary?

speaker: Pascal
text: Hmmm… You know me well, it would seem.

speaker: Sonia
text: You were even made one of the Four Fangs. Spending the rest of your days in this place seems so wasteful. I’ve heard that Brendan calls you “the Beast.” A monster who would massacre an entire village to kill one person.

speaker: Pascal
text: He doesn’t know how to enjoy his work. “Never harm any innocents.” Bah. “The Black Fang brings justice to those above the law.” Ha ha ha… Quite droll jokes, don’t you think?

speaker: Sonia
text: I’m going to release you, Count. I’ve a job for you. Something you’ll love. What do you say? Are you interested?

speaker: Pascal
text: Hmmm… Why not? It can’t be worse than rotting here. And I must say, I do love my work… Now, tell me. What is the name of my target?

speaker: Hector
text: This is a really remote area, isn’t it?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yeah. Few people call this area home.

speaker: Lyn
text: Hector, are you sure about this? Is the Fire Emblem really here?

speaker: Hector
text: Yes, I paid a small ransom for this information. There’s no mistake. Look! Do you see those three run-down fortresses? I was told the thieves who base themselves there stole the Emblem.

speaker: Lyn
text: Thieves. Wonder if it’s true.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We’ll simply have to go and confirm it for ourselves.

speaker: Hector
text: Come on. Let’s go!

speaker: Lyn
text: Oh! Wait, you two! This looks… It’s them!

speaker: Pascal
text: It’s about time. Shall we get started?

speaker: Black Fang
text: Lo…Lord Pascal, are you sure? Shouldn’t we tell the chief we’ve found them?

speaker: Pascal
text: You don’t understand, do you? If we tell anyone, the Four Fangs will take over. I will not let my prey be snatched away by those spoiled children.

speaker: Black Fang
text: But… But…

speaker: Pascal
text: If you wish to be executed for desertion, I’ll not stop you from fleeing. I think it would be more fun to fight though, don’t you? Shall we proceed, gentlemen?

speaker: Lyn
text: …Looks like we’re completely surrounded.

speaker: Hector
text: Bah, I don’t think we’ll lose if we fight, but… These are not the most favorable conditions. OK! I don’t care who, but someone needs to break out and seize those fortresses. Got that!? We seize all three of them!

speaker: Florina
text: Oh, Mark.

speaker: Fiora
text: We’re moving out, too, right, Mark? Let’s go, Florina.

speaker: Florina
text: OK… But there are so many of them. If only Farina were here with us…

speaker: Fiora
text: Florina, it’s not helping us to talk about her now. Now, Mark. Give us our orders.

speaker: Farina
text: Wow! It’s started! I must negotiate quickly, or all the fighting will be done! Who looks to be in charge on this side? Aha! There! That must be the leader!

speaker: Pascal
text: I am Count Pascal Grentzer of Landskron... The man who will cut short your miserable lives.

speaker: Pascal
text: Gahaa... Urrg...gaa... Is this...death? Is this...what I have... wrought so oft before?

speaker: Karla
text: Hmmm… I heard there was a fighter whose swordwork was a terror to behold. I traveled a long way to see him myself, but it wasn’t my brother. My brother’s strokes are far more lovely. I would lend you my sword, but I’m looking for someone. Take this. It is a poor substitute, but perhaps it will help you.

speaker: Farina
text: Say, excuse me! Yes, you, the grim-faced one!

speaker: Hector
text: Me?

speaker: Farina
text: You’re really pushing yourself, taking on all these enemies.

speaker: Hector
text: It’s not for pleasure! Hey, who are you, anyway!? You’re not with those guys, are you?

speaker: Farina
text: Me? No, I’m not. I came out here because I heard I could make some gold. What a joke! Only a fool would work for this piddling amount! Skills like mine do not some cheap.

speaker: Hector
text: You seem pretty... sure of yourself.

speaker: Farina
text: I am Farina, a mercenary attached to the Strongwings, Ilia’s 3rd division of pegasus knights. No doubt you’ve heard of me!

speaker: Hector
text: I’ve heard Ilian mercenaries never betray their employers. So...how much would it cost to hire you for ourselves?

speaker: Farina
text: Ah, so you’ve an appreciation for true warriors after all? Let me see... I’m yours for 20,000 gold.

speaker: Hector
text: 20,000 gold!?! That’s laughable. No sellsword is worth that much!

speaker: Farina
text: I beg to differ. Your journey is a long one, is it not? More than one battle, surely. That requires a special contract, special arrangements. Not to be morbid, but there are sympathy payments to my family in the unlikely event of my death, for example. Not to mention bonuses and hazard pay, medical treatment...

speaker: Hector
text: Hold on! That’s enough!! ...Your fee includes all of that, right?

speaker: Farina
text: Ah, so you understand? I’m so pleased. Well, what’ll it be? Will you hire me?

speaker: Hector
text: What should I do... Hey, Mark! You decide. Should we hire her?

speaker: Hector
text: Here it is: 20,000 gold. You’ve no complaints, do you?

speaker: Farina
text: Wow!

speaker: Hector
text: What is it? You’ll accept it, right?

speaker: Farina
text: ...You surprise me. You didn’t even try to negotiate... Just paid the gold up front! Who... Who are you?

speaker: Hector
text: I’m Marquess Ostia’s brother, Hector. Are you going to take the money or not?

speaker: Farina
text: Ah! My gold!! Of course I’ll take it! Ostia’s the biggest territory in all Lycia, isn’t it? Pleasure doing business with you, noble sir!

speaker: Hector
text: Mm. I’m counting on you.

speaker: Farina
text: Oh, and there are weapons and vulneraries, too. All of my current possessions are included in my fee. Anything new, you pay for. I never cover those expenses. Never!

speaker: Hector
text: You’ve got it all figured out, don’t you?

speaker: Farina
text: Well, if it isn’t Florina!

speaker: Florina
text: Farina... Is it truly you?

speaker: Farina
text: It’s been so long! How have you been?

speaker: Farina
text: Hey! Don’t start crying all over me!!

speaker: Florina
text: ...But... ...Farina... ...I haven’t seen you since you ran away from home.

speaker: Farina
text: Ran away? I didn’t run away.

speaker: Florina
text: But... ...Fiora, she... she said that you weren’t coming home again......

speaker: Farina
text: Well, uh...we... You know, sisters fight sometimes. I said things, she said things... It’s in the past now.

speaker: Florina
text: ...Really?

speaker: Farina
text: Really! Really! Now stop crying, please? So, um... You’re fighting with Lord Hector, too, right? It looks like we’ll be working together for a while.

speaker: Florina
text: ...Uh-huh!

speaker: Farina
text: Ah, Sister?

speaker: Fiora
text: Farina...You...Why are you here?

speaker: Farina
text: You and Florina are with Lord Hector’s company, right?

speaker: Fiora
text: Yes, that’s right. ... You, too?

speaker: Farina
text: Mm. I’m getting paid a nice, hefty sum. I plan to see he gets his money’s worth.

speaker: Fiora
text: Farina... I know it’s been two years, but...

speaker: Farina
text: What? Oh...that. Let’s talk about it later, just the two of us. See you!

speaker: Fiora
text: Oh! Farina... .....

speaker: Hector
text: That’s it! It’s finished! You’re not nearly good enough to trap us!

speaker: Lyn
text: We should have listened to Eliwood. We should’ve gone toward the palace and avoided this trap.

speaker: Hector
text: No sense worrying about it now. What we need to worry about is where we go from here.

speaker: Lyn
text: Now you try and talk sense? You really are something else, Hector.

speaker: Hector
text: Can’t hold a candle to you, though.

speaker: Lyn
text: What did you say?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Peace! Both of you! Anytime we’re able to weaken our foe, we’ve done well. Now we’ve got to get out of here. No telling when reinforcements might arrive.

speaker: Hector
text: All right. Let’s go.

speaker: Lyn
text: You’re right. Let’s hurry.

speaker: Eliwood
text: A great, rotted tree... This would appear to be the place of which Uhai spoke.

speaker: Lyn
text: So if we move west from here, we’ll reach the Dragon’s Gate, right?

speaker: Hector
text: OK, let’s go!

speaker: Lyn
text: Hector, hold a moment.

speaker: Hector
text: What?

speaker: Lyn
text: Walk quietly. Your armor is too noisy.

speaker: Hector
text: Oh! ... How’s this?

speaker: Lyn
text: You’re still clanking.

speaker: Hector
text: Do you see what I’m wearing? This equipment is not light! How do you propose I walk quietly in this!?

speaker: Lyn
text: Stop yelling at me! It’s because of that clattering armor you’re wearing! I’m just saying we have to move cautiously. Nothing more!

speaker: Hector
text: I know! And I’m saying that I’m doing my best!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Quiet, both of you! Armor or no, if you two keep shouting like that, every enemy from here to Pherae itself will hear us!

speaker: Lyn
text: Ah...

speaker: Hector
text: Sorry.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We must proceed with caution.  I can’t believe Uhai was the only Black Fang in these woods.

speaker: Black Fang
text: Lord Aion, we’ve received word from the pegasus unit. Targets are approaching from the far side of that mountain to the east.

speaker: Aion
text: Hmph... Uhai must have failed after all. I’m not surprised. We’re talking about the shallow wisdom of a Sacaen nomad, after all. He possessed a certain rough talent, but no mind for planning. Our units are in place, are they not?

speaker: Black Fang
text: Yes.

speaker: Aion
text: Ha ha... Good. Very good. In confined spaces like this, my thunder magic devastates. The battle has already been won... I cannot lose. Combat is an equation. Those with intelligence have a natural advantage. Those imbeciles will not reach the Dragon’s Gate. Never. I will bury them here in this forest!

speaker: Eliwood
text: I can see ruins. Is that the Dragon’s Gate?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian? Are you all right?

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Beware! ......The enemy comes!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Enemy?

speaker: Shaman
text: Eliwood of Pherae! Prepare yourself!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Oof!! We won’t reach the Dragon’s Gate if we stay on the defensive. Hit their commander, and attack the ruins!

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood. Is their commander the one in the ruins?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I think so. It must be him.

speaker: Hector
text: Looks like he’s a pretty solid magic user. Bah, I’m still not confident against mages and their ilk.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Is that so, Hector? Perhaps you should hold back a little then.

speaker: Hector
text: What nonsense is that? I can’t fight from the rear!

speaker: Eliwood
text: No, I just meant that sometimes it’s advantageous to...

speaker: Hector
text: Why waste good breath on words when there’s fighting to be done! C’mon!

speaker: Eliwood
text: H-Hey! Hector!! ...Why do I even try?!

speaker: Fiora
text: Honored tactician... Your name is Mark, correct? The enemy commander is readying his troops beyond that mountain. I can fly over the mountain and direct you, but... Getting too close could prove to be dangerous. Bear that in mind when you give me my orders.

speaker: Aion
text: Wha-What?! The magic power of this place... The source is...distorted... I...I can’t use any of my magic!

speaker: Black Fang
text: Lord Aion! Disaster! A magic seal!

speaker: Aion
text: A magic– That good-for-nothing has shown his face?! Curses... I’d not forseen this!!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Who is it? What are you doing there!?

speaker: Renault
text: I’m Renault. I’m on a pilgrimage.

speaker: Eliwood
text: A bishop!? Forgive my rudeness...

speaker: Renault
text: What are you doing here? You don’t appear to be with the black-robed group I saw earlier.

speaker: Eliwood
text: No, we stand opposed to them. ...This is a battleground. You should stay here, Your Excellency. This battle is nothing that need concern you.

speaker: Renault
text: I’m sure that I cannot convince you to lay down your arms. That being the case, I give you this.

speaker: Eliwood
text: This...

speaker: Renault
text: It may help you live longer. Even if you face the misery of defeat in combat, you might yet find another road if you but live.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Thank you.

speaker: Renault
text: May you be watched over and protected in your venture.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Thank you. You as well, Your Excellency.

speaker: Aion
text: Thunder! Thunder, hear my cry!

speaker: Aion
text: This can’t be... happening...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Is everyone well?

speaker: Hector
text: Yes, somehow.

speaker: Lyn
text: Eliwood, I’m sorry. I said things I shouldn’t have.

speaker: Hector
text: No, I was shouting without thinking. I was wrong. Forgive me.

speaker: Lyn
text: No, it was my fault. If I hadn’t...

speaker: Eliwood
text: It’s no one’s fault. There’s an eerie power here.

speaker: Hector
text: Eerie power?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I don’t feel it any longer, but... It was meant to make us uneasy. Was it connected to that area where magic was nullified?

speaker: Lyn
text: Now that you mention it, I was so irritable... I couldn’t let even the smallest thing go by without complaining. ...What could that have been? The Black Fang couldn’t use magic either. So it wasn’t an ally of theirs...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Who knows?

speaker: Hector
text: It’s gone now, so no sense in worrying about it. We should concentrate on pushing forward.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hmm. Let’s make haste to the Dragon’s Gate.

speaker: Nils
text: ...So hot. I'm...going to die.

speaker: Hector
text: Hey, do you want me to carry you on my back?

speaker: Nils
text: Huh?

speaker: Hector
text: Why are you looking at me like that?

speaker: Nils
text: Such kindness from you surprised me, Lord Hector. Is this some fever dream?

speaker: Hector
text: What's that supposed to mean? I was concerned that you might collapse again, like the other day.

speaker: Lyn
text: You're usually so brusque. It's no wonder he's confused. Don't be shy, Nils. Let him help you out.

speaker: Hector
text: Do as you're told, boy!

speaker: Nils
text: Waaa!! Waaaaaaa!!! I'm going to fall! I'm going to fall!!!

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Marquess Ostia said, "Enter the desert and move west. Someone will meet you." ...And yet we've seen no one.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I wonder if we need to move farther in?

speaker: Ninian
text: ...You might be right.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Here.

speaker: Ninian
text: What?

speaker: Eliwood
text: This heat is taking its toll on you. If you please, take my arm.

speaker: Ninian
text: I couldn't...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Oh, come now.

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Very well. Forgive me... ......

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hm? Is something wrong?

speaker: Ninian
text: ...It's strange.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What is?

speaker: Ninian
text: All of you treat my brother and me so...normally. Doesn't it bother you? Our powers...our looks... We're different from...people...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Has that been bothering you? What's wrong with being a bit different from other people? When I look at you, I don't see other people. I see Ninian. I see a normal, kindhearted girl.

speaker: Ninian
text: Do you speak truly?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mm.

speaker: Ninian
text: Lord Eliwood.

speaker: Athos
text: ...I believe someone approaches.

speaker: Louise
text: Is it Lord Pent?

speaker: Athos
text: No, it's a group sent by Uther of Ostia. Hawkeye will find them soon and bring them here. Hmph. Your companion is still searching in the desert.

speaker: Louise
text: He's not having any luck finding what he's after, is he?

speaker: Athos
text: No, I believe he'll find it before long. ...However, a group of bandits is also moving. They've found Pent and are preparing to attack.

speaker: Louise
text: Oh, that's...

speaker: Athos
text: Are you concerned for his safety?

speaker: Louise
text: No, Lord Pent can take care of himself. However, if his return here is delayed...

speaker: Athos
text: Yes?

speaker: Louise
text: Will you take your evening meal without us? I will wait for Lord Pent, but I'm sure you must be hungry.

speaker: Athos
text: Ha ha ha ha...

speaker: Louise
text: Lord Athos? What is it?

speaker: Athos
text: ...It's you, Louise. You are a most amusing woman. Since Pent brought you here, I feel I've laughed enough for ten years! You have my gratitude.

speaker: Louise
text: Hm? I'm not sure I understand, but I'm pleased to have been of service.

speaker: Athos
text: Ha ha ha.

speaker: Louise
text: By the way, the visitors are coming from Lycia, aren't they? I wonder what they want.

speaker: Louise
text: Lord Archsage, your coloring... Are you well?

speaker: Athos
text: Once it begins to turn, none can halt the wheel of fate. But as long as there is hope, people continue to try. ...They do not know the despair that awaits...

speaker: Ninian
text: Um, Lord Eliwood?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: Over there... Someone is under attack.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Hector
text: Ah! That must be him!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Looks like.....a lone man and a crowd of bandits.

speaker: Lyn
text: Let's help him! I dislike seeing someone facing overwhelming odds!

speaker: Hector
text: Hold on, Lyn! I'm going with you!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hey, you two!

speaker: Nils
text: Where do they get all that energy? Unbelievable.

speaker: Ninian
text: ...What will you do?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Let's go! Have to keep up with one's friends, right?

speaker: Paul
text: Oh, look at this kindly soul, Jasmine! He's waiting all by himself to give us his treasure!

speaker: Jasmine
text: Oho, Paul! I do believe you're right! Such generosity!!

speaker: Pent
text: ...It's taken me many days to find this. I've worked too hard to hand this over to you thugs.

speaker: Paul
text: So rude... And to think we were going to let you live... We're fragile creatures! You can't trifle with our emotions so! You're a bad man! He's so bad, Jasmine!

speaker: Jasmine
text: Oh, Paul. I know it. I really do. My heart, it is breaking.

speaker: Paul
text: What? You, too, Jasmine?

speaker: Jasmine
text: And you as well, Paul?

speaker: Paul
text: Let's go! We must convince him to reconsider!

speaker: Pent
text: ...I've no wish to hurt you...

speaker: Canas
text: Actually, this is quite fascinating. Mark, the Nabata wasteland is a bit of a paradise to magic adepts. Stories tell of the many magical artifacts lost in these sands. I'll keep my eyes open. Of course, I'll be fighting as well.

speaker: Rath
text: Mark… It’s been a long time. No… I have no other business. Command me as you’ve done in the past.

speaker: Paul
text: I can't believe we lost, Brother... Aaah... It's a tragedy, Jasmine.

speaker: Jasmine
text: I got hit, but it feels gooood... These people are too strong, Paul...

speaker: Fa
text: You know what? I’m watching the house all by myself. Do you know how to do that? You have to sit and be good. So that’s why I’m here. What are all of you guys doing? Are you hunting for treasure, like that other guy? Let me tell you a secret. There’s something good buried near the bones. I know stuff like that.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Who are you?

speaker: Hawkeye
text: I'm Hawkeye, defender of this desert.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Defender? Of a desert?

speaker: Hawkeye
text: I will drive out the bandits. Guests need not fight.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Please wait! Guests!?

speaker: Hector
text: Ahh…shade. Whew…that’s nice. …Huh? Shade…

speaker: Hector
text: Hm! Waaa! Who… Who are you?!?

speaker: Hawkeye
text: I’m Hawkeye, defender of this desert.

speaker: Hector
text: You’re with them? You’ve got some nerve threatening me!

speaker: Hawkeye
text: I will drive the bandits away. Guests need not fight.

speaker: Hector
text: …Huh? He-Hey! What’s going on?

speaker: Pent
text: Hello there. Beautiful weather, isn't it?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Er... Yes, sure.

speaker: Pent
text: Pardon, I'm in the midst of some confusion. I beg your leave.

speaker: Hector
text: Hey, you! Are you OK?

speaker: Pent
text: Hello there. Beautiful weather, isn’t it?

speaker: Hector
text: What?

speaker: Pent
text: Pardon, I’m in the midst of some confusion. I beg your leave.

speaker: Hector
text: H-Hey! Hold it! Grrr! Don’t leave me here!!!

speaker: Pent
text: You really helped me out. Thank you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: We couldn't watch such a lopsided battle. That's all.

speaker: Pent
text: So why have you come to this wasteland?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Well... We were told to come here and meet a "living legend."

speaker: Pent
text: Living legend? Ha ha ha! I see. That's well said.

speaker: Lyn
text: But do you know what it means?

speaker: Pent
text: Yes, I suppose I do. Looks like we share a common destination. Hawkeye! You're here, too.

speaker: Hawkeye
text: Pent, did you find it?

speaker: Pent
text: That I did. And as I thought, it's spectacular.

speaker: Hawkeye
text: It's getting dark. Let's go back.

speaker: Pent
text: Yes, let's make haste. Desert nights are treacherous.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Oh...OK.

speaker: Hector
text: I don't mind going with you, but how far do we have to walk? No matter how far we go, there's just more sand... What!?

speaker: Lyn
text: Hector? What is...it... Hect... Kyaa!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector? Lyndis? Where did those two... Hnh? What in blazes!? I'm... I'm sinking into the sand!

speaker: Eliwood
text: We've received word from Captain Fargus. If we come to Badon, he'll give us passage to the Dread Isle.

speaker: Lyn
text: Well then, let's get going!

speaker: Marcus
text: It would be best if we outfitted ourselves before setting out. We will need many supplies for a campaign on Valor.

speaker: Hector
text: And the castle town here is better stocked than Badon, I'm sure. We can empty the coffers here and sell the treasures if need be.

speaker: Oswin
text: Harrummph!!

speaker: Hector
text: ...Uh... Within limits, of course. Say...30,000 gold?

speaker: Oswin
text: That seems a reasonable amount.

speaker: Hector
text: Come on! I'll lead the way!

speaker: Marcus
text: Ostia's castle town is as impressive as ever. Shops and items of all types imaginable.

speaker: Hector
text: For generations, our ancestors dedicated themselves to a sort of frugal militarism. Nobles and commoners alike shunned extravagance. "Corrupt neither the body nor the mind," they cried! Since the time of Roland, this has been the dominant ideology of Ostia.

speaker: Marcus
text: I heard that when Lord Uther first participated in the Lycian Council as Marquess Ostia, he gave a scathing indictment of the peer system. Now I understand, his philosophy had its roots in the history of Ostia itself.

speaker: Hector
text: That's right. Yet this thinking... it threatens the lifestyles of many of our aristocrats. So some groups view my brother with enmity. I must grow wiser so that I can sit at my brother's side and aid him. Of course, my fighting skills are not yet what they should be...

speaker: Hector
text: But this isn't the place for that kind of talk. We've got to get going. Come on!

speaker: Marcus
text: Yes, I will go with you.

speaker: Lyn
text: ...Curious.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What is it, Lyndis?

speaker: Lyn
text: Hector. He acts like such a brute, but he takes his duties seriously.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector has always been a man of firm character. I've always envied him for that. His ability to conceal any doubts he feels about himself or his actions.

speaker: Lyn
text: Eliwood, you're more than strong enough yourself.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hm?

speaker: Lyn
text: Look at all that's happened in the past few months. Especially for you, Eliwood. One horrible thing after another...

speaker: Lyn
text: Yet you're still here. You didn't run away. Through all the battles and injuries... you've held your head high and marched on. Your... Your strength, I admire. Your kindness...I adore.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Lyndis...
Hey! What are you two doing? Let's go! Both of you!

speaker: Lyn
text: Well... I guess we should go.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Uh, Lyndis...

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood, what are you yammering about? Huh? Are you feeling OK? You're all flushed.

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Hector... About last night...

speaker: Hector
text: Don’t worry about it. No matter the clamor I raise, my brother is dead. All I can do now is try not to distract Eliwood and the others. I must put on a strong face, must be strong for them.

speaker: Oswin
text: I see.

speaker: Hector
text: But, Oswin, I...will not forgive you.

speaker: Hector
text: Not only you, but my brother, as well. Why...why did you hide this from me? Only me? Am I...so untrustworthy?

speaker: Oswin
text: ...Lord Hector, you may hate me and scorn me as you will, but... doubting Lord Uther’s intentions? You should not do that.

speaker: Oswin
text: I... The last message I received from Lord Uther ordered that, should he die, I must keep that news secret from you.

speaker: Hector
text: But why?

speaker: Oswin
text: This is what was written in Lord Uther’s letter... He is true to his own feelings... If asked to choose between his brother and the world, he would not hesitate in rushing to my side. Though he often speaks in anger, we are brothers. We are all we have. I have never doubted his affection. Yet what if the choice were between brother and friend? To choose one would mean abandoning the other. He would come to despise himself, whatever his choice. I cannot force him to make such a decision.

speaker: Oswin
text: Lord Uther had your feelings foremost in his heart. He was also considering Eliwood, who had lost his father. ...Please, if nothing else...understand this.

speaker: Soldier
text: Lord Hector! I have brought the 30,000 gold that was requested from the treasury!

speaker: Bartre
text: Will you look at that! It's an arena! That is a battleground for men to test their strength! Come on, Mark! We can fight to our heart's content!!

speaker: Karla
text: No leads here either… Where in the world could he have gotten to? Ah…brother of mine…

speaker: Bartre
text: You! Wench!

speaker: Karla
text: Hm?

speaker: Bartre
text: Meeting me here will be your doom! I must erase the shame I met on the Western Isles! Come! We duel!

speaker: Karla
text: ...Oh, I remember you. You’re the guy who came out of nowhere and challenged me... The one I knocked out with my first sword stroke.

speaker: Bartre
text: The Bartre before you is not the same one you faced then! I will have my revenge for the Isles here in Ostia! Now, dig up some courage, and do your worst!

speaker: Karla
text: Hmmm... I did not come here looking for a fight. But how can I refuse you your revenge? Let us begin.

speaker: Karla
text: Oh... It seems you’ve improved some.

speaker: Bartre
text: Quiet! We’ve only just started. Continue!

speaker: Karla
text: So tell me, where have you been training?

speaker: Bartre
text: I serve Lord Eliwood now. I’m working as a guard for him! Tough opponents every day, but we just tear ’em up and cast ’em aside!

speaker: Karla
text: Ha... That’s interesting. If that’s the case, I think I’ll join you.

speaker: Bartre
text: What?

speaker: Karla
text: My brother gravitates toward strong warriors... This journey of yours sounds like a dangerous one. Joining you might help me find him sooner.

speaker: Bartre
text: I don’t know what you mean! What about our duel?!

speaker: Karla
text: We’ll put it on hold. Don’t worry. I don’t run away. I like you. It would be a waste to kill you here. Someday I’ll finish you in an appropriate fashion!

speaker: Bartre
text: Hmm... OK! Agreed! You’re now my sworn enemy, wench!

speaker: Hector
text: ...What is it? If you need something, get out here!

speaker: Matthew
text: Ha ha... Spotted me, eh? ... Well, um... Ah! Young master, beautiful day, isn’t it?

speaker: Hector
text: Looks like it’s about to rain to me.

speaker: Matthew
text: Oh...ah... Is that so?

speaker: Hector
text: Stop treating me like a pouting child. I’m fine. You needn’t worry about me.

speaker: Matthew
text: Is that so? No problems then, eh?

speaker: Hector
text: Did you know, too? About my brother...

speaker: Matthew
text: .....Yes. I’m sorry for holding my tongue.

speaker: Hector
text: Worried about me, right? Sorry about that. There’s a lot going on.

speaker: Matthew
text: Please don’t apologize! ...You’re going to make me cry... Like his father before him... ... such a good man... wh...why...

speaker: Hector
text: My brother really was a great man, wasn’t he? A man like me, I don’t know if I can follow in his footsteps.

speaker: Matthew
text: What are you saying? Young master... for Ostia, and for Leila... ... We...

speaker: Hector
text: All right. Well then, we’d better survive this war. Both of us... For Ostia...to protect her!

speaker: Matthew
text: That’s right! We must make it back!

speaker: Serra
text: Looorrrd He-ctor!

speaker: Hector
text: Hm? Oh, Serra. What is it?

speaker: Serra
text: Eww! Is there something wrong with you?

speaker: Hector
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Serra
text: Come on! I’m right here, and you’re not mad or anything! It’s like all the laws of nature have been inverted!

speaker: Hector
text: ...Do I really treat you so poorly?

speaker: Serra
text: Yes, you do. You make the face and shoo me away.

speaker: Hector
text: Really? Sorry about that.

speaker: Serra
text: Don’t do that! Oh, you’re bound to cause some catastrophe if you keep behaving so oddly! Run for your lives! Hector’s being nice!

speaker: Hector
text: Uh...

speaker: Serra
text: Oh, I’m only joking. There’s reason to run after all! Only, Lord Hector, there’s just one thing I must know.

speaker: Hector
text: What is it?

speaker: Serra
text: When is Lord Uther coming back?

speaker: Hector
text: What?!

speaker: Serra
text: I was so looking forward to getting some sort of reward. With him gone, I’m wondering how much longer I must wait! I would’ve loved to have gone to Etruria! I’m so disappointed!

speaker: Hector
text: ...So no one’s told you anything either.

speaker: Serra
text: Hm? About what?

speaker: Hector
text: It’s a–nothing.

speaker: Serra
text: Hm? Something’s weird. More importantly, Lord Hector! It’s time to go shopping. I’ve found some hair ornaments that are perfect for me...

speaker: Hector
text: Do you want me to buy them?

speaker: Serra
text: Huh? Would you really?

speaker: Hector
text: You want them, right?

speaker: Serra
text: No, no, no...

speaker: Hector
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Serra
text: Look ooouuuuuutttt!!! It’s an earthquake! It’s the cataclysm! Save me! Blessed Elimine!

speaker: Hector
text: ...Hey. That’s a bit much, isn’t it?

speaker: Lyn
text: Hector! Wait up a minute!

speaker: Hector
text: Hm? What is it?

speaker: Lyn
text: ...I’m sorry.

speaker: Hector
text: Huh?

speaker: Lyn
text: ...When we first met, I criticized your fighting style, remember? ...I wanted to apologize...

speaker: Hector
text: Oh, that? Don’t worry about it. ...Why bring this up now?

speaker: Lyn
text: I used to think you were selfish, oblivious to others’ needs. Even after all this time, I only saw you as crude and insensitive.

speaker: Hector
text: Hey, now... Do I really need to hear this? I mean, what’s your point?

speaker: Lyn
text: ...I used to be like that, too. I relied too much on my own strength and stuck to myself... All I did was cause problems to the people around me. ...I think you’re like that, too... So, sometimes, I feel I’m looking at the old me. Sometimes...I treat you horribly.

speaker: Hector
text: Yeah, that’s true. Sometimes, you really lay into me.

speaker: Lyn
text: ...But aboard the pirate ship... and back there...what you said made me realize I was wrong. So...I’m sorry.

speaker: Hector
text: ...You apologized once before. I admitted that I’ve got a bad attitude... It’s fine, right? Just let it go.

speaker: Lyn
text: Let it go? I can’t just let it go! That doesn’t satisfy me. ...Hit me! It’ll make me feel better!

speaker: Hector
text: What?

speaker: Lyn
text: C’mon! I won’t move! Wind up and let it fly!

speaker: Hector
text: You... Hahhh...

speaker: Lyn
text: Hm? ... ...Hector? What is it? Are you afraid?!

speaker: Hector
text: Give me a break. Do you think I could hit a woman?

speaker: Lyn
text: It’s OK. Just don’t think of me as a woman.

speaker: Hector
text: I can’t smack a woman I’ve lost my heart to.

speaker: Lyn
text: C’mon! Hurry– ...What?

speaker: Hector
text: Look, enough of this foolishness. Let’s go!

speaker: Lyn
text: ...What did you just say? Hold it! Hector!!

speaker: Man
text: Weapons and items can help build your fortune, you know? You ought to search through any chest you come across.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...That should cover it. Let’s head out for Badon. Then to the Dread Isle!!

speaker: Hector
text: Eliwood! I forgot something in the castle. Go on ahead. I’ll catch up shortly.

speaker: Eliwood
text: All right.

speaker: Hector
text: The throne is empty... Makes her look so small. ......Even on the verge of death, you worried about me... Blast... You were always like that, eh, Brother? I never asked it of you, but you watched over me nonetheless... Like a father... With that know-it-all look... I told you... Don’t treat me like a kid... You never listened. ......I’m coming back. I’ll take care of Nergal and end his threat to the world. I’ll be back... And I’ll take the throne. I may not be nearly as dependable as you, Brother, but... Even so, together we’ll make Ostia and all Lycia a place of peace. We’ll put an end to peerage and make Ostia a place where all are equal. ...We’ll try our best... Watch and see. Brother!

speaker: Limstella
text: Welcome home, Master.

speaker: Nergal
text: Limstella, look at this.

speaker: Limstella
text: The children's dragon stone. What will you do with it?

speaker: Nergal
text: I will infuse it with quintessence.

speaker: Limstella
text: This is...

speaker: Nergal
text: The dragon girl... Ninian's essence. Beautiful... Absolutely beautiful....... With this, I will be able to call dragons whenever I please.

speaker: Limstella
text: Shall we begin the process right away?

speaker: Nergal
text: No, I lost some quintessence from the injuries I took from Athos. To summon the numbers I need, I must have more essence. One must be fully prepared when dealing with dragons. If they wrested free from my control and killed me, all would be for naught.

speaker: Limstella
text: I fear to report... that the quintessence from the Black Fang has all been used. Where shall the next harvest come from?

speaker: Nergal
text: Heh heh heh... All the materials we need are heading this way even now.

speaker: Limstella
text: ...I see. Eliwood and friends.

speaker: Nergal
text: That's right. I will crush them, steal their essences, and call forth my dragons!! Heh heh heh... Haaa haa haha haha hah!!!

speaker: Wil
text: Ah, this should suffice! Tonight’s bed!

speaker: Sain
text: This mildewy old fortress? Is this the best we can do? Come, Wil! Surely you jest!

speaker: Wil
text: The bandits keep everything in turmoil around here. No one has time to worry about travelers. And there are rather a lot of us.

speaker: Lyn
text: This will be fine. Who wants to be stuck inside, anyway? I prefer a place where I can feel the wind blow.

speaker: Florina
text: As long as I’m at Lyn’s side, I’ll be fine.

speaker: Sain
text: And for your protection, your man-at-arms Sain will be right here by your side, ladies.

speaker: Kent
text: Sain, both you and I are to remain awake. We will alternate the watch.

speaker: Sain
text: Ah, alas...

speaker: Unknown
text: Your pardon, milady...

speaker: Lyn
text: Who’s there?

speaker: Natalie
text: I...Forgive my intrusion...My name’s Natalie. I’m from a village not far from here...Ah! Ow...

speaker: Lyn
text: Are you all right?

speaker: Natalie
text: Hm?

speaker: Lyn
text: Your leg...

speaker: Natalie
text: It’s fine. Don’t worry. It’s from a childhood sickness...I can’t travel far on it, but it doesn’t trouble me much.

speaker: Lyn
text: What are you doing here all by yourself?

speaker: Natalie
text: I’m looking for my husband...I heard he was in this area. He said he was going to raise money to have my leg mended. He left the village and hasn’t returned. He’s a kindhearted man, but I think he might be involved in something dangerous. I got so worried...Here’s a sketch of him. It’s a poor likeness at best, but...His name is Dorcas. Do you know of him?

speaker: Lyn
text: I’m sorry. I don’t believe I’ve seen or heard of him.

speaker: Natalie
text: I see...If you do meet him, please give him a message. Tell him that Natalie is looking for him.

speaker: Lyn
text: I will tell him. I promise.

speaker: Carjiga
text: Here they are. We’ve finally tracked down the band that defeated Migal.

speaker: Ratface
text: So they’ve decided to hole up in this ruined fortress. Perfect. We’ll wait ’til it gets dark, and then...

speaker: Carjiga
text: You’re an idiot! There are only a few of them, and some are women! If we attacked them at night, I’d be a laughingstock! Besides, we might hurt the women by mistake! I will not be so wasteful!

speaker: Ratface
text: You’re right, Carjiga! You’re so smart!

speaker: Carjiga
text: We’ll avenge Migal and get some pretty souvenirs to boot. Who knows, maybe I’ll be a leader after all. Ha ha ha! Let’s go! Spread out and encircle the place, you rogues! Let’s finish this before it gets too dark to see!

speaker: Carjiga
text: Hey, you! Your name’s...Dorcas, right?

speaker: Carjiga
text: You haven’t done much since you joined us. If those weapons of yours aren’t just for show, today’s the day to let us see what you can do.

speaker: Carjiga
text: I want you to attack from the back entrance to the east. There’s supposed to be a woman inside. I want you to capture her. Do that, and I’ll increase your share of the take. If you want gold, you’ll get the job done.

speaker: Dorcas
text: A bunch of women, huh? It would break Natalie’s sweet heart to see me sink so low.

speaker: Kent
text: Lady Lyndis! Outside the fortress! Bandits!

speaker: Lyn
text: What did you say?

speaker: Sain
text: Persistent bunch, aren’t they? What do you think? Shall we go out and face them?

speaker: Lyn
text: No... Natalie cannot move well, and that would put her in danger. Let them come to us. We’ll fight here, within these walls.

speaker: Lyn
text: Mark, take over. The command is yours. All we have to do is hold out until they tire and leave.

speaker: Natalie
text: Oh...

speaker: Lyn
text: Rest easy, Natalie. No one will harm you! Listen, everyone! Fight with caution!

speaker: Tutorial
text: In this chapter, your goal is to protect a special character for a set period of time. Keep Natalie safe for 7 turns.  Natalie, and other green units are called NPCs. NPCs are not enemies, but they cannot be moved or given orders. Sometimes, green units will be attacked because they are on the field of combat. Be careful not to let enemies close in on Natalie.

speaker: Lyn
text: Mark! This fortress has two entrances. That’s where we must meet the enemy! I’ll take the eastern door. Mark, you and the others guard the main entrance.

speaker: Tutorial
text: When the enemy far outnumbers your group, it's safer to restrict the battle to smaller areas. No matter how strong an enemy is, if he's attacked on all sides, he's sure to take massive damage. So, the east door is Lyn's, and the south door is everyone else's. Be on guard. Select Lyn, move her to the space indicated by the cursor, and have her wait.

speaker: Lyn
text: You must move me first. I need to get to the east door!

speaker: Lyn
text: The entrance to the east... I need to guard it and protect our rear!

speaker: Lyn
text: Mark! That man over there... Doesn’t he resemble the picture of Natalie’s husband?

speaker: Tutorial
text: Sometimes, you can speak with enemy characters. If you think you can converse with someone, move one of your units to an adjacent space. By and large, you'll know whom to send from hints you receive in other conversations. When you're not sure, just try using Lyn. Select Lyn now.

speaker: Lyn
text: I need to talk with that man. Bring me to him.

speaker: Lyn
text: Please, Tactician. I need to talk to that man!

speaker: Lyn
text: You! Tell me, are you Dorcas?

speaker: Dorcas
text: ..... How do you know my name?

speaker: Lyn
text: Natalie told me. What are you doing with these rogues?

speaker: Dorcas
text: I need money...

speaker: Lyn
text: That may be, but...joining up with mercenaries?

speaker: Dorcas
text: It's the only way to earn gold in these parts. I'll do anything...even this.

speaker: Lyn
text: For gold? Anything? Would you hurt your wife? Natalie is here! We're protecting her within this fortress!!

speaker: Dorcas
text: What!? Natalie's... She's here?

speaker: Lyn
text: She was so worried that she came looking for you. Think, Dorcas! Would your actions please your wife?

speaker: Dorcas
text: ..... ...You're right.

speaker: Lyn
text: Well?

speaker: Dorcas
text: I understand. I can't do this. I'm done with these bandits. Here and now.

speaker: Lyn
text: Really?

speaker: Dorcas
text: Yes... And I would repay you for your kindness toward Natalie. Allow me to fight for you.

speaker: Tutorial
text: In this way, you can sometimes turn enemies into allies. Never underestimate the persuasive power of speech. Your new companion, Dorcas, is an axe-wielding fighter. Do you remember the weapon triangle? Axes are strong against lances and weak against swords. Axes have more power than other weapons, but they are also more difficult to hit with. Try using Dorcas to attack. Select Dorcas now.

speaker: Dorcas
text: So you're their tactician... I'll use my axes and fight alongside you. Direct me as you will.

speaker: Tutorial
text: The weapon Dorcas is using is called a handaxe. Use it to attack an adjacent opponent, or throw it in indirect combat in the manner of a bow. This versatility makes it a valuable weapon.

speaker: Tutorial
text: Right now, after all of your units have moved, it automatically becomes the enemy's turn, right? Sometimes, there are moments when you might not want or be able to move all of your units. When it's bothersome to tell your units to wait one by one, select end from the map menu to speed things up. To display the map menu, place the cursor on an unoccupied space and press the A Button.

speaker: Carjiga
text: What are you waiting for? She's just a child! A girl! Grrr! Get more men up here now!!

speaker: Natalie
text: Ah...

speaker: Lyn
text: Natalie!

speaker: Lyn
text: I wasn't strong enough... ...I couldn't protect Natalie. I'm sorry Tactician... I need to be alone. ...I... I failed her when she needed help most.

speaker: Dorcas
text: Natalie!

speaker: Natalie
text: Is it you?

speaker: Dorcas
text: Natalie! Are you all right? What were you thinking, coming out all this way?

speaker: Natalie
text: I was worried about you. Please, don't let my leg trouble you anymore. You mustn't put yourself in such danger. Please!

speaker: Dorcas
text: I'm sorry. I must have been out of my head. I didn't realize... That girl Lyn made me open my eyes.

speaker: Natalie
text: Lyndis brought you here?

speaker: Dorcas
text: I'll explain later. We've got to drive back these bandits first. Listen, stay put. Don't move from here.

speaker: Natalie
text: All right. As long as you're here, I know I'm safe.

speaker: Carjiga
text: Urgh! How? How are they so tough? You! Bring me more men here right away!

speaker: Carjiga
text: Arrgh.. This isn't... Not me...

speaker: Lyn
text: The enemy's fled... Tactician! We've won!!!

speaker: Natalie
text: Dorcas!

speaker: Dorcas
text: I'm so sorry, Natalie.

speaker: Lyn
text: All's well that ends well. Right, Natalie?

speaker: Dorcas
text: Our village is close. I'll take Natalie home and return tomorrow.

speaker: Lyn
text: Hm? Why can't we just say our farewells today?

speaker: Dorcas
text: Well, I... I spoke with Tactician. I... I've been invited to join your group.

speaker: Lyn
text: But we're going to Lycia.

speaker: Dorcas
text: I have to go somewhere to earn money. If you think I'll be of use, I'd like to fight for you. You helped my wife... I owe you.

speaker: Lyn
text: Dorcas...

speaker: Natalie
text: Please, Lyn. We are both in agreement on this. Watch over my husband.

speaker: Lyn
text: Things have finally calmed down.

speaker: Kent
text: We shall take turns keeping watch. Please rest easily.

speaker: Lyn
text: Is that all right? Are you sure? Sain!

speaker: Sain
text: Ye-Yes! Of course!

speaker: Lyn
text: Let me warn you... If bandits sneak up on you, they will cut you down without mercy. Do you understand that?

speaker: Sain
text: What are you saying? Am I not a knight? There's no need to worry so! Right, Kent?

speaker: Kent
text: If there's anything suspicious, I will take care of it. Please be assured.

speaker: Lyn
text: Really? Well, goodnight then. See you tomorrow, Tactician.

speaker: Kent
text: Let's go.

speaker: Sain
text: Ha ha... No one trusts me...

speaker: Nergal
text: …I name you Kishuna. You are the only morph to whom I’ve given emotions. It won’t suffice simply to refer to you as a number. It is said man was sculpted by the hands of the gods. If so, then you, who were sculpted by these, my hands… And I, whose labors gave you breath and life… What are we, then? What does that make us? In your fabricated heart, which I gave unto you, what is it that you believe, Kishuna?

speaker: Nils
text: He... He's called some friends. They are...very powerful.

speaker: Pent
text: He summoned them here? I'm beginning to suspect the magic seal created this place.

speaker: Hawkeye
text: If we kill him, can we get out of here?

speaker: Pent
text: Perhaps.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Then we fight! If they have strength, then we'll match their strength and challenge them! We don't have time for this!!

speaker: Hawkeye
text: I will fight, too. Pent, you stay here and guard the others.

speaker: Pent
text: Understood.

speaker: Hawkeye
text: Select those who will go with us. ...And choose carefully.

speaker: Eliwood
text: All right! Are you ready, everyone? Try not to get separated.

speaker: Hawkeye
text: ...Don't move!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah! ...The wall!

speaker: Hawkeye
text: ...He's responsible. He's watching us from somewhere.

speaker: Hawkeye
text: Mark, is it? I must see you all safely back to my master. If you have need of it, I will lend you my strength.

speaker: Pent
text: The air... It's returned to normal! The magic seal has fled.

speaker: Eliwood
text: What in the name of all that is decent is that? It has human form, but it's... It's not human!

speaker: Ninian
text: ...That was a creature of heresy. Its existence makes a ruin of nature's most basic laws.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ninian?

speaker: Ninian
text: ...Ah, Lord Eliwood. I...

speaker: Pent
text: ...In this world, there are many mysterious things that fall beyond our realm of understanding. Come, let us leave this place. A living legend awaits us.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Ah... Yes!

speaker: Hawkeye
text: ...Daughter of...

speaker: Hawkeye
text: ......Be strong...

speaker: Hawkeye
text: ...I've brought them.

speaker: Athos
text: Welcome, children of Roland.

speaker: Hector
text: We've come from Lycia, old man. Do you understand?

speaker: Lyn
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Eliwood
text: I think I know. Thousands of years ago, man and dragon fought on this continent.

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, mankind won, and the dragons fled this world.

speaker: Eliwood
text: That's correct. Man against dragon... That war that we know as the Scouring. And you know of the Eight Legends, the heroes who led man to victory?

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, we've all heard the stories of the Eight Legends. I was raised in Sacae, so I know of Hanon, the horseman.

speaker: Hector
text: Sacae is where Hanon was born. Our country, Lycia, was founded by the hero Roland.

speaker: Lyn
text: That's why you called us "children of Roland," right?

speaker: Athos
text: That is correct, daughter of Hanon and Roland.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Who are you?

speaker: Athos
text: I am Athos. Many choose simply to call me Archsage.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Athos?! It can't be...

speaker: Lyn
text: Huh? What?!

speaker: Hector
text: Archsage Athos was one of the Eight Legends. If you really were him, old man... you'd have to be over a thousand years old.

speaker: Athos
text: The world is full of mysteries. Solve one, and along comes another... Before I knew, I'd grown distant from my fellow man. Hunger... It knows no bounds.

speaker: Lyn
text: A thousand years... That's a long time.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yet thanks to such longevity, we're meeting here today.

speaker: Hector
text: Living legend... Now I see it.

speaker: Athos
text: You're here because you want to stop Nergal, aren't you?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes. Did you receive word from Marquess Ostia?

speaker: Athos
text: No... I am aware of most things that occur on the continent. However, knowledge is not enough for me to prevent disaster.

speaker: Lyn
text: Nils said something similar to that before. "With my special power, I can sense danger coming, but I can't do anything to stop it."

speaker: Athos
text: Nils... One of the children of destiny.

speaker: Lyn
text: He's here with us, but something outside caught his attention.

speaker: Athos
text: ...I'm sure something stopped him...

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hm?

speaker: Athos
text: Let's talk about Nergal. How do we stop him?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes, what can you tell us? What wisdom can you share?

speaker: Athos
text: Mm. Your foe is, like me, no longer...altogether human. It will be difficult to slay him through traditional means. He wields a terrible power. His endless strength stems from an ancient, forbidden magic... To defeat him, you will need a suitable response.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Response?

speaker: Athos
text: ...While he is resting, you must find the power to oppose him.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Tell us what it is! We'll do anything!!

speaker: Athos
text: It will be harder than you can imagine. Great trials await you. ...As does great despair. You may regret your decision. Will you stay the course, children?

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Our will remains fixed.

speaker: Athos
text: This is a road from which you cannot turn back.

speaker: Hector
text: We've known that all along!

speaker: Lyn
text: We can overcome anything. You'll see. Together, we are strong.

speaker: Athos
text: ...Very well. Let me tell you what you must do.

speaker: Athos
text: Have you understood all that you have heard?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes. We are to seek out the Shrine of Seals in Bern, right?

speaker: Athos
text: Take Hawkeye with you. Add his skills to your own.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Thank you.

speaker: Athos
text: ...And you? What will you do, Pent and Louise?

speaker: Pent
text: Nergal, a magic user who rivals you, Lord Athos... And the return of the dragons. An intriguing story.

speaker: Pent
text: Forgive the late introductions. I am Pent, Count Reglay of Etruria. This is Louise, my wife.

speaker: Louise
text: It's nice to meet you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Count Reglay? You are Count Reglay?

speaker: Lyn
text: Who? Is he someone special?

speaker: Hector
text: Yes. He hails from the most prominent noble house in Etruria. He's known as the Magic General. What has brought you to this place?

speaker: Athos
text: Bern's successor will soon have his coming-of-age ceremony. Pent and Louise are to attend as representatives of Etruria. Pent claimed there was time to search the desert for a magic artifact said to have been lost in the sands here long ago. You arrived shortly after we did. Perhaps something was guiding you.

speaker: Pent
text: Bowing to the dictates of fate, my wife and I would like to join you if we may.

speaker: Lyn
text: Well, of course. That's fine, right, Eliwood? Will you send word of your mission to your countrymen?

speaker: Pent
text: There's no reason to, and if we did, who would believe us? Besides, it's not unusual for us to remain absent for long periods. I doubt anyone will be surprised by our absence. Right, my dear?

speaker: Louise
text: Tee hee. You're right, my love.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Not unlike a certain young noble we've heard of...

speaker: Hector
text: That's great! Thanks a lot!

speaker: Eliwood
text: In any event, we welcome you both with all our hearts.

speaker: Pent
text: Thank you.

speaker: Athos
text: ...There's not much time. I'll send you to Lycia. Hawkeye! Gather everyone here in the plaza.

speaker: Athos
text: You are Tactician, correct? Fate blows a strange wind in your direction. Much rides on your shoulders and in your abilities. I want you to take this. It enhances natural abilities, skills with which one was born. Give this to whomever you feel will benefit the most. Do not waste its power holding on to it. Use it.

speaker: Hawkeye
text: Everyone is here.

speaker: Athos
text: Thank you. Eliwood, your territory is the closest to Bern, is it not?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Yes. The border lies in the mountains.

speaker: Athos
text: Very good. Now please envision a nice, wide place in Pherae... Next, think of the name of a person you might meet there.

speaker: Eliwood
text: As you say. ... ...

speaker: Athos
text: Now, children of Roland, it is time to say farewell. You must reach the Shrine of Seals. There, your destinies' doors will open wide before you.

speaker: Eleanora
text: My beloved... I cannot believe you are gone. Every time I close my eyes, I see you at my side. Your memory haunts me, and I am filled with sorrow. ...Elbert... If by some chance you can hear my prayer... Please look after our son.
Mother...

speaker: Eleanora
text: What!? Eliwood? Where--Where are you?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mother! I'm home! I've returned!

speaker: Eleanora
text: Ah!! Eliwood! Is it really you? Oh, how did you... You startled me so!

speaker: Eliwood
text: Forgive me, Mother. The Archsage sent us.

speaker: Eleanora
text: You look so tired. ...Have you lost weight? Oh, come closer and let me see your face.

speaker: Eliwood
text: ...Mother, about Father...

speaker: Eleanora
text: I heard his last moments were glorious. Though he's gone, he will ever be my life's joy.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I know.

speaker: Eleanora
text: Come... Let us make everyone comfortable. You all look in need of a rest.

speaker: Eliwood
text: I'm sorry, Mother. We must hurry onward...

speaker: Eleanora
text: I know that! But for one night... here in the castle... Eliwood... just for tonight.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Mother...

speaker: Hector
text: One night's not going to hurt us. Who knows when we'll be back this way?

speaker: Lyn
text: Yes, let's do it. I am so exhausted.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector, Lyn... Thank you.

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hello, Tactician. So you're still awake. Tactician, do you know Bern well? No, nor do I... Nothing more than I've heard at court. I'm sure that, with all of your travels, you know more than I. By the way, Tactician, where were you born? Before you met Lyndis in Sacae, where were you? If it's difficult to speak about, you needn't worry. It's just that we've been together for so long, and I really know almost nothing about you. If you don't mind, won't you tell me about yourself? I would like to learn more about you and your life.

speaker: Hector
text: More of them!

speaker: Lyn
text: There are still some morphs left? So this must be Nergal’s doing, too.

speaker: Nils
text: Hey, Lord Hector! It’s that weird power again... Like in the ruins below the desert. That area where magic was nullified.

speaker: Hector
text: A magic seal? Here?

speaker: Eliwood
text: Hector, what are you talking about? What’s a magic seal?

speaker: Hector
text: I don’t know... I don’t know too much about it.

speaker: Nils
text: What’s going on? It feels different than last time. In the desert, its energy felt so hostile... Now, it feels more like ...sorrow?

speaker: Lyn
text: Hector, they’re moving.

speaker: Hector
text: I don’t know who they are, but it looks like they’re after a fight. Show them no mercy! Let’s go!

speaker: Eliwood
text: The barrier’s gone...

speaker: Hector
text: We beat it. But what was it? We saw it here once before, and then under the desert. Was that the same creature?

speaker: Eliwood
text: After that final blow, its body crumbled into dust.

speaker: Lyn
text: Yeah. That’s the same thing that happened to those morphs.

speaker: Hector
text: So this thing... This magic seal was a morph, too? But it didn’t look anything like the rest of them.

speaker: Nils
text: But it was still a morph. When it died... I heard its voice call out... It called out a name... Nergal. Did you hear its voice? Sorrow... It was filled with a terrible sorrow.

speaker: Hector
text: Everybody, are you ready? Once we get through here, it’s on to the Dragon’s Gate and the final battle! Here we go! Time to crush Nergal’s ambitions!!
